text: Argeles. Belle bière opaque aux arômes fins de cacao et de café. Fluide en bouche , belle longueur.

Damn, this one and the Bern really stand out for the widely available Belgians. Fairly complex taste, raisins, dates, figs, caramel, toffee, that kinda thing, but even a hint of sourness there. Sweet of course, as quads are, but not overly so and certainly not (as sometimes is the case w these Belgians) to cover up mediocrity in other aspects

Aromat: przepiękny, słodki, ciężki, gęsty i zawiesisty, są w nim karmel, rodzynki, suszone śliwki, figi i daktyle.
Wygląd: piękna, ciemna, krwistoczerwona miedź, wysoka czapa jasnokremowej, drobnopęcherzykowej piany, utrzymująca się długo. Sporo osadu na dnie butelki.
Smak: pełne, oleiste, treściwe, gęsta tekstura. Słodycz karmelu i słodkich owoców lekko skontrowana winnością świeżych owoców. Jest tu karmel, toffi, rodzynki, suszone śliwki, figi, świeże jasne owoce, winogrona, morele, jabłka. Wykwintne i dobrze ułożone, alkohol świetnie ukryty, lekko cierpkie na finiszu.. Klasyczna Belgia, ale w dobrym wykonaniu, a nawet bardzo dobrym.

330ml Bottle: Pours a hazy dark brown with red highlights and thick, persistent tan head. Dark fruit aromas with a slight alcohol note. An amazing, complex flavour as it warms. Beer is sweet, probably due to the alcohol. Flavours of caramel, toffee, prunes, dates, molasses and raisins to name but a few. Low bitterness, full bodied, medium to low carbonation. Overall an amazing beer.
The taste brings the flavour of old baby pants as Pampers. Aroma of the plums
Vynikající masivní pivo se silným řízem, plností a bohatou krémovou pěnou..
Dark brown appearance with a tan head. Aroma is dried fruits (resins, figs etc.), rye bread, caramel and spices. taste of dried fruit, spices and caramel.
For me one of the best beer. Color, taste, aroma....all is perfect!!!!
Just incredible aroma and appearance. Taste is too complicated I think. So I wouldnt drink it often, but its definitely worth a shot.
Had in Brugge. Excellent taste with incredible aroma. Fantastic, evolving palate with a crisp finish. Rather excessive sediment, which is a small substraction from an otherwise almost flawless beer.
nice big foamy head. appearance nearly black. realy strong taste. malt, caramel (sugar). excellent.

Drunk at home brought at Mad Squirrel bottle shop in Berkhamstead. Large foamy head, almost jet black appearance. Fantastically smooth taste, lasting sweet finish, just an overall fantastic beer! ❤️

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent beer, and I will drink more of it. However...the palate was somewhat thin imho. Additionally I am not a fan of a carbonation that "bubbles" in my mouth. Again, the fruit and caramel flavors are great; just not my favorite Belgium for the above mentioned reasons. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rötlich dunkelbraune Farbe mit weißer, grobporiger Schaumkrone. Karamell, getrocknete Früchte und eine Alkoholnote steigen in die Nase. Sehr gut aufeinander abgestimmte Aromen, Karamell, etwas Schokolade, dunkle Früchte, angenehme Säure mit erstaunlicherweise gar nicht prägnanter Alkoholnote. Natürlich haben wir hier 11,3 %, andere Biere dieses Kalibers weisen jedoch eine viel exponiertere Alkoholnote auf, die hier schön eingebunden ist. Sehr schlüssig, ausgeprägte Aromen, wundervoll zu trinken.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 This beer, as I feel ALL Belgium Trappiste ales are, are of the highest quality.Not much to say, other than this ale is supreme above most other beers. Its pedigree and quality is nearly above reproach! It does NOT get much better than this. Orval, in my estimation, is in the same category, but its aroma is a little better, more floral.

W aromacie suszone ciemne owoce, śliwka, rodzynki, alkohol, nuty chlebowe. W smaku jest dosyć wytrawnie. Są ciemne owoce, skórka chleba i ten alkohol. Może leżakowanie by mu pomogło, bo alko niestety mocno przeszkadza.
Bottle, bb 28.04.2020. Ruby brown color, big off-white head. Aromas of dried fruits, plums, brown sugar. Sweet with well perceptible alcohol. Quite good, but not my cup of tea.
Very common in Belgium, you fall in love of it the moment you taste it. A real trappist with alcoholic/sweet taste. Excellent beer!

Bottle at home from Freshfields in Croydon. Pours dark red brown with an off white head. Aroma is boozy dried fruits, molasses, bread, caramel and a little clove. Taste is a sweet boozy hit of dried fruit, a bit like a good Christmas cake, some clove, banana and toffee in the background with just a little boozy bite as the sweetness mellows out. Nice and smooth and definitely drinkable.

Bottle, BB date still over 4 years away. Good carbonation, head. Dark amber, clear. Aroma slightly spicy, fruity, caramel; very pleasant but delicate. Taste: caramel, dark berries, licorice; slightly tart, bitterness sharp but not overpowering. Very sweet. Mouthfeel medium to full. Short, slightly thin finish with a bite of alcohol. 
Too sweet on its own. Could be perfect with cheese after an excellent meal. Dangerous because one cannot really taste the alcohol...A suitable sourness would nicely balance this beer and make it greater still.
Fles gedeeld met LiekevdV. Het is een donker bruin bier met veel koolzuur. Het heeft een erg gebrande smaak.
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!
A pesar de la bena presencia y color me resulta empalagosa, excesivamente dulce.

Een heel lekker tamelijk zwaar bier. Zeer stevige smaak die tot het einde blijft. De Rochefort 6 en 8 smaken identiek maar zijn wat dunner van smaak. Dit is geen bier om mee te beginnen, alle andere bieren smaken dan heel waterig, mooie afsluiter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I dont speak beer! Still very sophisticated aroma. This was my wifes favorites as it was smooth to drink with a respectable intrinsic flavor profile. Drink this it would make you cool!
An incredible beer that goes straight to your head. Great aroma and quite yeasty

W aromacie nuty chlebowe, lekki szlachetny alkohol, przyprawy. Całość niezbyt intensywna. Piana duża, duże pęcherzyki, beżowa, szybko opada. W smaku czuć ta Belgię, wyraźnie przyprawy korzenne, wysokie wysycenie, całość szlachetna, alkohol genialnie ukryty. Czuć śliwkę, ciemne owoce, rodzynki. Jak na 27blg nie jest zbyt gęste i wypełniające. Chyba liczyłem na większą słodycz. W zamian jest szlachetna wytrawnosc. Ciekawa pozycja.
wow wow wow. wonderful aroma of figs, plums and cherry. carbonation helps to push flavours around mouth, which includes figs, plums, cherries, chocolate and a slight hint of lemon. special beer.
Superb beer - the strength is masked by the delicious flavours and smooth taste. This is one of my go-to trappist beers when Im in need!

(Warka do 6.12.2021r)
Piwo barwy ciemnobrązowej z całą masą rubinowych refleksów, nieprzejrzyste.
Piana beżowa, betonowa, drobna, zbita, pozostawia cudowny lacing na szkle, po prostu piana idealna.
Czuć, że mamy do czynienia z potężnym piwem, a zaczynając od początku, na pierwszy plan wysuwają się ciemne owoce, jeżyny oraz wiśnie, czereśnie, czerwone porzeczki, przejrzałe winogrona, rodzynki, aromat przypomina bardzo dobre wino lub szampan. Następnie dochodzi przypalony karmel wraz z przyprawami, gdzieniegdzie manifestują swoją obecność nuty rustykalne(siano), a także przypalony spód od ciasta, może lekka paloność.
W smaku jest zdecydowanie wytrawne, wysycenie wysokie(ale nie przesadzone), są tutaj winne posmaki mieszając się z śliwkami, wiśniami czereśniami, przejrzałymi winogronami, później dochodzą przyprawy, leciutki karmel.
Finisz pozostaje w tonie winnym, a później ustępuje subtelnej ziołowości.
Trappistes Rochefort 10 jest genialnym i wielowymiarowym quadruplem, przede wszystkim świetnie zharmonizowanym w aromacie i smaku, wszystko współgra ze sobą tworzą genialne piwo.
Pomimo dość sporego alkoholowego "bagażu" nie czuć go nawet krzty(nawet nie rozgrzewa w przełyk, coś niezwykłego), widać że w Belgi opanowali to do perfekcji. Piwo zdecydowanie do dłuższej degustacji i powolnego sączenia.
W śmiesznie niskiej cenie dostajemy trunek klasy światowej. Nic dodać nic ująć.

Ciemne, przejrzyste, mocno nagazowane, bardzo dobra piana. W zapachu słodkość, karmel, likier. W smaku super likier, ostre nuty, trochę przyprawowości, słodkości. Świetne piwo, jeden z najlepszych Belgów.

No point in describing this awesome beer as there are tons of descriptions already on RateBeer.
I very much like this spicy note of liquorice in the taste, it is really unique. To me it is one of the best beers ever made. It is strong but doesnt feel alcoholic at all, taste is awesome - I love liquorice! And the aftertaste lasts really long...
Only thing to criticize is the aroma - it is very pleasant but could be a bit stronger though :)

couleur noir brillante avec de beaux reflets bruns , la carbonisation est légère.
le col de mousse est crémeux et normal (2-3 doigts maximum ) et dune couleur légèrement caramelisé et retombe assez vite.

au nez, les arômes sont explosif sur le malt torréfié, le caramel et le café moka 

la bouche est parfaitement équilibré avec des notes de malt torréfié et de café ainsi quune belle longueur en bouche.

Aroma: Caramel and alcohol, soap touches.
Appearance: Very dark brown color with clear liquid and tan head.
Taste: Heavy sweetness with medium bitter notes.
Palate: Full body with thin texture and average carbonation. Short sweet alcoholic finish.
Overall: Not my beer but it is a strong beer with a full body. In fact it is going to be my refference for full body.
Ocena w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Pite wiele razy na przestrzeni lat. Bardzo klasyczny belg, dużo tutaj karmelu, słodyczy, suszonych owoców, melasy. Smaczne ale czasem wymaga doleżakowania.

Aroma: sweetness, candy, malt, liquorice.
Appearance: dark with big brown head.
Taste: malt, sweetness, alcohol, liquorice.
Palate: full bodied, medium carbonation, smooth.

There really is nothing nore to say. 100% all the way. This may not be the most sought-after of the Abbey beers but it must be the best. Creamy rich head. Creamy rich aroma. Creamy rich mouth-feel. Creamy rich taste (with coffee, chocolate, fruitiness). 

And the bonus is that you dont have to stand in a queue at the brewery to get hold of it!!!
Beh che dire una birra strepitosa! Tra le mie preferite! Birra trappista scura con unimportante gradazione!
coffee, herbs, cheese, vanilla, black, cloudy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish,
Goed bier natuurlijk. Alles is er al wel over gezegd. Ik vind het nog steeds knap dat ze zon hoog kwaliteit sniveau kunnen aanhouden bij hoge oplages produktie.

Very difficult to say anything that havent been said about this beer. I am having one right now served in an original glass. 11.3 just blends in perfectly with the caramellic taste when served at the right temperature. To me there is an initial peppery taste to Trappiste beer that I really like - which is followed by a lot of bitter sweetness. Love this.

A tad sweeter than the Westy and Abt 12, but very similar in taste and aroma. Dark fruits, boozy and Earthy. 
Definitely one of the best Trappist beers thats relatively easy to find.
Just great. You wouldnt expect to find such a beer in the supermarket. Yet it has everything to make it one of the best beers in the world.

One of my favourite beers. A complex beer that develops in the glass and in the bottle over time. Very dark, almost black colour. Aroma of alcohol and caramel. Wonderful taste with notes of resin and caramel.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2017 0.33 bottle. Pours redish amber, with nice beige head and load of bubbles. Its like a living ecosystem in a glass. Aroma is huge: raspberry, sour cherries, liquorish sweetness, alcoholic spicyness. A medium to full body, topped with a light carbonation. Flavors are complex and subtle at the same time: rasperry jam, sour-cherry liquor, slight hint of yeast and sweet malts. Balance bertween alcoholic spicyness and warmth, sweetness is on point being tamed by a light bitterness at the end. Master class.
UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 From Au Brasseur Brussels. Cerveja aromática e complexa. Cor escura com ótima Formação de espuma. um clássico das trapistas.
Dość słaby aromat karmelowo alkoholowy. Dość wytrawne, alkoholowe. Nie rozumiem hypu tego piwa.
Understandably one of the best beer in the world. A bit high strong. Still a very straight drink that goes down too fast.
Blanlabalajdjd jdjdbxbejsnd jejsbajjdnejx jrjdbjejd jsjdbkdka jsjbdbdjdjjsjxjk
Ciemnobrązowe o wysokim nasyceniu. W aromacie śliwki i suszone owoce. W smaku podobnie + lekko wyczuwalny alkohol, który rozgrzewa przełyk. Niewielka goryczka.

It pours beautifully with a small head and a lovely colour in the glass. A nice aroma of burnt malt, but there was, to me, an extreme dichotomy between the taste and the mouthfeel. The taste was a typical dark ale, but the mouthfeel was something special; rich, velvety and a tang from the alcohol. It was really quite odd and while enjoyable as an experiment, it is not something that I will rush to experience again.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Ciemne owoce, suszone i świeże, przyprawy, karmel, nieco miodu i alkoholu. Średnie ciało, średnio słodkie. Niska goryczka, wysokie wysycenie.
Шикарно& мужицко& пиво! Крепкое, насыщен& с мощным и долгим послевк& Советую к употреб& исключи& в мужицко& компани& с мясными блюдами

Bottle. It poured a dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of dark fruits, raisins and plums. The taste was similar to the aroma with more dark fruits, raisins, figs and some earthiness. Really tasty.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2017 Drank this several times. This is my favorite beer among Trappists and my first beer that got me into love for the crafts! I still remember my surprised face when i first drink this. 
Pours hazy brown color, good carbonation, small white head, medium sweetness, dried fruits like raisins, plum and toasty. I will definitely go for it more often.

Flasche 0,33l: Kastanienbraun, dunkles Mahagoni, deutliche Trübung, sehr kräftiger stabiler grobporiger Schaum; in der Nase kräftige dunkle Süße, Malz, Malzzucker, Toffee, dunkle/eingelegte Früchte, Backpflaumen, Rosinen, fruchtige Säure, Röstaromen, Tannine, dunkle Schokolade, kräftige süßlich-würzige Bitterkeit; im Körper kräftige würzige Süße, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, Malz, Malzzucker,Toffee, Röstaromen, dunkle/eingelegte Früchte, Backpflaumen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, angenehme dunkel-fruchtige BItterkeit; angenehmer fruchtig-würziger Nachgang mit leichten Röstaromen
Brown pour. Lots of dark fruit in the aroma and taste. Booze in the flavor as well. Really nice

Dunkelbraun mit starkem Schaum, Aroma gleichermaßen malzig-Schokolade-Karamell wie säuerlich-fermentiert. Im Geschmack perfekt abgestimmt zwischen Malzsüße und säuerlichen Aromen, kaum Bitteraromen; Einkochpflaume; lang anhaltend im Abtrunk

Estamos ante una Cuádruple potentísima en todos los sentidos. Su aspecto, su aroma y sabor y por supuesto potente también en cuanto a graduación alcohólica.

Vierte marrón oscura e inmediatamente llama la atención su cantidad de espuma beis, cremosa y compacta.

 Si la vista es impactante, en cuanto acercas la nariz ya se te empieza a ir la cabeza fuertemente. Y con el primer trago directamente te quieres quedar a vivir en ella para siempre.

No sabría muy bien por dónde empezar. Durante todo el rato que dura la copa, tienes mil sensaciones aromáticas y gustativas diferentes. Caramelo, torrefactos, frutas maduras, especias, uvas pasas, chocolate uhhhhmmmmm delicioso chocolate, casi se puede masticar.

Su más de 11% de alcohol está ahí, evidentemente, pero nunca te incordia en el trago. He tomado cerveza de abadía con menos graduación cuyo alcohol te macea infinitamente más que aquí.

33 cl. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: not very intense aromas of toasted malts, caramel, prunes, plums, raisins, grapes, wine, toffee. Hints of alcohol, porto wine, sherry, spices.
Appearance: deep brown color with low head thickness. Light beige foam made of small bubbles. Low retention. No Brussels lacing. Very dark but it seems to have a little bit of hazyness. 
Taste: medium-high sweetness, low-to-medium bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of toasted malts, caramel, prunes, raisins, plums, dark fruits. Alcohol not very noticeable, you know it is there because of the warming effect but it is very well hidden under a lot of layers of complex flavors. Very well balanced.
Palate: medium-full body, silky texture, low carbonation, very long sweet finish of toasted malts, prunes, raisins, plums, dried dark fruits, licorice. Excellent mouthfeel.
Overall: not very intense aromas but very good and intense flavors of prunes, raisins, dark fruits, toasted malts. Very long sweet finish with similar flavors. Good appearance and excellent mouthfeel. Very complex beer with a lot of different layers of flavors. Excellent beer.

Botella en Doemens.

Vierte en color castaño, con espuma de café bastante fugaz, aunque con buena carbonatación.

De intensidad media nariz, franca y algo timida en un principio. Da notas de pasas y frutos secos, así como alguna nota floral como de azar. También un punto cítrico y algo especiado. Entre las notas tostadas da caramelo suave y un agradable bombón de licor, redondeando el punto licoroso. También presenta algunas notas lácticas.

En boca resulta explosiva, con un dulzor como de regaliz y un amargor marcado y creciente.

De gran cuerpo y textura aterciopelada, su calidez resulta muy notable. Evoluciona en boca con notas de dulce de regaliz muy intensas. Una cerveza con mucho carácter y muy potente, no recomendable probablemente para no iniciados.

Bottle. Dark amber, little bit hazy with red sparks and huge, solid, frothy head. Good lacing. Quite strong aromas of raisins, dried fruits little bit red wine and malts. Full body, high carbonation, sweet with slight spicy feeling and light alcohol warming in the aftertaste and some light, hidden bitterness. Smooth, oily mouthfeel, complex in taste and very well balanced.
Dark brown almost redish colour with white foam. Aroma of dried fruit and malt. Very strong taste with a lot of fruit.
Caramel, bread, nuts, roasty, brown, cloudy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,
Shared bottle at home. Pours hazy dark brown with dense beige head. Aroma of caramel, candis sugar, ethanol, chocolate. Tastes sweet with balancing bitterness. Medium bodied, highly carbonated.
Piękny zapach. Wiśnie, daktyle, rodzynki, palony karmel. Piwo ciemno brązowe. Intensywna ale niezbyt trwała piana. W smaku ciemne owoce i karmel.

Pours dark brown color with small brown head. Aroma of vanilla, dark fruits, yeast, caramel, chocolate, toast. Taste of malts, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla. Full body with medium carbonation and a nice sweet long finish.

A strong Belgian but very well balanced. The alcohol is masked completely. Caramel malts on a mild body. Very smooth. Yeast throughout with a sweet finish. Nearly sessionable for a beer of this potency.

09-03-17 // bottle at home Bottled: 2014 Dark brown beer with a nice and solid beige head. Creamy malty taste, very smooth, alcohol well covered. Mild bitter, mild yeasty, mild nuts, toffee, light spices, very complex. Great beer.
Bottle @ Le Miladys. Belle robe noire, arôme de fruits mûrs et un final assez long avec une note de réglisse.

Barwa ciemnego bursztynu, obfita, ale szybko opadająca piana. Bardzo ładny aromat: figi, rum, karmel, rodzynki, trochę toffi. W smaku dzieje się dużo mniej, jest karmel, trochę suszonych owoców. Nie pomaga wysokie nasycenie. Trzeba jednak oddać, że piwo jest dobrze ułożone, alkohol kompletnie niewyczuwalny. Dobre, ale liczyłem na dużo więcej.

Butelka 330 ml. Bombowe, klasyka gatunku. Mocarne, piana super bujna, drobnopęcherzykowata, Pulsuje w ustach, szumi w głowie, potrzeba kilku sekund po przełknięciu, aby dojść do siebie. Belg przez wielkie B.

0.3 bottle. Pours dark brown color with medium, mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma of whine, perfume, yeast. Flavor is medium to high sweet, medium bitter. Notes of wine, chocolate, caramel. Finish is medium long, sweet with alcoholic warmth. Full body, average carbonation.
caramel, bread, toast, alcohol, brown, clear, medium body, thin feel, lively, roasty, barnyard,

Piwo barwy ciemnego bursztyna, z wysoką, aczkolwiek szybko opadającą syczącą pianą. W aromacie czerwone owoce, karmel, skóra, drewno, pojawia się też subtelna brzoskwinia. W smaku karmel, czerwone owoce, szlachetny rozgrzewający alkohol, przewinęła mi się gdzieś z tyłu brzoskwinka. Piwo jest trochę rzadkie i charakteryzuje się wysokim wysyceniem. Niestety pływały w nim jakieś czarne farfocle. Totalnie nie trafił w moje oczekiwania. Zarówno smak jak i aromat trochę takie "stłumione". Nie jest to napewno kiepskie piwo, aczkolwiek liczyłem na lepsze wrażenia.

Wow. What a wonderful beer. Dark brown with a creamy brownish head. Smell of malts and hops. The taste is sweet, light alcohol, fruity (dark fruits like dried plums), hop, dark roasted malt. Its complex full body and nicely ballanced. Delicious

Just a perfect beer. Strong trappistbeer. Zoet, volmondig, lange nadronk. Ik denk aan melkchocolade als ik hiervan geniet.
Voor mij beste bier ooit. Alhoewel Struise brouwers enkele kapers op de kust heeft.

This is it! The best of the best. Theres not much to discuss on this one, if you already experienced the 6 and 8 ones you should know what to expect with the 10. A lovely nuts / oak aroma and small hints of dark, red fruits. Blackberry maybe? The aftertaste, compared to the others, is much deeper, last longer in mouth and its alcohol level is also much more interesting. Very drinkable and still on the same level of sweetness as the two others. One of the best beer around, and a perfect gift for any beer lover. Totally APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW!
Sweet pruny alcohol notes. Dark brown reddish colour. Nice lasing with off white head. Obvious hints of alcohol with dark fruits. Very complex and smooth.

As many already said. This is a complex beer. All kind of tastes pass throughout drinking this beer. Sweet, fruit, hop, malt, acids, nicely ballanced. This realy a beer to enjoy. Be careful, there's quite a lot of alcohol in!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 bottle at home. Complex and heavy beer, but very rewarding. Definetely a perfect combination to a strong cheese.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 actually my expectations are higher, but its still enough to make noise! very complex taste with dark fruits, slightly vanilla, roasted sweet malts. softly carbonated. warming finish. highly drinkable for a quad.

Bardzo intensywny aromat słodkich owoców. trochę jabłka, brzoskwini, gnijącego mango, jakieś śliwki. Dużo tego. W smaku jeszcze więcej. Piwo określiłbym nawet jako bardzo słodkie. Tu już więcej rodzynków, śliwek, alkoholu.No i dochodzi robota drożdży. Zapamiętywalne. Bardzo dobre.

Nice head. Very intensive fruity aroma. Full of raisins, plums, caramel. Alcohol is very similiar as aroma. Very sweet, intensive, complex with alcoholic finish. Very high carbonation. Full body. Awesome beer.

bottle, fresh citrussy smell, moving to a sweet dark fruit flavour with malt extracts oming through. Taste is of spicy fruits with cirtrus aftertaste, little bitter and no lingering taste. Very perfect carbonation. Awesome flavours go very well together and cannot taste the 11.3% alcohol. Very good colour and creamy head. Best beer
Why couldnt love it? This is one of the most tasteful beer . The only one things to say is: Try it, and then we can talk about it...how wonderful is. Marvelous

22. 2. 2017, Ljubljana. Strong as an oxe. Almost as if it was aged in spirit barrels, you can feel the high alcohol presence.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark, hazy, big, creamy, head. Malty aromas: dark, dry fruits, bread, yeast. Sweet, with roasty biterness. Very Complex. Heavy, oily. Long, bitter aftertaste.

Out of an 11.2 oz. bottle from Market Street (thank you very much) I pour into my favorite Chimay glass about 3/4 of the bottle. It yields a nice quad style dark amber body and an outstanding near-white head. First time encounter gives a tropical fruit and banana nose. Beam me up Scotty. The taste is exquisite, dark fruit, malt, a light bitterness. A red letter day. Two great tastings today. If I can find this again I will partake again, price be damned. What is it about quadrupels?

BF - Sweet and stronger... Little too sweet.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Birra ambrato/marrone. Schiuma colore bianco sporco, fine, cremosa e poco persistente. Allolfatto sentori di banana, pera, toffee. Al palato note di caramello, legno, toffe, fruttacsecca, dolce. Lalcol so sente ma non disturba anzi le da carattere. Una grande birra da conversazione.
Bottle at home. It deserves the reputation it goes by. Smooth yeast, dark fruits, liquorice, raisins, brown sugar. Champagne carbonation. Warming alcohol. Superb beer.

Nice deep dark brown opaque pour with foamy off-white head disappearing super fast. Aroma of dark fruit, alcohol, molasses and cinnamon/spice. Full mouthfeel, chewy and heavy on the booze. Figs, plums and raisins, oh yeah. A Belgian that doesnt mess around and worth the rep it gets.
UPDATED: JUN 4, 2017 Tilpas sur! Tilpss gær! Fyldig! Fucking iorden! Lækker! Standarden burde ligge her! sig til hvis nogen finder bedre !?!?!

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 Barwa ciemny bursztyn z obfitą super drobną pianą. Aromat czerwonych owoców, marcepan, likierowość i paloność. W smaku słodki jakby likier, ciemne owoce, marcepan i miód gryczany. Wszystko takie bardzo dojrzałe w połączeniu. Alko praktycznie niewyczuwalne. Mocno grzeje w przełyk. Kosmiczne piwo.
Densidad, cuerpo alto, caramelo, trago corto y para disfrutar, muy buena cuadruple

Bottle in bruges at cambrinus with commonmac, samuelito, willyp, and rosskyle. Dark brown black with off white head. Sugar sweet licorice nose. Taste is candy, very rich, licorice again, light tarness. Good layers. Some chocolate, more than most Belgian beer. Finish is perfect. Great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Bottle at Cambrinus with commonshawn, rosskyle, dubtully, and samalito. You can?t beat this perfect glassware. Deep plum color with an off white head. Looks luxurious. Nose is dark sugar and deep fruity elements. Some mild chocolate. Taste is crazy delicious with a complex dark fruit quality and a malty characteristic. Chocolate and caramel play really well with a depth of fruit notes. Big and assertive without overwhelming the overall flavor. I need more of this as soon as possible.

Dark brown colour with a thick lasting one-finger beige head. Deep aroma of cane sugar, dark fruits and buttery biscuits. Flavor is big on Christmas spices, rum, clove in the finish, lots of alcohol, but not unpleasantly. Medium carbonation, quite a bit of hoppiness. The big alcohol presence makes R10 a definite sipper.

Biała, bardzo gęsta i zostawiająca wysoki lacing piana. Ciemno-złota barwa. W aromacie dużo ciemnych owoców i owoców w ogóle - śliwka, pomarańcza, porzeczka, nawet lekka cytryna. Nuty bardzo zbite ze sobą. Trochę przyprawowości. W smaku słodkie, likierowe, owocowe, przyprawowe. Rozgrzewające. Bardzo smaczne. Świetnie zbalansowane.

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Helder donkerbruin met robijnrode gloed en een beige schuimkraag. G: Gedroogd fruit, zoethout, banaan, vanille en karamel. S: Zoet. Banaan, vijgen, rozijnen, wat kruiden en alcoholwarmte. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.
Really good strong Belgian, the alcholic warmth makes this a great sipper. Had the token high quality belgian bready notes. Worth trying again and again.

In a bottle at the Gingerman in NYC. Great abbey ale smooth and easy to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours chocolate brown with a thick tan head. Caramel burnt sugar crime brûlée initial taste. Lingering finish of carmelized sugar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Kolor ciemno brązowy z przepiękną beżową pianą. 
W aromacie nuty ciemnych owoców i paloność. Delikatnie swoją obecność akcentuje marcepan W tle likierowe nuty alkoholu.
Smak to szlachetne nuty alkoholowe, przypominających, likiery, nalewki. Później ciemne owoce, marcepan.
Alkohol jest nieco wyczuwalny, ma zdecydowanie szlachetną formę, rozgrzewa, dodaje charakteru ale nie odrzuca. Nasycenie średnie w kierunku do niskiego, mi zdecydowanie odpowiada.

33cl bottle, 1 year old. Aroma: Liquorice, spices, cinnamon, vanilla and caramel. Taste: top class balance and elegance, this beer has so much flavour and complexity. Burnt sugar, heavy yeast, vinous port taste. Real beauty.

Acheter à Longueuil pour la première fois, cette bière ma donné lélan quil fallait pour aimer tout de la bière. Probablement la meilleure bière de ce style que je goûterai dans ma vie. Subtilité de figue et de raisin. Un petit goût du paradis.
Beer with dark color, strong taste, good foam volume, strong bitterness, (drunk a 33cl bottle during W-EBTM2013:Rouen, FR).
Bottle from Pazzos. Pours dark with thin tan head. Aroma had a lot of dark fruits. Taste was sweet without being overpowering.

Brown with medium beige head. Aroma is lots of marzipan, phenols and spices, raisins, black bread. Taste is sweet caramel, phenolic spices, slightly bitter alcohol. Full bodied with many large bubbles, long finish of spices and raisins. Nice.

Bottle. Blackish brown. Big foamy head. Aroma is rather subdued. Malts, plums and earthy, herbal hops. Taste is raisins, malts, caramell, figs, dark berries, chocolate and a little bit of coffee. Yeast and fruitcake. Complex and perfectly balanced. Long lasting aftertaste. Full bodied. Medium carbonation. Alcohol is very present but in a pleasant and not overwhelming way. Outstanding and one of my alltime favourites.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pour was dark brown, lasting tan head. Aroma was sweet dark fruit, raisin, plum. Taste was moderate sweet, complex, raisin, fig, alcohol is non existent, earthy.

Pours deep amber, almost a hue of purple, with aggressive beige head. Aromas of plum, orange marmalade, honey with a hint of honey and rye bread. Fine to medium carbonation with a medium mouth feel (thicker than expected for the style). Taste is finishing plums and over-ripe summer fruits fading to raisins at the end. Has a rumtoft element to it. Quite a bug alcohol kick but not burning. Finish is medium sweet and a pleasant bitterness to balance out. Overall very good beer and not too much Belgian yeast
pours dark brown small beige head aroma of dried fruits and cloves taste is caramel sweetness with a boozy finish
Great trappist. Rich dark colour with aromas of plums, yeast, caramel. Full body with powerfull taste

Aromat - ciemne, czerwone owoce, nuta czerwonego wina, lekka zbożowość i drożdże.
Piana dość obfita, średnia, dość długo się utrzymuje i zostawia ślad na szkle.
W smaku bardzo podobnie jak w aromacie - wino, czerwone owoce i drożdżowość.
Nasycenie wysokie.

Pours brown. Aroma of some dark friuts, marmelade, plum, vinous, yeast, raisin. Taste sweet and bitter, bread, little malty, maybe some chocolate, raisin, prune. Medium body, medium to low carbonation.
Bottle at De Hems, deep mahogany with a thin head, nose is dark fruit and a faint tartness. Sultanas, liquorice, Red wine, quite dry.
depending on the brew my favorite classic quadrupel, for the change of the 12 st Bernardus

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 Tastes very simmilliar to West XII. Thick with a strong alocohol taste and aroma. Quite hoppy but in a lager way. Not my type but it is a good beer. Good substitute for West XII.

I love this beer! If you are unable to get a Westy XII forget the St. Bernardus! Get your hands on this! This brew represents the the best the Trappist craft has to offer. Thank you Monks! And to God be the glory!

Enjoyed a bottle at Pub Italia in a huge chalice glass. Pours a big foamy brownish head that doesnt leave much lace. Head dissipates slightly and becomes a thinner layer. Has a dark amber colour. Aromas are mostly dark roasted malts and mild spices. Flavours are plentiful, with malts notes of raisins, caramel, herbal and earthy hops, hints of chocolate, barley and a bit yeasty. Quite overwhelming actually. Nice warming mouthfeel and a bit of a tingling sensation. Slight bitterness but quite welcome. Really smooth and goes down pretty easy, especially this one at 11.3%. Happy to have tried this one!
В аромате ведро дрожжей, черносл& На вид квад как квад); вкус сладкие дрожжи, винност& черносл& ,ощютима кислинк& от брожжен& послевк& кисло + сухофру& В целом неплохо, но я люблю более сладкие квады
Rich dark fruits, stone candy in the aroma. Small white head, fades quickly. Thick body, no heat from the abv. Enjoyed this.

Drank this a few times, never wrote anything. Murky brown, small creamy off-white head. Cherry brandy, walnut brandy, apricot, dried fruits. Fruity, fruit yogurt, lots of alcohol. Creamy texture, full body, lasting finish, lingering sweetness and alcohol. Very nice.

We are sampling this just after trying St. Bernardus 12 for the first time last night and this one unfortunately pales somewhat in comparison. The first thing that you notice when smelling and tasting is the strong alcohol content that is not disguised at all. It pours with a nice frothy tan head and a dark red brown color in the body. While the overall flavor is the typical sweet molassesy / caramelly flavor typical of most Belgians, the high alcohol content dominates every sip and masks some of the most subtle flavors that might otherwise emerge. Still it is an excellent beer compared to most any other Belgian, but despite a higher overall rating for this, I think the St Bernardus 12 was a bit better as it hid the alcohol much better.
PS for reference, my girlfriend just took a sip and said "eeeww alcohol" and Belgians are her favorite kind of beer.

From bottle in Belgian ale glass. Pours opaque brown with billowing 2-finger head. Aroma of Christmas fruitcake and booze. Rich malt profile and zesty palate makes for one tasty beer. EtOH and slight sourness help dry out the inevitable sweetness from the malt. I can see how this rates so highly
Forte, goût chocolaté très présent. ensemble sirupeux et lourd mais très agréable au palet.

Bottle at home. Aged a year or two. Brilliant! Taste of dried fruits, fudge, brown sugar, cinnamon buns and dark rye bread. Light perfect balanced bitterness at the end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piwo w kolorze ciemnobrazowym z obfita sredniopecherzykowa piana pozostawiajaca ladne zdobienia na szkle. W aromacie bardzo intensywna sliwka i morele, sa tez brzoskwinie, przyprawy i cukier trzcinowy. W smaku bardzo zlozona mieszanka tego co w aromacie z domieszka karmelu i drozdzy belgijskich. Wysokie nasycenie praktycznie bez goryczki z bardzo dobrze ukrytym alkoholem. Finisz troche wytrawny z ziolowym posmakiem. Klasyk!

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 Bottle. It pours dark brown with a light head. Quite a looker. Aromas of sweet dark fruits - raisins, dates etc., caster sugar and some spices. Taste is sweet and caramel like. The dark fruits are present in the taste as well. Some alcohol, but very drinkable.

Bière trappiste très foncée, avec beaucoup de mousse mais qui redescend assez rapidement. Une odeur très fumée, un peu métallique, assez pétillante, un goût de fumé, on reconnaît bien le houblon propre à la trappiste de rochefort, mais ce goût ne reste pas, il laisse place à un palais assez doux qui fait apprécier la trappiste

Aroma is fruity and surprisingly light for such a strong beer.
Taste is light sweet, medium bitter, caramel, raisins. Very unique and strong aftertaste. Alcohol very well hidden. Excellent beer, but not easily drinkable. I would prefer no 8, but this is also very good.
Aromas of bread, banana, citrus and spices. Pours a dark brown with small off white head. Tastes of banana and wood with a smooth fizzy finish. Exceptional beer.
A very strong beer, extremely full of tastes, sweet, bitter, caramel, dark, but with a huge depth. A spectacular beer, that cant be taken twice in the same day.

Donkerbruin bier met een rode gloed en een grote beige schuimkraag. Geur: alcoholisch, fruit, pruimen, vijg, rozijnen, kruiden, peperkoek. Smaak: zoet, fruitig, terug pruimen en vijg, licht bitter, karamel, toffee, wat alcoholisch. Volmondig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitter en alcoholisch verwarmend. Top bier!
Flesje gedronken bij Benzai. Roodbruin bier met stevig schuim. Aroma is caramel achtig en zoet. Smaak is zoet, koffie-achtig en fruitig (pruimen). Nasmaak is iets bitter.

Po otwarciu butelki po pokoju rozlewa się intensywny i przyjemny słodki zapach szlachetnego alkoholu, przyznaję bardzo przyjemny :) 
Kolor bardzo ciemny brązowy, nieprzejrzysty, prawieże czarny 
Nalewa się oleiście, piana wzbija się wysoka i gęsta, opada względnie powoli (jak na taką zawartość alkoholu) i ładnie oblepia kieliszek, wizualnie bardzo dobrze 
Zapach, jak wspomniałem, bardzo intensywny: dosyć złożony - nuty alkoholu, toffi, karmelu i nut belgijskich. 
W smaku jednak już nie jest tak dobrze - odczucie na podniebieiu jest dosyć przeszkadzające - piwo jest wysoko nagazowane prawieże jak szampan. jest dosyć oleiście, silnie wyczuwalna słodowość. W smaku dominuje karmel, coca cola (nie potrafię nie mieć takiego skojrzenia :), trochę korzenia, praliny, belgijska czekolada i rodzynki. Smak jest dosyć złożony i poukładany, alkohol jest wyczuwalny (11% robi swoje) i na mój gust niedostatecznie ukryty.
Finisz wytrwany, smaki zostają w przełyku. 
Piwo bardzo przyjemne, na kolano mnie nie rzuciło ale na jedno przyklękłem :), z pewnością miłe wprowadzenie do belgów :)

From 33cl bottle. Second time Ive tried it, and I might never understand all the fuss about quadrupel beers. Sure, its nice. The aroma is good (raisins, caramel, prunes...) but not so strong or outstanding. The appearance is not particularly enticing. The taste is good, sure, but I tend to prefer bitterness over sweetness, so not my cup of tea. Its also excessively carbonated, at least the high alcohol volume is quite tolerable. Pairing it with with strong smoked cheese & crackers with pumpkin and orange confiture was an excellent choice, thats the most positive thing I can say about it. Again, I wont say its a bad beer, I just dont understand why its ranked so high.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2017 Bottle. Pours brown-red with medium head. Aroma is wood, dark fruits, liquorice, malts, cereal. Flavour is molasses, spicy, toasted, caramel, rum, alcohol.

Ciemnomiedziane z pianą w kolorze złamanej bieli, obfitą ale szybko opadającą. W aromacie karmel, toffi, suszone owoce, figi, daktyle, rodzynki, odrobinę śliwki, brązowy cukier, melanoidyny. Słodkie, średnio alkoholowe, bardzo podobne jak w aromacie, niska goryczka. Wysokie nasycenie, ciało ok. Solidny quad, ale są lepsze

Truly an amazing world class beer. It has become my favorite and my go to beer of choice. I believe it is better than St Bernardus 12 and it holds its own with Westvleteren 12. Its definitely a big beer and should be sipped from a wide mouthed chalice. Alcohol is well hidden. . Well crafted and enjoyable for sure. I highly recommend .

Kolor: brunatny, zmętniony.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: sporo aromatów ciemnych, suszonych, owoców, daktyli, fig, wiśni, delikatne aromaty karmelu, melanoidyn.
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, słodycz, sporo nut ciemnych, suszonych owoców, daktyli, fig, delikatny karmel, melanoidyny, niska goryczka, delikatnie wyczuwalny alkohol.
Wysycenie: wysokie.

Pours an unclear reddish brown with a finger of off white foam. Nose has raisin, plum and a somewhat dry vinous maltiness, spices and a strong flowery yeast. The taste has a malty sweetness, dark fruit and spice combination. The longer it sits in the glass the better the mouthfeel becomes. Really lively and builds in the mouth like drinking Pepsi from the can. Not pleasant at all but it smoothens after some time. Nice caramel malty, almost coffeish finish leading to a drying aftertaste. Very good beer but a 4.3 beer it is not. Thats if you ask me of course.

Look: dark brown, clear, beige heade with average retention.


Aroma is rich and intense: sweet raisins, dried figs, sweet wine, some chocolate topping.
Taste: moderate sweet with light tartness and some warming alcohol bitterness.
Very light carbonation.
Flavour: dark macerated fruits, spices (allspice, black pepper), rum, crème brûlée.
Slightly harsh spicy and warming finish.

Very intense and complex.

Tried this a few times, just getting around to rating it now. This might be the easiest to obtain #2 beer of any style, at least where I live. Smells boozy with slight oak and ripe dark fruits, walnuts and toast. Very dark brown color with a light tan head that just refuses to recede. Very drinkable for the ABV, tastes lightly of dark fruit and everything else in the aroma. Great aftertaste, kinda hot, goes away quickly. The palate is surprisingly carbonated, hence the head that does not disappear. Extra carbonation works well here and it is still very smooth. I have to go against the grain here, I think this may be a bit overrated. Good for sure, just not an all time great.

This one is from memory, not that hard to recall. Pours dark amber with a fizzy tan head. Aromas of plum, raisin, licorice are a mouthful and first taste confirms this is truly a great beer. Easily discernible from the Chimay Bleu, St. Bernardus and Westvleteren 12. In my opinion, the best of the bunch because it is tightly restrained and not as savage as the the others.

Bottle, less than one year old. Pours hazy brown with large, slowly diminishing beige head. Strong aroma of raisins, plums, dried fruits, caramel, with a bit of alcohol. Taste is more than medium sweet: dark and red fruits, plums, caramel, spices, with a bit of fruity tartness and significant alcohol. Medium to full body, average carbonation. Very nice, but too fresh and boozy. I need to try aged (at least 3 years old) bottle of this beer.
Im sure this is the easiest top 10 beer to find ever. Absolute deal. High ABV in a perfect match. no doubt.

Typische quad kleur. Aroma is zoete mout met een ietwat zurige ondertoon. Doet me denken aan witte druiven. Smaak is zoet, witte zurige druiven. Afdronk is licht bitter om het zoete te compenseren. Mondgevoel is zeer veel koolzuur, waardoor het bier goed rond gaat in de mond. Een van mijn favoriete quads.
Bière arborant une très belle robe. Le goût et les arômes sont très forts. Cette bière est également très agréable au nez.
Brown. Ripe fruits. Smells old. Spices. Christmas. Sandy palate. Yeasty. Delicate. Bread.

33cl bottle @home. Pours brown with white head. Aroma has notes of dried fruits and bread. Taste is bread, dried fruits, not as sweet as i thought, and less alcohol than i thought considering the %. Overall really really good!

330 ml bottle from Theatre of Wine. Pours dark brown with short-lived tanned head. Warm aroma of marzipan, alcohol and bread. Tastes of bread, currants, sourdough, alcohol is well-hidden. Full bodied, low carbonation, oily, very smooth and long aftertaste. Very good beer, surprisingly easy to drink considering the ABV.

Poured dark witha rapidly diminishing frothy tan head. Vinous dark fruit and malt aroma. Medium body, flavour is sweet yet smooth dark fruit, raisin, cherry, some mildly caramelised malt. Dry, sweet medium aftertaste.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Awesome, a monster of intensity. Bread, dried fruit, red fruit, Belgian yeast, molasses, spices, coffee in the finish was a welcomed surprise. Rather sweet and smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle. Dark brown, quite clear with big slightly beige head. Aroma full of raisins, light bubblegum, roasted malt, bit of alcohol and spices. In taste medium dry, fruity (fresh and dried) with more malty profile, nice candi sugar, raisins and chocolate. Medium body, moderate to high carbonation, dry and medium bitter finish, still a bit harsh from alcohol, but after aging it is really fantastic brew.

La perfezione. La quantità di odori che si percepiscono e la loro evoluzione nel corso della bevuta è sconvolgente. La cosa che mi ha lasciato totalmente esterrefatto è come riesca a lasciare la bocca perfettamente pulita dopo un sorso così pieno, caldo, dolce, ricco, speziato. Fino ad ora non ho assaggiato di meglio e non posso non dargli il punteggio pieno.

Let me just say it has never taken me as long to prepare to compose a rating for a beer, ever! I saw this in stock for along time at Golden Crust in Red Lion, PA. I stopped in for lunch yesterday. It hasnt been on the shelf now for a couple of months so I asked Vinny when he would get more. Well lo and behold he said he stashed 2 bottles! Alrighty then, here goes------- 11:04) $10.50 for one 11.2oz.bottle. Poured very cold to a chalice. Ill have to do this a little differently because Ive never came across a beverage so COMPLEX. I rated St. Bernardus Abt 12 back in in April 2014 and have heard this was better and now that I am out of my shitty marriage, I can try anything I please.::::::AROMA - clove, banana, plum TASTE - medium/heavy sweet, light bitterness, lightly sour BODY - Full CARBONATION - effervescent MOUTH FEEL - complex FINISH - lingering sweet TASTING NOTES - Belgian candy sugar, mild wild yeast, alcohol, plum, dates, blackberry, toffee, butterscotch, raisin 
And then I took the last few sips that were very warm, well that would be another rating!!! Thanks Vinnie, keep stashin!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 33cl bottle from 2013. Aroma of malt, dark fruit, cloves, banana nut bread. Appearance was a deep brown with substantial yeast sediment (even leaving a 1/2" in the bottle during the pour). Large billowing head when poured into a chimay chalice. Remained very lively the entire time in the glass due to the nucleation. Taste was boozy, sweet, and malty. The four years in the bottle made the beer sweeter, with port like qualities. Very warming on the palate. Medium bodied with strong carbonation. This and the St. Bernardus 12 are my two go-to Belgian quads when I want the real deal. World class trappist.

medium aroma - outdated malt, some nuances of aged wine, caramel, fermented black fruits, rum and some cognac notes, all covered with something outdated, stale (like a cheese with mold).
medium taste - alcoholic strength, a bit burning, in foreground, malt, well fermented fruits, slightly burnt sugars sweetness, some soft cheese with mold, a bit of belgian yeasts.
a good belgian beer with a lot of alcohol.
UPDATED: JAN 9, 2017 Lekkere frisse neus met abrikoos en noten. Smaak is mooi vol en rond met vijgen, rozijnen, banaan en pruim. Mooie zachte afdronk.

17/20 lovely Trappist beer. So powerful both in taste and alcohol %. Red cheeks by the end of the bottle. Taste of raisin and dates, slight alcohol burn. Maybe just a bit too powerful for me. I'll have to try 6 and 8

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured into a snifter showing caramel brown with two fingers of tanned foam.

The nose shows a lovely sweet Belgian yeast forwardness with hints of raisins, toffee, and caramel. 

The palate is highly carbonated and light to slightly medium bodied. Flavors of black currant, plum, and very light hints of raisin. Surprisingly dry with barely any sweetness but still fruit forward. Strong alcoholic spiciness but does not subtract as it appears on the aftertaste and lasts for a short to medium finish. I cant wait to try this aged.
Wdgjgjjtddgjcfbjfchtdxggddcbggffessdfgfffgghh5dchh  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Aroma caramel malts and warm alcohol. Taste the same with slight hints of dark fruits. Mouthfeel thick, carbonation rather high. Not complex but very nice on a cold winter evening.
Trübes dunkelbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, süßlich, brauner Zucker, Karamell, fruchtig, dunkle Beeren, Rosinen, leicht alkoholisch.

A light aroma of plums and dried fruit. Pours a cloudy brown color with a lasting foamy tan head. A full bodied viscous mouth feel. Tastes of plum and raisins with a hint of berries. A lasting plum and alcohol finish.

Color marrón con algún destello rojizo. Rotunda presencia: buena capa de espuma de fina burbuja y buena retención, deja encaje en la copa. En nariz bizcocho, azúcar moreno, fruta madura. Bastante carbonatada. En boca compleja: ciruelas pasas, frutos secos, algo de caramelo, bastante bizcocho. Calidez alcohólica, aunque el alcohol esta muy bien integrado los 11% tienen que notarse a la fuerza.. BB 2020-09-08
33 cl bottle @ home. Dark brown beer with brown head. Sweet, malty aroma of caramel, raisins, coffee. Taste is similar, tastes like it is aged in whiskey barrels. Not my cup of tea.
Barwa ciemna, piana lekko brunatna. Bogaty aromat i wyjątkowy smak. Można by wiele pisać ale lepiej po prostu się napić.

Bière brune qui saffirme tout de suite en bouche. Un vrai plaisir à consommer lentement toutefois. Une odeur caramélisée attirante. Un goût très présent permet de la savourer même très longtemps après tant elle imprègne notre bouche. Que je taime trappiste 10 !

From bottle at FOB, in Rimini, Italy. Pours a dark amber with cappuccino foam. Aroma has licorice, fruits under spirits and nuts. Body is thick and sticky. Taste is consistent with aroma, with marked sweetness. Palate is great, with persistence of the sweet flavors and stickiness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Aroma: Nutty, Cinnamon, Cardamom, Slight CO2 burn/smell (like dry ice inhale)

Color: Dark - Looks like root beer, except opaque. Brown

Head: Light, creamy - big bubbles, small head

Taste: Warm, caramel, Belgian yeast, slight alcohol, apple cider, not typical dark beer flavor, despite color. Bread, sweet. Very slight bourbon characteristics. Dates.

Mouthfeel: Bubbly - larger bubbles. Coating feel, linger strong

Notes: Lightly carbonated - more bubbles as warms
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Botella 33cl en Cerveceria Kraken (Oviedo) Belga fuerte con gran sabor, una de las mejores Belgas que se pueden beber
Butelka; barwa brunatna. Piana bujna. Aromat słodki, owocowy, śliwki, rodzynek, cukru, winny. Smak owocowy, winny, rodzynek, śliwek, whisky. Alkohol świetnie ukryty. Goryczka średnia.
W aromacie słodkie owoce (to chyba te belgijskie nowofalowe chmiele?), karmel, syrop kandyzowany. W smaku fajne ciało, wymieszanie karmelu z owocami. Genialny quad.

Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is classical - caramel, raisins, grapes, sourness, cinnamon, cardamom, light leaves, balanced with wine barrels. Taste is very well balanced with beer bitterness, wine sourness and berries sweetness. Oak barrels, caramel, cinnamon, grapes and raisins, soft and silky apple pie with caramel cream. Wonderful beer!

Dark, strong alcohol but also creamy, rich, all complexed with sweetness.
One of the best trappist beer.
Taste: caramel, bread, herbs, alcohol. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: full body, creamy.

330ml bottle pours dark brown with generous foamy head. Caramel malt, bready aroma with a hint of fruit. Tastes of caramel, brown sugar, yeast, dried fruit and cream liquor. Plenty of bubbles, dried fruit undertones and strong alcohol give this beer a subtle wine-like finish. Although this is a rich, sweet and complex beer, the long-lasting carbonation keeps it fresh all the way through. Great for cooler weather, but I will be buying a few in summer as well.

Great experience, Slightly bitter chocolate, dark fruit and sweet banana flavours. A strong sweetness, but not too much, great balance in mouth. Smooth, Probably one of my favourite beers of all time, never to share!

From memory. 330ml bottle. Pours brown. This wasnt what I was expecting as I had never tried a dark Belgian beer, and nothing so strong. Medium carbonation. Toffee, liqorish, Dandelion n Burdock, chocolate, dark fruit and sweet banana flavours. A strong sweetness, yet it never gets cloying. Smooth, thick mouth feel. This feels like a dessert more than a beer. Probably one of my favourite beers of all time and now i wished i had sipped it on my own rather than sharing it out.

I have to make a stipulation on this review: I put this in the fridge to chill and left it too long so I may have missed some of the aroma and flavour. That being said, this was a full flavoured, delicious beer. It pours a very dark brown with a small bubbly head. Theres pretty heavy carbonation that maintains that head. I got a bready aroma, a little malt, a little yeast. Taste is dry but slightly sweet, like a wine. Notes of toffee, dark chocolate, alcohol, and there is definitely a dry, tannic red wine presence. Also, a slight earthy hop bite on the finish. The mouthfeel is oily but light. This is a VERY complex and unusual beer. Delicious, but at 11%abv, one was enough.
Color is deep brown with a tint of red. Aroma is full of chocolate. Taste has licquorice, oil, salty toffee. The sweet elements keep developing in the aftertaste. Very complex and sophisticated.

Bottle from the Good Spirits Co Wine & Beer. Pours a dark dark brown, with a generous frothy pale coffee coloured head. Nose is bananas, bananas, bananas. Then theres Belgian style yeasts, bread, and maybe a little chocolate. Taste is rich and malty and sweet, with again a little chocolate. The high ABV is not at all noticeable. Palate is silky smooth, slightly sticky. The carbonation is quite high, but I guess thats a Belgian thing.

The following Dutch proverb is made for this beer: like an angel peeing on your tongue. Aromas and taste: Dried fruits, coffee, bread. Sweetness and bitterness perfecty in balance. Its high in alcohol but its not boozy whatsoever. In fact the alcohol contributes to the great taste. The best quad in town! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from bierlinie. Pours pitch black. Nose is oak, toffee, sweet, boozy. Palate is dark fruits, toffee, chocolate, bread. Finish is long and warm. This is beautifully Balanced and complex. just a bit heavy for my taste, not the Best beer to finish a tasting on.

Belle brune opaque surmontée dune mousse ivoire avec des bulles moyennes... Un nez charnu, avec des arômes de fruits secs (prune, figue, raisin, datte...), de myrtilles et de mûres, de sucre candi, de miel et de caramel, sur un arôme de houblons extrêmement équilibré. Très beau nez qui ne laisse pas deviner les 11.3 % dalcool. En bouche, une explosion : lamertume des houblons en attaque franche, ensuite le fruit (poire williams, reine-claude, mirabelle...), et sur la fin, les arômes de céréales grillées qui viennent mourir sur lalcool qui ne vient même pas perturber lensemble, dun équilibre impressionnant. Les levures sont présentes en fin de bouche mais restent nobles. Le plus beau, cest quau fur et à mesure de la dégustation, dautres goûts et arômes apparaissent, comme le bubble gum et la barbe à papa, cest fou !!!  Un goût sublime, un must, tout simplement ! Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

Aroma- plum, candy sugar, ethanol, stone fruit, wine, currant. Appearance -blackish brown with an off white head, that pours 2 fingers of foam that recedes into a pillowy head. Some yeast at the bottom. Taste is plum, dates, vinous tones, booze, raisin, port, earth, black currants. Palate is medium thick, starts sweet and boozy finishes somewhat dry and fruity. With a long finish. Overall- a complex and contemplative brew that evolves with each sip.

Light colored, delicate head
Mud-brown, opaque color
Balanced, crisp on palate
Currents, raisins, cloves, wine notes

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. I bought this several years ago and if Im reading the label correctly, its BBD was 2013 so Ill endeavour to rerate a fresher bottle should I get the chance. That being said, despite much care, this poured a murky, particulate ruddy chestnut with a somewhat lasting beige head. Yeasty, vinous and rich but mellow and complex. Raisin, prune, liquorice, run and vanilla aromas and flavours. Medium to full body, medium carbonation and a moderate length and intensity finish. Besides the rum-esque characters, it hides its strength well. As mature as it is, its held up well despite the BBD.

11.2oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a large-medium, foamy tan head. Aroma is Trappist yeast, toffee, raisins, and plum. Taste is raisins, plums, dates, wine, chocolate malt, and yeast. Port wine-like finish - sweet, fruity, and alcoholic. Full body. Moderate carbonation. Heavy, syrupy mouthfeel.
Very sweet! Quality stuff but at 11% this is a bit over the top. I like the extreme stuff though. Malts are plenty. Not much hops. Some fudge.
Mousse onctueuse et très belle bière brune. Très subtile mélange végétal et fruit (prunes confites) Une grande bière.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is strong malts, booze and fruit. Long ending. Really nice trappist

Bottle poured into Trappist glass. Smooth mouthfeel quickly hit by perfect carbonation. Toffee aroma and breaded taste. Aftertaste of raisins. Very smooth beer with absolutely no hint of this being 11.3 ABV. One of the best beers in the world for a reason!!
Superbe robe brune. Un arome de malt, pruneaux très plaisant. Un délice en bouche. Une merveille.

Jolie couleur brune intense avec une mousse ivoire très généreuse qui retombe assez vite.
Une bonne odeur de pruneaux et malts grillés.
Un velouté en bouche très agréable avec le goût de pruneaux qui domine.
Une chaleur qui se prolonge avec une légère touche damertume.
Complexité et équilibre pour cette bière où on ne sent même pas lalcool qui pourtant est bien présent!!!!!!
Cest le Pont Charles de Pragues!Un véritable trésor!!!!

Dégustée dans un verre calice Maredsous.
Belle robe brun sombre, carbonatation intense et mousse ivoire persistante.
Le nez est complexe et dune parfaite harmonie : levures, malts et fruits secs, prunes, raisins...
Le goût nous emmène vers les sommets : équilibre idéal entre les notes fruitées et les malts, complémentarité entre la douceur et lamertume.
Larrière bouche prolonge longuement ces extraordinaires sensations.
La Chapelle Sixtine des bières!
Prunes, sweet caramel, toffee, banana bread. Dark brown with huge head. Smooth notes of caramel, grape and molasses, carbonated to perfection.

Appearance: dark ruby brown
Aroma: fruit, plums 
Mouthfeel: medium full, medium carbonation
Taste: plum, fruit, spicy alcohol 
Overall: really great beer

Top notch Top notch Top notch Top notch Top notch Top notch (<75 characters)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with a beautiful tan head, mostly lasting, great lacing. Aromas of toasted malts, caramel, fruitiness - grapes and apple. Flavours are very smooth and well balanced: malt, Belgian-like yeasty, delicious bitter touch and a soft dryness to it. The alcohol is fairly well hidden, I only really notice it after a while. Extremely creamy, long gradual finish although just a medium body (medium to full at most). Very nice indeed.
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 Дикие травы, карамел& черный хлеб, избыточ& дрожжи
Bottle. Color: Almost black, frothy long lasting beige head. Taste: Complex; red fruit, chocolate, malted barley, yeast, brown sugar, nuts, alcohol, hints of hops. Long lasting medium sweet finish.

Opaque black color with strong glass clinging activity and a yeast ring deposit at the bottom. Creamy and frothy orangy 5 finger island sparkling head sprinkled with some dark charred powder, lasting more than 30 minutes, with an average amount of legs. Flavors of dark fruits, cherries, ester fruits, banana yeast, oak, molasses, herbal spices. Highly sugary yet strong bitterness with an earthy feel. Medium body with strong prickly carbonation. Powerful puckering, leathery, and chalky finish, ending with a dry yeasty, dark fruity, and barrel aged feel. Overall the craft is well done but hard to enjoy. Good appetizer and hard alcohol style brevage. Very boozy, super dry, no freshness. I find it difficult to drink having no pleasing elements. Its quite complex while overly intense.

Una abt/Quadruple de color castaño oscuro sin filtrar y espuma media. Su aroma es suave en las que se destacan notas de caramelo, frutos secos (ciruelas y pasas) y un toque de dulce de leche y café. Su sabor es fuerte, corpóreo en el que destacan los frutos secos (ciruela), chocolate y uva con un final seco, cremoso y duradero que mantiene un dejo suave de alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Si ha fin dal primo assaggio limpressione di una birra dalla grande personalità. Sembra di bere la tradizione, un piccolo pezzo di storia che si manifesta attraverso un equilibrio eccezionale tra gli aromi in gioco. Colore splendido, schiuma assolutamente discreta, grande palato anche se il luppolo la fa da padrone.

Thought I had already rated this this one and that I was giving it a 2nd rate. But no, ntl I still think this beer is overrated. A little too artificial and the mouthfeel is not that great. I stick with 3.6.
One of the top Belgian beer to my opinion. Very impressive. Dark color, smell caramel and taste like resin.The best

Slight alcohol aroma masked by dark fruit. Exceptional dark brown color. Brown head that remains through drinking and provides wonderful lacing. I taste hints of caramel, molasses, and even slight chocolate.

Wonderful beer.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 Bouteille de 33 cl. Déjà "goûtée" et dégustée à de nombreuses reprises mais cette nouvelle dégustation suit celle dune autre bière belge du même type et franchement "il ny a pas photo" : un monde de différence à tous les niveaux ! Tout est dans le détail, surtout la subtilité, léquilibre, la finition. Là où certains pêchent par un ajout immodéré de sucre, dautres qui ne soignent pas lapparence et les plaisirs des arômes, Rochefort conserve sa finesse et son savoir-faire est toujours perceptible.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 Color marrón oscuro con reflejos claros y sin apenas capa de espuma (marrón claro también). No mucha carbonatación. Restos de, probablemente, fermentación en botella. Aroma a malta tostada, algo frutal, quizá algo especiado, y un mínimo de alcohol (notable pero muy mínimo en comparación a otras cervezas del estilo). El sabor es similar, con presencia de alguna fruta (quizá higo); incluso con notas mínimas de café, y con el alcohol, de nuevo, muy moderado. Se percibe que hay alcohol, evidentemente, pero jamás pensaría uno que esta cerveza es de 11,3%, lo cual, al menos para mi paladar, es muy de agradecer. Esta cerveza me parece acongojante. Realizar algo así debe ser un trabajo complejo de narices. Gracias, Rochefort Trappistes, qué más puedo decir...
Great fruity aroma. Alcohol is strong (in a good way). Dont need to say anything about it. ONe of the best beers Ive ever had.

Bottle shared with JMD at HNB 25.08.16. Almost ebony. Foamy and persistent beige head and lacing. Complex aroma of berries marinated in sherry, cream liquor, caramel and medium dark malt. Similar taste, with soft liquorice in aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel.

Murky dark brown, thin beige head shows nice persistence and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is in the likes of a dark fruits cake: molasses, dark/dried fruits, sugar. Im also detecting a hint of coffee. Alcohol is detectable but not too aggressive. Taste reflects the aroma; the beer is obviously on the sweet side but pleasantly so, with a hint of spiciness in the finish. Again alcohol is detectable but not over the top, brings a warming feel. Full body, light crispness, nicely creamy mouthfeel. Good

At home, 2015 bottle (33cl). Direct comparison tasting with Westvleteren 12.

Pour: dark, dunkel red, purplish, clear. Medium carb, good foam.
Nose: dried fruits, sweet, dades&raisins, brown sugar / molasses, malts.
Taste: first - dried fruits, dry minerals, alcohol is certainly present; mid - slight bitterness, malts; after - sirup and molasses, very pleasant.
Mouthfeel: Sirupy thick consistency, aggressive carbonation and bitterness.
Verdict: Very pleasant, sweet and sirupy. The alcohol is a bit too dominant to my taste.

Pours deep ruby-brown with a big frothy tan head, hardly any lacing. Nose of toast, maple syrup, caramel, raisins, rum, spice, yeast, candied zest, panettone. Taste is medium to high sweetness backed up just by high carbonation (hardly any bitterness). Medium body, rather thin for the ABV, high alco warmth on finish. Excellent but overrated (IMHO some De Struise or Straffe Hendrik quads are way better).

Zeer complexe geur en smaak. De kandijsuiker, caramel, donker fruit en een myriade aan kruiden zorgen voor een fluweelzoete smaak. Naar het einde toe domineert de alcohol. Perfectie bestaat niet maar Rochefort 10 komt akelig dichtbij!

Bottle. Pours dark hazy brown with tan head. Aroma is complex and fruity with dried fruits like dates, figs, raisins, liquorice, caramel, dark and roasted malts yet sweet. Taste is even more complex with malt, cane sugar, dried fruits, date, fig, raisin, apricot, liquorice, caramel and molasses. Finish is surprisingly dry and carbonation lively and hides alcohol well. A wonder!

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Impressive look with heavy foam and dark colour. Intense flavours. Caramel, liquorice, banana, raisins, salt, coffee. Nice carbonisation. Not much smell. Could have been a little less sweet, otherwise great stuff.
Very dark brown color with nice two finger tan head. Aroma is sweet. Taste has coffee and in aftertaste salty licorice.

33CL bottle had for several years,
pours a dark brown with a cream head
 aroma is grain malt fruity 
 Taste is dry malt rich dried fruit currants sultanas,bit of bitterness dryness ,not present in younger versions,long dry finish 
 easily the best trappist beer,and a world class ale

Gushing. Brown, nice off white head. Aroma: dark fruits, toffee, raisins, some yast notes. Heavy sweetness, quite full body. Flavour: raisins, malts, caramel, subtle dark malts, but most of all alcohol.

Served in a tulip from a 330ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy very dark chestnut colour with a thick light beige head, plenty of lacing in the glass. Aroma is winey, dark fruits, a hint of molasses and clear alcohol. Taste is mainly dark fruits and winey, resembles a port at the finish - warming, fruity and yet again, very alcoholic. Medium body with medium carbonation and clear alcoholic aftertaste. Observing the comments Ive expected it to be something completely out of this world but am quite disappointed... The strength of the beer is clearly present from start to finish in a form of a very detectable alcohol - in the aroma, the taste and the aftertaste. I bet if this kind of beer was produced by anybody else but Trappists, it wouldve been slaughtered for being too heavily laced with alcohol...

Espuma beige-marrón, color chococalte oscuro casi negro y opaco que no deja pasar la luz, aroma dulce en nariz, sabor potente donde a pesar de los 11 grados se disfruta y se aprecian las notas dulces y el regusto sabroso y permanente.

330ml bottle. Dark pour with a thick lingering head. Deep flavours with spices, dried fruits (raisins and dates in particular) and a sweet chocolatey note. Finishes like a port: fruity and boozy. The body is quite carbonated and perhaps thinner than the strength would imply, and theres nothing done to hide the strength.
Bijzonder mooi krachtige quadrupel. Levendig karakter met veel fruitig aroma en licht zoet/bittere smaak. Perfect in balans.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 Bottle at unibar. Dark brown big head, long lasting. Aroma of dades, raisen, dried fruits, sweets. Medium carbonation. Taste is sweets, dried fruit, dades, notes of Alchohol, not dominant though. Good beer, strong taste. Creamy body. 

UPDATE 29-10-2016 Raised the aroma from eight to nine. This is really a good and very inviting aroma of much complexity.

From bottle. Pour a deep brown with little head, though carbonation is very evident. Aroma of dark cherry, raisin and blackcurrant and these flavours come through on the palate along with soft liquorice. Great depth of flavour. I would certainly recommend you try this beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy dark brown. Nose of raisins, malt loaf, coffee, dark chocolate, molasses. Taste is savoury, full bodied, syrupy, whisky.

Apparence : Brune foncée aux reflets rouges vifs, bon col beige mousseux, belles rétention et dentelle, effervescence élevée et rapide. 

Nez : Pain grillé, levure belge équilibrée avec le malt, touche dalcool, pruneaux, mûres, léger boisé, touche de caramel. Belle complexité à travers laquelle on semble dénoter quelque chose de nouveau chaque fois quon y plonge le nez. 

G : Entrée équilibrée entre le pain grillé, le malt mi sucré et la levure belge, qui prend de plus en plus de place au mi palais. Elle est alors accompagnée dune belle amertume et des fruits mentionnés au nez. Des fruits noirs que lon peut trouver dans certains vins rouges. La finale présente lamertume ainsi quune belle chaleur dalcool. 

S : Plutôt dense, effervescence moyenne à faible, longue finale chaleureuse et quelque peu épicée.

O : Bière dans laquelle la levure belge sexprime davantage par ses notes fruitées (plutôt uniques de surcroit) que par ses épices, ce que je trouve personnellement intéressant. Le pain grillé et la touche damertume viennent bien complémenter les fruits et les épices pour en faire une bière goûteuse, multidimensionnelle, équilibrée et tout de même facile à boire. Pas de défaut.
This 11.3% Beer took my heart and flew around the room with it. Tastes so good makes you wanna slap yo mama lol. Really though this is an awesome beer definitely a must try.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with medium sized tanned head. Aroma of plum, raisin, sage, liquorice. Sweet and complex.

Believe the hype. Effervescent pour with tan head that disappears within seconds. Dark cherry impression in the ruby red colour, nose, and taste. Heavenly scent - huge cherry, currant, raisin, fig profile. Taste is similar, but not as huge as the aroma; loads of dark fruit and some bread. Heavy carbonation adds a refreshing character without too much muting. Finish has a light hop note which Im not used to in a quad, but it absolutely fits. An 11.3% with no booze taste, but has some heat going down. World class.
Cerveja bem forte. Levemente adocicada e sabor bem forte. Da para sentir bem o alcool.
warming sensation, caramel tones, champagne bubbles, alcoholic goodness. Perfect drink for the festive season, Christmas tastes of raisin and plum.
Cerveja trapista, de coloração marrom escura. Aroma maltado, sabor adocicado, álcool presente.

Bottle, Pours muddy brown with tan head. Aroma of strong belgian yeast, almond, dried fruits, raisins, plums, light apriciot rather complex. Taste is heavy, not really that sweet or that bitte, but quite balanced. quite intense and smooth.

12 degrees Celsius in a tulip glass from a bottle. Nose is sticky sweet toffee and candied dark fruits. Pours beautifully dark mahogany brown to almost black with a thick, frothy three fingers of tan head. Head has dissipated quickly to simply leave a ring - no lacing. Taste is sweet, followed by sweet with a hint of alcohol at the end (but only a hint). Moderately thick and low effervescence. Gently warming on the way down. Medium length palate. 
Definitely a digestif which could easily replace a Cognac. I wish I had some chocolate mud cake to go with it. Lovely. 
Wouldnt take to a BBQ though.
Dark brown. Brown sugar aromas, dried fruits, raisins, caramel, spice. Taste is heavily sweet, dried fruits like figs, apricot and raisins, brown sugar, yeast, spices. Long, sweet finish.

A bottle from Jasons near NCC Uni., drunk at home. Opaque, chocolatey colour, head dissipates quickly. Malty aroma with hints of caramel. Fizzy, carbonated mouth feel, not unpleasant. Taste is sweet and heavy, with a kick of alcohol at the end. An excellent Trappist.
Barbacoa in Boise. Happy Hour 2 for $10. Wow. Best before bottle 13.10.2020. Classic and what all quads strive to be. Deep flavor. Smooth lingering head. Happiness all around.

Átlátszatlan barna, sok üledékkel, nagy és tartós habbal. Illata észteres, és karamelles. Íze erősen karamelles, pici pörkölt beütéssel, gyenge gyümölcsös mellékízzel. Az alkohol nem bújik el, bizony érezni a sör erejét. Nagyon testes, kifejezetten laktató, szénsavas sör.

Bottle (about a year old) at home. Ive been desperate to try this for a long time, and I finally cracked it this weekend. It was highly carbonated and foamy, which surprised me. Fantastic dark Belgian taste that captures all the best tastes of Trappist beer: raisins, dark fruit, molasses, candy sugar, and grain. Complex and tasty.

11.2oz bottle. Hazy red plum color with a substantial off white head. Raisin plum aroma. Sweet plum raisin chocolate toffee flavor. Medium heavy sticky. Delicious and complex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is the drink that made me fall in love with beer. Creamy, dark fruits, chocolate and cinnamon. Always a hint of wood and caramel that runs through every sip. A meld that only a master brewer can accomplish. The most beautiful complexion, dark and inviting. So complex yet so accessible. It will make you grin with pleasure as you try to analyse what the hell youre drinking. Never bettered.

Bottle - Slightly hazy light brwn colour, massive creamy beige head, good retention and fine lacing. Amazingly complex aromas of plum, chocolate, honey, raisins, red grapes, some cloves, dates, candy, toasted nuts, toffee with a touch of cinnamon some wood, herbs. Taste bings that complexity a higher level. Very well balanced, sophisticated and complex beer. Truly amazing and exciting.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2016 Bottle. What a beer, and it?s just awesome to find it in every supermarket (like every Quadruppel) at a really fair price. Good big cream head, strong carbonation. Very sweet and fruity. Flavors : raisin, chocolate, caramel. It?s not really hopy (it?s so malty that it should be overly hoped to be tasted). Strong alcohol flavour too...

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 330 ml bottle. Pours dark copper with a light brown head. The aroma is lightly yeasty. Full body with average carbonation. The taste is pretty sweet with some acidity from overripe apples and pears. Caramel, honey, and brown sugar and an warming alcoholic ending. A little to much sweetness for my taste.

Bouteille 33 cl - couleur marron foncé comme du cola, tête beige résistante, arômes complexe, sur la cerise, les fruits noires, le caramel, goût complexe lui aussi, on va sur le malt, le caramel, la cerise noire, texture onctueuse, une belle réussite

APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso con algunos destellos cafés a contraluz, con una corona de espuma color beige de buena retención de burbujas muy compactas.

AROMA: es muy compleja, destacan las notas a caramelo, toffee, costra de pan, frutos oscuros maduros como ciruelas, pasas, dátiles, higos, notas a plátano, ligeramente el especiado de la levadura belga, licorosa.

SABOR: al igual que el aroma es muy complejo; al tocar el líquido la boca se siente dulce, al trago nuevamente destacan las notas a caramelo, azúcar no procesado, toffee, frutos oscuros maduros como ciruelas, higos, dátiles, pasas, notas a plátano, pan, nueces, algo especiado característico de la levadura, muy ligeras notas a chicle y algunas notas herbales, sabor a vino jerez sin llegar a sentirse licorosa en boca, todo seguido de un amargor medio bajo. El retrogusto queda un amargor medio bajo no astringente con larga permanencia de los sabores.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio con mediana baja carbonatación. El alcohol bien escondido, sólo se siente una sensación calurosa ligera en garganta al correr el líquido.

RESUMEN: excelente cerveza, de clase mundial.
330ml bottle. Dark amber with an off-white bubbly head. Slightly hoppy aroma, mildly sawdust-like. Bitter flavour, with hops and notes of brandy. Not the greatest Trappist I have ever encountered.

330ml bottle. Huge aroma which is slightly sweet and has notes of something spicy. The flavour is much lighter body then I expected but the flavour profile is monstrous. While there are many flavours I am finding it very difficult to name any.

Cor marrom escuro com tonalidade caramelo e sedimentos finos em suspensão; espuma bege de alta formação e persistência de uma fina camada com lacing razoável (no copo adequado a persistência e lacing diminuem).
Aroma de frutas secas, frutas cristalizadas, nozes e pimenta; em segundo plano notas vinificadas e álcool.
Sabor inicialmente de frutas secas e cristalizadas e nozes, acompanhado de uma picância intensa e deliciosa; evolui para um meio discreto de vinho do Porto com final alcoólico amadeirado e de amargor terroso; retrogosto alcoólico, amadeirado, terroso e picante.
Corpo sedoso, carbonatação média.
Incrível drinkability.

33cl bottle at home. Pours a hazy dark brown colour with a reddish glow and a small beoge head. Aroma of liquorice, citrus, cherries, caramel, slight yeast, raisins. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a slight sour and dry finish. Notes of coffee, cacao, raisins, alcohol, liquorice, toasted malts, cherries. Texture is sticky, full bodied with soft carbonation

Chocolate colored and hazy. Thick, frothy tan head. 
Raspberry, lemon, banana, sour cherry aromas. 
Medium sour and sweet throughout. 
Cherry, bread, and lemon flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Comparable à la Westvleteren 12, mais beaucoup plus accessible. Un grand classique, qui existe depuis toujours... et pour toujours... amen!

20160605 Home; 33 cl bottle; BB 20210316: A bright rubbish colour with a good brownish foam layer which stays very good for a high alcoholic beer. The complex smell is sweet caramel, chocolate, alcohol; Red/dark fruit (raisins, black berries); dark malt. The taste is even more complex besides the alcohol and the sweetness. A malty bitterness which give the beer a mocca-chocolate taste with dark fruit (raisins and black berries). Also a liquor-like feeling. Just a little more carbonisation as a normal beer. A malty bitterness with some hops in the aftertaste. A nice complex beer for a finish of a beer tasting party.
Its a nice amber with right head when poured. Initially too much alcohol but the it settles and very drinkable. Not sure i would drink a six pack but nice to finish the night with

6an är bra, 8an bättre men 10an är lätt bäst. Mycket doft och smak i denna! Torkade frukter, sötma, kryddor, karamell, jäst. Riktigt bra, en öl man gärna njuter av i lugn och ro!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Alko. Very dark brown color with nice two finger tan head. Aroma is sweet. Taste has coffee and in aftertaste salty licorice.

Pours a hazy dark brown cola colored with a thin tan ring. Medium carbonation and plenty of lacing. Nice tart aroma of Brett and Belgian spices. Flavors of caramel, toffee, and light spices burst onto your tongue and linger. The finish is smooth with a hint of warmth. Hides the alcohol extremely well. Very enjoyable. Similar to Gulden Draak but not as sweet.

11.2 oz. bottle into Trappistes Rochefort glass. Pour is dark brown with a creamy beige head. Aroma is cherry, dark fruits, caramel, and has some vinous qualities. Taste is dark fruits, plum, Belgian yeast, spice, malt, caramel, vinous, and nutty. Has a creamy, velvety texture. Warming finish, but not overly so.
