Very complex, but Id like to think the recipe is a simple one that has been perfected over many years. One of the best.

Aroma: roasty, malty and complex; Appearance: black-brown with off white head that dissipates fairly quickly; Taste: rich and malty, boozy, and smooth; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: still a favorite of all time.

BUY IT ITS Amazing 

The top product from the Rochefort Trappist brewery. Dark color, full and very impressive taste. Strong plum, raisin, and black currant palate, with ascending notes of vinousness and other complexities

330 mL bottle. The pour is a dark brown color, nice shade, with a larger light khaki head that falls down to a finger high cap, but it fizzes like a soda, its definitely not thick beer like. The aroma is interesting. Very complex. There is a nice sweet malt that meshes with a light vinousness and carries a good bit of dark fruit. There is a strong sweetness that isnt as bad as I thought it was at one time. Thanks, changing palate. The flavor is good. There is a lot of sweet malts and a good punch of dark fruits and a light caramel There isnt a whole lot of complexity in addition to that. This is nothing like a traditional belgian, and all of the good qualities that I look for. The mouth feel is a little thin, but the fizzy carbonation really throws it off. The aftertaste is lingeringly sweet and carries a light fruit to it. Its not too bad, much better than I remember.

Rochefort 10 cellared 3 years

Pours a dark brown color with a fluffy, fizzy, two finger sized head.

Fantastic aromas of ripe sour cherries among rock sugar and roasted malts, very intense on the nose. Almost a little boozy, but amazingly well integrated into the decadent sweet aromas, balanced by old wood and toasted walnut shell. 

Has a very lively, bubbly carbonation, which makes the beers heavy body unfold in a lighter manner on the tongue, also washing away its boozy peak, which is recognizable for just a split second, while leaving with a long lasting warmth down the throat. 

Cherries from the nose are amongst the flavors from the very beginning, entangled into toffee, licorice, dried wood bark and autumn leaves. Malts have a toasty richness in this, which is heavy on the tongue, opening up the palate perfectly to the sweeter flavors, and makes it possible to integrate its warm boozy note so perfectly well. Nuttiness mingles into the warming alcohol, producing a cola sweetness, calmed by old earth and toasty malts, while finishing with a bubbly mineralic tone and dried plums. 

I am blown away by this one, this tastes perfect. Love the dried, sugared, alcohol soaked cherry note, which blends into roasted, rich malts. All flavors are intense and well pronounced at the same time, creating an awesome balance, making it possible for the different components to pack such a huge punch.

Voluminös. Komplex. Spritzig. Atemberaubend. Man riecht, schaut und wenn dann das erste Schlückchen die Kehle hinab gegleitet ist, kann man es nicht fassen. So vielschichtig kann ein Getränk sein. Trockenobstsüße wird vom trocken Körper abgefedert, der Nachhall bricht mehrmals in verschiedene Richtungen aus um dann langsam und wärmend alkoholisch ins Ziel zu gelangen.HEAVY!!!! 0,33l/ca.2 Euro aus einem Carrefour in Belgien. Bottle by Baby.

Drinking from a 33cl bottle. 
In the aroma alcohol
The clear brown beer has a medium Brown head
In the taste caramel and coffee
Medium carbonated

Botella. Presencia caoba profundo con corona blanca persistente y compacta. Carbonatacion media. Aroma a frutos secos, caramelo y licor, En boca intenso sabor carameloso y licor acabando dulce, alcohol perfectamente integrado, Retrogusto potente a licor y caramelo.

Pours very dark brown color with small, short lasting off-white head. Hazy appearance. Lovely smell, sweet and floral.

Full body with average carbonation. Creamy, thick texture. Very smooth on the tongue despite the alcohol burn. Taste is mostly sweet. Rich aroma. Herbal, floral, toffee, spices, nuts... Lovely. Dry finish with subtly noticeable alcohol presence. 

Overall, excellent.

If youre looking for a pooter go away! This is a quality Belgian beer! Ive tried the 6, 8, 10 all delicious different abv. I even like Rochefort and saint bernadus better than the so called number one rated beer on this site. You dont even taste the alcohol, thats the thing about high abv beers u taste the alcohol more than all the malts/hops/barley/caramel....this you only taste yummy caramel, toasty molasses, n wonderful belgique malts! YUM!

Scents of yeast and malt sweet and nuts. Pours opaque brown with a rocky big tan head. Big huge flavors of malt and leather umami combination of sweet and sour with an abrupt acerbic finish which is the only hint of alcohol. Oily mouthfeel with heavy carbonation. Quite a mouthfull. Rockin.

Bottle. Pours dark chestnut brown with huge white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, caramel, cinnamon, nutmeg, prunes, black currant jam, port wine and hints of hay. Taste is medium acidic, light salty, light bitter and medium to very sweet. Body is creamy with soft carbonation. Finish is long and mostly sweet and somewhat bitter with notes of sugar, malt syrup, honey, toffee, bitter grapefruit, pomegranate, port wine, sweet licorice and raw salty licorice. Very rich and complex
Bottle. Amazing beer where the aroma, and taste is blended together into one nice beer. Difficult to describe, but its very complex and a great beer in all ways.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Bottle from The bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a deep brown colour with a frothy off white head. Aroma of blackcurrant, plum, raisin, some cherry, slight bready malts, chocolate, a little cola, a hint of liquorice, Belgian yeast and subtle spice. Taste of blackcurrant, plum, cola, some chocolate, raisin, slight liquorice, spice, a little cherry, a hint of brown sugar and subtle herbal hops. Full bodied and slick texture. A powerfully long, fruity, spicy bitterness in the finish. Another wonderfully complex Belgian quad, lovely fruity flavours and lots of spiciness. Quite alcoholic and sweet at times but so flavourful. Best Belgian beer Ive had so far.

330 ml bottle.

Nearly black with dark head. Some lacing. Maybe sweet taste, great mouthfeel. Just high price in Norway.

Darkest of all Trappistes Rochefort. Strong carbonation, mouthfeel divine. Very complex and deep taste and aroma, but not heavy. Superb balance. Syrup bread - which is the trade mark reserved just to the world class in this type of beers. Hallelujah! Would like to marry my son in the family of the brewer.

More or less the gold standard for quality in beer, its an amazing brew indeed, with so much going on (not least of which is the healthy 11.3% kick). Could be slightly more rounded in terms of mouthfeel but any criticism here is like mortals tossing pebbles at gods.

Aroma: plum, raisin, high alcohols.
Appearance: hazy deep brown color and beige head.
Taste: really warming alcohol, peachy, roasted dark malts, red fruits, plum, champagne notes (strange), black currant, quite dry.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, fruit finish.
Overall: Really interesting stuff, for me alcohol is to high and even slightly rough.
Bottle, dark pour, velvet head. Vibrant raisins and citrus nose. Bright carbonation, rich molasses and alcohol. Not much lingers
From bottle. Pours very dark amber, hazy, with big, beige head. Chocolate, good liquor, malty, warming alcohol, wood. High carbonation, nice lacing, smooth.

This beer is what they say it is. Rich and complex. The strength though lies in its subtlety. The tastes and smells arent "in your face", its all smooth and well, subtle.
This makes this beer to me one of the very best.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2016 Có? powiedzie?, belgijski klasyk, w mojej opinii lepszy ni? Westvletteren XII i St.Sixtus Abt. Aromat karmelowy, dobrego winnego alkoholu (madera?), pot??ne dro?d?e. W smaku "trapistowskie" dojrza?e gruszki i jab?ka, ?liwka, marcepan, troch? banana i wanilii. Wszystko to mo?na spotka? w wielu innych piwach ale tu jest idealnie zharmonizowane. Finisz d?ugi, wytrwany, lekko przesuszaj?cy - alkohol robi swoje cho? przy 11,3% ABV piwo to jest wyj?tkowo pijalne. Majstersztyk.

Pours rasin, dark amber with tan head. The aroma is really fruity. Plums, figs, bubblegum, raisins. The flavor is sweet with plum, fig, sugar, caramel. Body is medium, overall very sweet well balanced witht the alcohol.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 Po przelaniu do kielicha prezentuje się przepięknie, ciemnobrązowa ciecz z bujną, beżową pianą, wygląd naprawdę klasowy. Aromat średnio intensywny, czuć nieco fenoli, ciemne owoce, nuty winne, nieco też szlachetnych trunków. Smak przebogaty, czuć nieco rozgrzewającego alkoholu, rodzynki, wino, nalewkę z ciemnych owoców, fenole, można analizować każdy łyk. Wytrawne, bardzo degustacyjne ze względu na bogactwo smaku i aromatu. Deserowe piwo. Choć mi bardziej z Rochefortów podeszła 8, i tak jest bardzo dobre

300ml bottle. Pours dark brown with small beige head. Aroma of port wine, dried fruits, plums, caramel, alcohol. Medium body with soft carbonation. Taste is bittersweet, very complex and warming. Exceptionally great beer.
Foamy pour. Citrus on nose. Sour molasses with sweet finish. Mid Thick mouth feel. Head sticks around for a while.

330ml bottle. Pours deep brown with a medium and persistent off-white/beige head. Aroma is malty, caramel, toffee, dried fruits, cherry, brown sugar, yeasts, fruits. Flavour is sweet and malty with a vinous touch and a bittersweet end. Full body, medium carbonation. A great beer!

Pours very dark brown from the bottle. The creamy tan crown remains rather small but lingers for the duration. Quite striking is the aroma, which is inviting as well as complex; the usual roasted malt and caramel is present but portwine and cherry play strong accompanying roles. The first sip is smooth and very warming. The overall impression the beer makes is rather like a rich and sweetish tasting stout mixed with a good cognac or portwine. The tastes are really pretty amazing, and each sip is a little different, and draws you in, leaving you wanting more. Hints of caramel, plum and bubble gum are all present, and the beer finishes with a soft cherry note. 
The beer came to me highly recommended and has not disappointed. At 11.3 ABV and being heavy bodied and rich it is not something I could see drinking on a regular basis, but it makes an excellent digestif and would certainly be a good winter beer. The next bottle I plan to age and see how it tastes in two years time. Excellent.
Simply stunning. A bit different at first, when it comes to 'sweet' belgium beers, but a cery nice chocolate/caramel/dried fruits end. Goes great with some Kalamata olives
Aroma of Brown sugar, dried fruits, spices. Dark brown color, thin quickly disappearing head. Medium body, Weil balanced, alcohol hidden.

Bottle at Strawberry Thief, Bristol.
Appearance: small off-white head which stays for long, dark brown colour, hazy, fair lacing.
Aroma: malts + yeasts, bit of fruits.
Taste: quite sweet fruity, deep taste.
Palate: full bodied, but not too heavy, good carboration, long finish.
Very good beer, very intensive taste with a nice aroma, perfectly balanced. Wow!

rating from 19/06/2015, hard to believe ive only just had this. got a bottle from beergeek shop, had it on my own at home, friday night. pours dark brown with a tan head. amazing aroma of brown sugar, raisins, dried fruits, dark chocolate. taste follows. brandy, figs, plums, toffee, bit of coffee. the dark fruits really control the flavour. its malty and rich and the boozy dunt you get from it is perfect. silky smooth feeling and a dry lasting finish. man its just fucking great what can i say
Very nice beer, strong aroma and flavor. Tastes like a roasty chocolate, as for me nice. Head disappears rather quickly. High ABV so be careful before you enjoy to many :) One of my fav black beers!
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Aún teniendo 11,3 grados de alcohol, no se nota en la boca. Aunque sí en el espíritus. Buenísima.

Two labels on the bottle with information about the drink temperature but not about in details the hops and malts. 
A black beer with a cappuccino head, a nose full of chocolate, full budy, creamy in the mouth, flat carbonation, short and not dominated finish,
(I have a 0.33l bottle with best-before date 01.2021)

It is a dark brown with some hazing. The head has a mousy look to it in a tan color. Strong fruit ester aromas that feature cherries and plums that features a bready malt and spices. There are also perfume aromas as it warms. The taste features bready and toasty malts with cherries and plums. There is a vinous quality to it and strong alcohol, but it is not hot. It is mostly sweet with a slight bitterness that creeps in towards the finish. It has a moderate feel to it. It finishes very dry with alcohol warming.

Great beer, the aroma was very floral and lots of caramel almost a little bit like a perfume. The taste was nutty, floral, malty, and caramel. The beer hid the alcohol very well. The mouthfeel was great.

Dark fruits, caramel, toasted notes, good white/tan head quite persistant and very creamy, beautiful dark brown, taste of dark fruits, full body, high carbonation maybe i prefer a bit less, alcohol is well hidden, present only in the aftertaste, medium sweetness...oh wow, this is a bless.
Litt skuffet ifht forventninger. Mulig den kler et bedre viltmåltid, men alene så er Westmalle bedre.

Dark brown, lowish carbonation. Nice fruity aroma of plums, dates, caramel, and alcohol. Quite sweet. Rich and fruity. Tastes of dried fruits, prunes, a slight root beer quality to it. Some herbal notes. A tiniest hint of chocolate. Has a nice acidity in the end that keeps this from being overbearingly sweet. Very malt and yeast driven beer. Little to no hop flavor. Bitterness comes from the spicy phenols. Very complex, but easy to drink, even at the high alcohol level. One of the best beers in the world. Bravo.
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2016 Bottle. Brown, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.
Almost like candy. Sweet, powerful and fanrastic aromas. One of the best trapists there is.
A great Quadrupple. One of the better I tasted. Lovely brown colour with good foam. Great taste that warms your belly. Enjoy!
On tap at Coopers tavern. Just awesome. Dark fruit, plum, wood, earth, spice, booze is everywhere.

Aromat wyraźne rodzynki, suszone owoce, trochę karmelu i alkoholu. Barwa ciemno brunatna. W smaku rozgrzewające, lekko alkoholowe też, ciutka wanilii. Zdecydowanie degustacyjne piwo. Bardzo dobre piwo.

Heaven in a glass. Pours a rich slightly hazy dark brown. Aroma of dark fruits and,caramel sweetness. Taste is smooth and sweet with caramel, dark fruit, hint of licorice and syrup with exceptional carbonation.Great balance, great flavor, great experience.

probably a weird bottle. Aroma was gentle alcohol, dark sugars, some raisins, way in the back some gentle plums, some toast. soft and balanced. when warmed some esters pop up as well. 
appearance: amber-brown, slight haze, medium off white head with ok retention. 
alcohol, sweetness, raisins, possibly some plums, toast. quite gentle and balanced for a big beer. not that intimidating though. expected more complexity. 

medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, sweetish short finish. overall a great balance for a big beer, but not a big difference from the 6,8.
light malt aroma, brown in color with nice head. complex taste. malty, sweet, slight spice, hints of plum/stone fruit flavor, rich dark caramel malt flavors, slight malty alcohol finish.

Dark brown with a caramel colored head. Complex aroma with promises of dark fruits, sweetness and a hint of citrus. The taste is unsurpassable, it gives sweet caramel, slight hint of licorice and syrup bread. The head is beautiful and creamy. It´s texture is a smooth round feeling. Overall this is the best beer I have ever tasted, the Rochefort 10 is in a class of it´s own.
La complessità di questa birra é al palato con note maltate intense ma mai eccessive e un finale corposo e equilibrato con tonalità tostate e lievemente affumicate. Notevole.
Pasas, frutos rojos, licorosa. Alcohol presente, pero muy bien balanceado con los perfiles frutales.
Looks and taste as you would expect an abbaye beer to. Nothing special but still a good brew that i will buy again.
Dark amber, poor foam. Complex aroma: carmel, red wine, plum, raisins. Taste complex a lot of fruits, some pepper, spicies from yeast. Well balanced. World class.
Dark coloured and cloudy. Pretty sweet aroma. Without head, minimal. The taste is medium sweet.
Pours a dark brown. Raisin and dark fruits with yeast notes in the very complex aroma and taste. Excellent, the best Quadrupel Ive ever tried and, therefore, my favorite one.

This is not a beer, its ... heaven! 1 bottle of 33 cl of this is all you need as an alternative for 3 glasses of wine. Not sure if there is any beer out there better than R10. Available in nearly every supermarket in Belgium for cheap price too.
Color marrone scuro con schiuma beige. Frutti di bosco, caramello, frutta secca, con alcool ben percettibile. Meravigliosa.

Wysoka, trwała piana. Ładnie znaczy szkło. W aromacie dużo karmelu, rodzynek, trochę zwietrzalego chmielu przechodzącego w wymiociny. Wysoko nasycone. W smaku karmel z czerwonymi owocami - słodowe. Jak to z trapistami bywa, super ukryty alkohol - niewyczuwalny w smaku, znieczula jamę ustną. W porównaniu do chimay, bernardusa czy gulden draaka, nie porwalo mnie.

Denne belgiske trappist har et mørkt udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en sød og frugtigt aroma og smager af sød karamel og lakrids med noter af citrus. Cremet fornemmelse. Lav karbonering.
Looks like Coca Cola, aroma is typical ale aroma,,colour of it and head is like Coca Cola as i said before,, very strong ale, with rich taste.

Kolor: Głęboka czerwień wpadająca już w brąz. 
Piana: Minimalistyczna, beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa. Piana z sykiem ucieka w dół. Po kilku sekundach nie zastaje już po niej nawet ślad, 
Zapach: Głęboki i bardzo wyraźny aromat. Pierwsze nuty zapachowe przywołują sugestie czerwonego wina.
W kolejnych niuchach już pojawiają się ciemne owoce: śliwki, ciemne winogrona, rodzynki.
Słodycz jest intensywna z karmelem i toffi na szczycie.
Smak: Jest wielowymiarowy.
Głębia smaku jest wprost niebywała.
Na języku czuć niezliczoną ilość składowych: śliwki, brzoskwinie, toffi, karmel, odrobinę orzechów, szczyptę mlecznej czekolady, rodzynki, winogrona.
Smak zmienia się co jakiś czas. Raz wydaje się winny, raz owocowy, raz przyprawowy.
Po ogrzaniu pojawiają się nawet sugestię whisky ze szczyptą pikantności (pieprz).
Goryczka niewielka, owocowa i krótka.
Alkohol perfekcyjnie zamaskowany. Aż trudno uwierzyć, że to piwo ma ponad 11%. Wyborny trunek. 
Wysycenie: Średnie w kierunku wysokim. Syczy przy nalewaniu i musuje na języku. 
Podsumowanie: 

Kompletne w smaku i aromacie. Złożone, wielowymiarowe piwo.
Nie ma się do czego przyczepić.
Smak i aromat osycylują wokół ciemnych owoców (śliwki, winogrona, rodzynki, brzoskwinie), słodkich składowych (karmel, toffi), winnych oraz przyprawowych akcentów.
Piwo początkowo słodkie, wyklejające usta, w miarę upływu czasu nabiera także lekko wytrawnych i alkoholowych cech.
Bardzo dobry wybór w dobrej cenie (ok. 16 zł.).
One of the better tasting Belgian beers. Complex taste of caramel chocolate
Short lasting creamy head. Strong bubble gum and caramel in smell and taste. Strong alcohol worming.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

A deep, deep red with a creamy, beige head. The aroma is like a banana milkshake, delicious smelling. Creamy mouthfeel. A banana milkshake type taste too with some coriander and other spices like cinnamon. This is truly an amazing beer!
0.33l bottle. pours a dark chestnut with a medium beige head and little lacing. aroma of black currants, caramel, alcohol. flavour of caramel, dried fruits, raisins. alcohol warmth.
dark brown to black with off-white thick head, alcoholic, yeasty, spicy smell, medium sweetness, spicy clove taste, medium body, lively carbonation, a little bit too much alkohol taste
0.33 l bottle. Dark brown color with a white head. Caramel, fruits and tofee in the complex aroma. Rich fruity,nutty and malty taste. Just as beer was meant to be.

Look; fawn top, ultra dark ruby body, beautiful. 
Aroma; caramel, honeyish yeast, floral forest, bread. 
Taste; caramel, fruits, yeast, chocolate, brown sugar candies, apple bush, grassy hops 
- finish is sweet, malty, fruity and lingering.
Feels soft, gentle, juicy. 
Overall very tasty, and women-friendly too. Valentines Day soon..... 
[33cl btl ll.3%abv, BB30.6.2020]
Boa trappista, achei a Rcohefort 6 melhor, mais equilibrada. Aroma um pouco forte, alcoolico, alcool aparece um pouco.
Jako tamno pivo, okus kave i karamele, samo sa puno alkohola, okus ostaje dugo ustima, preporuke, medju boljim pivama

Maravillosa cerveza belga. Cremosa y con sabor persistente. Espuma duradera y dorada. Fuerte de alcohol. 11.3. Pero de sabor compensado. Muy recomendable. Cerveza para tomar con tiempo y en buena compañía.
Bevuta in bottiglia da 33 cl alla birreria Petrarca a torino. Sempre un ottima scelta. Una buonissima birra trappiste. Corposissima. Finale reticente.
Scurissima, quasi nera, corposa ma morbida al palato, lalcool non è invadente, anzi forte il caramello, un pelo speziata, un must drink abs

.33l bottle poured a darkbrown beer. Strong body, smells wood-like and a bit sweet (caramel)

Taste is not bitter at all, malty and yeasty taste. 
Overall, great beer
Very strong caramel, dark fruit, spicy,complex aroma. Long-lasting off-white head. Almost black color. Spicy sweet taste, strong feeling of alcohol. Long aftertaste. Perfect beer!

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 What a fantastic texture. Taste wise it is very good but underwhelming compared to the Westvleteren 12 but is still much better then your average Trappiest, the flavor is a little sweet and acidic in comparison. Still the texture is fantastic. A very good beer.
Dark brown color. Smell of Figs, plums, oakiness, sweet caramel/toffee notes. Taste of dark fruits....plums, dates, figs, some cherries, hints of smokiness, spice, caramel sweetness.

0,33lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
Full body, dark cloudy beer. Aromz is sweet and reminds wine, got also some nuts and chocolate in the nose. Taste very rich, complex. Medium carbonation, brown foam that disappears quick. Better z bit more warm to drink (12-15 Degrees Celsius). One of the best, similar to the Westvleteren XII

Dark brown color, , foam disapperes quickly but it has strong smell, very complex aroma, sweet caramel start and great roasted nuts aftertaste, light carbonation, powerfull aroma and rich complex taste no doubt about it, the best word for describing it would be "wow"
Bière douce belle couleur brune. Elle se révèlent en deuxième bouche assez franche.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 Flavours and aromas are of some kind of very dark fruits (pruneau, wild berries), hint of acidity. Top quality beer. My favourite trappist (by very far) ! Pretty poor on the palate though, its probably because the aromas and flavours are so powerful, I mean its so complex and powerful that I may not be able to feel it all... Sweety/fruity aftertaste. Very lowly sweet and bitter You should try this one out, no disappointment possible.

L: pours a very dark mahogany, with a huge beige head that wont quit. 
S: the aroma is instant dark fruit and Belgian yeast character. As it warms and opens up its all plums, fig, currants, theres a lovely malt presence, toffee, slightly sweet, a touch of booze. Towards the end I got nuttiness mixed in. Marvelous. 
T: follows all the aromas, but leans a bit more with a vinious alcoholic flavour, totally balanced and warming. 
F: nicely carbonated in the first wash, then velvety smooth till the finish, warming and coating the tongue. 
O: this or Abt 12? I have no idea, I love them both, quads would possibly be my favourite style and this tops the tree. Stupendous drinking experience. Now to get my hands on Westy 12.

Bottle. Very dark hazy caramel color with caramel color foam. Thick aromas of dried fruit, figs, sweet, deep, malty and strong, 1st sip the alcohol stood out, but quickly smoothed out and became much more enjoyable. Thick full body with a smooth nice thick long finish. Taste, malty, oily, nutty, some fruit notes. Overall really good beer, really enjoyable to drink easy going and smooth.

dark brown color
aroma of clove and fruits slightly citric
sweet and fruity taste
hint of alchohol

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2016 0,33l bottle. Hazy brown colour with big foamy tan head that quickly shrinks to small size but after it stays. Aroma: sweet caramel with candy sugar, fruits, nuts. First I smelled some soapy aroma, but it vanished away quickly. Taste: Oh yeah. This is a serious beer. Very sweet malty taste, but not too harsh, well blanced. Hiding light bitterness. Lots of fruits, raisin, caramel taste, chocolate. The aroma doesnt lie. Full of flavours. I cant feel the high abv in the taste, just slowly in my head. Warming my stomach. Full body. Mild carbontion with long sweet/light bitter finish. King of the Quadrupels? Maybe. But one of the best beers in the world.

I forgot how good this beer was. Pours a cloudy, dark brown, with a tan head that disappears - but the lacing lasts long. Smell of plum and port wine. Very smooth, but with lively carbonation hitting the back of the throat. Plum, port wine, dark fruit taste. A bit of a flowery, perfume mouthfeel. Hints of Belgium yeast, but not as pronounced in my opinion as some other Belgium ales. Sweet beer. No alcohol burn, but can notice the affects before the glass is finished.
Slight sweet...no alcohol taste, a big surprise considering the ABV %. Im a bit put off by a cloudy appearance however the taste and aroma win me over. A fine Belgian, Ill drink again.

Bottle, 330ml. A dark brown beer with a medium size head. Aroma is of banana, spices, clove and alcohol. There is also belgian yeast that reminds me of other trappist beers I have tasted. Taste is bittersweet with a complex character. Robust bodied with some carbonation and considerable astringency. Aftertaste is full of spices with an alcoholic finish. Has a lot of character. Very dificult to drink and appreciate, but truly a world class beer.

Bottle, 33cl. Opaque dark brown with a swirling creamy brown head. Entrancing aromas of banana, dried fruits, bubblegum, vanilla and other spices, Belgian yeast, alcohol esters, maybe even a slight smoked touch. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich, smooth and creamy, with tremendous complexity. Sweet malt and fruity character with an oak, dried fruit and alcohol finish. Stunning beer.
My best quadrupel. The dark fruit character is really distinctive, a little bit spicy. Sweet, balanced, not much alcohol, must try.

I have been regularly drinking this beer a few times per month for the past 2 years or so. It is one of my go-to beers. The subtle sweetness combined with malt is outstanding. The soft fermentation absolutely compliments the flavors. I absolutely believe that this beer is one of the top 10 in the world and is probably the easiest to procure of any beer in this class. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Greatest quadruple! 
Amazing fruity taste and aroma
Persistent foam....thumbs up!!!!!

A little less special in my opinion than Rochefort 8, but still among the top beers in the world. A very rich and complex taste will form in your mouth from the first sip, and the aftertaste will linger on and on and on.
you should try it, smooth and sweet, high alcohol, warm, its so different in Taiwan, Im a beer beginner

Pours a deep rich hazy brown from a bottle. Plummy, jammy nose with brown sugar twinkletoes. Flavor is similar, but a little thin. I have to admit, Im a little underwhelmed, had built this one up a bunch. Good beer.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2016 Es una cerveza compleja, el sabor es intenso. Noto un fondo de regaliz. La graduación es bastante alta.

Zapach bardzo intensywny, bardzo złożony. Jest wyraźna słodowość, karmel, owoce, głównie śliwki, rodzynki i akcenty winne. Barwa ciemnobordowa z rubinowymi przebłyskami pod światło, mętne. Piana beżowa, średnio trwała. Opada do niskiej warstwy, w takiej postaci zostaje do samego końca, ładny lacing. W smaku słodowe, mocno owocowe, są rodzynki, sporo przypraw no i karmel. Fajnie grzejący alkohol, finisz w miarę delikatny. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie wysokie. Kapitalne klasztorne piwo, legenda.

11.3%ABV. Abt/Quadrupel

Poured out a dark black brown. 35ºSRM.

Nose has some clean sweet chin chow aromas. Slightly floral aspect to the nose which has chrysanthemums. 

Mouthfeel is soapy. Pronounced carbonation. Palate is honeyed dates, fig cake, boysenberry jam, toffee, caramel and coffee. There are some nice solid flavors of black bread, honey on graham cracker toast, darkly toasted wheat toast and creme brulee.

Finish is bitter and medium.

Goes on Favorites List!

Bottle. Beautiful brownish colour, smell is mild brown sugar, taste is soooo good, yeasty sweet, molasses. I can't say anything bad about this beer except it is so smooth and taste like more, and at 11,3 it's pretty dangerous.

Superb. I simply cannot fault this beer. Classic Trappist style. Compares very favourably in all departments to Westvletern, but is more readily available. Everything youd expect from a great Belgian quad. Pours like a dark campagne with tan head. Strong fig, raisin and plum notes. Slight burn back of throat. I think a Trappist glass brings out the best this great beer has to offer. This is widely available and really a must for anyone who likes strong Belgian dark beers. Id go so far to say everyone who likes any form of beer should try this.
Their magnum opus, although it is a tie with the 8! What taste, what aroma, what herbs and ingredients! The best trappists easily.
Una delle mie birre preferite. Tipica trappista equilibrata e corposa, forte aroma fruttato e delicato!

Poured into a trappist glass. Dark brown, mild spicy aroma. Roasted malts, fruity, sweet flavour. Nice carbonation with a little bite. Silky smooth chocolaty, velvety finish. Not my first, not my last!

It appears dark brown and hazy with a big rocky, light brown head. It contains the aroma of vanilla, dark fruits, toast, bread, some caramel and chocolate. It is very delicately balanced in taste: medium sweet due to the malts, light dry & bitter and very light sour. The body is full, the texture creamy, the carbonation perhaps a bit too lively. In the taste the alcohol is well hidden, but it hits you afterward. Though I prefer the Rochefort 8, its a Merry Christmas indeed with this one!

Another fine example of a Trappist quad. The notes of fig, plum, raisin and clove. Great aroma and fabulous taste and hits your palate with a burst of flavors. I always have a few in the fridge. Cheers!

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 22.09.2020 Pours dark brown liquid, medium frothy tan head, fell down after a while, but remained at some minimum level all the time during drinking, Aroma: sweet, raisins, candied fruits, plums, spicy, light warming alcohol, Taste: heavy sweet, medium bitter, light sour, quite strong alcohol taste, sweet and fruity, plums, raisins, malty, Palate: full body, soft to average carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, long sweet alcoholic aftertaste, Overall: very nice beer, enjoyed. Bit too alcoholic on nose as well in taste, but still very good.
Couleur brun foncé; mousse beige; arômes fruités; goût malté, fruité, vineux; lalcool se fait trop sentir; une peu trop sucrée aussi

Aromat to guma balonowa, rodzynki, figi, przypalony karmel.
W smaku dość słodkie, ale i wytrawne zarazem. Bardzo duzo suszonych owoców i rodzynek przeplata się tutaj z nutamo gumy balonowej i belgijskoscia drozdzy. Goryczka srednio niska, ziolowa, alkohol zaskakująco ukryty. Bardzo dobry, klasyczny klasztorniak.

0.33 flaske fra VP. Brun mørk uklar med offwhite skum som legger seg som et tynt lager og som varer. Aroma søt og syrlig fruktig med litt krydder. Smak er malt, karamel kremaktig med spiss ettersmak som varer. Kanongod

Good. Sweet, raisiny malts give way to healthy carbonation and an unexpected dry, puckering finish. I dont know. I just didnt find this beer as complex as others have claimed, and I cant say that I am in love with it. This one is probably not even in my top 10 of Trappist ales.

Bottle at pater macus. Dark brown colour with a small lightbrown head. Nose of dried fruits. Taste is medium bitterness with some sweetness and low carbonation. Aftertaste is banana, cereal with some sweetness. Honestly i expected more from this beer.

De las mejores trapenses sin duda. Entra extremadamente bien pese a su alta graduación, que no deja ni un atisbo de sabor a alcohol. Muy equilibrada, la única nota que quizás no llega al sobresaliente, según mi opinión es que es excesivamente gasificada.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 33 cl bottle, served in trappist chalice. This brew poured a very dark murky brown with a nice one finger lightbrown head and loadsfull of yeast that filled my glass and toppled to the bottom. Light carbonation. Very sweet aromas of black berries, dates, raisins, wet earth, caramel, vanilla, roasted malt, hops, hazelnuts. Taste is very much a continuation of the aromas. Very sweet, caramelized roast malts, the dark fruits, vanilla, nuts, raisins, and dates taste absolutely amazing. Full body, with a thick. long lasting, dry, earthy, fruity and creamy finish. This is a delight! A very big trappist beer especially for a dark, cold winter night.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015 (bottle 330ml)
Aroma:sweet and malty(chocolate,toast,) combined with lovely caramel and punch of dark and dried fruits (cherries,plums).
Appearance:dark copper almost brow color,huge dense off-white head,nice lacing.
Taste:sweet,Nice and complex taste of chocolate,caramel and dark fruits, toasty dry finish,toasty aftertaste.
Palate:medium-full body,high carbonation,pleasant alcohol warmth.
Overall:Super tasty dessert-lke beer.
A strong Belgium ale pours a dark reddish brown with slight head. Has lots of malty fruity flavors. Its a little price but worth tiring.

At this time, it's my favorite beer, followed by Straffe Hendrik Quadrupel and La Trappe Quadrupel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Close to perfection With Westvleteren 12 probably my favorite Belgian beer. Maybe even best in the world. So complex, oh my. Full bodied, warming. Fruity, refreshing, malty, chocolaty, yeasty, nutty. Christmas beer par excellence!

Bottled from Carrefour.
Dense creamy form and brown body.
Good palate and smooth taste.
Good one!

Very dark caramel colour with a cream foam, unfiltered and very dense. Aromas of caramelised cherries and raisins, smells like mincemeat. Palate, very smooth full bodied, complex with lingering aftertaste. Taste of boozy fruits. Overall, very complex fruity beer, but a little too full bodied for me.

Butelka 0,33l Kolor ciemnobrązowy, nieklarowny, piana średnia pozostawia małe ślady na szkle.Aromat owocowy z przewagą alkoholu, nieprzyjemny. Przebija się słodycz z suszonymi owocami. Wiem, że musi walić w czachę ale nie aż tak chociaż 11,3% robi swoje.
Mörkt brun dimmig öl med ett lättare smutsvitt skum. Dofter av malt, kryddor, mörka frukter och fikon. I smaken tillkommer jäst och aningar av lakrits.

Det er en øl i verdensklasse! Farven er mørkebrun/ mørke rødligbrun. Skumkronen er lysbrun og holder længe (hvis man tænker på alkoholprocenten). Aromaen er ristet malt, portvinsagtig(?) og frugt. Smagen er sødlige blommer, karamel, lakrids og vanille med en god eftersmag af lakrids.

Served in a tulip. Pour is dark brown with a tan head and nice lacing. Aroma is stone fruits and yeast. Flavor is where it is at. Plum, raisen, currants, molasses, and brown sugar. Thicker mouthfeel and very full and lingering on the palate. Excellent beer.
No doubt that this is best beer in the world. Rich and deep flavor is excellent. I really like this.

Dès ses prémices, cette bière ne semble annoncer que du bon. Une mousse magnifique - qui descend hélas trop vite - un nez de fruits rouges et pétillant.

Pour une de mes premières dégustations, cest donc une très belle expérience. Un palais framboisé, emporté par une légère torréfaction emportant dans une longueur assez stupéfiante lincroyable complexité de cette Rochefort.

Seul petit bémol, elle chiffre bien haut, et peut-être sera-t-il plus judicieux de goûter la 8° pour développer davantage de subtilités.

Une bière qui sera sans doute à goûter et à regoûter, pour bien en saisir toutes les nuances...
Bit too bubbly for me but excellent for its style. Dark, tasty, easy to drink. A bit hard to get ahold of.

Excelente cerveza, con mucha graduación alcoholico sin embargo se siente menos que en cervezas de menor graduación. Recomendadisima con unas tablas de fríos. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours opaque medium brown with light tan head and substantial lacing. Raisin bread aroma. Bread crust upfront with plum following. More bready malt in the long finish. Fine carbonation and chewy mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Number one in my favourites beers. The best taste, dark beer, little sweet, alcohol not recognisable, only in head.

Pours a soft brown with a voluminous pillowy head that slowly fades to leave a light lacing. The aroma is alcohol and spices with roasted malt and can be quite intense at first. Taste is roasted malt, spices, alcohol, cherries, prunes, raisins, some strawberry tones, slight vanilla, wood. Youd think this was barrel aged from the taste. Leaves a sharp alcohol, cherry and wood aftertaste.

Pours dark mahogany brown. 1 finger head. Lovely dark fruits on the nose, plums, sour cherry, candied sugar, figs & spice. Tastes of dark fruits, spice, malt sweetness along with some alcohol burn on the finish. Carbonation really helps express the flavours. This beer is what it is, and its really beautiful. If the alcohol burn was less on this beer it would score a lot higher, but at 11.3% what can you do?

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Mooi spul hoor, ingehouden tonen van chocolade en bosbessen en ondertussen een robuuste knakker van heb ik jou daar. Backlog from 2014/12/24.
Enorme diepe bramige en bessige fruitige en kruidige smaak die dwars door een kartonachtige mufheid beukt. Perfecte balans. Tovenaarsbrij! Backlog from 2015/03/01.
Tanned fast head. Dark brown. Plum, raisins, dates, strong, low carbons, low biterness, sweet fruits. Rich and warming.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle, 33 cl. Dark mahogany body with a foamy beige head. Sweet, fruity and spicy aroma with quite a bit of alcohol. Notes of plums. Rich, sweet taste with light/medium bitterness. Very malty and spicy flavours. Distinct alcohol. Medium body with prickly carbonation. Somewhat overcarbonated like the other two. Dry finish with warming alcohol. A wonderful beer that provides an intense experience, but a higher ABV would have been too much. One of the best Belgian ales I have had.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2016 Almost black color with a tan frothy head that stays long. Fine and rich beer smell: plum, raisins, dark sugar, slight portvine. Taste is full of dark fruits, plums, raisins, chocolates, yeast and spices. Beer tastes even better when its getting warm. Overall amazingly rich and complex beer, truly worth the ratings.

33cl bottle in Amsterdam on 29-Nov-2015. Dark amber colour with a fluffy tan coloured head which dissipates slowly. Aroma of Belgian yeast, berries and malt. Medium body and soft carbonation. Intense flavour, with the ABV well hidden but still providing a lovely warmth when drinking. Chocolate up front, followed by berries, vanilla and molasses. A smooth and warm, slightly bitter finish. Excellent.
(bottle) hazy dark honey amber colour with a tall, fine beige head; aroma of stewed fruit, dried fruit, jam; smooth palate; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish
Dunkle Farbe brauner cremiger Schaum, Geruch nach malzig fruchtig, Rosine feige rum im Geschmack sehr komplex
Bottle (11.2oz $6.50): Best before date 2020 five years from now. Need to have again to remember the details, but very enjoyable and will drink again.
Aus der Flasche in Lüttich. Glänzende dunkle Farbe und fester cremiger Schaum. Intensives Aroma nach Dörrobst, Vanille und Rum. Schwerer Geschmack. Extrem vollmundig. Großes Bier!

2013 bottle pour..produces a medium caramel brown color with a massive amount of particles that eventually float downward..pretty solid tan creamy head..nose is abundant with dark fruit..plums..raisins..currants..brown sugar...wow the mouthfeel on this is impressive..bold yet subdued..quite light bodied..can barely get any trace of the very high abv in play..creamy texture..long solid finish that is full of the dark fruit reminiscent of the style..excellent..

Pours clear dark brown. Sweet fruity aroma, caramel, dried fruit, red wine, oil, roasted notes. Very smooth and balanced. Dry, highly carbonated. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Embouteillée 20/12/2014, bue après 11 mois. Robe dun brun rougeâtre presque opaque surmonté d?un épais col de mousse blanchâtre et crémeux. Dentelle très collante et laiteuse. Arômes de malt à la fois grillé et caramélisé, baies confites, levures, pruneaux et sucre brun. Comme la 6 et 8, lalcool ne paraît aucunement. Cest doux, sucré et dune belle complexité. En bouche, cest fidèle au nez mais encore mieux. Un amalgame de fruits foncés: mûres, cerises noires, pruneaux et raisins rouges, le tout saupoudré de sucre brun. Un bon fond malté qui saffirme tout en douceur dans un style mielleux. Notes de chocolat au lait, noix de pecan et légère torréfaction. Une complexité monstre. Le tout dans une belle texture onctueuse et un corps bien rond. 11.2% dalcool? La pureté des saveurs le cache habilement. Sans contredit une des meilleures trappistes.
Aroma complexo, doce, levemente tostado, alcoólico e frutado. Sabor também complexo doce, amargo e alcoólico. O amargor não persiste o que torna a cada gole único. Incrível, a melhor que já degustei.
Flaska inköpt för ca ett år sedan. Mycket fruktig doft av dadlar, fruktkaka och russin. Intensiv och fyllig smak. Eldig och god munkänsla.
Malzig süß mit Aromen von Dörrobst, Rosinen, Vanille und wenig Röstaromen.
Brown pour, large head. Aroma and taste of dark dried fruit, prune, rasin, caramel, brown sugar, dates. Alcohol well hidden. A standard bearer

Signori e signore: Madame la trappista!
Di un colore bruno intenso con riflessi carminio, mostra una schiuma abbondante e persistente color cappuccino. Al naso c'è un universo di aromi: banana matura, pera, ciliegia, caramello ed un sentore di Porto riconducibile al robusto tenore di alcol. In bocca non si smentisce, ritornano i sentori di frutta rossa e legno e nel finale una secchezza che riporta alla liquirizia insieme al cioccolato leggero che si percepisce unitamente al velluto di un corpo morbido e caldo. Una poesia da bere.

Amazing strong taste yet light on the palate. Color is medium brown to honey with a moderate amount of head. Aroma is sweet but not overpowering. Had this from a bottle (only distribution method) at La Trappiste in Bruge.
Excelente cerveza, cabeza duradera, aroma agradable y sabor sin igual. Es una clásica que hay que probar al menos una vez aunque si es posible hay que tenerla siempre a la mano.
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2015 Great flavour and taste. You don?t appreciate the alcohol. Perfect for winter evenings.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 Re-rate. First time bad bottle. This time OK. Dark chestnut color, tan head. Aroma of cherries, banana, malt. Warm, slightly alcoholic finish. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet. Very good indeed.

Pours a darh, hazy, reddish brown brew with a tall head that quickly gives way to a thin lacing. There are sediments at the bottom of the bottle, which I always pour into the glass, since I found that, if anything, they add a bit more spiciness to the drink. 
The smell is amazing, with caramel and raspberries blending in with the more subtle raisin smell. Tastes like raspberries, raisins, with a malty sweetness and a hint of spiciness from the alcohol along with a very pleasant and subtle belgian yiest sourness. Of medium body and carbonation, this is a very easy to drink beer, the only trap being the alcohol concentration.

Pours hazy dark brown with a khaki head. Head retention is amazing. AROMA: rich malt, plum, molasses, brown sugar, coriander, candied sugar, alcohol, herbs, orange zest, floral, caramel, raisin, dates, bread, roasty, cough syrup, woody, currants, earthy funk, citrus, nuts, coffee, licorice, spices, herbal hops and other dark stone fruits. TASTE: rich malt, plum, molasses, brown sugar, coriander, candied sugar, creamy,dates, currants, alcohol, herbs, orange zest, caramel, raisin, bread, roasty, cough syrup, woody, earthy funk, citrus, nuts, coffee, licorice, spices, herbal hops and other dark stone fruits. AFTER TASTE: dark stone fruits, burned caramel, malt and spices with a creamy dry finish.

Cest ma bière préférée. Douceur, arômes extraordinaires. Tout cela explose en bouche et laisse un sentiment de bonheur quasiment indeScriptible. Cette bière surnomée "la merveille" réveille des sentiments que lon pensait impossibles.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 Plum on the nose, very pleasing, so much so I sniffed it a few times before I took the my first sip. Dark chocolate thats not to sweet and blends well with plum and other dried fruit aromas. The alcohol is warming and some may consider it too strong but works for me. Complex, rich and by the way, outstanding.

Bottle. Colour...very dark brown with a corpulent tan head. Nose...gobs and gobs of dark, dried fruits and boiled molasses with overdone creme brûlée. Palate...tight, dry and frothy with booze soaked dates and currants. The mid palate is sharp and bitey with ethanol but the sweetness helps temper the booze and adds a delightful dimension. The finish is lengthy and filled with boiled sweets.

Pours chestnut brown, murky, with one-finger coarse beige head. Aroma is green apples, pear drops, bread crusts, maybe red cherry and raisin. Taste starts with plum, then some alcohol but fairly restrained. Very good but not as complex or spectacular as Id expected.
Ottima birra, piena ed elegante al naso e in bocca. Un mix di sapori equilibratissimi e puliti-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Botella. @La Barrica 13, Candas 05/11/2015. BBD: 23/10/2016
Color marrón, sabor malta, caramelo, cuerpo denso.

Ingen tvil om at dette er noe av det beste som er produsert. Smak av malt, syrlig fruktsmaker som plomme, svisker o.l en liten ettersmak av krydder. Overhodet ingen beskhet i ettersmaken og ikke nødvendigvis en følelse av den høye alkoholprosenten.

Bottle from MBR, deep dark brown, creamy tan colored head with average lacing. Good carbonation, Aroma of sweet plums, raisins, spices (found some corainader). Malty but not to sweet, spicy on palate, dried fruit and everything balanced to perfection. Apsolutely amazing beer!

Butelka. Barwa brunatna, mętna. Piana lekko beżowa, obfita, szybko się redukuje. Intensywny aromat suszonych owoców, karmelu, rodzynek, śliwek. W smaku odczuwalna słodycz, suszone owoce, alkohol, lekki alkohol, który rozgrzewa przełyk. Goryczka na średnim poziomie. Piwo pełne, treściwe. Bardzo dobre piwo warte swojej ceny.

One of my all time favourites. Hints of chocolade, perfectly balanced. Nothing wrong. And i can get it from our local supermarket

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark hazy caramel color with weak caramel color foam. Thick aromas of dried fruit, figs, sweet, deep, malty also strong and aged. Palate, Thick, full body, smooth, nice thick long finish. Taste, malty, oily, nutty, some fruit notes and bit of alcohol taste on the back of the mouth. Overall really good beer, really enjoyable to drink easy going and smooth defenatly recomend!
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 aromas of dark bread, raisin skins, figs and currant cherry. Taste is dates/figs, dark bread, raisin skins.
Caoba opaco y beis compacta. Aromas lácticos, chocolate, caramelo y pan. Cuerpo denso, inicio dulce de chocolate y caramelo, sabor láctico y final seco ligeramente tostado.

bottle @ home. Aged 5 years. Pours a brown liquid with a beige, medium head that quite quickly dissipated. Perfect vinous and moderate sweet aroma with lots of dark fruits (raisins, dates, some prunes), brown sugar, dark syrup, coffee, biscuits and some herbs. Sweet vinous taste. Big bodied with medium duration and smooth texture. Finishes dry with balanced bitterness. Prunes, dates, red fruits, dark sugar, coffee, wood, ash, sweet caramel, some milk chocolate, roasted malt and warming alcohol.
La meilleure bière au monde pour moi. J'aimerai beaucoup la tester après plusieurs années de garde.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2015 A: deep dark brown, creamy dense tan colored head that doesnt hold well, high carbonation / S: caramel, banana, dark fruits, dried fruits, alcohol / T: fig newtons, apricot, liquorice, brown sugar, dark fruits, dried fruits, dark chocolate, cold medicine, throat lozenge, woody, some spice, coffee, some bitterness, whisky, slightly dry finish/ M: full bodied, creamy, oily, chewy, good carbonation, warm, big / O: very masculine but complex beer, it will get even better with age.

From bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of sweet plums, raisins, nuts, spices, cereal. Taste is super sweet, alcohol, bit of wood, nuts, caramel. Not my thing, but I get why people enjoy this.

Pours a deep opaque chocolate brown. Long lasting head. The first sip is rich. The high alcohol content is immediately evident and continues to be evident with every sip. The ale itself is smooth and full-bodied. The finish is understated. Overall, worthy of its reputation.
Ample tan head, dark brown with a slight reddish hue. Raisin, molasses, banana. Sweet, some slight earthiness. Long finish, very clean, medium body, fairly chewy. Very good.
Simply put my favorite beer of all time. Just perfect. Dark, full, warming, faint banana and dark fruits.
Dark brown, with thin head. Alcohol hits the nose big time. Alcohol, plums, very complex.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2016 33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Pours darkbrown with a medium white head. Aroma of sweet dried fruits, rasins, syrup, and alcohol. Taste is super sweet, with tons of dried fruits, malt and alcohol. Medium- bitterness. Full-bodied. High carbonation.
10-19-15 Reykalin, Iceland. Bjor Gardurinn. BeerGarden Foss Hotel. PixelPool 15th Anniversary

Aroma: caramel, chocolate, coffee, citrus, 
Appearance: black, frothy, tan foam, 
Taste: medium bitterness, 
Palate:medium body, creamy, lively, long finish, 
Overall: special taste, the aroma is good and long finish.
Quite simply in my top 3 of all time favourite beers. Outstanding in all aspects.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle at home, served at room temperature, poured into a Westmalle glass. Deep dark brown with clumpy tan head. Prune and dried fruit aroma. Fruitcake flavour, cheese, shiraz...Rather delicious. Full bodied, thick, long juicy finish. Top notch.

33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Its not often I have a chance to test a 100/100-beer. Hazy dark brown with a beige head. Aromas: where to begin? Fruits, chocolate, coffee, raisins, hops, nuts, alcohol, apples and more. Taste is sweet, alcoholic. Lively carbonation - almost like champagne. Rich and complex beer. Top notch!

Bottle. In aroma mostly dark, dried fruits like plum or cherry, In tase is sweet, with low bitterness.Great juicy taste with some alcoholic notes. Very good, stable white head. Very good beer. I recommend!

Pours an otherwise fairly clear dark ruby body, but huge solid climps of yeast
come and sink to the bottom of the glass. This one had absoutely no head, despite the high carbonation. Nose has intense notes of plum, raisin, sherry, 
The taste is quite sweet with some dark caramel and chokolate notes and some warmth from the alcohol. The finish is fairly dry and somewhat bitter. High carbonation and rich palate, quite easy to drink despite the high alcohol content and warmth that it imparts. Very well made, complex and balanced beer. Too bad there was no head, otherwise close to perfection.

Massive mocha head. Fades slowly, nice lacing. Murky reddish brown. Raisin, fig, plum, alcohol aroma. Matching flavours with dried red fruit, brown sugar, warmth, slightly rummy. Med-full body. High carbonation. Dry but lingering sweet finish. Complex and rich (opposite of me).
Nog zon typische Belgische Trappist. Een donkere kleur, weinig schuimkraag.

Bottled, 33 cl. Aroma: raisins, dark fruits, plump hops, nuts, notes of cacao and dark natural chocolate. Appearance: dark brown, cloudy. Taste: plumps, nuts, a little crisp of bread. Palate: heavy body, texture - slick, long finish.

Brunatne, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i redukuje się do pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat przyjemny, słodkawy, alkoholowy, owocowy, rodzynki i śliwka. W smaku z jednej strony słodkie, wyklejające całą jamę ustną, a z drugiej strony wytrawne, ziołowe, alkoholowe. Goryczka wysoka, ziołowa, alkoholowa. Ogólnie bardzo udane piwo, z każdym łykiem czuć ciężar gatunku, ale mimo to jest ono dość pijalne, jednak u mnie przewagę o dosłownie włos ma z tego browaru "8".
Aroma ; volle donker fruit geur uiterlijk zwartbruin.volle donkere fruit smaak pruimachtig met iets zoutig,lange volle nasmaak echt altijd heerlijk en zin in en volgende

Nose is a gentle mixture of banana, honey, raisins and malt. The taste replicates the nose, but adds further complexity. Dark berries, brown sugar, tropical fruit and some soft spices are complimented by a very soft effervescence and appropriately rich body. As good as advertised (if you are not a hop head).

Poors dark and heavy. Caramel, marcipan, figs, vanilla, hint of banana and raisin slight warm alcohol but not disturbing at all. Finish is long full of dark fruits. Just brilliant one of my favourite Belgians.

There is a reason that this is consistently rated as one of the top beers in the world, it's fantastic! Because of the alcohol content you need to be careful. But non the less one of my favourites!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Abdij bier 
Prima bij diner
Heerlijke smaak lijkt wel een wijn smaak aan te raken. 
Nieuwe ontdekking
Pours dark brown with a large white head.Aroma; raisins, dried fruit, caramel and sugar. Well carbonated with flavour of dried fruit, raisins, liqourice with a wine tone.
UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Wow. En supergod øl, hvis eneste ulempe er den høje alkohol-procent. Flot farve og lækker smag

Rödbrun med ett stort vitt skum. Kraftig doft av russin, malt, bröd. Djup smak med lång eftersmak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Almost black, creamy, tan, long lasting head, small lacing. Sweet and vinous aroma, dark sugar, caramel, toffee, dark berries, dried fruit, herbs and booze. Full-bodied, creamy mouthfeel, high-carbonated. Sweet and complex taste, dried dark fruit, plums, raisins, herbs, caramel, caramelized dark sugar. Finish with a warming alcohol, oak, chocolate and unfortunately big booze taste.
black,cloudy, caramel, roasty, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sweetness, long finish, bitter, lively, thick feel,

Pours dark brown with persistent beige head. Wine-like aroma, very fruity. Dried fruits, candy sugar and alcohol aswell. Taste is light sweet, also reminding grapes/wine, light bitterness. Medium body, light carbonation.

As a dark beer fan, this is the best beer in the world. I cant improve on the countless reviews re the taste, aroma and palate of this magnificent beer. The price mandates this to a special occasion, but when I drink it, I take that rare moment from an otherwise hectic life and say "Life is good!".
På flaska importerad från Belgien. Mörk brun med en hög skumkrona. Doftar hö. en söt lite spritsig smak av karamell och honung.

"Nec plus Ultra" of dark strong beer. Lots of tradition and cultivated yeast strains cultivated through the years.
Sometimes heavy on year head if you drink more then two or combined with other drinks.
impossible to clone.
Pitch black color, thin brown head. Aroma of berries, alcohol and brown sugar. Complex taste, same as aroma plus wooden barrel, oak. Full body, thick, lively carbonation. //stella

Adquirida en New Beer Distributors, New York. Intenso aroma a café. Sabor dulce al comienzo amargándose en el paladar. De apariencia oscura y densa espuma. Una cuádruple exquisita e incomparable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Som altid en dejlig trappistøl. En nydelse - dog uden at klokkerne ringer...

Coffee-like colour. Head disapears immediately, only a small head stays. Aroma: banana, chocolate, bread, brown sugar. Taste is more bitter than one would expect after smelling the beer. What a full and rich flavor. Hints of coffee, chocolate, malts, and quite a dry finish. This beer has a stout-ish taste and smell, but is definitely more complex. Its high alcohol percentage is barely noticable. A beer you should have tried!
0,33l Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Bier mit kleiner heller Schaumkrone. Riecht nach reifen Früchten, schmeckt nach reifen Früchten, leicht malzig im Abgang schmeckt es nach Alkohol.

Originally rated on 10/4/06.Fantastic is the word that best describes this beer, The initial smell was a hint of bananas, nice head, excellent dark body, Alcohol taste was a little strong but in a good way, complex flavors with hints of nuts and fruits. I wish i could have this beer everyday. Well worth the price.

Like the number 8 another amazing beer. Dark brown with creamy head. Total in balance.Soft, sweet taste, although the high percentage ( 11,3% )
Excellent!
Bottle from bevmo. Pours ruby brown with off white head. Taste of figs and dark fruits with some roasted malts.
another example of a perfect beer! Not much to say, the beer does all the talking... Absolutely amazing as all the Belgian trappist beers

Havia ouvido outros comentários falando que era muito forte e não equilibrada em relação a Rochefort 8. Achei uma ótima cerveja. Percebe-se pouco o teor alcoolico. Bem equilibrada. Complexa. O sabor é melhor que o aroma.

330 ml bottle from the LCBO.
Appearance: Pours a
dark hazy brown with a finger of tan head. Short retention and subtle lacing.
Aroma:
Nuts, apricots, yeast.
Flavours:
Caramel, nuts, yeast, apricot, sweet malt and brown sugar.
Mouthfeel:
Higher carbonation and a crisp finish. 
Overall: Ill start by saying Im not a huge Trappist ale fan but ... this is one of the best beers Ive had period. There are so many things going on with both the aromas and flavours and multiple subtle nuances.
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 One of the best quads i ever tried...full of flavor with malt and berries...tons of carbonation....better as it warms....very solid showing...
Verry nice balanced beer. Wonderfull aromas of chocolate and caramel and a light sweetness with a long finish,

Pours a very dark brown with a very large, slowly settling, foamy mocha head. Aromas of dates, figs, caramel, chocolate, muscovado sugar, roasted oak, vanilla. Taste is quite sweet with faint roasted notes. Mouthfeel is smooth with medium carbonation. Very very good!
330ml bottle at home. Very good Belgian quad. Dark brown, strong dark fruits without a taste of alchohol despite its high percentage.

Wonderful aromas of caramel and chocolate in harmony with fruity tones. Sparkling, frothy foam when poured. Clear dark-brown liquid. Well balanced sweetness and bitterness - not even a slightly taste alcohol even though it is 11,3%. Fresh and not too heavy. At first it is sparkling in your mouth followed by a creamy texture, and a fresh, light sweet finish. I really love this beer - a perfect quadrupel, in my opinion better than Westvleteren 12.

À elle seule, la Rochefort 10 définit et impose le style. Lennui avec une bière si pointue dans un style bien précis est que tout le reste est déception. Dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina, la bière brune aux reflets rouges qui est devant moi est coiffée dune mousse à la fois imposante et légère comme de la ouate. Le liquide est majestueux, onctueux, duveteux. Magnifiquement appétissant! Je reçois de profonds arômes de fruits bien mûrs comme dun immense plateau sur lequel sont présentés pruneaux, figues, dattes, raisins noirs et myrtilles. Quelques chose qui me rappelle également la pâtisserie. En bouche, une gorgée de ce nectar suffit à graver à jamais ce magnifique tableau dans ma mémoire. La rondeur est exquise, leffervescence vivante et vivifiante, Je passe des fruits confits au chocolat, au caramel... La complexité, le moelleux et la profondeur de cette bière témoignent dune maîtrise absolue du savoir brassicole. Je suis privilégié de déguster une telle bière!

From a 33cl bottle purchased at Les Fleurs du Malt in Lyon (Thanks Cyril!)A very dark hazy orange/brown with a beige head. Remarkable aromas of plum, blackcurrant and raisins. Incredibly rich and complex with a mouthfeel that makes every taste bud come alive. Very long finish with tastes of fruit, caramel and dark chocolate. A truly great rich-tasting beer with great balance, harmony and complexity.
Un nez très léger avec une odeur de fruits des bois, de caramel. Un palet extraordinaire avec une fin très prometteuse : une vraie bière noire avec une très belle couleur .
330ml bottle at home. Dark color with off white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, caramel, dark fruits. Sweet taste like aroma. With soft carbonation

COlore rosso scuro, marrone, molta schiuma.
Odore frutta matura, fichi secchi, alcool, caramello, leggero vinoso.
Sapore fruttato, caramellato, leggero tostato, dolce ma tagliato bene dallamaro finale. Frizzantezza medio-alta, alcool ben nascosto ma molto corposa.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2015 Bottle (expiry date - X 2020).

Aroma: from the bottle: dark chocolate, alcohol, quite roasty too.

Appearance: black, cloudy (almost pure black colour) with minimal head.

Taste: heavy bodied with heavy bitterness, dark belgian chocolate and fresh roasted coffee beans, alcohol is present as well. Reminds me a bit of belgian chocolates with strong acohol (kind of liquor) filling. Actually sweetness is less than medium.

Full bodied. oily, with medium carbonation and long coffee-bitter finish.

The best beer Ive drank so far, I guess. Im tippytoing more and more towards belgian styles. I like them.

Hazy dark brown with red and ruby tones. Nice big head caused by carbonation I think. Great lacing.. Aroma: pharmacy, cloves, cinammon, resin and herbs/flowers. Taste: toffi, cloves, christmas gingerbread herbs, a bit of good quality mead and alcolic aftertaste with low bitterness and sweet gingerbread tones. Oily and quie full body. High carbonation. In mouth sense: It creates some kind of spicy alcolic aftertaste combined with hint of milk chocolate. Very intersting beer, quite nice for long winter evenings, it causes really nice heating feeling

Bottle from brewdog bar, Sheffield. Dark brown with small off white head. Aroma is prune and plum, raisins and toffee Taste is sweet, savoury and humming with alcohol. Carbonation is on the fizzy side, medium body with oily mouthfeel. Very nice.7

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a dark brown with a huge, latte colored soapy head that dissipates then leaves a nice film throughout. Lots of dark fruit on the nose: plum, raisin, prune along with sorghum, bread pudding, star anise, clove and nutmeg. Taste is fairly similar with lots of combinations of the flavors above standing out at different times. Hides the ABV fairly well, but still has some slight booziness. Finish is dry with that classic Belgian yeast characteristic. Very solid, but I prefer the Rochefort 8 all day.

Dark hazy brown.
Raisins, prunes, brown sugar, overripe banana
Sweetish, but surprisingly dry for the abv. Very full body. Chocolatey.

This is a little too intense for me, but very very good.

Dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, raisins, blue currants, licorice, red wine, coffee and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet, mild bitter, well balanced and long lasting. Body is medium, texture is creamy and carbonation average. A favourite.

Really bubbly compared to Abt12, but very good. Sweet caramel taste. Has that real Belgian taste you just dont get in American versions. Lots of bread yeast notes in the smell and taste. Some dark fruit taste. Hints of spice. Just a really great beer.
Absolutely great, I would say this is the second-finest of the Trappist beers. Very dark, rather strong aroma, and with a strong taste that stays with you for a while. Easy to find in Belgium.
Bottle in Brussels. Nice amber body with white head. Nose is perfumy, sweet, fruity. Taste is fruits, raisins, plums, candy. Very creamy, warming. Nicely done beer!
Perfect looking dark with tight bubbled head taste prune plum cherry damson alcohol hits you straight up from the start tastes different with every mouthful as great abbey should
Bottle from Systembolaget. Big bubbly beige head. Dark brown body. Smells of plums, nuts, yeast, syrup, hops. Tastes of plum, sugar, currants, nuts. A bit salty and sweet, but mostly bitter.
Very dark Trappist beer with pleasant aroma. Lovely sweet taste with flavours of caramel and liquorice. An exceptional beer
Cerveza con cuerpo amargor y alto grado de alcohol me encanta esta cerveza trapense. , pan, cítrico

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2016 What a brilliant beer! Dark brown with a two finger light brown head. Aroma of dark fruit and caramel. Sweet taste with very little bitterness. Nice warmth from the alcohol. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 330ml bottle. Purchased fall of 2013, and in the cellar since then. Pours a very murky garnet colour with LOTS of visible floating sediment that is literally churning as the carbonation rises into a fluffy beige head. It doesnt look bad, but the living sediment doesnt make me think, "Mmm...delicious". Smells great though. Lots of notes that remind me of European bitters (Amaros, Jagermeister, etc.) with faint red licorice, light honey, light molasses candy, chamomile, and a faint trace of eucalyptus. Taste wise, a lot of candy like notes with some considerable alcohol given its age, more red licorice, light molasses, raisin, and again "Original Ricola" that heads into some caramel malt notes, light bitterness, a Fishermans Friend like note, light rye crisp, graphite, and some light sourness in the finish. Believe me, there are more things I could probably describe if I had the time, but I dont. This is the real deal. Looking forward to my 2014 bottle.

Deep amber colour, opaque, tall off-white head shrinking to a thick & creamy film clutching at glass. The aroma is yeasty, perfumy, some champagne, candy, roast, dry fruit, honeymelon, earth. Some notes are hard to define. Full body. Very warming. A dozen of taste aspects: dried fruit, sherry, champagne, liqorice, liqueur, praline, cognac, spicy yeast. Its hard to find words for the complexity of this brew. Some hops delivers the finish of the perfect picture. Splendid.
Tolles Bier, tolle Farbe, super Schaum. Sehr rund, komplexe Aromen, leicht alkoholisch. Langer, leckerer Nachgeschmack.

Originally reviewed on 9/14/2011. 330 mL bottle poured into a chalice. Bottled 2/16/2011. Murky brown body that has the slightest red tint to it. You cant see much through it, though. A surprising khaki head on top that seems to die down and come back to life every time I move the beer. The lacing is substantial and also fascinating to watch. The swirling patterns are like Rorschach tests. Yeasty aromas that manifest themselves as bananas. Lots of dark fruits of every variety. Amazingly complex and delightful aroma, perhaps a bit overpowered by booze. The flavors that come across are just amazing. Raisins, plums, figs, and an estery banana flavor to bundle them all together. Again, the booze is prevalent, but its nice. Theres even a slight bitterness at the end and I dont know where it comes from.
Full bodied and warming. The alcohol burn is present, but still appropriate. Its a little bit dry in the finish.

Outstanding, save a bit of excessive alcohol burn.
Amazing beer! Such great flavor, nice creamy head. Love the carbonation and appearance.
Donker bier met kleine gistdeeltjes en een bijzondere geur en smaak. Ook een fijne, zachte nasmaak.

12oz bottle into chalice. What more can be said of this monster? Rich, bold, complex and delicious. Full-on plum, currant, and dried fruits; viscous palate. Warming without being boozy. Comes in and out of circulation in town; never sure if, when it disappears, more will ever show up in town. Oh, to have an infinite cellar of it...
From 0,33L bottle bought at Vinmonopolet. Complexity beyond comparison. A great experience

Dark brown with a nice tan head, good retention. Nose is figs, raisins, caramel, toffee, marzipan, yeast esters. Flavour is so well balanced, notes of banana, dark fruits, sweet malts, brown sugar, bubblegum. Slight hint of alcohol, but for the abv its really well hidden. One of the best.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, zmętnine. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości, krótka
AROMAT: Intensywny. Bogaty bukiet zapachów wprost uderza nasz zmysł powonienia. Owoce suszone, owoce kandyzowane, fenole, zioła, przyprawy korzenne, kwiaty, karmel, zboża no i rzecz oczywista - alkohol.
SMAK: Trudno opisać to uczucie jednym zdaniem. Estry, fenole, karmel i alkohol w  niemal idealnej harmonii, po kolei "atakują" nasze kubki smakowe.

Ich werde das Bier nicht ausführlich beschreiben; die große Mehrheit kennt es eh schon.
Daher bleibt nur zu sagen: Weltklasse. Eines der besten Biere der Welt, dazu Preis-/Leistungs-Verhältnis sagenhaft.
Einfach nur toll.
Sviskon i aromen. Impstout utseende. Barleywine referenser. Fin arom komplex. Fin kolsyra. Inte oäven inte oäven
Golden brown with a lighter head. Sweet caramel aroma with a huge caramel taste quite sweet with raisin notes. 11.3% percentile which you feel. Great belgian beer.
I have nothing to add, that other raters have not already written. This beer is simply the best.
Dark brown pour with a thin white head. Aroma of some malts, light. Flavor of cinnamon, malts, and light hops with a crisp finish.
Very smooth, slightly sweet malty taste fading to bitter with just a hint of the alcohol. A very good brew.

Old bottle (3 ish years, I think). Very dark brown with nice tan head that dissipated. Smells like good dark bread, dark fruits, and a hint of sour. Smooth for such a high ABV. Nicely balanced. I see why people like this. (and I like it too.)

Vertical tasting. Old bottle (4 years, 4 month old) Nose is sweet bread, dark fruit, brown sugar. Taste has lots of fruity esters, sweet chestnuts and figs. Soft mouthfeel. Dark and cloudy in appearance, minimal head, but it sticks around. Newer bottle (1 year, 10 months old) is obviously similar but differs as such: Nose is less intense, lighter and there is some citrus and peppery notes and less bread in the smell and taste. More carbonation and head. And a lighter, almost reddish hue. This monster holds up really nice, but I prefer the fresher liquid.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2015 Fantastisk øl, Lækker blød skum, flot mørk farve og masser af duft og smag, frugt og vinagtig. 
One of my favourites at the moment

Bottle- pours dark brown with an off white head. Plum, raisin, chocolate and sweet malts. Taste is sweet up front then a slow burn into a dry bittersweet finish. Well balanced palate. Would never know its 11.3%.
Good head, dark brown beer, some sediment floating around so let the bottle stand a while before filling your glass. Banana, melon, caramel. Fruity aroma ,absolutely Delicious.
Amazing plum aroma,thick white head. Super sweet almost candy Like raisin flavor. No carbonation. Tastes like a fine wine almost.

Pours a dark brown with a fizzy off white head. Nose is dark chocolate, raisin, plum, currants, dark fruit. Flavor is smooth and rich. Lots of dark fruit, raisin, prunes, plums, toffee, cloves. Thick, viscous mouthfeel with a heavy body. Rich and warming, moderate carbonation. Silky and delicious. Gorgeous mix of dark fruit flavors and rich toffee and caramel.
Best brew while in Brussels, had on tap and from bottle.   Great yeasty nose,  lasting head retention, smooth and fresh on the palate.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle from McHughs. Pours dark red brown with foam tan head. Aroma is dough, raspberry, chocolate, cherry, walnut, wood, earth, rum, ripe banana. So much going on. Flavour is sweet banana, bread, nuts, dry wood with slight alcohol wood finish. Full body with medium Carbonation. Really great beer.
Rated based on notes taken 25 June 2012 -- This is a solid trappist brew. I really need to buy some to age and see how well they do.
In 0.33 bottle. Nice thick cap. Dark brown. Bitter sweet with caramel tone.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 Deepest brown with a thick tan head. Loads of cherries on the nose and in the taste. Some bread, yeast, alcohol. Boozy, and medium thin in the mouth. Great quad, but a step behind Westvleteren & St. Bernardus for me.

Pours a deep burgundy red with a khaki head of moderate size which quickly recedes to a third of its initial size. Aroma is dominated by malts - caramel, sweet biscuits, red wine and raspberry compote. Taste is caramel, hazelnuts, almonds, slight oak, some vanilla, a hint of tart berry, red wine, a hint of tart apple, dates and some pleasant alcohol warmth in the mid-taste. As complex as is described by the previous 4730 reviews. This tops the top 50 widely available beers list for me.
Excellent aroma and personality; maybe too high the alcohol percentage making more difficult to get the full taste.
33 cl. flaske. 11,3 % mørkt øl af den ultra stærke slags. Smagen er udmærket med alt, alt for stærkt til min smag. Købt i MENU Aalborg.

Bottle from giant eagle gahanna. Nose is smoky broth and alcohol. Wine like and very complex, with hints of smoke, dark cherry, carmelized sugar and some thick stank malt. Strong and well deserving of its high rating. Would do again for sure. $$ but worth it.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Cloudy brown color, average sized creamy brownish head. Aroma of ice cream chocolate, nuts, red fruits, lots of maltiness. Taste of red fruits, dark fruits, chocolate, again lots of maltiness, strong raspberries presence. Full body, lively carbonation. Complex and smooth as hell. Alcohol is nowhere to be found. Classic stuff.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Geweldig bier. Lekkere donker bruine kleur en smaakt ook naar caramel, neigt zelfs wat naar port. Het meest bijzondere aan dit bier is de bruisende explosie bij elke slok. Smaak tintelt lang door. Al met al dus bijzonder bier alleen over smaak valt te twisten en dat is het in mijn ogen net niet.

Pours mahogany brown with medium frothy off-white head with average to good lacing. Aroma is malty, with lots of nuts, roasted caramel and milk chocolate. Lovely orange and resin hoppiness with some herbs. Broth, earth and leather dough yeast aromas. Notes of date, vanilla, toffee and hint of clove. Very complex and deep aroma with a moderate alcohol touch. Malty, deep taste with perfectly balanced hoppiness that make a long soothing experience. Palate is excellent - medium to full body, creamy texture, soft to medium carbonation with tiny bubbles. Alcoholic is medium. A beer worth its praise.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 A very beutiful beer with a nutbrown color which turn darkbrown if you pour the sediment. It has hints of fruit in the aroma and a very good head. It is a very strong tasting beer with hints of fruit but also alcohol.
Simply the best. Balanced, complex and fascinating. A secret is reserved beer the night before of a prior matrató, years ago I do and it works!
Dio esiste.sentori di frutta prugna e il finale un qualcosa di ancestrale.La MAGNIFA

Bottle shared in London during Pauls 30th - big thanks to Fergus for this one! Vintage 2009. Pours mostly clear amber-red with a few floaty bits and a creamy, tan head. Rounded nose with lots of creamy, ripe fruits, berries, toffee, dates. Medium to heavy sweet flavorbwith rich, gooey toffee and caramel, fruitcake, bread, figs, dates, golden raisins. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming on the finish with continuing notes of rich bread, cake, ripe fruits, some creany vanilla, figs, toffee. The condition is great - this beer has aged well. Outstanding. Worthy of the praise.
UPDATED: JUN 25, 2015 Dark brown color. Some red fruit, grain, deep roast grain, caramel, alcohol. Medium to heavy body; somewhat sticky mouthfeel. Very rich beer.
Spuit hard uit de fles. Donker, licht troebel. Dik schuim. Ruikt karamel. Smaakt heerlijk zoet. Mooie, volle nasmaak

Zahvaljujuci mom prijatelju i vlasniku picerije VIVA u Sibeniku , odlicnom covjeku Goranu , dosao sam i do ove pive ...veliki izbor belgijskih piva ...svaka cast na tome ..
Pivo je kvalitetno , vrhunski odradjeno ..malo mutno i ima minimalno taloga..jako pivo punog okusa ...tesko za ispijanje .. impresivan je okus ..

Belíssima trapista verteu na taça um líquido turvo,meio licoroso,com coloração marrom escura e um colarinho bege cremoso com média formação e duração;no nariz e na boca uma explosão de aromas e sabores,aparecendo malte tostado,lúpulo,notas frutadas(banana,pera),caramelo,chocolate,f secas,condimentos(cravo),toques picantes e amadeirados,álcool igualmente notado mas muito bem inserido,corpo alto,média carbonatação,final longo e suavemente amargo.Magnífica talvez seja a palavra certa para esse monumento de cerveja.

Bottle 0.33l. Brown cloudy liquid with small beige head. Full body, medium carbonation. Barrel aroma, some caramel, cloves, nutmeg maybe, vanilla. Heavy sweetness but not in a bad way. Alcoholy. Rich and complex.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2015 Dark, thick flavor. Plums on the front end, finishes with chocolate. Great beer, but after seeing the ratings would have liked a little more complexity.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Bottle 0.33 l, Drink Hala, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobrązowe, mętne piwo z jasnobeżową, bardzo obfitą pianą oraz przyjemnym, słodowym, owocowym i lekko winnym aromacie. W smaku złożone - tu jest wszytko, ciemne owoce, posmaki winne, wpadające w winiak, trochę karmelu, lekka palonść - tego się nie da opisać, to trzeba wypić! Mimo tej mieszanki smaków jest idealnie zbalansowane i bardzo pijalne.

Marrón oscura. Un par de dedos de espuma bastante duradera.Olor a azúcar moreno y hierbas. Mucho sedimento. Textura cremosa. Sabor con dulzor agradable inicial, bastante suave junto con especias y hierbas. Desencadena en final bastante alcohólico y seco. En conjunto bastante equilibrada. Es una muy buena cerveza.. Y una gran copa. Aunque no entre mis quads
What is there really to say, that has not been said? The pinnacle of Belgian brewing. What is Belgian beer, you ask? THIS is it!
What a beer!!!! One of the best belgian beer what i drunk. Perfect color, taste, aroma.

330 ml bottle at home.
