BB 11/2017. dark brown hazy color. medium big off-white head. smells malty sweet, dried fruits, liqueurish, honey, light notes of marzipan, plums. full body, rather bubbly carbonation, oily mouthfeel. tastes malty sweet, nice notes of berries and dried fruits, warming alcohol, liqueurish, notes of candy and light marzipan. finishes with dried fruity and alcoholic notes. quite nice, had this at the same time as Westy 12 and its a close tie. The Westy was a bit less obvious boozy, but it was cellared for a while, while this one was relatively fresh. overall both great beers though.
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2015 Pours deep brown with sporadic foam. Strong alcohol. Malt, caramel, nuts, raisins, coffee, liquorice, apples and pebble. Fine carbonated and extremely complex taste

Bottiglia. Colore bruno, torbido e scuro, con abbondante schiuma beige. Grandiosa già alla vista. Aroma devastante e complesso, che sprigiona note di frutta, uvetta, caramello, malto e vagamente cioccolato. Sapore eccellente, dolce ben bilanciato, che eredita la complessità dellaroma, con un finale dove lalcol si fa notare decisamente. Corpo pieno e carbonatazione vivace. Un must assoluto.

Bottle from Drinks of the World. Pours hazy brown. This beer defines the standard when it comes to Quadruples, but there are more complex ones. Still a beer that I drink often as it is available everywhere.

33cl dans son verre associé. Noir profond et opaque, surmonté dune mousse dense qui persiste jusquà la dernière gorgée. Un arôme dune rare complexité. Puissamment fruité (prune, mure, divers fruits confits...), de la levure, un côté torréfié avec du caramel et du malt grillé. En bouche on retrouve tout ça, à ceci près que jy perçoit un côté herbeux et quelque-chose de capiteux, ainsi que tout un tas de choses pas vraiment descriptible au fur et à mesure quelle se réchauffe. La densité et la longueur en bouche sont impressionnantes... Bref en ce qui me concerne cest une des meilleures bières qui soit, même comparée à la Westvleteren 12 ou autres St Bernardus Abt et Abbaye des Rocs brune. Tout amateur de bière se doit den boire, et den reboire, cest une redécouverte perpétuelle !
dark slighty cloudy beer, strong malt taste, caramel, warm mouth feel aftertaste,smells amazing
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 A bottle of paradise. My favourite Belgian ale. Caramel and dark fruit aroma and full body. Very complex.

Pours a hazy brown color with a large offshite head and lots of carbonation. Aroma of dark malt, strong plum with raisins and dark cherrys. There!s a little bit of brown sugar also in there maybe. It gets better as you keep smelling. Very complex. Medium to full body with lots of carbonation. Medium sweetness with a strong alcool finish.

0.33 l bottle. Dark brown, cloudy, tan foam. Powerfull aroma: rich and charming malt, caramel, dried fruits, raisins and prunes, a little spice. Taste: sweet, malt, wine, berries and fruit, cherries with brandy, hops spicy and light bitterness in the finish, very warming. Amazing!

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2017 Booze on the nose. Similar to the 8 it sort of fades from dark brown under the head to almost golden at the bottom. I really like the 8, but this one is even better. More forward and bolder. This one has some nuts and some kind of chocolatey prune flavor. Decent carbonation and a dry finish. An absolute must for drinkers. Really cool.

F:
-certainly more boozy than the Rochefort 8
O:
Very much a most intense Rochefort Beer.Not quite as balanced as the Rochefort 8 though.

Dark brown and hazy color. Good initial beige head, that kept a small lace till the end. Low carbonation but full and round bodied. Creamy texture. Aroma is yeast, raisins, plums, very spicy (cloves and pepper). Taste is sweet, plums raisins, dried red fruits, caramel, roasted malt. ginger biscuit and spicy. Aftertaste is long, sweet and dry.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2016 On est dans le top des quadruples...Le nez est sucré, fruité : abricot, légèrement raisin/vineux, cerise griotte. De la levure. En bouche, on perçoit de suite une attaque d?alcool qui s?évapore de suite en réglisse ainsi qu?un soupçon de cannelle. L?abricot se retrouve en toute fin de bouche (genre abricot sec, un brin plus amer).Les transitions sont parfaites via l?alcool, le sucre...Pour les amateurs de belges fortes, corpulentes, rondes, une indispensable, une incontournable !
my favourite trappiste and my favourite beer overall. Nice and dark and very tasty.
At beer bar in Bruges w Bergers. Usually a beer this thick and syrupy isn't my thing but this tastes like a great chocolates stout. Fresh bottle with matching glass. Awesome.
Very dark brown with a quickly-dissipating light beige head. Lots of yeast left in the bottle. Aroma is not strong, dark fruits, some yeast and alcohol. Taste is sweet and malty. Nice

Hazy greasy brown lemonade. Greasy, soft prune nose. Initial taste is bright sweaty dark fruit, keen lemon and a faint creamy white choc and capped booziness. Clean, enriching mouthfeel and a cookie sweetness. Fading clean sweetness. Very, very drinkable. Always solid. Always one I forget to rate.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 Could this be the second best beer in the world after Westvleteren XII ? YES.
Penso sia la birra più buona che abbia bevuto in vita mia. Magnifica. Indescrivibile..

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2015 Aroma spices looks dark Brown Nice sturdy foam which sticks tot the glass taste caramel little alcohol little bitterness spices little dryness on aftertaste deels comfortabele in mouth would not give it the 11% in flavor at all brilliant beer
По праву лучшее пиво, и не только среди траппис& Не использ& всякие эффекты вкуса, оно умудряе& остават& самым слаженн& и рабоче-к
One of the best beers Ive had in along time. Picked it up at Woodmans grocery and very happy I did. Has a very smooth taste and great aftertaste too.

33 cl bottle, shared. Dark brown color. Light beige (mocha-colored) head. Aromas: sweet, dark malts, chocolate, raisins. Retronasal its sweet, raisins, dark sugar, light red fruit. Flavor is sweet, malty, with some chocolate. Strong alcohol feel, warming. Medium bodied, but certainly not thick. Long finish with no new flavors.

0,33 l bottle from EDEKA Mohr, bottled on 16/9/2014. Clear, very dark ruby with a medium large, very creamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Beautiful! Lovely, sweetish-fruity aroma of plums, raisins, figs, cherries, cane sugar, nuts and a bit of red wine. Very intense, sweetish-fruity taste of prunes, raisins, figs, dates, toffee, nuts and dark chocolate. Long, minimally bitter, pleasant but rather alcoholic and warming finish with a bit of whiskey. Full body, phenomenally creamy, lively carbonation. World-class brew with a wide range of flavours, maybe unexpectedly a bit shy with its aroma. Fantastic creaminess and very round, though. Huge!

Brown color, taste of a lot of dried fruit/plums and a bit of spice, carbonated, a bit of alcohol but so little for how much there is. As noted by most, a world class beer. There are some Trappist beers I prefer but this is of the top. Pretty easy to find as well for me.

Dark brown, with a soap film head. Aromas are very pronounced breads, yeasts, malts, and grains. A moderately viscous mouth feel. There are plums, red fruit peels, and figs in the tastes. A definite alcohol presence in the back of the throat, especially the warmer it gets.
Bottle from Tacoma boys. Pours a hazy dark brown. Thick tan head. Scent is a smidge of alcohol, Spices. Taste has some spice. Cinnamon, vanilla, dark fruits. Smooth. Good beer.

Rosso molto scuro con riflessi giallastri, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, schiuma ocra di bassa persistenza.
Aroma di prugna e uva passa, malti tostati, zucchero candito, belle note vinose e leggero acetico.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata, stesse note al palato, in aggiunta leggero cacao ed una magnifica nota alcolica sul finale che scalda l'anima, leggero erbaceo sul finale, allappa leggermente.
La gradazione alcolica la rende "leggermente piccante".
Magnifica.

Pours a dark beige head with aromas of candy and chocolate toffee and light honey. Dark bottle brown body. Not hazy if bottle not poured entirely. Thick in mouth and very long. Malt leads to chocolate again. One of my favorites for red meat and cheeses.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with thick white foamy head- great appearance but with a very faint sweet fruity aroma. Sweet grainy barley flavoured with some plum and sugary sweetness. Thick in texture. Smooth and full-bodied. Low carbonation. Strong but doesnt taste strong - you do feel the strength though. Very nice but maybe not as great as I was expecting. Maybe my expectations were too lofty!

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2015 Wow Fantastic! Aroma is sweet with: bubblegum, vanilla, plum. Damn! The taste is so complex, I cant give a discription! Overall sweet but not cloying. You defenitly feel and taste the alcohol, but it doesnt dominate at all. Medium bitterness and a long finish! Great beer!

Flaska från SB. Mycket vackrare blir knappas en öl, där den mörkbruna vätskan toppas av ett gräddigt smutsvitt skum som aldrig riktigt försvinner. Mycket inbjudande. Dofter av vanilj, smörkola, frukt och jäst. Smakinslag av karamell, smörkola, plommon och alkohol. Fyllig kropp, len munkänsla. När ölen väl når nästan rumstemperatur blir den alldeles charmant.

Foam: thick pale brown but quite quick diminished
Colour: very dark brown
Aroma: alcohol sweet, liquorice, spices, cinnamon, vanilla
Taste: top class balance and elegance, this beer has so much flavour and complexity hard to describe them all, very complex, chocolate, spicy, loads of liquorice, burnt sugar, heavy yeast, vinous port taste, sweet malty, alcohol present but very good masked, fruity, one of the greatest beer worth to try, better not to cold.

Very rich, strong typical belgian quadrupel beer. Really great. Fruity, full of phenols. Its deep dark copper color, with tiny, not very good head. The beer is a bit over carbonated, but this doesnt spoil it very much. Except that, the mouth feel is rich and silky. It has very nice body. In taste its a bit alcoholic, but still for 11,3% abv its easy drinking. In taste its fruity and malty, very classical quadrupel, warms you up from inside. In overall it obviously is wold class beer.

A true classic, and never disappoints. Dates and caramel sublimely twist together culminating in a dry finish. American versions tend to be more attentuated than European, so if you get the chance to drink one of these in Europe, a slightly sweeter finish reveals even more flavor.

Bottle from Good Spirits Co. Lively, hazy, reddish-brown beer with a thick foamy head. The smell has malt, chocolate, a mixture of sugary fruits with a touch of zest in there too. Flavour has that same blend of fruit, a sorty airy spiciness, chocolate. And whats more, its surprisingly mellow given its strength with a lovely, almost creamy feel to it despite how lively it looks.

Sadly Its not my kind of beer. Das aroma isch viel zstarch. Ich han kei plan was palata söt heisse, deswäge chan ich dem nur es 1 ghä. De appearance isch normal. Wie scho gseid ned mis. Bla das isch fingertipertup. Underirdisch glaubhaft sind die gläubige.

Bottle bought at Delhaize. Pours dark brown with a medium beige head.
Best of three. Tastes very alcoholic, winelike, dried fruits, caramel, roasted malts, sugary sweet.

33 cl bottle. Pours dark brown color with large head and good lacing. Nice smell of hay and vanilla. Very strong and deep taste. Alcohol is very well hidden, but still noticeable. Medium flavourful aftertaste. This is excellent beer, and with little less alcohol it would be perfect.
Impossibile trovare difetti a questa spettacolare trappista. Birra eccezionale sotto tutti gli aspetti, colore, aroma dolce, caramello al palato, carbonazione perfetta, alcol idem in bella evidenza.

Dark and cloudy. Aroma is strong fruity, plum(?), fermented fruit, winey, pure. Palate, smooth yet watery after. Taste, fermented fruit basket covered by a canvas, while someone is pouring over some plum juice. Strong alcohol, banana.

Det er en af de bedste øl i verden. Den har bare det hele. Stærk, mørk, sødlig, humlet og fyldig

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle from Piligrim. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma of caramel, vanilla, booze. Taste is brown sugar, vanilla, alcohol.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2015 Compra: www.cervezasespeciales.com

Opinión: De las mejores trapenses y puede que la mejor. Desde luego su relacion calidad-precio es la mejor

Bottle. Big, creamy, brownish head. With, of course, lot of lacing. The color of liquid part is redish-brown. In nose there are corriander, bubble gum, chocolate, dark fruits... wow. Flavor is chocolate, bubble gum, corriander with some pepperness and alcohol. Actually, hoppy finish. Sweet at begining but bitter finish. Overall: when i bought this beer I thought that it will be overpriced. Good but overpriced. Now I think: this is awsome beer. Real beauty.
Very nice 	quaddrupple. Belgian sweetness , bit sweet, dangerisly delicious! Wouldt tell the amount of alcohol when you drink it. Houterig, vanille, caramel, chocolade

Cloudy deep brown beer, big head thats fades. Aroma raisin, malt, booze, vanilla. Taste is raisin, molasses, spice, anise, banana, some toasted barley. Palate is rich, not thick, carbonation is bright and bubbly, very soda-like. Expected more...

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Aroma espetacular de chocolate e caramelo. Escura, sabor particular, amargor nao muito intenso, com gosto marcante entre caramelo, chocolate e café. Se o teor alcoólico fosse menos evidente daria nota máxima. Sensacional!!!
Sin duda, una de las mejores cervezas que he probado. Sabor potente y a la vez equilibrado. Buenísima!!
One of the best beers I've ever had. Glad my bro in law hooked me up with this beer.

Bottle. Dark brown almost opaque black color and light brown head. Aroma has sweet ripe fruits, caramel, raisins, plums. Taste is a bit sweet but ends with a quite dry and somewhat bitter aftertaste. Flavors of raisin, ripe fruits, coffee, dark chocolate, malt, toffee. Very well balanced. Excellent one.
Great example of this style. Second best behind the Westvleteren. Perhaps a toss up.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2015 Caramel-brown, with a generous head. Slightly floral but less than the other two Rochefort. Strong and sharp vinous, brown sugar and dry fruits notes.  Sweet, and sour, with an alcoholic finish. Average bitterness and high carbonation. Full body. Very complex but westvleteren is so much velvety smoother

Cerveja marrom e turva com um creme bege e persistente. Aroma complexo com notas de frutas secas escuras, castanhas e seu alto teor alcoólico é facilmente percebido. Ao beber, uma sensação vivaz e um dulçor que finaliza secando a boca, mantendo um retrogosto agradabilíssimo. Excelente!!

Degustata in bottiglia da 33 centilitri. Il solo pensiero di berla ti migliora la giornata o la nottata. Impeccabile allapparenza è altrettanto buona. Riesce a mascherare gli ultimi di 11 gradi e rotti egregiamente, se ne bevi solo una... :) marrone scuro caramellata, pastosa, di carattere ed inconfondibile. Il top.

Purchased at Systembolaget in Sweden. Pours a dark beer with foam that quickly vanishes. Its a beer with traces of dark fruit and chocolate. Gentle, mild taste with some sweatness. Best served in a Trappist glass. My favorite Belgian beer.

Dark brown color, small foam. Chestnut aroma but there is something else I cant recognize, strong and full taste with alcohol presence and long lasting after taste. Beer with full aroma, but not to bitter nor to sweet, and every essence mixed right.
0.33l bottle. Muddy brown color with small head. Aroma of chestnut, plum and raisins. Taste is mostly dominating alcohol and leaves very dry mouthfeel.

Cloudy dark brown with light brown head that is quickly quashed by the ABV. Aroma of dark fermented plums, raisins, woody, and booze. Not too sweet, like the aroma fermented dried fruits, candy sugar and smooth alcohol burn. Very nice quad with little to no banana. Gets better with age.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 Very dark brown. Thick beige froth.
Incredibly aromatic and complex: plantain, prune, citrus rind, black treacle, coffee beans, yeast, flour, panettone pie.
Very powerful, yet not heavy due to its precise sourness. Sweet and balanced, mouth-filling and very, very long. One of the greatest, to be sipped slowly and carefully.

Darker brown colored, opaque, wonderfully strong beige creamy and lasting head. Sweet caramel, toffee, bit of chocolate, and dried and dark fruits. Taste is moderate to strong sweet caramel, brown sugar, toffee, some toasted malt some chocolate and bit of nuts and of course lots of dried and dark fruits. Full bodied, bit sticky, and quite creamy. Quite complex, a very beautiful beer!

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 This is truly a very beatiful beer! 

It pours dark red-brown, almoust black with a one finger high, beige head that dissapears fast with a wizzing noice. 

Nose: Vanilla, whiped cream, raisin, plum, milk chocolate, brown sugar and dark syrup. 
Taste: Dried fruit, brown sugar, dark bread, a hint of coffee, licorice and vanilla. 
Body: Medium body with a complex texture. High carbonation. A little warming booze from the 11.3% ABV. So great beer! 

 Absolutely top!

Pianka skromna, szybko opada, nie oblepia szkła ale nie o nią tu chodzi. Aromat nalewki, likieru, jakiegoś ciemnego owocu. Piwo wcale nie takie słodkie, może nieco zbyt wyczuwalny alkohol. Skala jest bardzo względna - jak na 11,3% to dobrze ukryty ale takie Westmalle ma lepiej schowany alkohol. Odczucie w ustach - bąbelkujące, szczypiące, grzeje w przełyk. Zdradliwie pijalne. Wyborne piwo, najwyższa półka.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 It has a nice fruity(mostly plum) taste at the end, but for me it was to alcoholic. Maybe I didnt drink it with the right food companion, but definetly I preffered a beer with more flavor and less alcohol.

Muddy brown, with a soap film head. Aromas are very pronounced breads, yeasts, malts, and grains.
A moderately viscous mouth feel. There are plums, red fruit peels, and figs in the tastes. A definite alcohol presence in the back of the throat, especially the warmer it gets. This is quite simply a joy of a beer to drink. Brewing at its best.
SB internetbeställningssortiment, flaska. Sviskon i aromen. Impstout utseende. Barleywine referenser. Fin arom komplex. Fin kolsyra. Inte oäven inte oäven.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2016 Bottle with expiry date 16.09.2019, tasted 2.04.2015. Intensive aroma of raisin, candi sugar, figs, wine, bready aftertaste; alcohol is quite strong. Light sweetness, light bitterness, mostly from alcohol. Full body. Very good, although its hard to ignore the alcohol.
Bottle with expiry 15.03.2021, tasted 25.11.2015. Some raisin, sugar, wine - but not very intensive. Some alcohol. Worse than last. Not very impressive.
Flaska från SB. Brunröd med fluffigt beige skum. Maltig söt doft. Söt med lite lakritstoner. Karamell, jäst och lite syrlighet.
Simply a beast of beer. Nearly perfect. Years and years trying it. My impressions havent changed. You need more comments?

Bottle. Dark brown with small, persistent beige head. Aroma of malts, yeast, raisins, caramel, fruity, bananas, some apricot. Taste sweet, lot of malts and caramel. Full body, creamy texture, alcohol warming all over body. Awesome.

Dark brown, small beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins, dried dates, and warm, pleasant aroma of alcohol. Tastes medium sweet, caramel, slightly fruity and yeast. Light bitterness and alcohol warming. Brilliant beer.
Really good somewhat dark beer. Fruity with a hint of vanilla anc cherries. Malts are present and had a decent head. Overall, I enjoyed drinking this but not my style.
Sehr dunkel. Hellbrauner Schaum. Geruch nach Dörobst, dunklen Kirschen und Bourbon. Für 11,3 % noch sehr mild im Geschmack. Ein Bier für besondere Anlässe!

33cl BBE 09/12/2019 Rather fresh. Aroma of caramelized cherries, bread, burnt sugar and some nutmeg. Pours dark brown with thin white head. Heavily hazy. Malty and fantastically caramelized beer. Sweet and strong. Medium bodied and extremely carbonated. Served at 12degC in to trappist goblet. A very strong example of Quad. I would love it to be less fizzy though.

Poured from bottle, 11.2oz, used porter stemmed glass. Large frothy whitish brown head above dark brown color. Smells as described with a hint of vanilla. Palate is smooth and enjoyable. High alcohol content noted in taste but not overwhelming and the overall taste is nice with hint of vanilla and hazelnut at the finish.
Very good, and tasty, dark beer. A bit fruity, but just to in the right amount. Maybe the best in the 8/10/12 Rochefort series.

330 ml bottle. Chocolate smell, with notes of vanilla, cherry, cream, very complex. Dark color with a beautiful white head that doesnt fade. Extraordinary. Bitter taste, but very balanced. Elegant beer that even if intense, it doesnt exacerbate nothing. Because is a strong beer, you can feel it with your throat, but not the alcohol, just the great taste. Fantastic beer, i can die in peace now.
Söt arom med inslag av barrträd och kola. Syrlig smak med något sur eftersmak, hint av banan. Mörk rödbrun färg.

Dark brown, tan and creamy head. Mild lacing. Raisin, plumb, dark berry, mild citrus and mild floral notes. Full bodied, sweet malt, mild roast, mild alcohol, fruity, earthy and mild lemon. Medium bitterness, nice balancing fruity malts, mild spice, and nice dry notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fast schwarz, im Licht dunkelbraune und rote Akzente. Hellbrauner sahniger Schaum.
In der Nase malzige Aromen, Karamell, Likör. Im Mund sehr weich. Tolle Aromen von getrockneten Früchten, Honigkuchen, Karamell, Kirschen.

Perfektes Bier!

Bottle, aged 2.5 years, deep brown color with dark red reflex, lightly tan head, not very persistent,.
Sweet aroma, liquor notes, caramel malt.
In mouth are smooth with really low carbonation, i have thinked about a much solid body, but its not heavy, almost silky, sweet sensation, dried fruit (raisins...), malt, liquor (good rum?), great  sweet aftertaste.

Color is dark brown, with a beige head. The aromas of caramel and malt are dominant. Dark chocolate, plums and raisins can be distinguished in the taste, combined with a tender vinous touch. Although the beer has an ABV of 11,3%, it is very smooth to drink. Top class beer. Best beer I ever drank.

Reddish pour, little head. Aroma is big, currant, plum, raisins, apple and caramel. Taste is complex blend of plum, raisins and apple. Very nice mouth feel on this. All flavors mesh well. Really nicely built beer. Top of the list for style.
Plum in the nose, thick and steady head, warms. Complex taste. Hidden alcohol. Best trappist I had. Soy sauce colour.

Aroma earthy, dark dry, alcohol, 
Appearance brown, hazy, cloudy, minimal head, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate full body, lively, 
Overall out of all the trappist beers I have had this is my favorite and I would suggest this beer to a friend
Color was dark amber. Minimal head, but it was good for 11% anyway. Aroma was something like sad layer, hidden alcohol. Taste a little bit vinous, well balanced.
Pours deep reddish brown with thick beige head. Aromas are yeasty, dark fruits. Nicely sweet, not cloying, with alcohol warmth and a bit of oakiness and astringency near the finish.

Pours a deep amber brown color with an off white head. Malt, caramel, molasses, raisin, plum, yeast and toast aroma. Plum, raisin, cherry, chocolate, caramel, molasses, yeast, toast, clove and malt flavors. Medium full body and lively carbonation. Dark fruit and caramel finish.

Pour is caramel with an off-white head with solid retention but very little lacing. Nose is like plum pudding: steeped plums/prunes/raisins, spices, caramel, molasses, toasted bread and nuts. Taste-wise this stuff is just stupid smooth for 11%. Lots of sweet dark fruit and roasted grain and nuts, boozy, vinous, almost port-like warmth. Carbonation is lively and the finish is so deliciously, perfectly dry. The booze is present, noticeable, but never overpowering. Damn fine stuff.

33cl bottle from the cellar. Pours a dark brown color with a thin tan head. aroma is dark fruit, cherry, raisin, plum. medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, toast, raisin, cherry, red wine, nutty, with a sweet, molasses finish. Amazingly complex.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Aspecto: Color amarillo cobrizo intenso, opacidad media. 
- Aroma: Explosión de dulces de frutas tropicales (pera, plátano, mango), algunas características como los dulces que recuerdan a la goma de mascar y caramelos duros. 
- Cuerpo/sabor: En boca, plátano y pera ligeramente picante, lúpulo floral, y maravillosamente rica, la presencia cálida del alcohol. Algunos sabores más se suman a la increíble complejidad de esta cerveza, como el chocolate e higo.
This is a fantastic quad abbey beer. Great aroma, sweet, malty, and nice alcohol balance. A must of course.
This was my first Belgian Ale. I didnt know what to expect. For the praise heaped around this beer I expected more but it wasnt terrible.
One of the better widely available trappist abt/quadrupels. It is fairly carbonated beer, has a good malty flavour and interesting aromas.

.33ml bottle. Deep dark brown with tan head. Rich dark fruit aroma, raisins, rich malt. Big rich flavor, carbonation and hops balance dark malt and dark fruit flavor. Alcohol presence noticeable. This is nice, clean crisp and a Quad!

Bottle (shared with friends).
Dark amber color. Complex taste, full body. Enjoyable and good beer.

Beige, frothy head. Persistent. Copper/Brune, cloudy. Intense and persistent at nose. Honey, caramel, chocolate, raisin, prune, blueberry. Full body. Good carbonation. Massive warming sensation but the alcohol is not heavy in the taste.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 Very dark brown, hazy, dense velvety brown head which lasts well on a wide Rochefort glass. Caramel malty sweet aroma can be recognized from distance, also ripe fruits, liquorice, light spices, plums, raisings. Palate is full bodied, rather sweet but lightly bitter finish. Taste has caramel malts, dark fruits, raisin, cacao, herbs, dried fruits. Warmth of alcohol. Excellent, complex.

I am a ticker but this is one of the few beers I take among the new ones every time I order beers from Belgium.

Aroma: Dried fruits, plum and dark malt aromas. 
Appearance: Dark brown with rich tan head.
Taste: Medium sweetness with a hint of sourness in the finish.
Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, soft finish.
Overall: Very solid. A tad too sweet for my taste, but lots of depth and flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
ciemny, głęboki kolor; piana niezbyt obfita; aromat bardzo bogaty - owocowy; smak - owcowy, leśny, belgijski
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 Heerlijk donker zacht bier met een diepe smaak. Flink in de alcohol maar toch zeer lekker te drinken. Donker caramel mout. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
È la mia birra trappista preferita. Forte come gradazione, odore tipico di una ale belga.

This is my favorite beer. Big and yet very smooth and drinkable. The description is spot on

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 330 mL bottle poured into a goblet. The aroma is initially a bright cherrywood note with a touch of smokiness and a light resin quality. This aroma blends into a port wine note consisting of an alcohol touch with fruity flare - tart cherry, plum, strawberry, and a light banana note - with undertones of buttery pie crust and brown sugar. It?s a murky opaque dark cherry brown with a dense foam, tan head that retains a medium-thick ring and a solid, soft foam surface, and leaves only a light, but dense wisp, lacing on the glass. The taste is a medium high bittersweet port wine. The texture is thick and oily with an abundant fuzzy carbonation to smooth things out. The body is full with lots of plum and raisin notes as well as a woody feel. There?s a mellow and smooth wine warmth at the finish with toffee, sweet cherry, and plum flavors. The aftertaste is dry and clean with a toffee and spice touch.

Aged 1 yr, 3/13/2016. Strong boozy wood aromas greet the nose with bourbon port wine. This settles to eventually reveal caramel and cola. It pours a murky raisin color with soft, light, beige head that showd mild retention and sparse lace. The taste a a medium high sweet with a medium bitter. Foamy carbonation accompanies a slick texture. The medium full body has a woody spice and cola profile with a light leather quality. Tastes of smokey, light raisin emerges and turns to chocolate and cherry. The finish is similar to port wine with a clove spice and a light grape jelly. Its aftertaste is light, dry, and clean  with clove and mild port wine flavors

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruits, liquorice and chocolate.

Appearance:

Opaque ruby/brown beer with medium/heavy yeast and with a medium/large off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruits, liquorice and chocolate.

Overall:

So little to describe, yet so much to decipher. Such an intense flavour and yet so amazingly complex. This is the best quad for me and might be the best beer.
Jai beau en goûter dautres très bonnes, la rochefort 10 reste pour moi le top du top, qui convient en beaucoup de circonstances.

Bottle. Pours Hazy dark chestnutt brown with particles in suspension and a medium sized frothy tan head. Aroma of caramel, spices and ripe fruit. Taste is red fruit, caramel and spices latching on. Medium to full bodied. creamy texture. Really good.

Bottle 330ml, pours almost clear hazelnut brown with some yeast and hop particles swiming in it. Creamy colored head reduces fast to a nice lacing. Strongly sparkling. Sweet aroma of caramel, red fruits, nuts and biscuits. Noticable also some basement notes. In taste also a lot of sweetness with some light background bitterness. The beer is full bodied with a lot very fruitty character and some spicy aftertaste that reminds me of black pepper. Dry with a tart finish. Very nice one eventhough Im not a big fan of the belgian style.
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2015 Отличны& очень крепкий эль, с карамел& привкус& Крепост& на вкус не заметна.

2/22 Bottle - Incredible beer! Very nice dark brown pour, nice head, very thick texture. Nice fruit and caramel smell. Excellent tasting beer, very nice strong kick going down. Quadrupels are among my favorite beers, and this one was one of the best I have ever had. Highly recommended!!!

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Bottle. Tan frothy head, diminishing but leaving a very thin lasting layer. Aroma is complex and intense. A lot of ripe fruit, dark fruit and prune with some toasted malts tinge.Taste is also complex and rich, plenty of dried fruit flavours (prune, plum and raisin) with caramel and toasted malt tinge. Lasting ripe fruit acidity aftertaste.

Pours a dark amber, cola-like robe topped by a fluffy tanned head showing great retention and lacing capacities. The nose is sweet, fruity, gives notes of chocolate, plums, figs, and salted caramel. The taste is also sweet but not overwhelming. The fruitiness is dominant with the figs and plums upfront and sweet chocolate in the back. The body is full but very cloud-like all at once. Some expanding booze comes through the back of the palate. This beer is complex and enjoyable. A perfect addition to any cellar, you can let it age a few years to increase its flavor spectrum. Cheers!

There was quite a bit of smoke when I opened this beer. It pours a dark hazy brown with a medium sized off white head that had great retention and left some good lacing around the glass. The aroma is dark fruits, figs, raisins, alcohol, and some sugar. The taste is very similar to the aroma. I pick up the dark fruits, figs, plum, raisins, and some candy sugar mixed in there as well. The alcohol can be picked up in the flavor. The mouthfeel is on the heavy side and the drinkability is rather low. This beer is a sipper and not a gulper. This is not a bad beer and is worth a try but I think the Rochefort Trappistes 8 is a much more balanced beer than this one.
One of the best beers i habe ever drunk..a little bit sweet but very good..perfect harmony

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home, 2011 bottle. Pours deep brown with some floaties, small off-white head. Aroma is massive with dried fruits, overripe fruit, nuts and raisins. Flavour is sweet malt and caramel. Full bodied, average carbonation. Finish is complex and long with plums, raisins and caramel dominating. I couldnt taste or smell the yeast. Very vinous but thats how I like it.

Bottle: hazy, medium brown, light head and moderate lace. The aroma is dominated by a sluggish ferment profile. Cooked dried fruit. Funky. Maybe volatile. Dense. Very wine like. Over ripe and a stuck ferment. Also Anas a lactic edge. Dry to off dry. Slightly sour but probably due to high CO2 and also has low bitterness. Intense flavor, great weight with loads of dried fruit. Its a good beer. Either not great or a bad bottle.

Kremowa gesta piana ktora szybko opada ale pozostawia centymetrowa warstwe do samego konca,bardzo ciemny rubinowy kolor,wrecz czarny,ledwie przejrzysty pod swiatlo,piekny owocowy zapach,czuc rodzynki,suszone sliwki,w tle leciutki zapach alkocholu,smak to istne bogactwo,palony slod,czekolada,sliwki,lekka goryczka z tylu,rozgrzewajace:)

Dark brown almost black body with a tan head. Aroma of apple. Taste of apple and mahogany with a sweet finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lekker donker bier. Hoog alcoholpercentage. Zachte volle smaak. Bittere afdronk. Stevige schuimkraag.

Look: pours a cloudy dark brown. Light brown head. 
Smell: Apple cider vinegar. Apple skin. Sweet caramel. 
Taste: sweet caramel. Candy sugar. Apple skin. Apple cider vinegar. Unmatched savory flavor. 
Feel: medium carbonation. Mostly dry. Leaves a thin film on the mouth. 
Overall: ok beer. Very smooth. Slight savory. 
First drank: home 2/20/15
Vintage: best before 26.06.2018

0,33 bottle 2 years old purchased in Skopje (RIP Beershop Macedonia) and consumed in Kosovo. Pours a very dark brown, mahogany with a medium ivory head which stays floating on the surface after having lowered. Nose: macerated cherries, red fruit, fresh black figs. So nice! Mouth: aging a couple of years has not helped that much carbonation getting flat but still it has improved it. Same complexity and consistency of a Porto wine which actually this beer recalls. Dates, dry fruit, again macerated cherries under spirit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Coke colour, large beige head. Aroma and taste bananas, cinnamon. Full body. Similar to Rochefort 8, but considerably more complex. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 Pours hazy brown with a finger of dense, creamy head. Yeasty esters, bread, and lightly caramelized sugar take the nose.Tastes of bread, almost no alcohol (truly remarkable at over 11+%), and a slight sweetness make this the finest example of the style. This is the best brew in whats also my favourite style, and thus is the best beer Ive ever experienced.

The richness in flavor is amazing, like a big slice of brown bread with a black current and apple molasses. Too bad its not a great looking beer, otherwise this is the king of Trappist for me, next to Orval.

Bottle from De Zwart in Wilnis.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 06.11.2018. Ladna piana, stosunkowo powoli opadajaca, brudzaca szklo. W Tulipie Duvala (z tym... jak one tam sie zwa... no, grawerem na dnie ktory wyzwala babelki) piana jest obecna caly czas w trakcie picie, do samego konca, chocby i pol godziny. i to polcentymetrowa warstwa. Samo piwo ciemne, czerwonawe w odcieniu. Aromaty bardzo bogate - rodzynki i nne suszone owoce (figi? daktyle? cos w ten desen), swieze, ciemne owoce (sliwki, wisnie ale tez banany), przyprawowosc lekka (gozdzik? i niestety kolendra), troszke zbozowo chlebowych, troszke drozdzy, nieco karmelu... i pewnie jeszcze kilka rzeczy ktorych nie potrafie wylowic. W smaku tez taka pieknie ulozona kompozycja, z przewaga gorzko-slodkich posmakow. Wysycenie spore, odczuwalne na jezyku. Tekstura nieco lepka. Alkohol doskonale ukryty. SUPER piwo, ale zarazem taki nieco Adas Miauczynski - zawsze drugi... bo mi bardziej pasuje Trappistes Rochefort 8 z tego browaru... i quadrupel np z la trappe z tego stylu.. obydwa o wlos, o kolendrowy wlos. ;) http://tiny.pl/ggmvgOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Deep chestnut brown with high and dense tan head that doesnt entirely block the aromas of autumn: toffee, raisins, leaves, black bread.
In the glass, there is also a light sourness like dried lemon, figs, cinnamon and caramel, wisps of chocolate, coffee and grapes. Theres a touch of gingery heat, but the high alcohol stays in the background. Its a wonderfully complex and well-structured drink, so give it time to open up.
We can quibble over whether Rochefort 10 is the best beer in the world, or the second, or the seventh, but its in that sentence.
Bottle from systembolaget. Amazing trappist! The taste is filling the mouth with love! Not much more to say, but try it. If not for anything else, do it for the experience!

Brune, opaque, avec une mousse de couleur crème. Nez sucré, fruité (raisins) et épicé. Goût fortifié (alcool), sucré, torréfié, anissé et épicé... Un délice, une merveille... un moment incroyable pour les papilles!

UPDATED: APR 2, 2015 This is the best beer in the world, no doubt. Beautifull dark brown color. The beer is topped by a soft creamy foam, which is slightly brown. The smell is sweet and has a hint of caramel. The taste is devine. It has sweetness, hints of caramel, bitterness, all perfectly balanced. The beer has a creamy appearance, really soft in the mouth. The beer has a nice full body. The finish is long and delicious. All the good tastes of the beer die away slowly. This beer shares first place with La Trappe Tripel.

Tomada en cerveceria Kraken.
Si está entre las 10 mejores cervezas no es por casualidad. 
Aunque he notado que no siempre se comparta igual en botella como sucede con la Chimay.
Potente belga con aroma y sabor que no deja indiferente.

Perfecta para tomar relajadamente y disfrutar un cervezon atemporal

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2016 Quite dark brown appearance, with a long lasting cloudy head. Complex tastes of chocolate, brown sugar, caramel, raisin and hints of coffee and vanilla. Heavy body, bubbly carbonation and a lasting aftertaste of dark brown sugar. A trappistes to measure other trappistes against

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2016 Marrom escura, espuma de média formação e persistência. Aroma maltado, caramelo, torrado aparente, chocolate, nozes, uvas escuras, nuances incríveis e incomparáveis, que variam com a temperatura. Palada trás um médio dulçor e leve amargor da torrefação e açucar queimado. Corpo denso, baixa carbonatação. Aftertaste lembra chocolate amargo, álcool apesar de elevado é muito bem inserido. Uma das melhores do mundo. Só imagino isso na fonte direto do barril ....
A big burly monk thats a little too boozy for me. Sticking with the Rochefort 8.

Very good and tasty beer despite of the large alc. percentage. 
Aroma of caramel  and chocolate, very cloudy foam top on the glass.

I am not trying to be elitist or picky here, but I expected more from this top 50 selection. 

Perhaps I chose the wrong glass, or the wrong temperature (about 10c). Will need to try again at a later date
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Aroma: caramel, coffee, honey? Hint of Cinnamon
Look: dark brown with good head about 1"
Mouth: smooth and full
Palate: coffee, toffee (caramel) and cinnamon.
I'm not a big fan of malts and coffee stouts but overall I loved this one. A very good balance of flavors and you don't feel alcohol (at 11.3 % abv) a single bit. Highly recommended!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Barwa brązowa, mętna, piana bezowa, średnio pęcherzykowa, średnia i nietrwała. W aromacie przyjemne nuty Quadrupla, dość słodko, przewaga rodzynek, daktyli, fig, suszonych gruszek i moreli, są też nuty kandyzowanych owoców, karmelu, wina głogowego i gronowego. Smak szlachetny, pełny, dość owocowy, mniej słodki niż w aromacie, wyraźne nuty pumpernikla i przypraw, goryczka niska ziołowa, finisz likierowy, wino malaga. Nagazowanie średnie do wysokiego, dodające pijalności i zmniejszające uczucie ciężkości tego trunku.
Tu leżakowanie zdecydowanie dodałoby temu trunkowi jeszcze większej głębi i bogactwa...

Dark brown color with white head. The smell is a little heavy with caramel and licorice notes. The carbonation strikes me as a bit too aggressive (it obviously gets a bit calmer after a while). The taste is less heavy than expected. Almost watery concerning the viscosity, the taste is far from watery. As expected, some coffee, chocolate, toffee and licorice . the taste is warming, as you would think, if you read the alcohol content on the lable.
Still a nice beer, but not my favorite style, or my favorite beer of this style.
in my opinion, Belgium s finest brown beer without a doubt. So ritch in flavour, its a journey on its own.

Pours a mahogany brown with a dense tan head. Aromas are completely subdued by alcohol and a nasty bubblegum aroma. Taste is sweet and not much else. There is a long aftertaste, filled with hot esters, fusel alcohols and solvents. Mouthfeel is slightly fizzy, but still feels sticky.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 Dark brown, white head, really little bubbles, stays to the end. 
Aroma of fruits (cherry, peach, banana), raisins, caramel, dark chocolate. 
Taste: Damn. Too much going on. I give up. Awsome.
Full body, slick texture, lively carbonation. Long finish.
Overall: its second time Im drinking this and Im way more impressed than 1st time. Definitly one of the best beers in the world. And when I consider its easy to get, I would say it best beer in the world.

Appearance is large white head with a deep, unfiltered amber and some yeast. Aroma is a mix of alcohol, spice, and sweet malt. Taste is some sweet spice with a hit of alcohol. Overall right in the middle of the pack of Belgians for me.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours a deep brown, like mahogany with a 1/2" thick tan head. Can see some yeast floating around in the liquid. Definitely some dried fruit aromas with a touch of sourness. Full bodied and a little sticky, the taste is on the sweet side. Lively carbonation on the tongue. The finish gets a little sour. Not noticing the alcohol taste, but there is a little warming after the swallow. Cant find anything wrong about this one!

Flaska systembolaget. Mörkbrun kulör med beiget skum. Stor härlig doft. Knäck, plommon, russin, mandelmassa. Mycket komplex smak med äpple och russin. Fat, lite tobak och bränt socker. Söt med fin torr avslutning.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours murky dark brown with a lot of sediment and an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are dried fruit, malt, alcohol, and yeast - with a dry finish.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2015 Bottle @ Six Roses, Lille - FR. Color: clear dark brown beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel, black bread, notes of alcohol. Taste: high domination of malt and caramel. Explosive taste. Notes of alcohol. Aftertaste: raisin, plums and caramel. Finish alcohol.
-----
Bottle from 2006 @ Kulminator, Antwerpen - BE. Color: dark deep brown with no carbonation and really small ivory head. Smell: notes of caramel, malt and small yeast finish. Spice notes. Cinnamon. Taste: good palate, nice body well balanced; Good caramel and malt taste with nice caramel and candy finish. Small yeast finish. Good attenuation. Very amazing beer! Aftertaste: caramel and yeast. Small cinnamon finish.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2015 Bottle from local Saq. Aroma: dark red fruits, sugar candies, fig. app: brownish with nice medium frothy beige head. Taste and palate : full body, medium sweetness, velvety, short sweet and fruity finish. Good carbonation. Overall : enjoy this beer quite a lot. It?s perfectly balanced, it?s sweet but not too much. A quadruple at its best.

Bottle. Pours a clear brown color, looking dark brown in the glass, producing a fairly large tanned head. Fluffy and lasting. Complex aroma of burnt sugars, banana-esters, raisins, plums, toasted malts and some bready dough notes as well. Simply wonderful. Taste is a sweet blend of all the above. Masterfully integrated flavors, nothing really sticks out of the mix. Notes of port, a whiff of alcohol, raisins, dark candied sugars are just a handful of flavors. The body is full with a slick texture. High levels of co2 and a long semi-sweet finish that warms.

Simply amazing beer. Dark brown, hazy beer with off-white head. This quad has mainly caramel, malts, fruit (plums and raisins) in the aroma and is quite sweet and a bit bitter (just the right amount). Complex but still very nicely balanced!

Wow, que cerveja. Marrom escura, boa espuma. Aromas de frutas secas, mel, passas ao rum. Sabor bem adocicado. Uma senhora cerveja. Corpo médio-alto, amargor médio-baixo. Licorosa, aftertaste alcoólico.

I have some troubles with this style so its not on my top list, but its still a really good brew. Aroma is caramels, dark fruit, especially raisins and yeast. The taste is rich from sweet dark fruits, raisins and plum. Very sweet malts. Low on the bitterness and for being a high-alcohol brew, not that stingy that I expected. "Pleasant, sweet, warming" is the three-word review.
Brown color with medium creamy beige head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits. Taste is sweet, plums, spices with some alcohol hint.

Bottle @ home, right out of the fridge. Complex, subtle aroma, with dominant yeast, caramel, floral touches. Deep reddish brown, hazy, rich iced-tea color. Minimal head, no lacing. Semi-sweet, light bitterness, mild tartness. Medium to full body, moderately creamy, with lively carbonation. Medium finish of alcohol, warming as the beer warms up. Super delicious.
330ml bottle at the Beerstore, Thessaloniki. Dark brown color with small beige frothy head. Aroma is wineous and fruity. Sweet taste, fruity, wineous, malty. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pour a nice brown colour with medium head. Aroma is spices, fruits. Taste is same. Sublime!

Truly one of the worlds greatest beers! So complex, demanding but also rewarding especilly at wintertime. I have enjoyed this gem for many years and am just drinking a young example with the frothy almost white head and frizziness typical of Rocheforts being drunk soon after purchase. This bottle has a best before date in 2019! and I have even kept examples after this date. They age exceptionally well, becoming less lively, but even more complex...actually I prefer them that way.

Belle robe brune.
Mousse bien.
Très fruitée, épicée, longue en bouche avec un arrière goût vanillé. Carbonatation plutôt fine.
Une excellente trappiste.

This tedeemed my view of this beer series. I appreciate the malty brew, because the flavor profile is of alcohol, with medium creamy sweetness. The softer palate is a fairly long finish with a caramel/cereal essence. The ppalate also has a bit of dried candy and apricot and a hint if banana. The finish is semi dry and the aftertast finishes boozy on the whiskey side. This is pleasant and the sips call in to fave yet the yearning for another immediate sip- well done.
Lovely foamy warm white head. Mouthfeel is smooth but not oily. Slightly burnt taste but alot of dark fruits also. Warm finish with lingering taste. Great!

It is almost a perfect beer in its style. It pours brown in a smooth colour and appearance with soft and thin amber head. Excellent smell and taste with chocolate remarks. One of the best beers I have ever tasted.
Bottle. Going from previous notes, smooth with no lingering aftertaste. One of the best Quadrupels I have had.

Robe brune. Nez très épicé et complexe, sur des notes de malt, de houblon et dépices. Bouche tout en rondeur et en élégance, malgré la puissance alcoolique, longue finale caramelisée. Une bière impressionnante de longueur et de complexité.

Bottle @ home.
Aroma of vinous raisins, dried fruits, caramel. Hazy brown with small off-white head. Virtually no head lasting. Moderate sweetness, moderate bitterness. Full body, oily texture, lively carbonation, long finish.
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 Délicieux gout de banane en entrée et en arrière bouche. Une couleur brune de fines bulles, un must.
Excellent Trappist. Sweetness, fruit. But little sticks alcohol in taste and aftertaste

Finally got round to rating another of the classics. This beer brings back so many memories, sitting in bars in Brussels, being refused a bottle in a cafe in Namur with Mr Goodall for reasons which are still unclear today. Deep brown colour, the darkest of the Rocheforts, although maybe redder and browner than I remembered. Deep, sweet aroma. Fruity, fruit cake, gentle hop spice, soft palate, firm malt but no burn from the alcohol despite absurd abv (teach that to some of the upstart brewers these days!). Delicious.
Strong but smooth taste Well sweet no bitterness quadruple type a gourmand beer sweeter than trappe quadruple.

Poured from a 0.33 l bottle. Thick frothy tan head, red brown color. The great aroma that even I can smell and enjoy. Full and complex taste. Lightly sweet, medium bitterness. I really wish I had the experience to better explain this beer. It is full of flavor.

Bottle. Pours a deep amber/brown color with a staying two-finger bubbly white-yellowish head. Sweet aroma of malt and yeast. Taste has more of everything compared to the two other ones - malt, yeast, bread, dark fruits, dark sugar, spices and alcohol. Full body and soft carbonation. Finish is malty, fruity, spicy and boozy. This is an awesome beer. Definitely in my Belgian "top 5". It just doesnt get much better than this.

Had it for the first time in a pub in Ghent and it was absolutely amazing. Drank it few times more and was never dissapointed. This is so complex, rich aroma and flavour. Heavenly beer. A prove for God existence really. :-).

Pours a darkbrown almost black beer with a medium head. From start on it has almost a coffee feeling about it. Taste is light fruity, dark chocolate, malts. Real complex and defining. Even though the alcohol percentage is quite high, you don?t mention it while drinking it and that?s the strength of this beer that it creates such a dimension in its flavour and presence that the alcohol is just one of the ingredients for this great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 Rochefort Trappistes 10 uitgeschonken in Rochefort Trappist bierglas. De kleur is diep donkerbruin troebel, met beige schuimkraag. De geur is gedroogd fruit, rozijnen dadels. De smaak van deze trappist is heel complex, geroosterde mout, gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, en dadels. Verder ook drop, chocolade, aarde en houttonen. De smaak lijkt wat oud en zelfs enigszins muf, maar dan wel op een heel aangename manier! De afdronk is licht fruitig en hout. Door al de complexiteit in smaken is de alcohol van 11,3% goed verborgen. De Rochefort Trappistes 10 behoort tot de beste bieren van België. Ook interessant om langere tijd te bewaren.

Lovely deep woody and boozy aroma.pour dark and soft with a beige head. Very smooth on the tongue with a deep dark flavour, reminiscent of winter with woody and liquorice(very light) accents. An impressive potent beer that wont leave you neutral
How: Bottle. Appearance: Hazy, brown muddy color. Aroma:plums, raisin, yeast, liqueur, complex. Palate:full body, lots of sweetness, light carbonation. Long finish.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 In Bruges, Belgium. Paired with moules frites. Great beer after a great day in Bruges! Aroma of dark fruits, spice, and brown sugar. Taste of spices, banana, plum, and malty sweetness. Complex and well balanced.

This king truly earned its status as a Top 10 in style. Wow. From the outset, this slugs it right outta the park with handsome and mysterious looks; murky, yeast-speckled earth with a fizzy but lovely beige head that is reminiscent of a bubbling spring....it looks like a tiny beast could come up from the depths. The aroma is as rich and potent as one could hope for, purveying a panoply of lusciousness. Plum pudding, raisins, toffee, whole wheat bread, basement, chocolate, light coffee, earth and wood, dark fruit cake and holiday spices. Intensely complex but not muddled, the flavour follows suit astoundingly, taking the tastebuds on a tour de force through the layers. A latent vinous quality rears its head towards the finish which is dry and a bit tart. An active and prickly feel on the palate, this beer is refreshingly light and heavy at the same time. 11.3% eh? Could have fooled me as the booze is artfully hidden behind a community of muscular , wonderful flavours. A grand champion. Excited to see what the cellard edition will bring...
Eerste biertje van 2015. Blijft een ontzettend mooi bier. Vol van smaak donker fruit, caramel, gebrande suiker, Stevige body.

Flaske købt i brugsen i Fensmark. Sikke en dejlig øl, Den smager virkelig godt, men er også meget stærk/ krydret i smagen og hvis man syntes at det bliver for meget (som mig) så er man ikke helt galt på den, for den fylder meget, både i smag og i palate, jeg vil gerne rose denne øl for dens kompleksitet over hele linien.

0.33 l bottle from Alko. Big head, but dies quickly. Dark brown colour. Well, the taste is very complex - Im not sure what Im tasting. You have some bitterness and sweetnes, Belgian chocolate with butterscotch etc. I have to admit my taste is probably not developed enough to fully appreciate this.
thick and dark, with complex dark fruit aroma. sweet with some earthiness and alcohol warming. one of my favorites.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 Pours dark purple opaque colour, with stable off-white head. Aroma with medium noticable alcohol, and with notes of  port wine, grape, candy sugar, coriander, cloves and caramel. 
Flavor: taste is similar: alcohol note is evident and strong, but very well balanced with malts: prevails notes of candy sugar caramel, wheat, with esters of dark fruits (plums) and grape (port wine, muscat), with hints of coriander and cloves.
Body is stick, malt sweetness is high, hop bitterness is low. carbonation is soft.
It is hard decide which is better: Westvleteren or Rochefort? Well...I prefer second one.
Trapista deliciosa que faz parte do time vencedor da rochefort 8, 10 e 12. Alto teor alcoólico e seu sabor especial transmitem uma experiência única ao desgastar essa cerveja

Can't believe it's taken me this long to write a review for what is likely my favourite beer. It's full flavoured. The whole palate experiences something. It has depth. Terrific balance. Enjoyed best out of the Rochefort chalice. For me Trappist beer is magical. Rochefort 10 is great on its own or with a meal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Una meraviglia per la bocca....un liquido pieno di sapori che sidentificano bene....sopratutto un sapore tostato, note di malto, frutta secca, cacao con un finale pepato!! Giustamente dietro a Westvleteren....ma non per questo meno buona..anzi! Una della mie birre preferite!

I prefer to drink this after I drink a like primer beer first like a Hoegaarden or Fat Tire. Probably just because, being a Trappist, the alcohol content is higher than normal. This beer is the best beer Ive ever tasted, you dont even notice the 11% alc because it goes down smoother than any beer Ive ever tasted. Many people saying the head doesnt stay, actually it does. Yes it thins out, but when I drink it there is a thin yet apparent head that remains the entire time.

Frische Flasche (33 cl) von Bierlieb, Berlin. - Tiefes Kastanienbraun mit Rotton, schwach trüb mit etwas unappetitlichen Schwebeteilchen; vom beigefarbenen Schaum bleibt nur eine dünne Decke. - Reiche Nase mit Anisbonbons, reifer Birne, Karamel und süßem dunklem Malz. - Im Antrunk zunächst eine würzige Kräuternote (Anis), sehr milde Bitterschokolade, Süßholz und süßes dunkles Malz. Die malzige Süße ist elegant fruchtig unterlegt (Pflaumenmus, flambierte Banane) aber doch ein wenig plump. Wenig schwer, beinahe schlank; perlend rezent, seidiges Mundgefühl. Im Abgang macht sich im Hintergrund ein Hauch von holzigem Hopfen bemerkbar, aber bis zuletzt dominiert die kräuterartig würzige Süße - hier fehlt eindeutig ein schweres, bitteres Gegengewicht zur glatten Süße. - Man merkt zwar, daß man es hier mit einem besonderen Bier zu tun hat, aber es ist einfach zu süß bzw. zu unfertig. Müßte wahrscheinlich ein paar Jahre lagern, um zu seinem vollen Potential heranzureifen.
Amazing beer, my favorite that gets better with every sip. Plum flavor is strong, and i love the sweetness that makes this quad so drinkable yet also strong

Amazing Belgian. Dark brown pour with a fast-fading tan head. Notes of sugar plumbs, candied sugar, brown sugar, raisins, dark fruits, yeast, and some spices. Barely noticeable alcohol flavour but it has an excellent warming effect.

Dark brown ale with medium head that goes down rather fast. Very rich complex aroma of plums, spices, candied sugar, more dark fruits. Taste is blackcurrant, spices, candied sugar, ripe banana peel, slightly astringent tartness, and with a huge spicy-peppery finish with a hint of banana peel and even grapefruit and a hint of bay leaf (or maybe just peppery). Still medium-bodied for this richness, but also heavy on alcohol, vinelike. Carbonation is very noticeable, but not too much yet. A fantastic beer and a true classic in the style, but a bit harder to drink than Bernardus due to its heaviness. I think Bernardus is a little bit more versatile.

Nice amber colored beer with fruity, bubblegum aroma and a brown long lasting head. You can feel a lot of alcohol in the taste which is quite bitter and also salty a bit.

I know I am supposed to love it, but its just not my style.
Delicious strong and rich beer. Sweet, plums, caramel. But maybe a little to sweet for my taste...
Poured from a 33 cl bottle. Very hazy brown with lots of sediment and off white head. Has a very good aftertaste. Almost no hint of alcohol. I could drink this all day!
Poured from 33cl bottle [29/01/2019]. Medium dark brown with beige head. Caramel, currant, plum, raisin. Medium body. Well balanced, but probably shouldve aged a bit.

Aroma: Medium dark fruit, plums, floral, sugar, light tobacco, fig, licorice
Appearance: Clear, amber body. Medium off-white head, fair retention.
Flavour: Medium malt, licorice, plum, candi sugar sweet. Medium-high phenolic, spicy, peppery. Light fruity, banana, Medium-light bitterness, balanced. Dry finish with lingering fruitiness
Mouthfeel: Medium body, medium high carbonation. Medium-high warning, harsh.
Overall: A good beer, but the warning and alcohol is quote harsh. 

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
18E. Belgian Dark Strong Ale
A nice maple colored pour.  Minimal head that is beige.  Not overpowering.  You can taste the plum and it tastes superb with anything sweet.  A favorite of mine.

Bottle - hazy ruby red with a fizzy dark brown head. aroma of chocolate, roast malt, hints of alcohol, some bubblegum. Taste of chocolate, roast malt, bubblegum, cocoa and grass. Rich smooth body with high carbonation.
Quite enjoyed this one. Aroma of dark fruits, little Belgium yeast. Flavour of raisins and figs, pretty surprised on how the 11.3 ABV was disguised.
bottle shared with my pal named josh hake at club w, alcohol aroma with taste of raisen ad light prune, this stuff hides the alcohol very wll, awesome

Pours deep cloudy brown with a thin beige head which dissipates quickly. Aroma of cherries, raisin and wine. Pleasantly carbonated and surprisingly subtle for a beer of this alcohol content. Crisp and rich with flavours of figs, plum, sweet cherry balanced with oak and cocoa. Superb Quad/BDSA.
Super beer, intense, deep creamy...many many good points and enjoyable, pricy but nothing crazy
toast, roasty, chocolate, coffee, herbs, floral, earthy, leather, smoke, woody, licorice,

Pours deep reddish-brown, less head and carbonation than #8. Smells of dark fruit of various ages - plum, raisin - and tastes of more ripe fruit with a hint of licorice. Sweet and bitter at the same time. Really awesome and likeable beer

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 Bottled. Pours hazy brown, lots of sediment. Really pretty. Frothy beige head. Aroma is raisins, very prominent fig, plum, lots of dark fruits. Smells amazing. Flavor is plums, raisins, fig, currants. Really pleasant, definitely those traditional quad flavors are present. Really awesome beer. This definitely stands out as far as Belgian beers go. Amazing. Better than Westy 12 imo.

Nice brown reddish appearance with off-white foam. Nice aroma. Very complex flavor... chocolate, dark fruit (berry plum etc.) malt. Reminds me of Duvel plus a wonderful complexity and substance with a bit of an alcohol finish (it is over 11%). My new favorite!
Looks like mud but is delicious! Malty, nuts and fruit aroma. Sweet and slightly bitter in a thick, full bodied delivery. Long, slightly bitter finish. Just excellent.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 This is certainly a respectable Quadrupel Trappist.
A Belgian character, because it is a strong beer, more rustic, with a remarkable dose of hops.
A peculiar aroma taking your body a dark color, almost black which forms a beige high foam, dense and medium term, as a Quadrupel should be.
Your scent is really striking. Alcohol is a little more noticeable, and lightly sweet and roasted malt has your palate with fruity touch - plums, raisins and perhaps port wine.

Your aftertaste I was transferred a taste peel fresh plums. This taste was showing up more and more evident during the tasting, appearing quite along with the warm feeling of alcohol.

Its impenetrable Notre Dame Abbey of Saint Remy in Rochefort where unfortunately there is no tasting in your local store that is close to the Abbey.
Absolutely one of the best beers I've ever had. Such a complex taste and sophistication to the flavor profile I'm not sure where to begin. Just find it and try it. You won't be disappointed.

The aroma is very much like other quads, filled with sweet dark fruit notes complimented with some funky notes. Looks as bad as westy 12 in the glass, dark dank mud water with carbonation. But if you now anything about this style you know that is a good sign! Taste is like the aroma multiplied several times, complex mixture of dark fruits, rum notes and some malt tones. In my opinion a more affordable and foremost available top notch belgian quad than Westy 12. Insane beer!

Bottle from SB.

Pours dark brown with serious carbonation and a thin layer of off-brown head. Aroma of red wine, chocolate, cherries. Tastes of the same with lingering aftertaste of raisin. 11.3 % abv is dangerously well concealed. Nice.

The color is pitch black. The scent is huge with lots of raisins and plums.
The taste is extremely rich. All the flavors forms what is almost an orgasm in your mouth. I absolutely love this beer.

bottle from plonk. pours hazy dark brown. Rich boozy aroma. highly carbonated, a little too much. flavour is sweet dark quadruple with alcohol finish very strong. I like my high alcohol beers but I think the alcohol is starting to overwhelm the other flavours here.
Deep and dark brown with a head that dissipates rather quickly. Notes of malt and caramel. Relatively light carbonation that hides the huge percentage of alcohol quite well. Just excellent.

I let this age 2.5 years before drinking. The color was a dark brown plum. The appearance was cloudy with swirls of light and dark. The aroma was complex of fruits and yeast. The texture was fantastic on the tongue. Flavor was a wine like maturity of malts with a bit of fruit. The linger I wished had lasted all night. Absolutely a pleasure and the patience was worth it.
Color very deep dark. Carmel and malt aromas. Slightly noticeable alcohol. Low carbonation. One of my favorite beer!
Deep red-brown trappist. Flavour of honey, bananas and pears with touches of dark chocolate.

Cor marrom de espuma marrom clara muito persistente, apresentando precipitações.
Aroma complexo, frutado, com aroma caramelo, um pouco tostado, especiarias, citrico

Robe brune et quelques reflets bruns à la lumière.Col de mousse blanc-cassé se dissipant assez vite, collant au peu, fin col de mousse à larrivé.Nez liquoreux, doux, cerises à lalcool et fruits des bois, fruits mûrs.Attaque fruitée douce et liquoreuse.Malts torréfiés bien présents, finale un peu amère, mais aussi douce et donc équilibrée.Corps bien crémeux, malts chocolatés : quintessence de la Belgique.Certainement ma meilleure brune trappiste pour le moment.

Aroma: dried fruits, malty, caramel, licorice, noble alcohol, complex
Taste: sweet, malt, caramel, dried fruits, noble alcohol

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 I am not a big fan of brown beers in but this one is wonderful. The colour is amazing, dark gold brown, it is quite strong but well balanced. The nose and the taste are beautiful with caramel and a lot of licorice, very leathery, smooth beer. If you try this with some dark chocolate (even better with salted butter chocolates), you will be in heaven!
Bottle from Hop City Birmingham. Pours hazy brown with white head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel and malts. Tastes of caramel, malt and fruity with a bit bitter at the back end. Very good
Veel rozijnen/kruidig, erg complexe rijke smaak. Alcoholisch aroma, schuim iets minder

330ml bottle. Aroma is a little alcoholic. Dark brown color, with off white head that liners well. Malty flavor, plum flavor, alcohol. Full bodied, but appropriate. Overall, a delicious Trappist beer!
Aroma is a strong fruity, malty, caramel. Color is a cloudy red brown with lots of floaties. Head is tan and frothy. It has a light sweet taste. A creamy full body with soft carbonation.
Bottle at home, dark brown/red beer with a small head, aroma is caramel, malt, dark fruit. Taste is malt, caramel, dark fruit, wine, very nice.

Toujours intéressant de revisiter un classique intemporel, surtout lorsque la bière a quelques années dans le corps. Ce millésime 2011 offre une mousse assez onctueuse qui se pose sur une bière brune aux reflets rubis. Au nez, des noisettes grillées et des prunes confites sont supportées par une vague déthanol bien présent. En bouche, lamorce de la madérisation est très discrète, ce qui confère un goût fruité plus prononcé à la bière. Raisins secs, fruits rouges et malts joufflus sont enveloppés par une chaleur alcoolisée prenante. Elle a encore beaucoup de corps et de goût, une grande bière.

Bottle pour split. Pours a dark reddish brown color with a foamy head. Beautiful beer. Subtle dark fruit, raisin and malt aroma. Delicious smooth flavor. A warming beer with the higher alcohol, but its practically non existent in the taste. Couldnt get enough of this stuff. Definitely going to track more down. Incredible.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 330ml bottle conditioned. Aroma of malt, banana, fruit and sweet caramel. Flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter with a slight sourness and spice. A brown coloured ale with a reddish hue and a large off white head of good consistency and a strong and complex flavour. Excellent beer, one of the best.
Ottimo aroma, corposa, alcolica quanto basta. Una gioia per il palato. La migliore birra che ho bevuto.

Nez: toffee, chocolat, pruneaux
Bouche: sucre, caramel, blé, chocolat, alcool.

Cest bon mais sa réputation est à mon sens très surfaite!
Dark beer with a tall head. Complex and spicy taste with a persistent aftertaste. Warming alcohol which does not compromise the taste.

BBE 1/2018 bottle. Pours clear with bits of yeast sediment. Brown head and reddish brown color. Nose has malts, licorice, raisins and hints of pure alcohol. Mouth is a balanced sweetness with just a little bit of bitterness and a complex thick texture. Finish is long and smooth.

Overall a very kick-ass beer after a little under 2 years of maturing. Im glad I have more of these in the cellar.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2015 Probably not really my style, after being an early fave in my craft journey. But a ripper if thats your thing. Big and fruity. Solid
UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 330cc bottle. Fantastic beer. The head just fades away immediately. Alcohol is a bit too present. Very complex aromas. Yeast, spices, caramel. A benchmark for the style.

Molto buona, corposa, con molto carattere.
Berla invecchiata di 3 anni permette di scoprire nuovi sapori.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Pours deep brown and clear with a frothy and long-lasting tan foam. Rich and complex aroma of caramel, chocolate, raisin and sweet plum. Medium/full body, creamy feel, lively carbonation. Taste is a bit drier than the aroma would suggest, and starts off with dried fruits, grape and some residual but well hidden alchohol. Long finish with sweet licorice, a hint of ripe apples and a subdued bitterness. One of my absolute favorite beers!

Pours a deep reddish brown with an off-white head and lacing. It has a rich aroma of raisin, wine, and some plum. The flavor is raisin, grape, and sugar up front with a semisweet backbone and long finish.
Even if lately i'm leaning more to bitter and bitter ales, this is one of my favourites. Simply flawless!

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass.

Trappist, so its juste good !!!
Were in front of a deep aroma, enhanced with a heavy but sweet trappist yeast taste. Great palate and nice dark brown colour.

Go drink it !

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2014 Forse la migliore quadrupel in circolazione. Colore scuro, molto scuro, poca schiuma, molto corpo a sostegno degli 11,3 gradi di alcol. Note fruttate e tostate, per una buona bevuta
Wonderfully complex brew filled with figs and plums in both aroma and flavor. Nicely balanced sweetness and barely any noticeable alcohol until the chest. Long dried fruit aftertaste.

Schuim zakt snel weg op het troebelig bier. 
Fruitige neus die zich ook doorzet in de mond.
Licht bitterige afdronk. Heerlijke trappist!

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 To moje setne piwo na ratebeerze. Spodziewałem się po nim sporo, a tu jednak Zonk. Aromat jabłkowego wina, piany brak, a w smaku jak w aromacie - jabol. Może zepsute, może mam kiepski gust - nie wiem.

Bottle with some age, best before february 2016. Poured in my rarely used Trois-Pistoles goblet. Brown pour with lasting pale beige offwhite head. Aroma is raisins, plums and belgian yeast. Im also getting some well integrated chocolate/caramel. Taste is along the same lines with mostly dried fruits. The main feature isnt sweetness, it remains relatively dry even with the intense dried fruits flavors. It is slightly tart and there is a substansive alcool warmth. Some old ale notes: Tobacco, port (slight oxydation from the age). Palate feels a little light with high carbonation which I dont appreciate is such a big beer. It is still well done considering the belgian strong ale category. A stellar example of a style Im not fond of.

Cloudy brown with some suspended sediment as I poured the whole bottle into the glass. Taste of plums, raisins, currents and baked apples and cherries, caramel, dark malts. The high alcohol content is hidden well, no more noticable than in the 8. Aroma matches taste but needs to warm up before any aroma is noticable.

Foam head disappears after a few seconds and hardly leaves anything. Color is very (very!) dark brown, very pretty.
Complex aroma. Chocolate is the most noticeable but there are notes of raisins and I would even say it resembles yoghurt somehow (?).
Not going to add a lot now since Im really not experienced enough to describe the taste. Ill just say this is my favorite beer.

I had tried this beer several years ago, and found it to be unremarkable. Now, several years later, I spotted all the glowing reviews this brew seems to draw. So I tried it once again, in hopes that I might have missed something the first time. 

I didn't. This brown Trappist Ale pours with no head, no aroma, slightly sour, and thin on flavor. 

Will not be trying again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A brown trappist with low head. Aroma is weak. Taste is sour................

Bottiglia 33 cl, trovo davvero difficile descrivere questa birra, esattamente come per la Westvleteren XII gli aromi e i sapori sono tantissimi e si arricchiscono ad ogni sorso. Una birra da provare assolutamente almeno una volta. Di sicuro nella mia top 10

Bottle 0,33 l. served in a tulip. Aroma: Sweet, chocolate, caramel, honey, leather, honeydew, dried fruit, plum, nougat, alcohol. Apperance: Pours a deep brown colour with a frothy amber head. Taste: Sweet, malt. Palate: Full body, smooth, tight carbonation. Warming alcohol aftertaste. A complex and great beer.

11.2 oz bottle, poured into a bell glass at approximately 50 degrees F.

A: Pours like free-flowing molten caramel, and forms a massive four-finger frothy head that lasts a long while before eventually dying to a half-finger cap. Once in the glass, the beer becomes a thick, impenetrable fog of burnished bronze. The iPhone flashlight test reveals light seeping through only around the edges, which take on a ruddy-copper glow. Bubbles can be seen steadily rising from the bottom in that light. Impressive sheets of lacing cling to the glass.

S: That is a heady bouquet indeed. Sweetness and booze are the initial impression, wreathed through with an array of fruits - cherry, plum, grape, and something that reminds me of a nectarine, not unlike a particularly confused orchard, or one of those odd Frankentrees being created these days. There are some hints of caramelized malt sweetness beneath.

T: Quite in sync with the nose! I find myself struck right out of the gate with sugary sweetness wrapped around sweet boozy warmth, which fades slightly into the background as the rush of fruits thunder in. All the fruitiness of the aroma is present, along with some hints of over-ripe apple and dates. Malty sweetness can be detected, quietly filling in what few cracks and crevices the other flavors may have missed. The finish ends with a slight alcohol burn, which persists for a bit.

M: Creamy-smooth, lush, rich, and full, this is a joy on the palate and tongue.

O: I see why this beer receives the marks it does. While I am still more a fan of the St. Bernardus Abt 12, this is quite the malty, yeasty, satisfying experience.

Pours hazy dark brown with a beauiful thick beige long lasting head. Wow. Strong aroma that is quite intense. Malts, caramel, dark fruits, plums, bit of citrus hops, raisins, yeast... Like the tastiest smelling fruit cake ever made... Beautiful as well. Taste is spicy and moderately sweet with a clear sense of the caramel and the raisins. Some nuts far away, some honey... Beautiful alcoholic kick as well. Well hidden, yet so flavorful... Small bitter throughout the sip... Soft warmish mouthfeel near the end... Wow... Just, wow... Absolute ten. Beautifully full bodied as well with a lovely creamy mouthfeel. Extremely well balanced... Excellent. Overall seen, this beer deserves only one description: nectar of the gods. Softer than the Bernardus Abt 12, which makes this beer a little bit more tastier to me. But thats just a minor difference.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2014 Im lucky to live in Brussels. I can find this beer easily in my grocery just 30 meters away from me. This is one of my favourite beer all time and what I like the most about this her is the Aroma. I havent tasted any other beer with an aroma better than this. Cheers : -)
UPDATED: DEC 6, 2015 Dark brown, large head. Strong aroma, with sweet accents (caramel). Full body, light carbonation. Solid taste, sweet and bitter. Taste reminds of cheese for some reason.
Brune, puissante et aromatique. Goût plutôt sucré. Forte rémanence en bouche. Très sympa.

Pours dark brown. Off white head. Aroma: dried fruit, plums, Madeira. Taste: exquisite deep and rich flavour, sweet and oily. Dried fruits, plums, Madeira. Raisins. Aftertaste is sweet and rounded. Well balanced. Warming alcohol that doesn't stick out. Damn good beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wspaniale, moc i niesamowity smak i aromat. Ju? po pierwszym ?yku przekonuje do siebie i daje zna? ?e jest niezwykle. Piwo z serii "must try"
Near perfection. Mijn favoriete redelijk verkrijgbaar biertje. Wel soms hoofdpijn nadien

Mørk colafarge som er så vidt litt transparent. Fiken er fremtredende i lukten sammen med et vinøst preg. Smaken også dominert av tørket frukt sammen med en fin maltsødme. God kullsyre som går over i en behagelig og myk alkoholvarme.

Brune café-créme foncé. Voilée. Mousse beige persistante. Peu de dépôts.
Arômatique toastage café caramel, sucrée. Liquoreuse. On décèle également un houblonnage agrumes.
En bouche très douce en balancée, avec un côté liquoreux très affirmé accompagnant sur toute la longueur. Amertume agréable également. Carbonation moyenne, crémeuse en bouche. Bière incroyable. 
Différent style, mais je préfère la 8 à priori...

330ml Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Liquorice, brown sugar, marzipan and blackcurrant, raisins and plums in the aroma. Rich taste with notes of liquorice, aniseed, dried fruit and a hint of brown sugar. Very easy to strength for the abv, but then so many Belgian beers are! :) A great brew.

Bottle from Tallinna Kaubamaja ( 4,70). BB 05.2019. Pours a very hazy, murky dark brown with a red hue and a massive light creamy head that drops very slow, leaving some lacing. The aroma has a red winey (port even) thickness accompanied by caramel and dark autumny fruits, but also some pungent alcoholic warmth. Taste starts with very subtle autumny fruit notes, followed with quite harsh alcoholic-caramelly-plummy notes, then settling with more mellow, balanced, sweet autumny fruits, wintery spices, and almonds. Its got a medium plus body with gentle carbonation and a surprisingly soft, velvety texture... It finishes dry, even a bit woody.

Maybe not in the mood right now for something like this, but will re-review to see if it needs a little push from the mere 3,8 Im giving it now, which seems fair though, coming from someone not terribly in love with Belgian style beers.

Looks cola like in the glass with off white thick head that disappeared quickly. 

Aroma is chocolate covered plums and a little dirt smell similar to a good red wine. 

Taste is dark fruit. Very balanced with a nice long finish.

Very good beer with great carbonation 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle purchased at Julios Liquors. Darker, damn near brown in color thick head retention. Aroma is real nice, light cherry, raisins and a fruit medley. Real nice. 
This is a delight to sip. The yeast is pretty bold, tons of fruit with candy sugar and dates. This is a younger bottle and the alcohol is rather evident in the finish giving a good amount of drying on the tongue. The body is fuller with a yeasty chewy texture but somehow has a easy to drink "lightness" perhaps the carbonation level plays here. I have not had a chance to compare vintages yet. But after this sample that will be in order. Pretty awesome quad.

W aromacie sporo rodzynek, suszonych owoców, karmel, przyprawy, nieco alkoholu przebija się już z aromatu, co trochę drażni. W smaku dość wytrawnie, przyprawy, karmel, bardzo silne rodzynki i wanilia, nieco melasy. Alkohol wyczuwalny, rozgrzewający juz w przełyku. Finisz przyprawowo - owocowy, długi i przyjemny.
