Doskonałe, choć nieco szorstkie piwo.

11.2 oz, bottle from Cash Wise in Williston. Appearance: finger khaki head, head lasts as a film, good lacing, copper red color, clear. Aroma: light chocolate, raisin. Palate: medium-full body, average carbonation, light alcohol warming, thin texture with a sticky finish. Taste: sweet chocolaty malt into a nice dark fruit, raisin, sweetness, that rides out the taste, with a light alcohol taste coming though in the middle. This is an amazing beer. There is a lot of hype behind it, so I was skeptical, but this is simply amazing. Perfect balance of booze to alcohol for the strength, amazing flavors, simple, but not overly so, not cloying, very drinkable for the percentage. I love this beer.

La Rochefort 10 presenta un color marrón oscuro profundo. Espuma densa y duradera. Su gran fuerza y su cuerpo rotundo se equilibran con una complejidad de sabores especiados y terrosos, con notas a castañas y chocolate amargo y reminiscencias a vino de Oporto, cuero, albaricoques y roble - una bebida muy interesante.

I bicycled through Belgium in the 1980s and my fondest beer memories remain from that trip. An absolute beer drinkers heaven! Several Trappistes have remained fresh in my mind over the years, and this is one of them. Popped a bottle this evening for the first time since I left Belgium years ago, and it is certainly one of the worlds best brews. They do one thing, and they do it extremely well indeed!

This beer is very strong tasted good and looked on the lighter end. It poured with a small head and left a good aroma

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy dark brown brew with a big reddish head with good retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet with dark fruits, dried fruits, caramel and spices, robust bodied, smooth, well balanced, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter with a sweet finish and a long aftertaste, very good.

"had this for the first time last night with the 6 and 8 as well. this was the consensus king of the belgians. poured a hazy dark brown with hints of dark fruits, figs and a surprisingly understated yeast presence in the nose and flavor...although the flavor was stronger and more assertive than the aroma (in all the Roche beers). Very nice, with a very smooth mouthfeel, which to me was the beers strongest aspect. Full bodied, as well as smooth. Tight carbonation that is not overdone. I was really hoping for a 5 or close to it with this one, and while i liked it more than any other belgian beer ive had to date, it fell just short of "blow your socks off status". Glad Ive got one of each left :)"

One of my favorite beer... Probably the best high alcohol beers of the world. 
Complex, full body. Aroma is a little bit malt and alcohol. Taste is balanced sweet, fruity and woody notes.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2016 330ml bottle served in its own chalice. 
A: Pours a dark brown color forming a small, creamy, thin bubbled, and beige head. Lots of small chunks can be seen floating inside, in the bottom of the glass. Retention is medium and only few lacings are formed and left in the glass. A thin layer remains for very long on the top. 
S: Complex. Sweet, grainy, spicy and fruity. Strong notes of dark fruits, mainly figs, raisins and plums. It reminded me a port wine. Strong notes of toffee, caramel malts, candy sugar and Belgium bready yeasts. Strong notes of cereal in the end. Brown bread. A bit of alcohol can be felt in the very end. 
T: Complex as the smell. Sweet and very malty upfront. Strong notes of dark fruits, toffee, caramel malts, candy sugar, Belgian yeasts, brown bread and spices. Mild hops bitterness profileM: Full, creamy, heavy and molasses body. Medium carbonation for a 11% ABV beer. Very fruity and malty aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkability. The definition of a perfect beer for me. 
[ BA Review @ 12/4/2009 ]

Bottle. Pours very dark brown, with a big slightly airy head receding to finger thickness. Aroma is sweet roasted caramel malts, with kandi, toffee and chocolate, as well as oak, nuts and some mocha coffee. Full body with a creamy texture, and a slightly pearly but soft carbonation. Flavour sweet roasted malts with chocolate and fruity yeast with lots of dark fruits and raisins, as well as oak, kandi and coffee. Very nicely balanced, with a nice bitter chocolate and sweetness from dark fruits and alcohol in the finish. Tremendous beer! Similar to, possibly slightly better, and definitively an obvious, easy to get alternative to Westy 12

cloudy dark-brown colour, fine persistant creamy head with a nice lacing, deeply complex aroma of plums, nougat, nuts, alcohol and cocolate, full-bodied, oily with a strong bitterness, the finish is explosive showing tons of malt, warming alcohol and licorice
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is raisins, caramel, dark fruit, taste is similar, rich and fruity.

Poured from 33cl bottle. Aroma of citrus and herbs. Pours a very dark brown with tan head. Slight sweet taste. Medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation, and a slightly bitter finish. Excellent Trappist brew.

Bottle @ De Tolly joogipood, Tartu, Estonia.
Pours with fluffy light brown head that slowly reduces. Aroma of sweetness, malt,raisins, alcohol, caramel. Taste of noticeble alcohol, malt, sweetness and hint of cherrys. Didn´t expect anything from it so it fulfilled all my expectations. Little bit too much aroma and taste of alcohol.

bottle @De Tolly Joogipood. Pours hazy brown with medium head.Aroma of banana, dark overriped cherrys, sweet- and theres so much more.Taste of raisins, bit alcohol,nicely sweet.Good one, but hoped more from aroma.

Dark brown color, light brown long lasting head. Lovely sweet aroma of malt,raisins, prunes, dates, banana cake, alcohol, caramel, yeast and a roasy choclate sensation. The sweet taste fills your mouth while the alcohol pleasantly burns its way down your chest.Tastewise loads of dried fruit notes, licorice, coffee, chocolate, malt, herbs, esthers and alcohol.

Bottle. Dark claret-brown with a creamy off-white head. The aroma is full and wonderful, like a rich fruitcake, balancing sweet bread and malt with fruit and spices. Flavour is deep and plummy, with malt, toffee, sweet but not overly, spicy as well. Cherries. Clove, cinnamon. The bitterness is just right. The mouthfeel is quite lean. A masterpiece of brewing and one of my favourites.
Complex, full body. Aroma is a little bit malt and alcohol. Taste is balanced sweet, fruity and woody notes.

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle. Pours an impenetrable black with a quickly disipating head. Sweet, fruity and complex with a slightly syrupy but very pleasant mouth feel. Very good beer
Fruity pear aroma. Its appearance doesnt do justice to this fine beer. Really powerful sweet mouthfeel. A beer not to miss if you visit Belgium.

Sötét barna szín krémes enyhén színezett hosszan tartó sűrű paplanos hab. Enyhén borsos, körtés banános illat. Kissé fanyar rumos diós ízvilág keserű csokis utóízzel. Rendkívül összetett az ízét és az illatát beleértve.
Bottle purchased in Brussels supermarket - absolutely awesome beer, deserving of its rating. Very sweet flavours of banana, caramel. you simply have to try this!
donker, smoke, mooie scherpe geur, (te) veel co2 . bitter, rokerige smaak. bitter, abrupt,
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2015 Perfetto esempio di quella che deve essere una birra. Marrone scuro, quasi ferma, con luvetta, le castagne ed appena appena orzo tostato. Densa, piena. Pane liquido...

Pours dark brown with a big long lasting light brown head, delicate appearance. Smell is sweet, somewhat reminfing of blackcurrant, some hoppy aromas and a light touch of alcohol. Taste is surprisingly mild for such a strong beer, very creamy and quite sweet with only a slight bitterness though not still unbalanced. Really an execellent belgian!

330mL BB 29.01.2019
Not my first foray with this fine Trappist ale, however never actually got around to rating it - 1200th rate seems an apt occasion!
Its a mysterious, somewhat sinister looking brew - deep, murky burgundy holding a small but thickly textured beige head.
The aroma is seductive, alluring, yet somewhat familiar & homely. Rich dark sugars, certainly an earthy candy sugar of sorts in there, which adds its own complexities of roast beetroot & rumminess, but thats merely the tip of the iceberg - chocolate pudding, black cherry & plum, and maybe even prunes, and why not some raisins! Theres some spice in there too; clove, black pepper, nutmeg - phenolically derived, one would have to assume.
Theres something about the weight of this beer, that just seems right. Yeah, sure, 11 or so percent, more than double strength, up there with wine, rah rah, but it just sits so nicely on the palate - velvety, thick, luscious, welcoming, friendly, warming, tremendously persistent in the best way possible. No other beer seems to be able to emulate the texture of this beer.
HOOK IT TO MY VEINS! Ahhhh... There are very few beverages in the world that compare to the refined complexity of this ale - perhaps the finest old Port or aged Bordeaux - theres something special going on here; chocolate, treacle, rum, raisin - starting to sound like a dessert! Vinous plums, and cherries, and black raspberries, and some other berry I dont know the name of, and then theres dried fruits too, and spices, and some leafy hop character, and some yeasty breadiness. What starts sweet soon dries out, a tickled of bitterness provides balance, and it just lingers with a cheek pinkening warmth, and begs oh so politely for another sip, and before you know it you realise you were foolish for only purchasing JUST ONE BOTTLE!
So in conclusion: what have we learnt? Many choose to make parallels between this and its fabled (and exceedingly rare) Trappist brother, the Westvleteren 12. And this is a fair comparison, and shall probably be hotly debated until the end of time. Would personally love to do a side-by-side tasting; some day. Until then, my favourite will be this beer, based on two points - yes, the Westy is amazing, and has some intrinsic qualities not seen in ANY other beers, but it lacks just a bit of body compared to the Rochefort, and, of course, obviously, theres the simple fact it is just so hard to come by (without forking out exorbitant quantities of cash). So hail to the king...baby

33cl flesje via Jumbo, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 11,3%
Uitgeschonken in La Trappe glas

Uiterlijk: donkerbruin met mooie crèmekleurige schuimlaag

Aroma en smaak: vol, caramel, donker fruit, zoet, warm

Conclusie: 1 van de bekendste bieren ter wereld, trappist, overal te krijgen, maar een echte topper

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Too strong, alcohol over powering but a very complex taste...Caramel.. Nutty.. Chocolate flavor.. Large head with dark brown look.

This is my favorite beer thats easily available. The foam is creamy, the aroma is sweet, it has a balance of flavors. Goes well with strong cheeses or steak. Highly recommended if you like dark Belgians.

bbe 05.2015 , coca cola like appearance. my nose and mouth cant really pick out what im smelling and tasting. medium sweet. finish is a pleasant light sweentess. This feels a lot more balanced and better than fresh, low carbonation. Alcohol well hidden. I can understand why this is great for some , for me its just solid with out the greatness.
Very sweet and sherry like. Raisins, dadels, liquorice and dark syrup. Nice one but trappist isnt a personal favorite.

Smell: Banana & apricot
Taste: Apricot & raisins
Sweet sherry tone. It's nice, but I'm not sure I'm very in to the style...?

One of the Greats for sure.
It pours a dark brown colour with an off white head.
It hasa fruity sweet smell with a hint of herbs.
It tastes sweet like plums and raisins with a slight alcohol after taste which is not bad considering its 11.5%.
The mouthfeel is full with average carbonation.
Overall, I cant find much to fault.
Trappists are so wonderful, plum dried fruit, caramel in the back, pured dark brown nice thin head not too much co2. Lightly booze yet refreshing in its own way. A++++

Bottle 33cl. Deep brown with fast fading caramel coloured top. Aroma is heavy sweet. Taste is complex with sweetness at first and an aftertaste with some mild bitterness. When I drank this for the first time (some years ago) it was one of my favourites, but I dont like it too much lately. Has something changed?

Brune marron foncé, mousse noisette relativement génereuse. Nez excessivement complexe : gateau, marron, noisette, fruits secs, moka, raisin, caramel, vin de noix. Bouche très complexe de pudding, caramel, raisin noir, cognac, fruits secs. Vraiment impressionnant, très bon. Longueur en bouche assez exceptionnelle, gout evolutif. Une dégustation qui se prolonge pour un plaisir renouvelé à chaque gorgée. Corps puissant, crémeux, alcoolique, légère amertume, bonne carbonation. Une des meilleures bières du monde. Ca donne envie doublier une caisse à la cave pour la gouter à divers stades de sa maturation !

330 ml bottle at Klepsydra Bar, Athens Greece. Dark ruby color, slightly hazy with a thin beige head. Aromas of intense caramel and malts. Taste of dark fruits, plums, raisins, burnt caramel, dark sugar, yeast. Sweet aftertaste, pretty long. Full body with medium carbonation.
Maravilhosa. Adoro esta cerveja. Drinkability elevado. Cheiro muito bom. Equilibradissima.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours dark brownish color with beige stable head. Wow, just wow. Everything you could possible want. Rich aroma: Green tea, plums, dried fruits, caramel, grapes. Rich, complex flavour. (Dark) Fruits, sweet malts, caramel, hobs, thick, sticky body. Warming. Perfection on bottle. Full bodied. Syrup-like. Wow. So much to notice and be aware off.

Bottle 0.33l at Carrefour Supermarket Brussels Belgium.Pour it dark colour with medium white head.Aroma of black fruits (black currant and plum),brown sugar , maybe caramel.Taste is so complex, full rich taste in your mouth.What a perfection.

Pours with a greyish head. Smells and tastes a bit like grapes and raisins, almost slightly wine-like. The aftertaste is warmly alcoholic, and holds tones of caramel to go with it. My bottle had a thick layer of fibers on the bottom. This is one of the finest enjoyment-beers I?ve had this year!

Flaske, 33 cl. Mørkebrun med et beige skum. Kompleks aroma og smag. SOrt te, tørret frugt, jord, nødder, karamel, anis, mynte, allehånde, let røget mørk kardemomme. Sød, fyldig, alkoholisk uden at være tung. En let drikkelig sipper. Ikke på niveau med westvleteren 12, men god.

Championsleague! This is a real competitor for westvleteren 12
What a taste, impressive on all fronts

Capturing a many-hued, steadily evolving classic, tasted fresh on last [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ kermes 09/2014, aged 4-8 months upon previous occasions. - Fresh: a late afternoon cordial chocolate or woody madeira/dessert wine of a sipper, pure chocolate coated dates and plums, spiced with fresher hints of bayleaf, mint, aniseed. Marmite on fresh brown, still rising bread at its most pedestrian base. Supreme drinkability, non-sticky mouthfeel despite thick, clearly defined layers of fruit sweetness. Prominent late herbal, nettle tea hop kick. / Older: oakier, earthier, more complex with the dormant potential of its spicy yeast, dusting roasted chocolate and caramel malts over red and purple berry dessert flavours on each new instance. Still residually sweet, with a woody and bitter chocolate dry finish. - One of few mercurial works of brewing art with potential to contiuously educate any drinkers palate, even those less fond of sweeter beers.
Uma das melhores cervejas Trappistes que tomei. Não é tão doce qto as outras. Muito gostosa, leve sabor alcoolico, levemente doce, espuma perfeita e coloração escura.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Al jarenlang een favoriete trappist van mij. Een heerlijk bier met een complexe smaak: zoet, licht bitter, caramel, mout, alcohol, gist, brood, in de verte wat chocola. De geur kon ik niet thuisbrengen, maar dat ligt aan mijzelf. Alles klopt aan dit bier. Het enige wat ontbreekt is de zachtheid die een Westvleteren trappist wel heeft.
Aroma is nuts, raisins, bread, alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet, LOTS of raisins. The alcohol gives a warming feeling. Complex and excellent beer.

This beer is delicious. The palate is interesting with fruit and layers if malt. Had from a bottle in a Rochefort glass. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rico em aroma e sabor, considero a melhor cerveja trapista que ja tomei, oculta bastante o sabor do alcool, mais saborosa na temperatura e na taça ideal!

Pours a very dark brown color with a decent head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is caramel, nutty, toffee, bread, dark fruits of plum and fig, a warming booze note. Taste is sweet, raisin, fig, sorghum molasses, chocolate orange. Mouthfeel is not as thick as the 8, somewhat dry and very refreshing. Overall very good, the booze becomes slightly stronger as it warms but is still very hidden for 11.3%.

Great Trappist beer, strong flavored, alcohol is fairly well masked, dark brown opaque with brown foam head that leaves quickly, complex flavor with a bit of sweetness, scent dried fruit and toasted nuts

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle. Pours a translucent reddish brown color with a small beige head. Aroma has notes of dark dried fruits and cola. Flavor is sublimely sweet and complex. Lots of dried fruits and sweet sherry notes. There is a wonderful, rich, buttery maltiness that is exquisite to sip and savor. Its somehow so very ethereal and indulgent. The warming alcohol conjures up memories of an old port, single malt scotch or rare bourbon. Its that good. The finish is sweet and fruity, with hints of juicy plums and Calvados. A beautiful beer.

Bottles from Rehills, Newcastle, Carrefour, Calais, Oddbins Newcastle (now closed). A very dark brown beer with a rich red fruit and floral hoppy flavour, currants, red fruit, sherry and sarsaparilla followed by a sugary sweet, candy sugar and powerfully alcoholic finish. Excellent!
Fruity and cocoa liquier on nose. Cake, dried fruits, plum, gooseberry and some roasted nuts. Candy sweet also. Sticky, malty, yeasty.

My favourite beer. Living on the south coast of England, I can drive over via Eurotunnel and buy this in Belgium pretty much any time I want. It means I can get it fresh and lay it down for drinking later. But youve really got to drink it from the correctly-shaped (chalice) glass; it really does affect the pour, the head, and the taste.

A nice beer but not really my style. Roasty, fruity, complex taste, but too boozy. Couldve done a better job hiding the alcohol. "But this is 11%!!!" Lots of 11% beers, even simple DIPAs, do a better job of hiding the alcohol than this.

So easy to get, but quite some time since I had one. Years ago I was lyrical about this beer, but I really think it has changed in a not so positive way. (I know my references have changed as well, but still .....).
Dark brown, can be clear, with a creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts , some sweetness and this typical herbal yeasty thing from which you can recognize a Rochefort. Not bad, but my first ratings (late 90s) would give it a much higher score than I will give it now.

The high alcohol percentage shouldnt scare you, its a very easy to drink beer with one of the greatest tastes ever! Dark brown beautiful color and the taste is very complex but extremely nice to drink. The fruits explode in your mouth while you can taste a sufficient bitterness.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 Dunkelbraun mit Rotscimmer im Glas, beiger Schaum. In der Nase Karamell, Likör, Gewürze, etwas dunkle Früchte, belgische Hefen. Komplex und sehr elegant. Am Gaumen dunkle Früchte, Alkohol, Feige, Karamell, Likörsüße. Vollmundig, ausfüllend und klebrig.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Hazy brown, low quickly diminishing beige head. Aroma of liqueur, cherry, very alcoholic, fruity, notes of honey, date honey. Heavy cherry flavor, very sweet, malty, yeasty, woody. Lively carbonation. Full body. Sweetish sticky aftertaste. Very nice.

Licorice aroma, cloudy dark brown with a small diminishing head, complex flavours very malty, long lasting flavour, has low carbonation very light to drink - smooth, considering the ABV was not at all overpowering it gives a great warming sensation

Served cool (set out of Fridge for 30 mins) Beer pours hazy dark brown, has a tall pillowy head and a carbonation strong enough to make the sediment "dance." Damp earthy/chocolate aroma. Creamy, slick feel with a medium-heavy body. Sweet, dark flavour with gentle a very bitterness. Very good beer.
Aroma is subtle, lightly fruity, nice dark coffee color with full head and lacing. Taste starts fruity and sweet with a full stout taste. Very complex, enjoyable beer.

Colore mogano scuro, leggermente opalescente per il lievito in sospensione, con schiuma color caramello, fine e persistente. Il naso: profumi netti ed intensi di banana, frutta secca, caffè tostato, liquirizia e pepe; dire che è ricca, multiforme, esplosiva non rende completamente lidea. E una vera prelibatezza. 11,3°: la potenza sì, ma in assoluto controllo ed equilibrio. In bocca è calda e strutturata, morbida e avvolgente; moderatamente frizzante si fa gustare con lentezza e metodicità. Le sensazioni del palato: malto, sempre e dovunque, frutta matura, spezie, pepe e cannella, un po di cioccolato e liquiriza, lievito, ma non in ordine sparso: ognuno di questi al momento giusto e al posto giusto, senza doppioni né sovrapposizioni. La corsa è delicata, calda di alcool, generosa di sensazioni: ancora la liquirizia, lamarino del cioccolato, un delicato luppolo finale che la rende armoniosa e armonica. Difficile fare meglio e trovare di meglio. Da servirsi a temperatura rigorosamente di cantina.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2016 It looks and smells good. Taste is mostly sweet (caramel, fruity), the aftertaste contains some heavy bitter notes of chocolate and alcohol. There is also a hint of spices. Its a great trappist, one of my favourites. Although it lacks the overwhelming balanced taste of Westvleteren or Bernardus.

Thick head. Lots of sediment. Dark espresso in color. Heavy malt smell up front, hint of smoked alderwood and fresh clover. Velvety texture with nicely balanced hops. Prominent flavor is nutmeg followed by citrusy hop bitters rounding out with sweet caramel malt.
High quality, delicious and complex beer. Smooth to drink and hard to predict amazing taste from a relatively subtle aroma. Very dark and opaque in color with thick frothy head and heavy sediment.

One of My favorite belgish beer !
So strong And so sweet at the same time ! A true Marvel !
Bottle, very good trappist, better than the rochefort 8, strong and heavy taste, dark brown, very nice color, high quality and perfect after taste
Veel beter dan dit wordt het niet. Een van de beste bieren dat ik gedronken heb. Een topper!
Aroma Is prachtig, kleur Is diep donker. Mondgevoel Is ook goed. Smaak Had iets beter gekund om voor mij bij de absolute top te horen.

0,33 l bottle in Hamburg. Opaque dark brown color, long lasting thick beige head. Delightful raisin, plum, caramel and malt aromas. Sweetish and spicy overall taste turns into a dry and strong, kinda alcohol - laden aftertaste. But still, quite drinkable for the high ABV. Lives up to the hype.
One of the best ale in the world ! Everything is perfect. Every time, its a pleasure to open a new bottle of Rochefort 10 !
Bottle. Plum, raisins, molasses, brown sugar, wood maybe oak, nice sweet taste, with a creamy body and a short finish. This beer defines this style, so its yeah of course its awesome.
The Best beer i tasted for a long time. Rich, smooth, sweet. Just what a beer should offer.

Bottle 330ml. Rich and dark, full bodied. Very little head, smooth start and a slight edge on the tail end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Det er simpelthen en fantastisk øl! Lækker skum, flot farve, eftersmagen er der i lang tid.
Bière trappiste dexception. Brune moelleuse à la mousse foncée. De multiples arômes à la fois puissants et subtiles. Rustique et sophistiquée. On sy perdrait presque.
Plum esthers, brown sugar and raisins to the nose. Deep brown with sediment and a foamy head. Flavor and mouthfeel are sublime!

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a dark brown colour with small head that diminish. Aroma of strong plum, red wine, raisin, and black currant. Taste of strong plum, brown sugar, alcohol, raisin, and black currant. Oily texture, medium to full body. Light carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle stamped as bb 06/10/15. Pours dark brown red with a thin white head. Arroma of bread, yeast, raisins and toffee. Sweet finish, warming alcohol.

Fľaa. Čokoládová tmavá fara, krémová pena, rýchlo padla. To bolo spôsobené nie príli vychladeným pohárom. Vôňa čokoládová, prezreté slivky, hrozienka. V chuti najskôr sladkosť, potom čokoláda, zľahka karamel, lieskové orieky. Krásne plné telo, bohatá chuť, stredná a najmä veľmi príjemná nasýtenosť. Výborné pivo.

Vu la note de cette bière je mattendais a beaucoup! Au premier coup doeil une ABT a laspect classique, beau liquide brun foncé avec un mince col de mousse. Au nez rien de désagréable mais rien de spectaculaire, alcool,miel,raisin sec,pruneau,levure belge,caramel... En bouche le liquide demeurent complexe mais ne mimpresionne pas. Un melange bien balancé de caramel,pruneau,raisin sec,miel en finale lalcool est moyennement bien caché. Corps moyen a élevé. Carbonation moyenne. Pas mon style mais pas désagréble. Je suis sur quil existe mieux dans ce style!
Grandr classe brune à la belge...une qualité de bulle exceptionnelle un melange de saveur subtile tirant sur le caramel....humm

11.2 oz bottle served in a shaker- poured a heavily murky darkened to near black brown in color when held to a light source, medium carbonation, 3mm light tan head that was quite bubbly but didnt fade away into oblivion because of it. Aroma of figs, plums, pears, brown sugar- quite a small sample to pick out because there are more. Hits the mouth with a wide body, malt doesnt need to be overpowering because various dark fruit sensations with toffee dominate it, middle has a bite of pepper and cumin, finish is slightly drying. Alcohol cannot be noticed at all. Just right for a pick me up!

Aroma of caramel, butterscotch, bubblegum, cereal, raisin, dough,.
Appears dark brown, clear, rocky head, tan foam.medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, umami, alcohol, full body, creamy, sticky, lively, long finish.oily feel.

Rochefort 10 pours dark brown with a red hue. The head is beige and frothy and sustains itself well for 11.3% ABV.

The nose is big and incrediby complex; it includes brown cane sugar, caramel, baked apple, pear, figs, blackcurrant, milk chocolate, biscuit, butterscotch, and bright bubblegum notes and even a hint of fruity ginjoko. The bouquet is not only as dark as you would expect, but is balanced with bright aromas at the same time. Incredible.

On the palate, the muted sugar counterbalance the heavy flavors up front, which include prunes, caramel, and dark bread crust, before the roastiness and bitterness from the hops invigorate the mid-palate. Peppery spiciness and warming alcohol conclude each mouthful with a dry finish, and leaves dark fruits and dark bread behind.

A deeply complex brew.

Pours a rich, chocolaty brown with a vigorous beige head, which dissipates quickly. Aroma of chocolate, toast, plum, licorice, and raisin. In terms of taste, theres caramel, toast, plum, and chocolate, with a slightly bitter finish and the warming sensation youd expect of a beer this strong. Full bodied, rich, creamy, and lively carbonation. very nice.
sweet dark fruit, raisin, malty aroma. similar taste. very smooth and just, fuck, what do you want me to say, its a great beer. you should drink it.

Dark mahogany pour. Beautiful Large thick creamy frothy lasting beige head. Complex malty, yeasty, and dark fruity. Lighter full body. Soft. Luscious and creamy. Pleasant spiciness. Welcomed alcohol warmth. Wonderful balance. One of the benchmarks of what beer can be.

Appearance: Dark brown with hazy ruby highlights and finger thick beige head.
Aroma: Toffee, fruit cake, vinous, butterscotch, spice, marzipan.
Taste: Low/medium sweetness and bitterness and low sourness.
Palate: Medium thick coarse texture, light/medium body, average/prickly carbonation, lingering fruity, toffee, spicy, marzipan with alcohol warmth and dryness.
Comments: Lovely and lace.

Syvän ruskea, samea, hieman vaahtoa. Tuoksu kevyt maltainen, miedompi kuin 8:ssa. Makeus erottuu hiukan, hieman luumua. Maku täyteläisen hedelmäinen, alkoholi tuntuu vahvasti. Una de las mejores cervezas que he tomado nunca, tostada, equilibrada, de las mejores sin discusión.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Mjukt sammetslen skum. Smak av russin, farinsocker. Svårt att plocka in dofter och smaker men helt underbar.

Une bière dexception quil faut absolument goûter une fois dans sa vie.
elle est encore meilleur si vous la laissez vieillir 3 ou 4 ans avant de la boire

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2014 Know this one thanks to Fabio. pours a nice thin beige head. dont serve to cold. yeasty on the bottom, so only pour in 10/11. briefly stir/swing the rest in the bottle and toast with your buddy to get the nicest power-yeasty start in your Rochefort adventure. let it breathe for a minute or two befor drinking. see the bubbles form circle like pictures in your Trappiste glas. tastes of rasins, caramel and also flowers. not too dry or bitter with a (initially) long (cool) finish. one of if not the best beer ive ever had.
It's really too bad that everyone agrees this is one of the best beers in the world, the price for a bottle just keeps rocketing up. Still, I cant't say it isnt't worth it

Bottle thanks to mcbackus...vintage 2006. Pours a dark, reddish brown color with tan head. Sweet fruity, dark fruits - raisins, plums, grapes, with hints of caramel malt in the aroma. More dark fruit flavor, some light Aramark malt notes, a lot of booze but smooth and well balanced, not like 11%+ brew. Nice.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2014 Dark sugar nose, not obnoxious like cheaper quads. Some serious sediment. Brown pour. Persistent bubbles. Touch of cherry, phenolic, with a hint of hop. Toffee? It ends up being a clean beer that doesnt stick to your mouth. However, it is a big warming beer that you may not notice the alcohol, but you cant really drink more than one of these in a sitting.
Cerveza muy muy buena. Muy suave de sabor y aroma. La encontre en el bar Montana en Gijon, España

Poured into my LaTrappe goblet for this special occasion. Pours a dark mahagony color with average foamy head. Appears nicely carbonated, so much so that it produces a nice little foamy mound in the center of a wispy foam ring around the glass. I did happen to notice that while pouring this beer, it appears to have a rather large amount of yeast sediment.
Smells dark and menacing with a rich complex malt bill followed by fruit and alcohol.
Sweet tasting malts, stewed plums and dates.
Big alcohol taste that hit me hard.
I also can taste a nice subtle bread or grain aspect to the taste.

Mouthfeel lighter then I would expect.
I noticed while I sampled this great beer that my tongue and lips seem to be coated with a sweet tastiness similar to powered malt when brewing a beer, I cantt explain it.
This is a powerful beer and I had a hard time just finishing the bottle. One is plenty for me since I am not a big fan of hangovers.
None the less its a good tasting beer that shows different nuances as it warms.
Dark thick brown with vanilla head. Sweet boozy aroma. Medium body with dry palate up front. Very complex flavors throughout.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2014 Una cervesa per a tenir en compte. És boníssima !!!!!!!!

Pretty used to Rochefort, although this is a class beer. Cloudy dark-brown colour, fine persistant creamy head with a nice lacing, deeply complex aroma of plums, banana(!!!), nougat, nuts, full-bodied, oily with a strong bitterness, the finish is explosive showing malt, warming alcohol and licorice. Doesnt age that well like the Westvleteren or Westmalle Dubbel. Wonder why?
Bottle, 330 ml from supermarket in Bruxelles. Pours dark brown with off-white head. Malty, dark fruit aroma. Malty sweet, caramel, dark fruits, some chocolate. Warming alcohol.
coffee, alcohol, brown, hazy, brown foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, full body,

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2015 The blue cap, the big one in the holy Rochefort trinity and one of the true greats in the massive ale style. Mousse-like, nicely lacing, tanned foam, stable in relation to its ABV, though it inevitably turns to islands of foam after a while, colour of the same hue as the 8 but clearly darker and equally misty; aroma even more powerful and intensely perfumed, I reckon anyone who knows this beer can recognise a bottle being opened from a few meters distance, impressions of banana liqueur, marzipan, chocolate, port wine, coriander, the ever-present Rochefort liquorice effect, peppery hops, freshly grated ginger, Flemish boterkoeken, dates, pear syrup; taste begins with a full and rich fruity sweetness, lots of candi sugar, medium carbonisation, very full, almost syrupy mouthfeel, intense and profound maltiness (caramel and chocolate with a nutty touch), opulently decorated with spices (coriander, cloves, liquorice), yeasty, aftertaste with an increasing degree of alcohol warmth (rum, brandy) but never becoming astringent, peppery hoppiness, candi sweetness also lingers on and I can accept the fact that this may be a bit too cloying for many (but then there is still the 8). Wish I had the patience to keep a few in my cellar for some years as this is one of the few big Belgian ales I have not yet tasted as old beer - and I am pretty sure this will stand the test of time gloriously.
Bottle 0.33l at Black Door, Helsinki. BBE 19.02.2019. Colour is brown with slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavors: Belgian yeast, spices, anise, dark fruits and malts.

From Brugge, somewhere. Appearance is a deep dark with an off white head. Aroma is of plums, raisins and some dark chocolate. Taste is of dark fruits, a touch of chocolate with a slight bready note at the end. Very smooth and drinkable. Theres a nice bit of spiciness in the finish. Very tasty.
Dark brown colour with creamy beige head. Sweet and fruity. Excelent trappist beer.
Complex, fruity, dark, and leathery. Sweet raisin but also dry with prickly carbonation. Full body. Some warming. Cloudy prune appearance.

@ Havregatan. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget (40:-). Fruity and sweet malty, raisins and caramel, some nice alcohol notes, very complex, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet and very fruity with alcohol notes.

Dark brown amber. 
Sudsy, quickly disappearing head.
Tons of suspended black flake particulate even after handling and pouring gently.
Best before 30.01.2018
Drank on July 7th 2014
Not sure what went wrong here. Beer may have turned do to bad storage conditions between brewer and me.
I long awaited trying this beer with great expectations I gleaned from all the wonderful reviews. 
But those expectations were quickly shattered as soon as I opened the bottle. 
Bottle hissed nicely as cap was released but not much gas remained in the liquid and beer fell rather flat on carbonation. 
Sweet, syrupy, plum, brandy, low bitterness. 
I will have to re-rate this beer in the future. 
Very sad.

12 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a deep brown, with a massive khaki head that dissipates into a disc, leaving good lacing. Nose is dark fruit, black currants, and caramel. Taste is black currants, raisins, and dark fruit, with a lot of different flavors. Gets more complex as it warms. One of the best beers I have ever had.
This is probably the best beer I have ever had. But then there is Westvlettere which is still an unknown but also a lot more expensive.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2016 White Foam not persistent. Back colour. Sweet raisins aroma, black chocolate, coffee, panela, caramel malt, wine... Mouth feel hot because the alcohol, after becames very complex flavour, sweet wine, dry fruits, roasted...
Very strong and complex beer
Pours a deep brown color, with a frothy tan head. Aroma is fruity with peach and apricot. Tasting you get a warming sensation from the alcohol, but its not much in the taste. Its malty and nutty.

Pours a dark, murky brown, with sediments floating, and with a foamy tan head. Aroma is intoxicating, perhaps my favorite aroma of any beer. I smell brown sugar, cinnamon, and dark fruits - mainly raisin. Flavor is sweet dark fruit, with a strong raisin aftertaste. The alcohol has a nice burn. Amazingly delicious.

375 ml bottle. Dark plum and raisin aroma and taste. Caramel malt. Huge flavors. Lovely.
Poured from bottle. Pours a rich brown color with thick head. Lots of rich malt flavors - caramel, dark fruits, and yeast. Very delicious and earns its high rating.
Outstanding complex Trappist, my favourite beer so far! The taste is the best part of this beer, with an unrivaled complexity and balance.

birra dal color bronzo, ottima la densità al palato. Il sapore è equilibrato tra fruttato ed amaro nasconde i suoi 11,3· alc. Consiglio di lasciarla nel bicchiere per qualche minuto per assaporarla al meglio! Ala salute

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2015 Dark brown color. Very enjoyable ale. One of the best enjoyable aroma and taste, good amount of raisins. Incredibly complex and ballanced. Great for summer. Liked the aftertaste - very smooth and sparkling. Unlike other summer taste beers - this is serious and manly stuff. Great ale!

Bottle, 0.33l. Murky dark brown color with medium frothy tan-like head, sparkling appearance and many yeast particles floating. Aroma of dark fruits, wine, caramel, spicy yeast and alcohol. Taste starts with rich and moderate sweet caramel malt and fruity, following is yeasty acid with strong alcohol note, mouthfeel is spicy and warming, while finish is almost without any bitterness. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation. Very rich and bold brew, when drinking it slowly, you dont feel that alcohol so much...

Bottle. Dark brown with large foamy beige head that dissipates quickly, slighjt caramel aroma, sweetish caramel-cherry taste with roasted malt at the background, mediuim carbonation, long finish with smoky aftertaste. One of the greats, happy to finally rate it though I had tried it quite a few times in the past!

29/V/14 - 33cl bottle after mass in the cathedral @ De Rechtvaardige Rechters (Gent) - BB: 6/II/19 (2014-571) 
Little cloudy dark brown beer, creamy beige head, irregular, pretty stable, little adhesive. Aroma: caramel, dark chocolate, bready, bit hoppy, some banana, yeast. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: sweet start, bit sugary, alcohol, caramel, dried fruits, nice bitterness, bit tangy, some chocolate. Aftertaste: little sweet, caramel, dried fruits, bit of hops, some dark chocolate, hint of mocha, more chocolate. Have been postponing my rating for this one forever, although Ive had it on multiple occasions before this rating. Sort of a "kill your darlings", right?
Bottle. Pours brown with light tan head. Aroma is very strong of gigs, raisins, dark fruits, sweet, Belgiany. Taste is very carbonated, rich, very flavorful, medium bodied. Great beer.

A beer on the ratebeer top 50 available locally which I havent rated, whats going on. 330ml bottle from Next Door in Sundrive. Brown pour, copper-ruby highlights in the light, foamy, then fizzt light-tan head which quickly fizzles away to nothing. Dark fruits - cherries, plums & raisins, oaky notes, leather, hazelnuts, smokey phenols, candi sugar, touches of tcp/band aids in the aroma. So much flavour, so complex. Sweet and malty up front, rich dark fruit sweetness in the middle, nuts, molasses, wine or sherry like tannins toward the finish. Theres a muted herby bitterness there too. Texture is rich and almost syrupy, nice amount of carbonation. Finish is long fruity, and sweet, with some warming alcohol. Really nice, but prefer the 8 slightly.
Very good beer. Something was missing for me in the body and it finished a little short. My expectations were very high. Im glad to have a few more but not excited about it.
Mahogany body with white head and sediment. Aromas malt and sweet citrus. Creamy body. Excellent.
Tasted Alongside Westys, St Bernardus 12, Decadence, others, Pours murky brown with big carb. Aroma is very nice dark fruits, taste is more full bodied and sweeter than westy 12, very nice

At my place on a Sunday before the USA vs Portugal World Cup game. Pours dark almond brown with a red glow coming through. White foam. Aroma is big and strong, earthy Belgium fruitiness, nutty esters. Taste is peanut Belgium fruitiness, tasty esters, phenolic, big maltiness that balances the strong Belgium fruit notes, finish is nice and balanced, and kind if cleans up on the back end. A great sipping beer, and probably the very best example of this style; which admittedly is not my favorite.

Sötét gesztenyebarna, feketébe hajló színű főzet, melyről illata alapján - kezdetben legalábbis - a megszokott jellegzetességeken kívül nem sok mindent tudunk megállapítani, az azonban szinte borítékolható, hogy édeskés ízre számíthatunk. Ez valóban így is történik, 8-as számú testvéréhez képest mindenképpen édesebb. Súlyosan testes sörhöz van szerencsénk, melyben felfedezhető némi rumba mártott dió aromája, valamint kávés csokoládé íze és vörösbor zamata. Édessége az idő múlásával azonban nem lesz egyre nyomasztóbb, kellemes marad mindvégig, így figyelmünk egy percig sem lankad mély komplexitásának felfedezése közben.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2014 Credo proprio che sia la mia birra preferita! Almeno tra quelle che ho provato finora. ASPETTO: mogano scuro, quasi nero a bicchiere pieno. Schiuma finissima e persistente (ne rimane sempre un filo sulla birra), marroncino chiaro con riflessi dorati. AROMA: complesso ed equilibrato allo stesso tempo. Emergono i sentori liquorosi. GUSTO: in bocca è una perfezione di sapori e di equilibrio. Si avvertono vari sapori, soprattutto del maltato, prugna secca, del tostato, della liquirizia e anche chiarissime note di cacao, nonché dellevidente e invitante liquoroso (Marsala e Porto). Corpo decisamente strutturato, carbonizzazione bassa (il giusto per questa birra). Lalcool si avverte nella bevuta, esaltando i sapori, ma non da minimamente alla testa, benché lABV sia dell11,3%.
CONCLUSIONE: ho assaggiato molte birre di qualità eccelsa, ognuna con delle caratteristiche particolari. Tra le tante, fino ad ora (anche se mi è difficile scegliere), credo che sia questa la mia preferita. Ne ho trovate altre con sapori ancora più forti, ma questa, come dicevo prima, è un vero capolavoro si gusto, sapori ed equilibrio. Tutti questi sapori sono perfettamente combinati tra loro, ognuno è dove deve essere e nellintensità che deve avere. Tutto questo (e anche il fatto che i suoi 11,3 gradi non danno minimamente alla testa) contribuisce a renderla una birra di gran classe. Una birra da meditazione o da accompagnare con piatti molto corposi.

0,33l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head and some sediment. Aroma is very complex with fruits (mostly plums and raisins), caramel, chocolate, candi sugar, spices, and maybe some barrel notes. Taste is medium sweet with notes of caramel and fruits. Alcohol is very well hidden. Medium bodied. Overall its very good and complex beer.

Flaska systemet - kryddig och lätt bördig arom. Djupt kopparfärgad nästan åt Brown Ale hållet. Inte riktigt vitt skum. Tydliga karanelltoner och något kryddig. Knappt besk. Härlig värme från alkoholen.

30 cl bottle @ home.
Black colored beer with a beige head.
Flavors: roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, spices, brown sugar.
One of the best.

Een bier als geen ander, krachtig maar ook zacht tegelijkertijd. Overdonderend mooi palet in de afdronk met hinten van banaan, hout, choco, caramel perfect in balans. Prachtig stevig en stabiel en licht romig van smaak. Sprankelend. Zo complex maar zo zacht te drinken. Geen extreme uitschieters wat dit tot een onbeschrijflijk mooi bier maakt.

The best beer it has been my pleasure to taste, so far. For all its complexity, and the alcohol strength, its an extraordinarily pleasurable beer to drink. It looks great, with the head persisting on top of the mahogany body right to the end of the glass. The aroma leads you into an amazing range of perfectly balanced flavours - malt loaf, delicately spiced toffee pudding, plums, brown sugar, cream, sherry, molasses. A full creamy body with tongue-tingling carbonation.
Could easily have scored this a "5" - will leave the perfect score in case I sample something better. But it will have to be very, very good indeed.

La première gorgée de Rochefort 10 continue de me surprendre par sa texture malgré la fuite des ans et les multiples récidives. Cest une sensation étrange, veloutée, légèrement grasse, à la fois douce et âcre, nutritive et éthérée. Lorsque jétais enfant, ma grand-mère machetait des bâtons dextrait de réglisse concentré. Je les cassais et les laissais fondre dans un peu deau. Le sirop ainsi produit était dun brun noirâtre et lorsque on lagitait , une mousse épaisse et beige se formait par dessus. Ce sont toutes ces couleurs et cette saveur que la Merveille rappelle à mes sens : la douceur un peu piquante et amère de la réglisse, lacajou noirâtre de son suc. En si bonne compagnie, on nest jamais à court de sensations. Au nez, des effluves de fraise très mûre, de banane, de pâte à crêpe aux raisins de Corinthe macérés dans du vieux rhum. Et parlons-en de rhum, ou de vieux quetsche, de boukha, dArmagnac Napoléon. Car du haut de ses 11,3° dalcool, cette bière, telle un grand vin tutoie les Dieux brûleurs de gorge et ennemis du chagrin. Je conseille de la déguster devant un feu de bois, un soir dhiver, en écoutant Dave Holland. Quand elle vieillit (jen ai en cave de plus de cinq ans, ce qui me motive grandement à ne pas mourir trop vite), elle sent davantage la prune et son goût se madérise, rancit comme on fleurit : à petites touches de pain dépice, de miel de châtaignier. Qui sait quelle saveur elle aurait à vingt ans  Mais personne na jamais su lattendre aussi longtemps.
Klasszikus Trappista sör, az egyik legjobb. Könnyen megkedvelhető, jó ízanyag, küllem, állag. Bármikor szívesen fogyasztom.
Pours dark with white head, with chocolaty aroma, tastes caramel but not as strong as I was expecting. Beautiful belgian trappist

This was quite a full beer, so its good that the bottles only contain 33 cl. While pouring the beer in the glass I could see that this would be a lively beer. With a strong carbonation the top was thick and brownish white, and the beer itself was black as a winter night. The aroma was roasty, and full of caramel, raisins and coffee, while the taste was full and strong. When drinking the beer I could taste a little bitterness, but the beer was also sweet and creamy. It surely has a full body, and with a lively carbonation and long finish I was left with a good feeling.

This is a strong beer, and with the fullness of the body I think its a good thing that the bottles are at the size they are. If I would have to compare it to another beer that I have tasted it must be the imperial stout, by Nøgne Ø (both the aroma and taste are similar).
This is the best beer in the world. Happy to be proven wrong but I have never had a better beer. All aspects, especially overall flavour, is exceptional
very complex aroma: port, plums, dog-rose, raisin, figs and spices... the taste of brandy, caramel, dark fruits, plums, cherry and spices... dry warming aftertaste... excellent trappist ale...

Pours a dark slightly hazy brown with light frothy well lacing head. Aroma is full of fruit: raisins, plums, and currants. Flavor is heavy sweet with alcohol, a full body and a carbonated delicious finish. Hints of yeast throughout One amazing quad.

With some swirling comes more sweetish roasted malts. Very aromatic and intense nose. The palate is full bodied, sweet and with a noticable acidity. Complex enough for it to be difficult to isolate different scents and flavours. Long but not the most intense finish. Loads of layers. Some boozy hints as it warms up. Very, very good.

Bottle. Pours a deep golden mahogany with a big creamy beige head. Aromas of dried sweet fruits, dark sugar, chocolate and slight nuts. Roasted malty taste with sweet fruits and yeast. Slightly alcoholic. Very soft carbonation. Not really worth 4.3 in my opinion but Trappists isnt my favorite type of beer - at all.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2014 33 cl bottle in Teku glass. Pours a huge slighltly beige creamy and bit foamy head, incredible persistence; deep dark mahogany colour, hint of ruby/golden reflexes. Smells sweet/toasted malts, huge dried/dark fruits, cocoa (quite impressive), wood and a bit of alcohol (port). Tastes dark sweet malts, dried fruits (nuts, plum, dates), cocoa, licorice, spices, belgian flavours. Actually what I probably liked most about this one was the balance (in the final): theres no sweet neither bitter, its just pure taste, as it is . Alcohol its extremly well hidden for real, and youll be quite amazed to know its 11.3 %. Carbonation its medium and pleasent, especially at this alc% ; creamy texture. Very complex, and especially balanced, this reserves for sure a place between best beers ever, belgian and not only

Its very sweet, with some friuty notes, caramel or toffee, some bananas, fig, plum. Wow, I cant even name all this notes. Absolutely fantastic beer. One of the best Ive ever taste.

Pours a dark brown with copper and plum hues. Biege head breaks into fine lacing. Nicely carbonated taboot. Aromas of dark grapes, leather, fig, plum, pie crust, spice and cloves. Bouteille de 330 ml dégustée au Pub Italia à Ottawa le 22 mars 2010 au coût de $12.95. Bière brune foncée.  Mousse assez, col beige-crème assez durable. Odeur de crème sucrée. Douce, assez sucrée, assez amère. Goût de chocolat au lait bien présent. À déguster lentement, ne se boit pas en quantité.
Near black, incredible nose of fruits and chocolate. So soft and full. Sweet with an unforgettable complexity

Courtesy of TizzleJizzle. Poured out of bottle into glass. Aged too long in his fridge before he finally let me drink it lol. Golden dark and has a "Snow-Globe" look with precious sediment. Awesome mouth feel and taste... like Lindsay Lohans Pussy! (Trust me I know) forget the details.. read the other comments.. its a plus x2!!!

330 ml bottle. Poured a beautiful unfiltered brown with a cream top. Complex taste sweet Belgian yeast, molasses, dark fruit, slight dough, and boozy. High carbonation, thick body. Wow, best beer Ive had thus far.

Transferred from BA review on 4-11-12 - 
Poured from bottle into Chimay chalice glass 

Appearance  The beer pours a deep brown color with small hints of red within. The tan head formed upon pouring was quite abundant. It began by fading fast giving way to a head of about half a finger which lasted with some great persistence. After a long while the head faded giving way to an abundant amount of lacing.

Smell  The aroma is heavy of dark fruits; a huge cherry aroma, mixed with prune and raisin. There are also some nice yeasty aromas.

Taste  Sweet flavors for dark fruit first meet the tongue. They are of similar composition to what was detected in the nose; cherry, prune and raisin. Some yeasty flavors and malt flavors then begin to develop shortly after the initial sweet fruit flavors. These are followed by some more subtle lighter fruit tropical flavors of banana and citrus. At the very end some of the alcohol of this 11.3 % abv beer makes its presence known, and with the fruit flavors, leaves a warming sweet taste in the mouth.

Mouthfeel The beer has a higher than average creaminess with a medium level of carbonation. The creaminess give the flavors a good chance to mingle on the tongue, but yet the carbonation matches the fruiter flavors well. While it is very good it is a little on the thin side for a beer of such strength and it makes it a bit too easy to drink.

Overall  This is a very good beer. It has wonderful dark fruit flavors and a nice warming kick. One to have every once in a while as a nice treat.
Thoroughly enjoyed this beer. Rich fruity aroma won me over. The flavour is pretty full on in a very good way. Ill defo drink this again.

Bottle from de Bierschuur in Poppel. The beer is dark brown with a large cream colored head and a lot of bubbles. The aroma is complex. On one side the aroma is very fruity, I guess some dark fruits and peaches. Also there is a nice sweetness which reminds me of brownies. The taste scents the aroma, so this beer is well balanced. Its soft and sweet and the alcohol is well noticable, but its very warming. The finish reminds me of cacao, is a litlle dry and bitter and stays for a while. 

WOW, this beer is fantastic. Much better than Bernardus Abt. I want another one.

What a beer, dark ruby, intense full warm flavour, quite high carbonation, think port..., spicy plum pudding drenched in rum with a generous scoop of vanilla ice-cream, it does have a real creaminess if left in the glass a while, but it has a backdrop of bitter yeasty to balance it all out to perfection,this beer will leave you wanting it again, super tasty,pure Belgium!

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 My oh my, this is a complex one! Bottle, 330ml. Pours a very murky dark duby with around a finger of tan head, which doesnt stick around too long and leaves some degree of lacing. Aroma consists of, in rough order of arrival, caramel and toffee malts, dark fruits such as raisins, cream, vanilla (possibly forming into cornish vanilla ice cream), honey, spices, little bit of alcohol, and finally notes of nut praline. And using the same system, the taste consists of VERY sweet caramel, clotted cream fudge, toffee, vanilla (again reminiscent of cornish vanilla ice cream), nut praline or caramel, tiny bit of alcohol, some sweeter fruits such as oranges perhaps, and right at the back a bit of bitterness to balance the whole thing out. Moderately carbonated yet silky smooth in the mouth, going down ridiculously well for an 11.3% ABV. Absolutely spectacular stuff.

first thing that hits the mouth is the carbonation then sweet black bread, some roasty flavours balanced by sourness, then again sweet nuts and even hints of fruit like plum for a short time. and between all this is hints of alcohol. after a third of bottle it becomes more than hint. it becomes a buzz. time to relax a little and then take another sip. 4,9 euros. not your hot summernite drink

This is a really unique belgium ale. Not very fruity but is like a wine. Feels carbonated and pours reddish orange with a tan head. Had at Mickey mantles.

The best beer i had in my life so far, rich taste it was served on 12 degrees and the aroma was very rich a warm taste that stays for a long time and makes you long for the next sip

Mellow while powerful aroma of nutty caramel, soapy currant and dark fruit bread. Murky medium brown color. Some smokey sweetness, the usual dark fruits you expect, some grassy bitterness, spicy yeast and chocolate aftertaste. Thats a lot and so is this beer. Heavy and silky, with a nice tingle on finish. Strength isnt exactly subtle, warms you throughout. A very impressive beer that I will shell for once in a while.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2015 This is a great beer. Nothing else to say. 
Buonissima birra, nientaltro da aggiungere.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2014 Pours a dark brown amber, very dark and hazy, with a thick white head. The aroma is of dark almost smoky malts, dried fruits, and alcohol. The flavor is heavy and robust. Woody, smoky, burnt malt, leather and earthy flavors stand out. These flavors cover up some of the lighter date, fig and prune notes. The alcohol is warming and lets you know its there and that this is a strong beer, with strong flavor and 11.3% abv. The palate is full, with a dry earthy finish.

11.2 oz bottle. Unknown vintage - possibly 2009 or older. The bottle gushed from the opening - pours a dark caramel brown with red hues on the Westvleteren (ahem) glass when backlit. The light tan soapy head quickly faded to a ring of bubbles at the base of the meniscus. A slight carbonation activity can be viewed throughout the glass as bubbles continue to rise to the surface. Aroma is pleasant and mild: bread, caramel, malt and yeast. Flavor is outstanding: dark fruits, raisin, plum, bread pudding, malt, semisweet chocolate. Alcohol is well-masked, medium to full-bodied with warming alcohol in the finish. I should have this more often.
Medium brown pour with thick cream color head. Smells of dark fruit and tastes the same. A very good beer. Second behind St. Bernardus, for me.

Beautiful nut brown with persistent creamy head. Bread, toffee and some red fruits in the nose. Caramel, bread and nuts fill the mouth with bold, nice body, fresh carbonation. Long, sweet and liquorous closure. 
Really marvelous.
Very dark almost opaque reddish brown, fizzy light head. Plum, brown sugar, booze, date, fig, fruit cake, light roast, raisin, cocoa, caramel, bread crust.

Bottle. Personally i think this is slightly better than the westvleteren 12. Aroma of raisins, sweet malt, plumes, caramel. It tastes delicious of course: sweet, warming complex taste with hints of dark fruits, chocolate and dark candy. Would have gotten a higher score from me if the alcoholtaste didn´t dominate the aftertaste so much. Still, excellent stuff.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Couleur noire, belle mousse beige. Super nez de fuits noirs, fruits secs, malt grillé, fruits jaunes ,reglisse, complexe!. En bouche cest une explosion de saveurs. Gout très complexe et très bien balancé de prune, caramel doux, chocolat doux, malt grillé, raisins, note de levure, note de bon alcool, notes dépices...Fiin de bouche très longue avec toutes les saveurs du gout.... Légère et ronde en bouche, super
Theres a reason this is considered one of the best beers in the world. And make no mistake, it is. In my experience, this is one of the most brilliantly crafted beers Ive ever had.
