Great beer, not my favorite mass produced Trappist, and certainly not worth the price. Esters were a bit strong in this one, seems to cover up a lot of the other flavors, but special B malt is quite pronounced, which is good.
Bottle. Pours a dark hazy brown with medium off-white head. Aroma of yeast, plums, raisins and toffee. Flavor is smooth, slightly yeasty, plums, caramel and licorice. Very complex. Very nice beer.
Bottle from Dad. Appearance is dark, hazy brown. Aroma of sweet malt and dried fruit. Taste matches, featuring plums and raisins. Very, very good.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with huge tan head. Nose is boozey raisin. Taste is dark fruit and brown sugar. Great quad.

Appearance - hazy dark brown. Super cloudy. 

Aroma - nothing

Mouth - super high carbs. Bite

Taste - nothin when it hits your lips. Then I get hints of fruit and crackers. Slight yeast like rustic bread. 

Overall - I normally hate Belgium's but this is completely different. It's not great like stouts and IPA but u can appreciate this. Not bad and gets better with each sip.
Bottle. Bustling with bubblegum sweet aroma, displaying rather thin texture on the palate,, slightly boozy. Recommendable

Aroma van vruchten , cederhout, het hoge alcoholgehalte wordt gemakkelijk gedragen door de rijke smaak van gefermenteerde vruchten, zoet graan en mout.Voor mij scoort deze trappist hoger dan de westvleteren 12 waarbij de beperkte beschikbaarheid en knullige distributie bewust bijdraagt aan de mythevorming rond dit bier.
Rochefort presteert het om een trappist van deze kwaliteit in grotere hoeveelheden te produceren tegen een faire prijs en het gemakkelijk beschikbaar te stellen aan de bier connaisseur. Chapeau!

Dark color, good carbonation dedpite the high abv. Complex aroma, herbal swee aromas. A bit sweet taste, you can feel the alchol a bit, taste of candi sugar. Perfect balanced hops. Rich mouthfull perfect togheter with a meal or alone by itself. My favorite trappetist beer.

This is one of the most enjoyable beers I have had in a long time. At 11% it is surprisingly smooth and tasty. As this beer warmed to room temperature the flavor continually changed and kept getting better. This beer is easy to find and at $6 a bottle is a bargain. It has easily made it to my favorites list!

A truly divine beer. Frothy, creamy head that is delightfully clingy; pleasant aroma. Splendidly dark, but surprisingly crisp. Rich but light bodied, oily and slightly creamy. Subtle orange and almond, dark fruits and raisin. Perfectly carbonated. Perfectly balanced hops, like a well mixed bass guitar. For me, a little too much ABV, but Ive had the 8 and this seems to be a better all-around package; perhaps a Rochefort "9" would be most suited for my tastes. Objectively, near perfection, but personally not quite something I could fall in love with.
-backlog- Excellent trappist. Spicy yeast with well hidden alcohol. One of the best belgians.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2015 Typical double pour, large foam head, large sediment. Aroma is wine like: plum, chocolate, whole grains, red wine. Taste is a little boozy, but very well balanced. Robust and intens chocolate flavour and taste, with mild sweet caramel undertone. Despite its alcohol contents it drinks quite smoothly. Development is alcoholic, but not too much, resembles red wine. Faint bitter ending. Nice level of carbonation which does not distract. Aftertaste is slightly stingy and sweet.
This is a really good beer. I find it better than the overrated Westvleteren
Una de mis favoritas. Potente pero a la vez muy fácil de beber y disfrutar. Redonda en todos los aspectos
Woody belgium taste. Cloudy brown with small light brown cafe colored head. Great palate. Not as good as #9 on the rate beer list though.
UPDATED: OCT 5, 2014 The alcohol migrates up through the nasal cavity. At 11.3%, two of these will calm you the f down, and you need it. Trust me.

Bottle. A beer I should have ticked a long time ago. Dark brown with amber highlights. A big beige head over flowed the glass. A rich malty, caramel, and yeasty aroma. Also something like vanilla and leather. First sip is rich malts with a hint of alcohol. Dark fruit including raisins with currant. Nicely complex with a smooth feel. A classic.
Una delle birre più buone mai provate, piacevole, vellutata, dolce ma allo stesso tempo gradevolmente amara... Una belga top!
Bottle at Plattesteen. Pours medium brown with a beige head. Aroma of raisins, figs, dark bread. Flavor follows nose, with a bit of red wine oak. Nice full mouthfeel.

Dark brown on the pour, just enough off white head. I get a lot of dark fruit on the nose and the palate. Very complex with the number of different fruits that come through. Sweet on the finish. Just a very well done beer.

Shocked Ive never rated this. Brown with gushing huge tan head that fades very fast. Yeasty, bready, spicy aroma that is just a hint tart. Flavor follows similarly, very bready with some dark fruit. Thin with medium carbonation.

11.2oz poured into a tulip- Poured a real dark brown with a bubbly head that shrinks quickly but not completely. Sweet aroma but not overpowering, quite nice. Taste like it smells not overpowering at all in sweetness and alcohol taste. Seems highly carbonated bubbles in my mouth. Some find it a heavy beer but I dont. This is not my beer style but this is good.
Quite simply the very best beer I have tried. Perfectly balanced, smooth. Wow! Everyone should try his.

Botella de 33 cl en la céltica. León. 20-04-2914 En el momento. Regreso a los tiempos belgas, color caoba con espuma beige persistente. Aromas maltosos y cereales con tonos dulces de caramelo ligeramente tostado. cuerpo medio a fuerte sobretodo según va tomando temperatura, adoptando sensaciones de licor, aunque fácil de beber y no excesivamente denso ni pastoso. Sabores muy maltosos con caramelos tostados y toffe, bastante bien de gas, espumando en boca en todo momento. Aumento de sabores tostados y sensación alcohólica a medida que calienta Bastante buena, ya no se cuantas botellas han caído de esta, y creo seguirán cayendo. Un clásico para repetir sin dudarlo en cualquier momento.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Blind quad test against Pannepot, St Bernardus 12, Rochefort 10, Westvleteren 12, St Amatus 12, The Sixth Glass, & Chimay Blue My prefered order was; Pannepot, Rochefort 10, St Amatus 12, Westvleteren 12, St Bernardus, Pannepeut, Sixth Glass and last Chimay. 
  
  
This one is really the best of the classic quads, aroma compared to other quads you get a lot more citrus and some refreshing notes. Taste is some almost blackberries and plum, very much dark fruit, and quite earthy, its a real dark fruit bomb, with belgian yeast and some licorice and lingering citrus spruce inputs from the hops.
Donkerbruine kleur met flinke beige schuimkraag. Aroma van fruit, fris. Smaakt super, wel wat zoet. Topper.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2015 Pours a dark brown colour with a creamy tan head. Aroma of dark malts, plum, raisin. Sweet and smooth but complex flavour. Dark fruits, quite carbonated, which makes a very big beer seem much lighter in alcohol. Very rich, full bodied and moorish and not at all overpowering. Where do they hide the alcohol? I i can?t find it; but will be on the floor later. Wow.
again one of those beers what belgians are famous for - rich taste, better drink it cellar temp than fridge. Deserves its top ratings it gets here.

Pours a dark mahogany brown with a thick tan head. Aroma is of dark fruit, toffee, spices and alcohol. Taste is sweeter than expected, big dark fruit, coffee, rum and alcohol. Creamy and smooth with medium carbonation. A very solid Quad.

Dark brown pour with nice head. Aroma kind of smelled like uncorked wine with Belgian yeast, raisin, plum, some sweetness and I got hints of rotting fruit perhaps. There was some alcohol to the taste and plenty of plum and raisin, following the nose. Nice and creamy on the palate with a bit of spice. Overall very well done beer.
Best beer I ever drunk, better than West-Vleteren in my opinion. Very rich taste, a bit fruity, very balanced.

Forget the pour and head and appearance. This product must be experienced if you even think that you are some kind of beer connoisseur.
Imagine all the great buttery breads and candies and dark fruits in Europe.
Put em together and imbibe. Truly something to behold. From Licorice and raisins to plums and walnut sweetbread. From Twizzlers and toasted nuts to bananas and apricot. The more you drink and think the more different combos and nuances you can come up with. A thing you must do. Wonderful and satisfying.

HAVE THIS BEER! (am i screaming out loud here?) ONE OF THE MOST COMPLEX THINGS I HAVE EVER TASTED. 
I LIKE IT JUST AS MUCH, MAYBE EVEN MORE THEN WESTI XII.... AND SOOOO MUCH EASIER TO GET!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep brown with little tanned head. Smell of raisins lemon fruit. Taste is deep malty. Heavy body. Coffee. Smooth.

33 cl, flaske, 11,3 %, købt hos Den Belgiske Ølbutik på Jyllingevej i Vanløse, 12. april 2014. 
Kandisbrun og ufiltreret Trappist klosterøl med lysere brunere nuancer. Moccafarvet skumkrone på 3 cm tykkelse. 
Duft af rosin og figen. Underliggende trappistgær-noter. Vinøs i dybet. 
Uovertruffen god smag. Sødme, sødme/bitterhed og sort peber i slutbilledet. Men aldrig overdøvende sødme. Tilpas og majestætisk.
Indholdet af kuldioxid er på et medium niveau, og ku' måske være en anelse lavere IMO. 
God lang lækker bitter og sødlig eftersmag. 
Flot øl.
33 cl systembolaget. Kan en öl bli mycket bättre? Mörk brun färg. Doftar lite, källararomer och, alkohol. Smakar, karamell, blommigt, gran, örter, alkohol, tuggummi, smörkola. Fantastiskt!
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2017 Helppo juotava. Hyvä vahva. Tummaa samppanjaa äijämakuun. Hienostunut. Zealot juoma. Hyvä on.  Edit. Oikein kiva, ei paras silti.

330 ml bottle. Dark brown body with red hues, almost opaque. Disapearing beige head. Composite aroma of raisins, dried plums, caramel, ripe cherries and light bread. Taste of dried fruits, dark malt, dry wine, little chocolate, superb balance. Full body, flat carbonation, malty-alcoholic bittersweet finish. Alcohol isnt subdued but definitly isnt galling, rather pleasantly warming. Fascinating experience of stiring and sniffing.

Dark mahogany with no head served cool. Sweet scent comprised of malt, cinnamon, toffee, and particularly dried fruit. Heavy, sweet, creamy, malty, with a robust presence of dried fruit. Lingering alcohol aftertaste. Good, but unfortunately not as complex as Id hoped.

Outstanding. Rich carmel color, creamy head, complex aroma and flavor. One of the best Trappist beers of its kind. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a treasure of the beer world. Im not as eloquent as some are but this brew is THE best Ive ever had. Every week I buy myself one just to enjoy!

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 33 cl, bottled. Pours very dark, almost black, mahogany with a a nice tannish beige head. Aroma: Strong notes of caramel, raisins, brown sugar. Pleasant malty notes, grains, bread. Pleasant rounding grassy hop notes. Taste: Quite sweet, brown sugar. Some malt, grains in flavour. Slight alcohol burn. Very balanced. Palate: Medium body, good. Pleasant noticeable carbonation - burp (8-4-7-4-15, 8.4.2014).

-----
Rerat (2.12.2015): BB 01.09.2020. 33 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy dark brown with a beige head. Good lacing. Aroma: Malt, fermented fruits. Currants. Brown sugar, mild notes of vanilla. Bread. Grains. Quite complex malty profile. Taste: Malty, alcohol. Medium sweet, balanced bitterness. Nuts. Palate: Medium body, strong carbonation. Warming alcohol in aftertaste. Interesting, yet balanced. It is good as is, young that is. (+1 T, +1 O, 8-4-8-4-16, 2.12.2015)
-----
Bottled 33 cl. BB 06.10.2020. Chocolate, alcohol. 
(6.5.2016, no score changes.)

Best Abt ever!!
E senza dubbio la miglir birra che io abbia mai bevuto, un profumo eccezionale, un bel colore ambrato molto scuro/marrone impenetrabile schiuma sottile e fina, poco persistente. Il gusto è spettacolare, qualcosa per me indescrivibile. Da bere in silenzio, sentendone il profumo e bevendo sorso per sorso, eccezionale!

(ps. è molto alcolica e non lo nasconde affatto, si sente e ti mette subito a sedere)
En mi aun corta experiencia, es lo mejor que he probado. Las industriales pierden todo el sentido.

Bottle from our lovely monopoly Alko. Dark cloudy, syrup brown color with small white head. Aroma of plum and dark fruits. Palate has strong sweetness and considered the 11,3 abv. there is little alcohol in palate. Well balanced, full bodied brew with low carbonation and flavors of liqourice and syrup. Really rich entity.

330 ml bottle. Brown with a big white-beige foam. Complex nose of toffee, chocolate, spices, dark fruits, dried fruits. Big body, soft mouthfeel. Very complex taste of chocolate, caramel, dried and dark fruits, coriander, alchool, red fruits, candy sugar. The best example of belgian dark beer!

Love this ale, rich smooth full of flavour. For special occasion in front of open fire. Nothing better

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smell is slightly sweet and malt, appearance is dark brown with light tan head, taste is dark fruit and malt with a clean finish.
No snark or silliness on this one. Just a great beer. Even better mouthfeel than I remember.

330ml bottle.Tulip glass, Malty Aroma, High-Medium Carbonation, Light brown head, Medium body, Slight lacing, Sweet but balanced, Fruity with hints of apple, and pleasant taste, Belgian yeast, Slight dry aftertaste, Hides alcohol very well.

Poured in original glass gives a nice dark brown color with thin head. Smells very fermented and kind of citric. The taste is Belgian but smooth and creamy at the same time, with notes of caramel. Really a good Belgian!

Deep murky dark brown with huge light brown creamy and long head. Strong malty aroma has Belgian yeast, bit alcohol, ripe dark fruits, raisins, plums, sweet with syrup, nuanced aroma with lots going on. Medium body, spicy palate with bit sting but not in a bad way, alcohol warmth, malty with elements from aroma, long tasty finish is also very malty with balancing dark fruits. Tasty and nuanced one with classic feel to it.
11oz bottle pours a hazy brown with a beige head. dark fruit raisins and a sweet malt taste

Had many times in the U.S. and Belgium. Finishing off the supply we picked up in Rochefort on Trappist/Ardennes trip. This is a beautiful and perfect beer. One of only a few Belgian beers that remind me of U.S. imperial stout, but in a way that is lighter, more elegant, more refined. For sure, one of the best beers Ive ever had.

Cerveja com aroma muito agradável e bem frutado. Coloração marrom, com excelentes carbonatação e formação de espuma. Ótima retenção de espuma. Sabor complexo, frutado, levemente torrado e com lembranças do caramelo. Retrogosto adocicado e com lembranças da torrefação. Cerveja complexa e bem encorpada sendo uma excelente representante das trapistas. Altamente recomendável!
Pretty good. I found it a little treacly, but not overpoweringly so. Smooth and pleasant drinking though.

Cerveja trapista belga muito saborosa , equilibrada e harmoniosa
Vale a pena provar

Bottle 33 cl. Pours murky Brown wit Nice Brown lacing head. Notes of beautiful malts, Belgium yeastiness, rye bread, light chocolate, caramel. Very smooth with alcohol well hidden even albeit 11,3. Malty goodness.

The very full-bodied ale has a very nice head, beautiful color, and excellent palate. The taste is unique, with strong hints of fruit, and generally strong tastes overall. The malt is superb and the hops are well balanced in this very strong brew.

Bottle 33 cl.
Dark, with a medium light tan head. Both aroma and taste has a beautiful complexity. Well rounded, and perfectly balanced. The alcohol taste brings an additional warmth to the taste.
Uma cerveja parruda, encorpada e de sabor intenso. Boa para tomar em um jantar. Acompanha bem carne vermelha ou uma pizza Premium. Não dá para tomar muitas.
Great beer, pours dark brown with a tanish head. Sweet tastes of caramel, fruits, and brown sugar with hints of spice. Very easy to drink for the ABV.
Great, dark Belgian Trappist ale. Dominated by dark fruits. Well-balanced, not overly sweet.
No es mucho lo que se puede agregar a todo lo que ya han dicho de esta cerveza... Una trapense con todas sus letras.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 (Drinking date: 17 March 2014) Very dark brown colour. Small layer of fast disappearing beige foam. Lovely sweet aroma of dark ripe fruits, pear, cola and liqorice. However the aromas could have been more powerfull. Sweet taste, you taste dark fruits, alcohol and liqorice. Sweet in the mouth, bitter aftertaste. Not very nice aftertaste, bit of liqorice-bitterness. The alcohol really burns in the mouth and throath, during drinking it as well as when you swallowed it. Long warm feeling stays behind. The beer is too thin and the carbonation is too heavy. Overall, I expected a lot more of this beer. It is a good beer, but in my opinion there are a lot better quads. I think this beer has a bit too much sweet-liqorice in the taste. It has a bit too fake-sweetness. It is a good beer, but not wonderfull in my opinion. It also is too thin. I dont say that it is a bad beer, but in my opinion there are a few things that could be better in it. Thats why I give it the total score of 3.7 (I think because everyone gives this beer such high scores, you are prejusticed. Just like with the Westvleteren 12. It can be / are good beers, but there are so much other excellent beers!)
Mörkbrun med stort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar ganska mycket söt malt! Finns inslag av russin och torkade frukter!

Dark brown with quite nice white head. Aroma of dark fruits with sweet notes and a little bit of alcohol. The taste is very complex, its defiitely more sweet than bitter, but it is a nice sweetness with flavours of fruits and alcohol that does not disturb. Some chocolate appears too. Its definitely the beer that you should think about while drinking it.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 330ml brown bottle with a plain traditional label design, poured into a beautiful Trappistes Rochefort Trappist goblet. Appearance is opaque dark sienna colored with a medium sized tan head with good retention. Aroma of black currants, dates, dried figs and pears. Flavours of black currants, dates, dried figs, prunes, raisins, caramel, butterscotch, roasted malts and spices. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, creamy texture and average carbonation. A world class beer, complex well balanced flavours, despite 11.3% ABV the alcohol is not noticeable. A lot of yeast sediment in the bottle that I like to pour all in from the beginning with this particular beer, as I think it enhanced the flavour. Great also paired with cheese, chocolate and grilled meat dishes.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, sehr fruchtig, reife Früchte, alkoholisch. Geschmack stark fruchtig, dunkle überreife Früchte, leicht röstmalzig, alkoholisch.

This pours murky and brown with a fat head of khaki creamy foam. A nose of luscious caramel, touch of booze and a bit of raisin and fig. A bit of sweet chocolate on the nose and soft peat. The taste is generous with malt sweetness. Luscious caramel, molasses, raisin, fig and and earthiness that isnt any dark malt flavor like coffee or chocolate. it;s soft. Mouthfeel is full but drinks lightly with plenty of carbonation to tickle. A mysterious drying. At some point in the beer the palate has become dry and you are left to wonder why. Sweetness from alcohol and a bit of alcohol dryness in the finish. 

Wonderful.

Herbal aroma, strong ale notes. Dark Brown color with a good and tasty foam. Light to medium body, raisin and fruit sweet flavors combine with the alcoholic beer. Medium end make me want 2 more bottles
Une bière de caractère sont seul défaut larôme assez fort qui prends le dessus sur le goût.

Amazing should be all this beer needs for a review, if you like belgian beers then just get around this beer! Ignore the alc%, you won notice it as the brewer has hidden it behind all the flavour in this beer.

Bottle. So this is what the good stuff tastes like. Well, I suppose so... Either I got an old bottle or I dont have a sophisticated enough palate. Pours hazy brown-lots of sediment at the bottom-with a creamy head that diminishes quickly to a thin ring that leaves no lacing. Aroma of bread and caramel. Medium to heavy sweet and lightly bitter. Average to soft carbonation, light body, oily texture and a lightly bitter and sticky sweet finish.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown. A truly delicious and complex beer. Sweet fruit and nutty flavors. The alcohol adds a nice warming effect. Worthy of the high rating.
One of my favorite ABT, well balanced beer, Orchard of fruits and nut maybe cherry... Will stay in my top 10 ABT !!!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle pours dark cloudy red-brown with thin head. Nose is fruity plum, fig, raisin, dark bread, nuts. Taste is rich creamy dark fruits, fig, plum, bread, cracker, grape. Finish is mildly bitter fruit and subtle grainy bread. Extremely smooth. Great.

Nice vinous aroma, sugary taste with dark fruit and toffee notes. Overall very tasty and enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Schiuma beige, abbastanza fine. Colore marrone scuro con riflessi rosso rubino. Aroma intenso e abbastanza persistente: liquoroso, speziato, liquirizia, frutta secca, cioccolato. Gusto intenso e persistente dove si ritrovano i sentori speziati (pepe), di liquirizia, frutta candita sotto spirito, cioccolato, malto (onnipresente).... Il tutto in continua evoluzione e sempre meravigliosamente bilanciato. 11.3 %di vol e non sentirli!
Aroma of ripe plums, peppermint candycane, syrup, bread, and caramel. Dry taste of brandy, caramel and black currants. Aftertaste of brandy and blood orange zest. Strong alcohol taste.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2014 Alcohol content as high as 11.3%, this beer is a taste that does not feel it. Also has a taste to become the habit about drinking fragrance if you drink in the complex, it is a great beer to drink beer enthusiasts prefer also makes sense.
330ml bottle. Pale brown with lasting beige head. Amazing aroma with raisins, yeast, dark fruitws and dark bitter chocolate. Taste is surprislingly fresh candy sugar and yeast. Excellent!

UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Pours a dark brown with thick light brown head and some sediment. Has a strong yeast aroma with some wheat and hard alcohol. A very hard dark alcohol flavor with heavy yeast, wheat, dark sweet fruits (prunes) and finishes with malts and whiskey/rum.
This is an almost perfect trappist to me. Very rich palate and a complex taste. A strong beer, but youre not drinking an alcohol bomb.

Bottle cotteridge wines. Good black colour great beige head and lacing. Aroma is dark fruits rasins plums etc. Taste is dark fruity good malts nice bitter finish some alcohol but not overpowering like a lot of high abv drinks well balanced. Nice full body and mouthfeel quite stong carbonated. V good.
UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 Definately my favorite!! Perfect dark beer, with a perfect pallet! I just ran out of words to describe this beer..
Fantastisk Øl man kan få kjøpt på "polet" i Norge. Prøv denne gjerne ved siden av mørk sjokolade

Heerlijke trappist in mijn ogen de lekkerste belgische trappist.
Vol van smaak en heerlijk afdronk

Bottle. Pours hazy dark with a large tan head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of bread, dark fruit, raisins, custard, herbs, spices. Taste is warming (alcohol), brown sugar and honey sweetness, dark fruit and spices. Lots going on. Smooth mouthfeel, long lingering taste. Perhaps a bit too much alcohol.

Complex with aromas of dry fruits (dry plums), roast, caramel, spice (especially nutmeg), licorice and citrus (it reminded me of citrus mirtyfolia, an orange-like fruit widely used for chinotto soft drink). Sweet at first, with over medium body. Interesting, but I couldnt appreciate this beer style: even though it mellowed while in the glass, for me the alcohol was just too strong (over 11%) and I found the beer very unbalanced. Im used to drinking wine (a lot), but the alcohol here really stands out and lingers for a while in the back of the mouth, giving a bitter sensation. It got a little better with time, but maybe its just not my style.

Pours a hazy brown with medium long lasting beige head leaving good lace and some sediment at the bottom. Aroma is dark dried fruits, plum, rasin, black currant, sweet rich maltiness, and just quite complex. Flavour is dark dried fruits, plums, rasins, black currant, rich maltiness, medium sweetness overall, faint alcohol(which is nothing for an 11.3 percent beer), caramel and dark sugars/syrups. Fantastic beer!

Pours a clear medium dark brown with a nice ice fluffy tan head. Aroma of caramel, sweet brown sugary malts, plums, raisins, black currants and a light gentle well rounded booze. Taste is brown sugar, caramel, plums, dark dried fruits, black currents and a nice smooth alcohol warming on the finish. Excellent quad that?s complex, smooth and easy to drink for such a high abv.
strong taste, the alcohol is somewhat dominating in the beginning, but the after taste is very special. rich taste.
Really not my style. The booze is much too strong for my taste, to where all I can taste is fruity alcohol.

wow, what a wonderfully complex brew this is. Poetry in a glass!

much darker that other trappist ales I recall having, it really doesnt have a strong aroma, but on tasting, a wonderful mix of senses are unleashed. It seems to hit more taste buds and areas of my tongue that other Belgian ales.

Really good, I have to be careful not to drink it too fast!

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a full off-white head. Full body with moderate carbonation. Sweet in the start with some bitter spicy notes in its finish. Licorice, brown sugar, herbs, spices, caramel and some chocolate. A very tasteful brew!

Not my type of beer, but the hype encouraged me to try. Pleasantly satisfied. Plums, grapefruit, honey, sourdough, and booze. Delicious. A little too carbonated for my taste. This might force me to try more of the Belgian styled ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color marrón oscuro, media cabeza de espuma densa y duradera. En nariz aromas a malta tostada, caramelo, frutos secos, castañas y vino de Oporto, albaricoques y roble, en boca entrada suave y maltosa con notas terrosas y a especias, el alcohol se aprecia más de lo que sería aconsejable, trago corto con retrogusto algo dulce, particularmente prefiero la nº 8 , ya que aporta similares matices con el alcohol mejor integrado y es más compleja.
Personalmente ..la mejor cuádruple del planeta...el único defecto es el exceso de sedimento...la perfección no existe! !!!!!
Nice dark beer, Full of flavor. A bitter finish. Beginning is sweet. Fine beer and tasteful.
Awesome aroma for this brew. I'm very much a IPA guy, but the berry flavor was pleasant even to me. Loved it.
Full flavored. Not overwhelming. Taste like berries but not too sweet. Not too bad.
Mooi donker zwart bier met een koffie crème kleurige schuimkraag. Smaak zoet Hoppige sterke koffie. De lekkerste Rochefort uit de lijn
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Ez az összhatás nekem még a Westvleteren 12-nél is meggyőzőbb! Tökéletes élmény ahogy átúszik a szájpadlásomon!

Dark brown pour, with small tan head, lacking in staying power. Aroma is malty and complexely spicy, side notes of caramel, cane sugar and oats. Taste is utterlu delicious, with subtle bitter notes which exceeds in strength over a couple of minutes. Very complex palate, with lotes of taste notes bombarding your mouth. Texture is oily to creamy.
Full of flavors, a bit bitter in beginning. Fast enough it is sweet and an explosion of flavours of sweet and a bit of butterscotch feeling is at the end. Fine beer and tasteful.

Sombre et mousse épaisse, ça donne déjà envie juste sortie de la bouteille... En goût, banane, fleur, poil de citron, malt , une farandole de goût de melange.. a la hauteur de sa réputation, je surkiff cette bière.. par contre il faut pas en abuser, ça cogne..
Very good, full, complex beer. Lots of dark fruits in the aroma and taste. Slightly alcoholic, but not in a bad way. This is a great sipper.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 In mijn ogen de beste trappist die er is (ja u leest het goed, beter dan de Westvleteren 12). Nog voller van smaak, meer aroma dat de WV12.Smaken van koffie, caramel, pruimen, rozijnen, donkere suiker. En die afdronk !!! Hemels en geeft een lekkere warme gloed !! Installeer je in je zetel, schenk deze uit en geniet !! Puur vakmanschap dit. Veel beter dan dit wordt het niet...

I believe that this is the perfect beer! I would guess I will never get my hands on a Westvleteren12 so I will not be able to compare it to this. Smooth and creamy and beautiful to the nose and palate. Only in the first sip from my chalice did I get even a hint of the alcohol. After that sip, it really wasnt noticeable at all. Well done by the monks at Abbaye Notre-Dame de Saint-Rémy! Bravo! Must be the holy water they use ;)

Butelka 0.3L Ciemne brunatne, mętne. Piana kremowa, średnioobfita pozostawia pierścień po sobie.
Aromat intensywny, owocowy, rodzynki, śliwki, ciemne pieczywo, dojrzałe ciemne winogrona.
W smaku śliwki w likierze, karmelki, alkohol, rodzynki, suszone owoce.
Świetne, mocno owocowe, genialnie ułożone piwo.
Alkohol mniej wyczuwalny niż w 8mce.
Genialne ale chyba Fuck Art this is Advertisement mi jeszcze bardziej smakował.
Dark and cloudy, unfiltered. Head wasn't much and didn't stick around long. Currants as the primary scent I'm getting. Very creamy mouth feel. Sweet and astringent. Interesting but not my type.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2014 Poured into Rochefort chalice. Looks very, very dark brown, almost black. Loose and bubbly cream head which lasts, including a crescendo of bubbles in the centre. Aromas of banana, brown sugar, lots of dark fruits like raisin and sultana, bit of vanilla, hint of yeast, freshly baked brown bread, sugary dried fruit. Lovely smelling. Taste- loads going on. Slight bitterness in the background, on top of which there are sugary dark fruits, dark cherries, hints of banana, maltiness, sweet toffee/caramel- almost like toffee-covered raisins, vanilla notes, hints of dark malt which become more prominent as it warms, bringing some roasty, slightly chocolatey qualities. It coats the tongue nicely but doesnt cloy, and is full bodied with a lingering finish. A truly superb beer.

Tasted during a quad comparison vs. Abt 12, Gulden Draak 9000, and Gregorious...very surprised Rochefort 10 stood out as the weakest by far, lacking depth.

Great head, hazy appearance was very nice, but plain aromas, not much cheese like the Rochefort 8. Disappointing taste.
UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 Great beer and great price at the LCBO just in case anyone is interested. Alcohol aroma is strong but not as noticeable when tasting.

"Finally ", Man Ive been on a personal quest searching everywhere I go for this magic potion. I have read very good reviews on this one, making me wont it even more. "Here we go"!, Dark frothy monster too dark to see thru glass , Caught me by surprise , thought it would be lighter. I was so overly anxious to taste it I poured it fast and started to develop a nice tan frothy head , that last . The power of this one hit me right away "Pow" alcohol , I knew one of these bad boys will do the trick. The nose was very pleasant , yeasty and for the first time Bubble gum , Yes Bubble gum sweetness , the more I drank the more me like. Great beer !!!

Formou uma espuma generosa, pouco densa e não muito persistente. Aroma levemente cítrico, um pouco doce. O paladar é realmente complexo, difícil definir todos os sabores que nota-se durante a degustação, mas percebi sabor de cravo, laranja e um toque apimentado e doce. O álcool é presente e permanece no retrogosto.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lovely nose of brown sugar, malts and a little vanilla. Dark coffee brown. Thin head. Ive had this beer quite a number of times, I just cant get over the big hit of booze, odd since Ive had lots of beers with equal or higher alcohol content. Anyway, big booze, malts some bitterness in the after taste. I know how much this beer is loved, but...

What more can be said. The best beer I've every tasted. High ABV but can't taste it. Very light flavor despite dark color. Had it in Rochefort chalice. Lots of sediment but didn't distract from enjoyment. Has all the qualities noted in other reviews. Dark, creamy, smooth, fig notes, coriander, etc

Will buy more to cellar to see if improves with age. Bottle I had was produced in Sept 12 (1.5 years)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 Poured a very deep amber into a wine glass, with a creamy head. A strong fruity smell, like raisins or figs with a deep alcohol scent pervading. The head seems to dissipate fairly quickly. A dark raisin taste almost sweet, with an alcohol aftertaste. All I taste is the raisiny fruit taste with the stinging alcohol coming in afterwards.
This beer surprised me, comes close to the WV'12. But has a bit more of a rough taste. Compared to the price/quality ratio it's better than WV'12 but on bare quality it misses a tiny bit of finesse.

This beer is a murky dark brown. Damn near black. Light only seems to get through on the edges. The head is thick, luscious, creamy and tan. This beer has a beautiful aroma. Dark fruits, dark malt and cotton candy all in the mix. And sweet cookie dough. Now this is a beer to savor. Beautiful taste as it hits the tongue. Sweet fruits meld in perfection with dark (slightly burnt?) malts and of course sugars (seemingly brown and dark candy). Barely a hint of alcohol. (And this is 11.5 a/v?) So damn smooth. And damn tasty to boot. One of the best Belgian beers Ive ever had.
Goes so nice with some cheese, dark colour, a bit sweet and rich in malt taste

Big thanks to Reggie Dunlap for throwing this in, I would never buy it on my own - too expensive for cheapie. From a bottle surprisingly dark. Rocky head fades to one half inch after a while. Pleasant slightly volatile aroma, somewhat like the smell of vanilla beans? First taste is fer sure alky like forward but perhaps more civilized in nature than most all Americana wannah beez. Some warming as it travels down the gullet toward its destination. Fairly refined for such a high alky content. Decent creamy co2 hides the overall numbing effects. Perhaps you like it that way; hiding the mind blowing effects behind a somewhat irritating belgian trappy. As the session continues it becomes more difficult to ignore the alky content behind the civilized manners. Impressed with the tremendous generosity in the trade but not impressed with the beer except to say this is much better than most American beers over 6.5%. Yea, I guess its OK for a 11 percenter. Thanks Kerry!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Eccezionale. Ogni volta che la bevo sento dei sapori nuovi. Buona apertura e permanenza, buona chiusura. Perfetta.
Se laisse déguster mais manque de piment! Trappiste devenue un peu trop commerciale et perd sont côté simple et authentique

Bottle at home. Bit of a gusher. Pours dark with an off-white head. Aroma of dark chocolate, sweet malts, caramelized sugar, dark fruits, as well as hops. 
Taste of chocolate, hints of yeast, dark fruits, bit of licorice, and nice warming alcohol in the after taste. Really good.

Dark brown/red with a small beige head.
Sweet malty aroma, red berries, black currant?
Taste is also sweet, has some leather, vinous notes, knäck. Some warming alcohol at the end.
Medium body, low carbonation
Long chocolate after taste.
Dark brown color. Cloudy. Cant see any bubbles. Small head. Aroma of brown sugar. Taste is sweet with some bitterness.
Sweet malty flavour. Spices, herbs, some dark chocolate, brown sugar and dried fruits. This is definitely one of the best.

From 12oz bottle to snifter. Pour is a black, thick but disappearing tan head. Nose is mostly dominated by alcohol, but also ,oil lasses, coffee, raisin. Taste is heavy bodied, oddly bitter and sweet. Good beer, unbelievable complexity.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a large tan head that leaves lacing. Plum and coffee but does have a slight boozy flavor. Overall quite nice
A little bit oversweet but very tasty. It's not a beer to drink a lot. Good to try without food because it's strong taste.

Excelente cerveja... Gosto bem definido com aroma forte melhor.. É uma das melhores trappistes...

-

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2015 Original: (2/8/2014) Deep roast barley aroma, molasses. Some earthy flavours with bread and yeast notes. High carbonation, big bubbles. 

New: Dark, deep ruby with a big tan head with good lacing and persistence. Aroma of soft plum and berry spice. There is an almost chocolatey berry aromatic. Flavour is big, kind of fake chocolate and berry with a burn from the alcohol level. Very Christmassy actually. Mouthfeel is thick and silky helped along by the high carbonation. Vinous, plum and berry notes become more prominent as it goes.

Amazing. Pours dark brown with a light tan semi thick head, and has a little residue which settles at the bottom. The aroma is banana nut bread, and just a little fruity. Taste is a smooth, warm flavor of love and commitment. Yep

Bottle. Dark brown pour with nice fine foamy khaki head. Aroma of dark fruit, plums, raisins. Lively mouthfeel, with a warming alcohol finish. Flavors of dark fruit, bananas, bread. Very subtle, yet complex flavors. Not sweet, not bitter.

Dark brown with some residu. Smell is banana but taste is plum, raisin black berries. Some yeast too. Complex taste but... The alcohol dominates in the finish though and takes over the experience completely by the end. The beers a little bit too strong for its own good.

As good as a beer can get, and one of the classics. Dark brown color. Great strength balanced by a complexity of flavors and firm malt backbone. The bouquet covers a wide range: port wine, leather, apricots, oak, spices
UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 Pours a very dark brown. Strong aroma of fruit and spiced yeast. Tastes of dark fruits and brown sugar. Amazing flavor that lasts. This beer is unbelievably good.

Sediment filled mahogany appearance with a medium size, off white head and decent lacing. Powerful aroma of dark fruit, spices and gingerbread. Equally complex blend of flavors, from tobacco, licorice and ripe dark fruit to molassas and caramel. Noticable, but not overpowering abv adds depth to the aftertaste. Full bodied, moderately carbonated mouthfeel with a long lasting finish. This beer is so good it gave me goosebumps and the only drawback was that it had to end.
In bottiglia. Aroma di tostato, nocciole, fruttasecca. Al palato dolcezza, frutta secca, vinosa, nota etilica evidente, calda e avvolgente. Molto complessa con molte diverse sfumatura ad ogni sorso.

so good wine taste?i love it ? Thank you for the videos and the nice photos! Food looks very delicious. Great to see the whole family enjoying the Chinese New Year celebration. Here are some photos taken at our Chinese New Year celebration with Mum
Que dire de plus ? Une classique belge, peut-être la meilleure trappiste. En vente partout :)
33cl bottle. Great beer that has quite a kick! Over 11% alcohol and stil a smooth drink! Personally I like the Bernardus Abt a little bite better, but this one is also a keep!
Cette bière de caract?re à larôme spécifique est agréable à déguster. Une seule suffira pour faire palpiter votre palais!
Hazy dark brown body with a tan head. Caramel, dark fruit, malt aroma. Taste is some spice along with the above. Carbonation medium. Leaves you with a nice warm feeling.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2014 Pours a burnt mahogany with some red embers. Head is tan and very transient. Aroma is some yeast, raisins, pear and a little bit of booze. All those notes combined resemble a slice of sweet stollen. 
Extremely smooth and silky medium body. Fairly bready with some dark fruit. Warm and dry finish. 
The complexity many speak of is perhaps indecipherable to trappist newcomers. I think its an extremely well constructed beer but lacks a defining quality.

Superb. What a quad should be. In a tasting with this, Westy 12, and Chemay Blue, this was essentially Westy 12. It's that good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle into a snifter. A dark brown pour with plenty of foamy tan head which settled into sparkling bubbles in the side of the glass. Complex nose, sweet caramel malt, cinnamon, spice, raisins, dark fruit. On the palate I get all of those flavors dancing and cascading around my tongue. A warm glow completes the experience... A truly fantastic beer, clearly one of the best.
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Pours chocolate brown. Aromas are peppery with toffee notes. Taste white pepper, dried apricot, caramel. Great finish. tremendous beer
Oh my. Simply incredible. Everything youve heard is true and then some. Picked up a single bottle for about $8 just to try it. I will plan to get more very soon!

Pours a hazy reddish brown with a thin head. Good lacing. Aromas are hard to nail down. Fruity malt and bread. Flavors of ... whew...chocolate, spice, banana and clove, biscuit and raisin. Wonderfully toasted grain flavors with dried fruit. Finishes with notes of chocolate, coffee and dried fruit. The complexities are amazing. Light and lively mouthfeel. The high alcohol content should make this beer heavier, but it is deceptively light. This is a wonderful brew.

Dark brown with an off white head. Aroma - Caramel, nuts, stewed fruit, brown sugar, hint of cinnamon spice, raisins, wood. Taste - great balance of caramel sweetness from the malt, alcohol is so well hidden considering the ABV. The bitterness is low but the balance is superb. Sticky fruits, dates, raisins and a little vanilla. Incredible beer.

Superb Trappist ale (no, this is not entirely redundant), although I have a slight preference for Rochefort 8. 

A - Pours a deep, dark brown, with a fine tan head. Effervescent

S - caramel, malts, slight alcohol, spices

T - high alcohol content is fairly well-hidden but remains readily noticeable. The high and detectable alcohol content loweers my rating is part of the reason I prefer Rochefort 8. 

(from notes: Fall 2010)
Botella 33cl en CerveZeres. Poco se puede añadir de una de las mejores cervezas del mundo. Nada que no se haya dicho ya. Simplemente excelente.

330ml bottle. Dark berries, plum, vinegar, earthy Belgian yeast, mild caramel, light toastiness. Sharp, complex flavour profile. Malt-sweet with a dry, bitter finish. Rich and boozy. Excellent, but not the world-beater I was expecting.

Quintessence of a Quad. Very dark in color with a very nice head that will stick around if you allow it. Caramel and dried fruit (apricot, plums and cherries) make up an awesomely complex taste that involves much more than described here. A finish that lasts for miles... Your eyes, nose and mouth enjoy comparable stimulation. St. Bs Abt 12. Westy12. Rochefort 10... All are world-class, but Ill take the Rochefort 10.

Drunk side to side with a Westvleteren 12.

tastes of ,raisins, blackcurrant, vanilla, bit licorice, bit caramel, bit banana. Hints of port, chocolate and cherry.
Long aftertaste of caramel, fruits and a bit of port. 
Compared to the Westvleteren 12 a shorter aftertaste and less licorice and port
A very good beer, one of the best and not too hard to get in europe.
UPDATED: MAY 7, 2014 Bottle. Pours a dark beer with slightly beige head. Aroma is caramel. Taste is caramel. A good balanced beer
Niet voor niets een van de beste bieren ter wereld. Mooie donkere kleur, schuim blijft lang staan. Smaak is intens, licht bitter, drop, rokerig, caramel. Lange afdronk, mijn favoriet.

Delad flaska, tack @msbrindbergs. Brun vätska med ljusbrunt skum som lägger sig fort. Doftar lite som mousserande vin. Ingen framträdande alkohol vilket är bra med tanke på 11.3 %vol... Saknar något i eftersmaken.
Pga av det höga betyget här är jag lite besviken samt att det inte är min typ av öl. Dock spännande och växer lite med tiden. Saknar en distinkt smak eller ton som dröjer sig kvar.
UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 Dark, almost opaque brown, not much head. Rich, dense fruitcake; tons of cinnamon, nutmeg; brandied figs. Dense, chewy, cakey. Foamy, fizzy finish.

Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle. Cloudy, medium brown with a thick, 1 inch, tan head that dissipates in a few minutes and leaves no lacing at all. The nose is complex  definitely pour this into a Trappist glass or snifter so you can enjoy this dimension of the drink. Aroma includes an immediate caramel, then bread and dark fruits (plum, raisin, berries). A light to medium sweetness that seems to evolve and express itself to varying degrees as I let it wash over my tongue. Slick feel, especially as it warms. Full body, and lighter carbonation than many Belgians. A slight stickiness on my lips  always a plus. 11.3% ABV, but Id never know that because its so well hidden. What an enjoyable ale. Dont miss this one!

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2014 pours a very dark brown with a huge fluffy beige head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is sweet with notes of bread, roast, and dark fruits. taste is sweet upfront with hints of toffee, followed by a sharp but inviting bitterness leaving lingering spicy notes. very full mouthfeel, very fizzy carbonation and a tingling sensation on the tongue. really love this beer!

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 33cl in a Trappist glass. Pours a wonderful dark colour with a thick (but short lived) head. Taste of toffee, liquorice and dried fruits. Hugely complex with a perfect mouthfeel. Very nourishing.

33cl bottle @ home. Dark brown color, strong brownish head. Aroma caramel, dark fruits, noticable alcohol, chocolate, baileys and wine notes, slight coffee. Taste light to medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sour. Full body, sticky texture, average carbonation, light bitterish sour finish. It rather feels like drinking wine not beer, and alcohol is well present therefore its not my style.

Small bottle @ Harrys 
Pours deep dark murky amber with nice low head. Aroma is malts, syrup, caramel, dark fruits. Flavor is plums, raisin, alcohol, dark malts, caramel notes, syrup notes. Swell beer! Wow.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A very dark brown beer with a large thin beige foam. Excellent lasting. Sparkling bubbles in the night. Yeast sediment at the bottom of the bottle. Fruity and floral aroma (berry, pear in the end) with spices and smoke. Spicy sweetness; bitter background; sour note. Warming beer. Nice body and texture. Long sweet finish. What can I say ? Excellent beer. A delicious dessert. A substitute for after-dinner liqueur.

Raisins, dates, plums, caramel malt. Very rich, heavy palate. It didnt really impress me compared to other quads, but I will re-rate it at some point for sure. Mine was served a bit too cold, so some complexity may have been lost.
Hazelnut, chocolate and raisens. Some caramel/ vanilla and berry fruits. Very good rounded beer

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Hint of sweet brandy, then a cider vinegar aroma. Brown, cloudy pour with small head. This bottle seemed to have a lot of solids in the bottom. Taste a bit of bitterness, port wine flavor, raisins and plum. I do not like the aroma too well but I did like the taste.The taste is complex and you can taste the alcohol but it is blended well to not be overpowering. Good beer.



2/1/14 I tried another Rochefort 10 and I believe the first time I rated this it may have been a bit old. This time it did not have the strong sour aroma and I did not see the floaters in the beer. It still had the alcohol taste but it had a sweeter, smoother taste. I liked it even better. Right there with my favorite, St. Bernardus.

Bottle, 2012 ed. Pour is murky brown, big tan head. Some retention/no lace. Aroma of dark fruit, ester, grape, earth, toffee, light chocolate, light toast. Taste is lightly tart, sweet, dark fruit, grape, earth, some warmth but no booze. 
Palate is soft, creamy, sweet finish.

Punta di diamante dello schieramento trappista. La nota alcolica poderosa sa mostrare anche un lato dolce e caldo, che spalanca le porte a una processione festosa di frutta scura, come prugne e bacche nere (ribes neri o mirtilli),e uvetta posseduta da uneuforia zuccherosa e quasi vinosa, senza abbandonarsi a tentazioni acidule. Le campane del palato suonano a festa per questa birra imperiale che scrive la storia.
best beer Ive ever had! more affordable than the W12 so good to know theres no limit to have it again! ace!
Lovely aroma, red fruits. Sweet but very well balanced, complex. Excellent mouthfeel. Dry and spicy finish. Maybe my favourite beer.

Reviewed from notes; consumed July 29, 2013; The appearance is a dark brown colored body with a two finger white foamy head that dies within thirty seconds, lacing tries to cling to the glass but slowly slides into the body. The smell is spicy yet somewhat has some sweet cherries, a little tartness comes through and some booziness. The taste is mainly spicy sweet booze, cherries become more of an undertone to the flavoring, big boozy aftertaste, and a dry spicy finish. On the palate, its about a medium to heavy, not sessionable - sipper (why am I having this at this time of year... I dunno), carbonation seems to be good for the style and good for me. Overall, wow, another booze bomb by Trappistes, I really need to stop getting these so fresh and just letting them age as Im thinking itll probably balance out eventually.

First bottle from BevMo back in the day, many times since then. Pours a deep brownish/ruby color. Wonderful nose of fig paste, plum reduction, burnt sugar, some booze, extracted Syrah. Contemplative palate with flavors of sweet raisin, more figs, warming alcohol, chocolate covered black and blue fruit, with some drying red wine character. My favorite of the Trappists.
UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 Nice taste and smell. Caramel flavours, sweet and good alcohol level. One of the best beers of the world. The best one for me.

The Famous Abbey St Remy Rochefort #10. Purchased at a beer and wine shop, not aged much. Begins with a solid but not too strong aroma of dark fruit, chocolate and caramel malt. appearance is a distinctive heavy hazy brown body with an eggshell-white fluffy head that reduces quickly but does not disappear. Flavor strength is also solid but not too strong, really just right. As other reviewers have noted, this beer really does feature a perfect level of carbonation, which among other effects keeps this beer from having too vinous a texture. Flavor is exceedingly complex as expected, malty with dark fruit notes and some roasty/burnt accents. Highlight for me is the subtle chocolate malt finish which I do not recall in the Rochefort #8 Ive previously sampled. Strong alcohol content is masked well. A pleasant long lasting cocoa finish. Savory indeed.
"Fine-tuned" is the word that comes to mind when I consider this brews keenly balanced aspects and ornate complexity. That being said, I think I recall enjoying the Rochefort #8 more than this beer, although they are similar and both are top of the line on a global scale.

Excellent beer. Abv is perfect. Head is amazing. Color is good. Low carbonation and excellent mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What to say? Nothing short of pure excellence. Smells strongly of dark fruits and a little breadiness. Taste is dark fruits, plums, raisins and figs, with hints of booze and bread. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation.

Very dark brown in colour. Very Malty (lots of chocolate, caramel, toffee, burnt sugar). Fruity (dark fruits, plums & raisins). Spicy. Yeasty (floaties and some sediment). Rich and silky smooth. Sweet malty, fruity and spicy, but quite dry. Alcohol well disguised. Dry fruity spicy malty finish. Exceedingly good. A classic. Tremendous beer!
does something magic as it slides down my gullet - dont ask what the microbes pissed out to produce this good a flavour and sensation

Very dark body with a tan head. Nice fruity nose. Starts off quite sweet and fruity before lots of liquorice flavour comes in and an increasing amount of bitterness. The alcohol is warming and fairly evident, but not overly so. Very nice but not the greatest beer Ive ever tasted.
Una quadrupel fantastica. Esplosione di sapori, tutti riconoscibili, banane, frutta liquorosa, caramello, cannella. Schiuma generosa e persistente. Una strong dark ale che ha pochi rivali.

Its much more rounded and in a sense mellower than the 8. Nicely bitter, has some great aromas, and a balanced delivery. Disappointed in the lack of head, of course, and how this appears but isnt flat. I like it, I wouldnt rave about it.

A belgian quadrupel.. What more is there to say? Pours darkbrown and murky, with an offwhite head, that quickly dissappears. The taste is a complex mix of malts, fruit and bread (?), with a nice mellow bitternes. Why I havent had the formidable beer earlier, I really cant say. Very enjoyable!

Best before August 13, 2018.
Appearance: Rochefort 10 pours a murky garnet hue, though without bright light the body appears an opaque chestnut. The head is tall and dense, forming an uneven light khaki colored head that is very persistent.
Aroma: Oh boy the aroma is huge. I get booze, butter, brown sugar, plum, grape and caramel with a very light spice to this. The aroma is huge and would match a big cheese no problem. 
Taste: The intro is very unsuspecting of the rich maltiness to follow. The intro is mild, though malty, with brown sugar hinting on the tongue. The beer picks up steam mid-way with a prominent brown sugar presence and a slight medicinal grape flavor. The finish builds further, a bit earthy with some clove, adding to the growing in boldness mid-flavors. The finish lingers for a bit of brown sugar and clove with underlying grape-soda like fruitiness.
Palate: Big and bready.
Overall: This is a phenomenal quad. I dont remember it being as fruity as this, but Ill take it. This is a standard to which other quads should be looked at. I would love this with some bold cheese.

Poured from bottle to glass. Deep dark amber brown hue with lingering fizzy off white head. Aroma is esters, sugar, plums, caramel, cloves, cola, molasses, ethanol. Mouthfeel is fantastic with medium light body and high carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout but not cloying. Cola-like astringentness in the following with a nice CO2 bite. Ethanol in the finish. Overall this is a superb Trappist brew!
Super produit! Je me fais surprendre encore... Juste assez riche et complexe pour que lalcool passe facilement et en fasse un délice. La mousse tient très longtemps.

Color : Dark Color 
Aroma : very strong aroma of dark fruits , sherry, belgian yeast , little bit of chocolate. 
Body : full and smooth Body and Carbonation		
Taste : is of vinousfruit , some alcohol taste ,very full in the mounth , caramel sherry , perfect for cold weather
Gran birra. Schiuma poco persistente. Rimane poco sulla lingua. Evidenti note di caramello. Gran palato. Da principiante gran birra, anche se con meno corpo di quello che mi aspettavo.

300 review. 330ml bottle. Pours a murky, dark ruby/caramel with an off-white, one finger head that stays forever. Lacing coating the glass. Slight sediment floating. I missed a bit of the yeast on the pour. Aroma has big notes of dark fruits and yeast with some slight candy sugar. Taste is deep and sweet but not too cloying. Notes of brown sugar, raisins and other dark fruit blended some alcohol taste, warmth and aftertaste. Medium-full body and carbonation. Very full in the mouth but not syrupy or creamy. Just really big but with a large amount of carbonation to keep it semi-drinkable. Overall this is a huge beer with a lot going on. Big aroma and flavours paired with a huge amount of mouth feel. Worth trying for sure. This bottle was fresh so Im interested in seeing how it ages. Cheers!

330 ml bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with beige head. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, dark fruit, sherry, dark chocolate and herbal hops. Body is full and smooth. Taste is of vinous fruit, caramel, sherry, brown sugar, herbal hops and warming alcohol. Finish is long and semi-dry. Wonderful, complex brew, perfect for cold weather.

Had bottled in a goblet glass. It pours as a very dark color with a tan head that dissipates slowly. The nose is very strong with aromas, with hints of sweetness, alcohol, yeast and some dried fruit. The taste is dried fruits, prunes, figs, plums and a sweet alcohol taste. It is a little lighter then I was hoping. I love this beer. I have to say this is a definite go to now. If you are looking to try something new that is strong, flavorful, aromatic and an overall great beer. Then this is the beer to try

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits, mild caramel, belgian yeast, and light spice. Smooth flavor of dark fruits, caramel, belgian yeast, roasted malts, light spice and light chocolate. Slightly bitter finish with a touch of alcohol. Very well balanced.

Backlog. Sweet sweet pleasant tones of ripe fruits, bananas, alcohol, raisins. Malty and yeasty. Taste is similar and pleasant with a warming alcohol. Definately getting my own one next time :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 I am not a beer "expert", so I don?t really know what to say about this one. Almost perfect. I love Belgium.

Rochefort Trappistes 10
Duft: sødlig, krydderier, svag citrus.
Smag. karamel. ikke lige så sød som 6 og 8. citrus, orange,

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2014 Hazy Brown with a lively, frothy, offwhite head. Aroma has dried fruit and vinous dark sugar. Flavour has Warming alcohol up front. Then comes more dried fruit and warm and complex dark sweetness. Finish is malty and boozy.
The aroma is rich but not over powering. There are hints of dates and other fruits, and Carmel. The finish leaves your palate fully indulged and begging for more. 10 is a great beer!

Appearance is creamy dark brown with a slight red hue, minimal white foam cap. Aroma is bready, woody, dark fruit, plum, raisin. Taste is a rich, smooth caramel malt, brown sugar, with dark fruit and plum. Mouthfeel is medium with decent carbonation. Slightly creamy viscosity. Finishes with rich malt and alcohol warmth.

Opaque red brown, tan head, dissipates quickly, thin rim remains; very complex aroma, sweet malts, dark fruit, brown sugar, chocolate, caramel, roasty, spruce, herbs, earthy, butterscotch, clove; round sweetbitter taste, toasty, dark fruits, some honey, raisins; full body, thick creamy texture, average carbonation; long sweetbitter finish with lingering dark fruit

Red towards brown. Nice yellow head. Whiskey, nuts and raisins in the aroma. raisins, candy with a strong mixture of alcohol and bitterness in the aftertaste. Complicated and changes as you drink more. High in carbon.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2014 Smells like red wine. Tastes like dried fruit, chocolate, Belgian yeast, oak, and alcohol. I see what all the fuss was about, this is an excellent beer.  There may be better beers than this out there, but Ive never had one.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a thick fluffy slightly off white head. Lots of different notes on the nose. Dark fruits most prominent with caramel, yeast, raisins, spices and perfume notes. Taste is very complex like the aroma. Very balanced quad. Plums, raisins, caramel, belgian yeast, bready tastes. Full bodied with a creamy and chewy mouthfeel. Incredible beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beermoth Manchester. Really excited to try this one, saved until the end of my Christmas presents! Pours a dark brown with a super long lasting head. Raisin and dark fruits on the nose. Taste is absolutely sensational; plummy, malty and warming - the carbonation tickles the palate and finishes off with very subtle, but terrific smooth bitterness. Absolutely excellent!

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2014 Surprised to see I had never rated this. Consequently, I didnt make any notes. Bottle was a few years old and had lost a little of the usual floral/parma violets elements. Lots of dark fruit, very belgian, yeasty, thick and smooth. Yum.
Another aged bottle, this time lots of treacle, caramel. Still great.

Pours a deep ruby red with a lively head that doesnt quit. Aroma notes include plum, fig, black currant, and liquorice. Taste is very fruity, with notes of plum, currant, fig, apricot, liquorice, , yeast, and a spicy finish!! This is an excellent beer, a masterpiece!

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2015 Bottles shared with co-workers...deep burgundy color,fluffy off white head..incredible aroma of plums,wine,yeast,toffee,raisins..outstanding flavor..rich,complex..great from start to finish.
Nice beer, aroma and body, strong but pretty tasty with its quadrupel fermentation. Best one I ever had

330ml de saq gardée 9 mois. Arôme riche de noisette. Couleur foncée mais pas opaque. Goût riche de fruits secs. Texture parfaitement parfaitement ronde. On ne votre pas lalcool pour 10%. Rien a redire.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle.

A- Caramel, dark fruits, roasted, spices.

A- Dark color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Balanced. Caramel, dark fruits, honey, raisins.

P- Full body, thick texture, average carbonation, smooth rich finish.

O- A wonderful quadrupel. I do prefer the 8 over the 10 but this is still a fantastic beer. Very complex.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 Poured into Trappist glass. Dark brown and murky with a creamy thin head that dissipates quickly leaving a lot of lacing in the glass as well. Aroma is dark fruits and much more alcohol scent than the 8. Taste is slightly more bitter than the 8 but has a nice long finish. Flavors of Wood and something sweet like plum with some malt as well. Warms up nicely and still tastes great, definitely more alcohol undertones. Excellent Quad/ABT. I may be one of few that prefers the 8 over this one though.
Bottle to chalice. Deep dark ruby reddish brown. Aroma of candy sugar and yeast. Taste is super complex dark fruity flavors. Prickly carbonation.

At first glance, it doesnt look like much. The body is a dull brown. The only thing thats worth noticing is the lively carbonation and the unbelievably retentive head. Then, you smell it. Lots of raisin and traces of other dark fruit mixed with booze. The real miracle is in drinking, though. Fruity, lively, softly grainy, and dry. A remarkable Trappist beer that has stood the test of time and achieved greatness.

Bottle nice dark brown body with tan not very long lasting head, aroma is dried fruits belgium yeasts some caramell, taste is caramell with wine, aftertaste is a little bit bitter with some hints of sourness, nice one

33cl Bottle at home. Brown pour with a tan head. Aroma - dark fruits, sweet malts a touch of caramel. The aromas come though in the taste a very complex beer. The high abv is without notice. Very enjoyable. N

Caramel, dark fruits, honey, some green apple in the aroma. Very pleasant!
Rather sweet in taste. Very light bitterness, 
Some warmth from the alcohol alcohol. Really nice!

Aroma: honey, dark fruits. Appearance: very dark brown, small brownish head. Taste: quite sweet, but still very pleasant. Palate: some alcohol, malts turning very, very lightly bitter. Overall: amazing Quadrupel, lives up to the reputation. Bottle from Wittich Weine, Switzerland.

Originally rated on 25/12/2013 as Christmas 2013 Belgian Quads Parallel Tasting" - Part 1 of 3

330 ml bottle bought at CitySuper in Harbor City, Tsim Sha Tsui.

Preparation: bottle maintained at ambient temperature of 10°C - 12°C overnight; Popped at 13.9°C (within recommended temperature range) onto the Chimay chalice.

Looks: Translucent deep brown colour with lots of dirt-like yeast sediments; One finger head and light beige foam which lasts for about 2 minutes; Very good sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant raisin, plum, dark fruit and port wine which can be smelt as soon as it was popped and half a foot away, with whiskey, wood, light musty, faint alcohol and light sugar.

Taste: A bliss of flavours, started out with warming alcohol and sugar, followed by malt with strong plum, assorted dark fruits, strong whiskey, brandy, Bel yeast, light spices, faint bubblegum, strong liquorices, lime and light grass. Some taste!

Body: Close to medium, watery and strong alcoholic palate.

Mouth Feel: the first few sips with light alcohol and sugar come first. Subsequently the whiskey, brandy and liquor taste takes over and the booze starts to roar with the dark fruits and woody barrel sweetness come through. Full malt and yeast stayed in the background.

Booze: It has all the nice liquor character, and the 11.3% booze start to lay waste like Godzilla midway through the session, so gotta sip carefully!

Hoppiness: Very muted grassy nose, strong bitter lime, light spice and muted grass to taste. Liquorices is strong with initial sips, but was overwhelmed by the booze thereafter for brandy-like astringent finish.

After Taste: Barely dry, boozy and sweet to mouth.

Comments: Finally got the chance to taste this one. I must say the 10 is the only Rochefort that deserves the Trappist name: it is boozy as usual, much more so than 8 and 6, but it was backed up with very nice whiskey and brandy warmth with some barrel aged woodiness. While its dark fruit, spice and other tastes are a bit light, its still very nice. A nice hard liquor disguised as beer, it will please many who like something hard-edged as well as crafty. I appreciate the 10 for its complexity, yet out of the best 3 Belgian Quads (Rochefort 10, St. Bernardus 12, and Westvletren XII), this is the least convincing.

Bottle (somewhat fresh I assume) from LCBO. Aroma is beautifully balanced here, plum, dark cherry, brown sugar, prune. Love this ones aroma. Very long lasting fluffy brown head, hazy dark brown. Beautiful flavor on this one as well, candi sugar comes through along with the bouquet of dried fruit and a sweet finish. Alcohol is noticeable but well integrated. Would love to see what age does to this. Medium bodied/high carbonation. Very good beer.

330 mL bottle. Pours a dark prune colour with an endless beige head of champagne like bubbles. Aromas of over ripe stone fruit, plum, date, dark brown sugar, bubble gum and spicy yeast phenols. Dry and boozy, with a spicy alcohol kick and a hint of hop bitterness and yeast tartness. Full bodied but light on the palate. Seems mildly disjointed; enjoyed the 8 a lot more. Grabbed another bottle to age.

$7 for 33cl @ hucks in spokane, WA.
Poured to NB globe.

A: Pours a dark maple brown. Two finger acorn head dissipates to thick comforter of fine, thick foam. This foam quilt sticks around permanently. Loose lacing.

S: Mixtures of molasses, brown sugar, nougat, malts, grain, earthy and noble hops. Hints of butter. This opens up and retains beautifully throughout the life. On the second tasting Ive done, this beer had a lovely buttered toast tone to it.

T: Earth, malt, molasses, warmth (ABV), sweetness constantly beaten back by low bittering. This beer doesnt hide the alcohol as I would expect for such renowned a brewery. 

M: heavy body, decent carbonation. Leaves the palate quite slick. 

D: Good beer. Dont see how this is in the top ten on BA right now. Its not in my top ten. I do love quads, but this one is not the cream of the crop.

Serving type: bottle

04-15-2011
Hazelnut, chocolate and strawberries. Some caramel, rum, vanilla and dark fruits. Extremely easy to drink for a 11.3% abv beer. Ridiculously good. There is black magic in this. A favourite.

(330ml bottle from LCBO, not aged) Pours a very deep reddish brown, a bunch of dark sediment, off-white moderate cap of tight froth, ring lingers with lots of lace. Aroma has lots of raisin, bit of plum/prune, definitely other dark fruit mixed in. Theres also a fair amount of brown sugar malt sweetness and some yeasty dark bread. The aroma is nice, but the real joy of the beer is on the tongue - black current jam, dark plums, caramel, sweet at first, bitter from the middle on with some yeasty character, a little nutty, still a very concentrated fruit/malt core - a little wine-like. Carbonation is fairly soft but quite active, cuts the rich plate and keeps balance. Some warmth from the alcohol, but not boozy. There is really a lot to this beer even by complex beer standards, but it is fantastically balanced. I havent had a good-condition St Bernardus in a while but this is better than I remember it being. Lovely.
Thick brown with tan head, aromas of toffee, malt, sugar, and yeast. Smooth mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Really nice.highly recommended

Brown pour with a tan head. Aroma - dark fruits, sweet malts a touch of caramel. The aromas come though in the taste a very complex beer. The high abv is without notice. Very enjoyable but Westy12 wins in my books.

$8 11.2oz bottle from Three Blind Mice in Mt. Clemens, Michigan poured into a tulip glass.

Appearance: A brown sort of color with a decent haze to it. Quite a bit of sediment. A little head. Basically no lacing.

Smell: Plum/raisin is definitely the most significant aroma. Quite sweet. A lot of caramel malts.

Taste/feel: Pretty much heaven. The 11.3% is invisible in the taste/aroma, but you get the warmth. You know its there. Just a wallop of dark fruits and some caramel malts... a pure joy to drink. A nice feel with a solid carbonation. When Rochefort 10 feels like its getting a bit too sweet, the carbonation bubbles it away. Never syrupy thick or cloying in anyway. A delight to drink. I feel like I may prefer St. Bernardus 12 to this by a slight margin, but this is still a World Class Quad without a doubt.
Cerveza trapense con cuerpo y sabor, color tostada con buen estilo trapense y sabor fuerte
Bottle. Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, and caramel notes. Medium body with notes of raisins, caramel, and a nice full malt body with a smooth alcohol finish.

Shared 12 oz. bottle at Johns Buffet-Restaurant & Tavern, in Winfield, IL., Poured to fluted glassware showing a cloudy brown color, with a nice layer of tan froth, and presentable lacing. The nose was brown sugar sweet, smooth malt, raisin, and plum/prune. Moderately bitter, the taste also offered toffee & caramel notes to this medium to full bodied brew. Quite sweet, but an excellent dessert course.

Bottle shared pours darkish brown with off white head that just lingers and holds to the glass. The aroma is sweet malts and dark fruits figs raisins plums and or dark cherries. The flavor is soooooo smooooth. Just a lot of the sweet malt and those dark fruits aged to perfection. Does this rival Westy XII? I think so very good and just plain delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 Wow this is immense! I dont know if words can quite do its complexity justice. Flavours are of spiced dark dried fruit, plums and blackcurrants initially which linger and last throughout as the bready bitter yeast comes through. Various aspects of the flavour come to the fore and fade throughout. This really is one of the greatest beers I have drank.
Heerlijke aroma! Vol, zwaar bier met beetje koffie/chocola. Wel tikkeltje teveel alcoholsmaak.

Something special for my 100th rating. 0,33L bottle, BB 08.2018. Pours very dark brown with big light tan head. The head stays for a long time. Strong aroma of caramel, bread, sweetness, raisins, phenols. Taste: fruits, malt, sweetness, slight sourness, caramel are the most obvious ones. Finish has mild bitterness. Alcohol is noticeable, but not distracting. The same goes about sweetness, bitterness etc.  they are all there, but nothing is too dominating. This is really well balanced beer. Lively carbonation. Overall: it may not be my favorite beer, but its impossible to deny that this is really great beer.

330ml bottle from Les Crepes de Sophie, Shrewsbury. One of those beers I havent had in a while, at least since I joined this site so Im cracking one open for a rating. Forgot how lusciously sweet and fruity that aroma is.. taste is strong, dark molasses, raisins, rich yeast, dark treacle, caramel.. exceptional depth but the 11.3% ABV gets a bit much and lacks the sweeter, almost floral aspects of St Bernardus 12. That said, this is still an incredible beer.
delicioso y espectacular elixir Trapense ,de las mejores del Mundo sin duda

Shared with Rock_Buffalo. A strong, impressive beer with a dark colour, fruits of the forest aromas and complex taste of an earthen, currant-esque flavour. Pours dark brown with a large tan head. Smells strongly of dark fruits and a little breadiness. Taste is dark fruits, plums, raisins and figs, with hints of booze and bread. Aroma: excellent sweet aroma between fruitiness and belgian sugars

Taste: great fruity taste that fills your mouth on first sip....caramel and toffee notes with nice sugar sweetness and smooth alcohol finishing

Brown sugar, caramel, plums, raisins and some spiciness from the yeast, rich and complex yet smooth and while it doesnt hide the alcohol it isnt dominated by the alcohol either. Simply a fantastic beer.

Trying my first 100/100 beer, expectations are high. Pours dark, hazy brown with a light brown head. The aroma ist not as massive as expected. Caramel and dried fruits. The first mouthful is overwhelming: very rich fruits, dried plum, nuts and caramel. Then developing a complex bitterness, hiding the massive alcohol. Perfect beer for a cold winter night at the fireside. Needs some more tasting to find all the notes and aromas.

Bottle from drink shop.
Pours dark orange-brown with a thick bege head that thins out but never really goes away. Beautiful. Aroma was pretty faint, but I could make out yeast, alcohol and rasins. Taste... Heavenly. Strong alcohol with yeast, rasins and something I cant quite make out. A very interesting and complex beer. Will probably rerate it after my palate improves.

Top notch, this is a special beer that even with the vast volume that they pump out keeps on being good, great and excellent

This is absolutely the best beer that I have tasted to date. If I were to describe out complex, balanced, and smooth a quadrup from Belgium should be - this nails it. I loved the coffee, toffee, dark fruit, flavored that never became sweet or syrupy. The finish stays pure and balanced too. Great value too.

 b) MHD 27.07.2016 
Direkter "Gegentest" zum Westvleteren 12 (welches im direkten Vergleich um Längen schlechter (!) abgeschnitten hat!! 

Also: fruchtig-vollmundiger Antrunk, die 11,3% sind zu keiner Zeit direkt spürbar. Samtig-weich. Zum Hauptteil kommen tolle Aromen von dunklen Trockenpflaumen und roten Kirchen hervor, dazu eine angenehme Kräuternote - alles Aromen, die mir beim Westvleteren 12 fehlen. Leicht dickflüssig. 
Der Nachgeschmack ist fein-herb, aber deutlich milder als beim Westvleteren 12, dafür um einiges aromatischer und bei weitem nicht so klebrig süß. Toll ausgewogen, so dass die Aromen dunkler Früchte noch lange auf der Zunge zurückbleiben. 

--> Ein ganz hervorragendes Bier! Absolute Spitzenklasse in seiner Kategorie!

Simply amazing! One of the best beer of his type ive ever drink! Perfect with meat and cheese

2 year old bottle. Sweet. Into a Westvleteren goblet.

A: Very dark mahogany with a fluffy, and everlasting, creme colored head. Good legs.

N: Malt, sweet bread, prune, raisin, and currant. Clove. This is very deep and very rich. 

T: Hefty malty sweetness that never becomes cloying.Theres a touch of bitterness and pounds of dark fruits.

M: Sticky and hefty. Bread in a glass. Alcohol is very well hidden. Sometimes I get bottles that are a touchy watery, but this one is sublime.

O: So good. A classic of the style and worth every penny,

From bottle. Dark pour. No head. Good lacing. Sweet without being cloying. Dark fruit balanced with more mild yeast presence.

(Bue à la suite dune Rochefort 8 pour la beauté de la chose) - Bière brune opaque aux reflets rubis, ornée dun col de mousse moyen de couleur crème. Le nez est sucré et épicé, comme les effluves dun gâteau qui est en train de cuire peuvent lêtre. On bave comme les chiens de Pavlov. On bave comme des chiens, peu importe à qui ils appartiennent. Lalcool (11.3%) ne perce étrangement pas jusquà mes narines. Laissons la bière se réchauffer un peu avant de goûter. En bouche, lenvoûtement est rapide. Inutile de résister. Je bois une bière carrément dans la même veine que la Rochefort 8, mais avec des intentions plus concentrées, des idées plus cochonnes. Cest bon de A à Z, en passant par le D, le P et même le Q! Si cette bière est un piège pour les papilles faciles, alors je suis réellement tombé dans la «Trappe»...
Krachtig biertje 11.3%. Lekkere smaak; vleugje caramel, koffie. Wel veel bubbels. Aanrader!
Krachtige smaak met een vleug caramel, iets te veel bubbels voor mij persoonlijk. Rochefort 8 vond ik beter met een subtielere smaak
Peut être la meilleure des trappistes ! Bière quasi parfaite, profonde, complexe, pleine de saveurs. Un incontournable.

Very good beer, candisugar, dark malts, plums, rasins, dark fruits etc... Perfect mouthfeel, incredibly nice.

Aroma is phenomenal. Nice lacing, ruby brown appearance. Nice dark fruit flavors. Alcohol overwelms the palate. Drinks like a cordial. Very nice but just a little too boozy for me.

Big Beer Tasting at The Brownstone, Round Two: 11.2 fl. oz. bottle. Hueless dark brown, lasting creamy foamy tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, sweet spiced malt and yeast. Silky smooth dark fruit taste, plum, figs and raisins, mildly roasted sweet caramel malt, some black licorice. Soft carbonation, full bodied, lightly hopped. ABV is very well hidden, slightly vinous finish. Amazing stuff. DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys) Interesting pairing with a "Stuffing" waffle, foigras maple syrup, green beans and carrots.

Couleur assez sombre, comme du coca. Nez expressif, sur le cacao, le caramel, les fruits cuits (prunes, fruits rouges), le raisin sec et une pointe dépice. Entrée en bouche très vive, explosive, très fruitée, compotée, puissante, un peu sucrée, puis ça retombe sur la fin de bouche. La finale est un peu courte.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 Bottle 0,33ltr: Dark brown coloured brew with an wonderful sweet bitter taste and hints of dark fruits, chocolate, vanilla, brandywine. This one finally rated for Ratebeer, but drunk it years ago before i become an Ratebearian and many of those pre-Ratebeer beer will follow.

Cache étonnement bien son alcool : cest une bière vraiment très bien brassée! Ça goüte les fruits agés, les bleuets cuits.
