Bravo.
Sophisticated taste and aroma for the true beer lover. Absolutely delicious and well worth the price.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2013 So here?s the deal, for a trappiste beer this is solid, real solid. Very fruity almost floral aroma, pours a beautiful dark unfiltered brown with a thick creamy head that dissipates slowly. Strong taste of fruits and sweet maltiness blended with an obvious presence of its alcohol. That all said its not a 4plus for me b/c its not my style of choice. Great in its own right and Ill try any beverage at least once...but for me, this?ll be few and far on the seconds.

Rochefort Trappistes 10 has a thin-to-medium, soapy, cream-colored head, a caramel-brown, bubbly, opaque appearance, with lots of brown chunks suspended throughout, and thin lacing left behind. The aroma is rich: very sweet malt, figs, dates, candi sugar, grain husk, and brandy wine. Taste is of those elements, with an overriding fruitcake note and a significant alcohol backing. Bitterness is low but present. Mouthfeel is heavy, cloying, brandy-like, and highly prickly. Rochefort Trappistes 10 finishes sweet, dry, rich, and boozy. Overall, this is a wonderful, world-class beer! RJT

Dark brown and slightly hazy, big fizzy off-white head that sticks around for quite a while. Robust but smooth malty aroma, notes of molasses, dark fruit, banana bread and herbs. The taste is big and sweet yet restrained somehow. Alcohol, liquorish, cough medicine, chocolate, dried fruit and black currant all politely vie for your attention. Medium carbonation with lots of tiny bubbles and a big mouthfeel. Its been a while since I drank this last, but as I recall I liked quite a bit better then. Still wonderful of course.

330ml bottle. Lives up to the hype and then some! Awesome dark fruit, raisin, plum and booze in the aroma and taste. Plenty of body in the mouth-feel and the finish is perfection. It just doesnt get much better than this!

I had this at Global Brew. Pours brown with off white head. Taste plum, black cherry, sweet. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

Bottle from The Dram Shop, Sheffield. Chestnut brown, with an off white, thin, lasting head. Aroma is sweet and dark, akin to chestnut honey. Some dark, dried fruit. Taste has an initial, brown sugar sweetness, which gives way to a vinous, slightly tart, dryness. Lovely, soft, warming mouthfeel. Finish is sweet to start, with a lingering, dark cherry, tart, dry end. Very good.

33cl bottle. Black color, brown-white head. Very fresh aroma, chocolate, toffee, ripe fruits. Taste is highly complex, starts sweet and quickly turns to a wine-like mouthfeeling with dominating ethanol notes. After a while notes of plum, chocolate and black currant appear. Love it.

aroma, taste, apperance, all is great. but this is a style i do not like. the suggerness and ripe plum taste is not something i like in a beer. over all best trappist i tasted, but im not a good judge , because i do not like this style.

Dark brown or caramel colour. thin head, aroma of alcohol, caramel, butterscotch, vanilla, dried fruits. Complex aroma. Taste of alcohol, sweet notes with bitter finish. Very strong and aromatic beer. Great beer, realy enjoyed this one!

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2015 Pours from bottle a hazy brown with a big beige head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of fruits and caramel. Flavor is sweet with dried fruits and caramel and some smoky overtones as well. This is a rich and complex brew. One of the nicest ever.

Bottle. Pours dark red/brown color, beige head. Aroma of plums, dark berries, sugar, alcohol, hints of honey. Taste is spicy, honey, alcohol, tangerines, wood, wine, medium sweet. Lot of alcohol in finish, medium sweet, warming.

The n 1 for me in the world. better than westvleteren XII. Great taste complexity, pepper, little cocoa, coffee, caramel. Great palate persistence. Simply the best. Combined with a great beer braised, or a dark chocolate just 90% cocoa.

Its really great! Dark hazy brown color, mid-sized beige head. Rich aroma of fruits , spices and liqueur. Taste of fruits , raisin , chocolate, little alcohol. Cognac in aftertaste. Wonderful but not for everyday)).

My #1 beer. Dark brown cloudy pour with pretty fast dissipating tan head. Smell of dried fruits, caramel, burnt sugar, sweet chocolate, i get blue cheese in there but that might just be me, cherries and much much more. Taste follows the nose with dried fruits like dates, raisins and tutti frutti. Sweet dark malts chocolate, but the dried fruits........ooh you divine dried fruits. Thick full bodied mouth smacking sweet mouthfeel. This is a beer that shows love for the art of brewing. 5 outta 5. If you havent yet, go get it, you wont be dissapointed.

Unreal. Pours a dreamy, deep dark brown with lively, quickly vanishing khaki head. Roasty aroma of caramel, booze, and Belgian yeast. Bread, dark fruit, caramel. Perfect amount of alcohol on the tongue. More yeast. Incredibly smooth. Warm. Absolutely top notch.

In my opinion better as the Westvleteren XII when drinking those beers young. After aging for years, I will prefere the Westvleteren. I especially love quadruple, and this one is already for a looong time one of my favourites.
Dark brown pour with medium sized offwhite head that quickly diminishes. Substantial amount of particles. Fresh malty aroma with underlying hoppy notes. some alchool

Aroma: Caramel, orange, butterscotch, raisins, bubble gum, dates. A remarkable complexity. An exceptional sustain of aromas. One small negative; a bit too much alcohol.
Appearance: Brown, full of yeast particles, extremely hazy, thick sparkling head that doesnt stay long. No lacing.
Taste: Caramel identifies itself very rapidly at first taste; after that, related flavors such as raisins, dates, brown sugar, figs, are showing up, wrapped up by a warm alcohol feel. A little floral bitterness is crowning the finish. Mouth feel is round, syrupy and with a lot of body. Balance is perfect. Hops are well dosed. An exceptional beer. A masterpiece of the brewing art. My general appreciation of this beer is 19 out of 20 because I dont know if its the best beer in the world, but its certainly the best one I tasted up to date. Un délice à chaque gorgée.
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2014 Arated, foamy, turbid. roasted olives. Amazing complex taste but sweetness is a bit too much

perfect color with a small-sized head, just how I like it. Has almost no smell and the smell there is, is a bit salmiak aroma, not my cup of tea. Smells good, lots of carbonation and alcohol taste, however not very rich. Good beer.

330ml bottle die bierkoning amsterdam. Pours toasty brown with medium carbonation.instant flavour and nose sweetmalt caramel sugars. Roasty, soy cloudy goodness. Strong abv but carried very well and perfect for autumn in Amsterdam

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 (bottle 0,33l) (2.11.2013)
Spicy, herbs, light fruity, later dried fruit, sweet, light caramel, malty aroma. Very complex aroma. Cloudy brown color. Medium, long lasting, brown head. Very sweet, strong spicy, light berry/dried fruit taste. Full body. Sticky texture. Spicy, light sweet, light dry, light warm finish. That is truly one of the best. (9.5.8.5..17=4.4) 
(bottle 0,33l) (24.12.2016)
Aroma: Fruity, dark fruits, chocolate, light alcohol, cherry, berries.
Appearance: Hazy dark brown color. Long lasting, beige head.
Taste: Medium sweet, dark fruits, light alcohol, light bitter.
Palate: Full body. Alcohol warm, light bitter finish.
Overall: Good, strong, fruity. (8.4.8.4..16=4.0)

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Clear dark brown with a good, long-lasting off-white head. High carbonation. Aromas are plums, leather, cigars, burnt sugar. Taste has big sweetness, rich mouthfeel, woody and vinous notes. Some creaminess in the texture. Bitterness comes in the end. Very good.

Superbe couleur sombre, nez puissant et complexe, avec des notes de raisins et de fruits rouges, peu damertume, mais un équilibre dans les goûts assez remarquable. Cette bière se déguste comme un bon vin. Le degré assez élevé dalcool met en exergue les saveurs. Lune de mes bières belges préférées.

Pours dark with nice head. Nose is raisins or grapes, dried fruits, boozy, a little winey. Tastes of dried fruits, raisin, malty sweetness, almost a vanilla taste on the finish. Very complex. Well carbonated, somewhat boozy. Much different from the St. Bernardus/Westy. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 26, 2015 Update: Very dark brown with big creamy beige head. Strong lacing and some nice bubbles, looks really good. Plums, raisins, strong raspberries, bananabread, apricots, brown sugar, molasses. Some boozy rum and cognac notes. Very sweet with boozy finish. Full bodied with creamy feel and light alcohol burn. Incridibly complex, theres something new with every sip. &&&&&&& Original rating: I dont believe in perfection, but this comes close. Slightly boozy, but the amazing aroma and taste and the palate that stays fantastic even after half an hour are world class.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with medium sized offwhite head that quickly diminishes. Substantial amount of particles. Fresh malty aroma with underlying hoppy notes. Smooth round taste with very little trace of the alcohol. Fizzy carbonation. A smooth composition with a long nice finish.

Mouth feel is awesome. Taste of raisins. Head doesn't last (drank at 45 degrees in a tulip). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Huge beer, one of, if not the best in the world. Ridiculously good. Aromas of dried fruits. Sweet but very balanced. High carbonation, in this one. A fresh one, becomes even better with some aging. 

--- Rated by Victor
Deep hazy brown. Nice cinnamon aroma. Beer is sweet and warming, Definitely a favorite of mine.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2016 Looks awesome, perfect color with a small-sized head, just how I like it. Has almost no smell and the smell there is, is a bit salmiak aroma, not my cup of tea. Smells good, lots of carbonation and alcohol taste, however not very rich. Good beer.

Edit: Rated lower after the supermarket-beer-tasting with Rik 13/8/16. Herby taste, some chocolate, raisin, pretty complex. Best supermarket beer, but not as good as I thought. Just doesnt taste THAT good.
En klassiker. Meget sødme fra alkoholen. Lidt for stærk. God blød snag med gid frugtig eftersmag. Ok øl men ingen favorit...

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2015 Bottle 33 cl. 
Dark, almost black hazy pour, small tan head. 
Minor nose, taste is sweet with plum and honey. 
Heavy body, but smooth despite the High alcohol content.
Soft carbonation.

Bottle..Pour is a dark brown with a nice off white head..Nose is spices, plum, alcohol, dark fruit, granola...Taste is plums, fig, dark fruit, spice, light sweetness, raisin caramel, alcohol is hidden,

Nez puissant, mousse assez importante et persistante, léger goût caramélisé. Peu amère, superbe couleur brun sombre opaque, bulles fines et en faible quantité. Superbe bière dapéritif, une des meilleures bières au monde, dont la popularité na pas altéré la qualité, contrairement à une Chimay bleue par exemple.
Essensen af god øl. Lidt stærk midt på dagen, men det er vel et mindre problem:......................
This foamed out a little bit when I opened it. I thought it had really good dark fruit flavors but overall not really for me. Still really good though.
Holy crap, this is like Chimay Blue squared! It is just amazing in every way.

As you can read below...this beer just goes down easy. Im trying to figure out how to clone it as a homebrew. But the sweetness and aroma are on point. I wish there was something better to compeer it too...but there isnt.
Dark brown. Aroma of cinnamon toast with butter, lightly roasted coffee. Perfect taste. Sweet and balanced. Thoroughly warming finish. A rare treat.

Dark colored ale with plum taste. Strong alcohol content. Could handle one or two but not much more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours nearly opaque prune-juice brown with a fine off-white head that fades rapidly to a rim and coating. Leaves killer fine-bubbled lacing. Aroma is honey-caramel and darkfruit with a mildly boozy undercurrent. Taste is wonderfully deep and complex. Subtle carbonation lends to a very pleasant crisp but warming mouthfeel. Raisins, plums, nuts, black cherries upfront, followed by well-integrated hops. Roasted malt and brown sugar. Just a touch of booze, but the 11.3 is incredibly well-disguised in the sip. This is a beer crafted with purpose and expertise that deserves its acclaim. Still, a luxury by price. If you like Belgians, you must try it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle 330ml. dark brown color with small head. aroma of fruits, caramel and spices. flavor is yeast, raisin and hints of honey. nice warmth from alcohol. without a doubt its a great beer.

33 cl bottle, 11.3%. Pours dark brown, with a massive expansive beige head. Lots of wine on the nose. Aroma is mildly fruity, with grapes, wine, dark malts, raisins, brown sugar, licorice, earthy yeast. Taste has a nice play between an initial intense sweetness and the final winey bitterness. Full bodied, carbonated, alcohol is there and it burns on this impressive 11.3, but it does not cover the complexity and could be said being around 8%.
This one is hell of a beer, massive, rock solid and well balanced.

bottle. dark brown, caramel color. cloudy with quite big sediments of yeast at the bottom of the glass. rather thin head that shrinks fast. aromas of alcohol, caramel, butterscotch, mature cheese, vanilla, raisins, yeast, wet wood, hints of rosemary and resin, dried fruits, liquorice. very round and complex aroma. oily/silky palate. taste of alcohol, rum/whiskey, malt, tobacco, wood, liquorice, sweet, sour, slightly bitter finish. medium carbonation. very strong, complex and aromatic beer with intense flavors!

The Rochefort Trappistes 10 pours a very dark brown to nearly black with a bubbly light tan head that lasts forever and leaves thick lacing. The aroma is raisin, plumb and dark fruit. The flavor is complex, full of dark fruits. The high ABV is hidden very well in the beer. Overall this beer is delicious.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 For me this is one of the best beers worldwide. The aroma is really (especially just after opening the bottle) amazing and the full body taste and malty aftertaste are from an exceptional quality.

Well another example of beer that leaves me speechless. Just love the color and how long stayed the head, its there forever. Where sharing a bottle, so each of us got some 100ml. Plenty cause its so dense and full. Want to come back to this rating after some years when I,m older. Impressive.

2013.10 - fles 33cl - donkerbruin bier met een ietwat rode glans, lichtbeige stabiele schuimkraag - neus : fruit, heel veel rozijntjes - smaak : peper (bijt je vast in de mond net als peper doet), vol en rijk van smaak, fruitig

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2015 Bottle 330ml @ home. Celebrating my 100th review on RateBeer in style! Pours dark brown with nice firm medium sized head. Aroma is nice and complex. Contains of raisins and dried fruit. And a lot I?m not capable of adressing. Taste is just marvelous. I get nuts, fruits and some alk. Sweet, then a nice bitter finish. Amazingly smooth beer, and actually lives up to the "hype" . I love Rochefort 8, but this just is a level above! I certainly picked the right beer to celebrate with! Cheers!

Bottle: bold, deep, & dark brown, almost with a gray tint to it, capped off with a creamy, tab colored layer of foam that retains pretty well. Aroma is slightly akin to a fine red wine. Dark, red grapes, figs, raisins, & vinous booze, with lots of malty undertones; brown sugar, burnt caramel, toffee, & plums, all with a moderate sweetness flowing through. Taste contains mild alcohol warmth, grapes, plums, sweet malty caramel & brown sugar, a touch of back-end floral notes, and some finishing, crisp bitterness. Very nice quad with huge complexity, although I prefer the Rochefort 8 for its superior drinkability and more complex flavor profile. Love the creamy mouth feel on this one, though.

Tuoksussa hiivaa sekä hedelmäisyyttä: mm. luumua ja persikkaa. Maussa samoja hedelmäisiä makuja kuin tuoksussakin, lisäksi aavistus rusinaa. Jälkimaussa hieman alkoholia, lakritsia ja luumua. Tiheä pitsinen vaahto, kirkkaan musta. Mainio, hyvin monimuotoinen olut, josta löytää joka maistamalla uusia makuja.
Dark color, full and very impressive taste. Strong plum, raisin, and black currant palate, with ascending notes of vinousness and other complexities.

Bu en bouteille dans un verre à Rochefort. Couleur brune caramel, et une petite mousse.
Cest ma trappiste préférée, une bière tellement riche que les mots me manquent, mais les choses principales à dire cest quon a une explosion en bouche et que malgré la teneur en alcool elle reste toujours parfaitement équilibrée, une tuerie !

Murky brown liquid the glass. Small beige head. Figs, brown sugar, raisins and bread in the nose. Tastes brown sugar, yeast, dark bread, dark fruits, syrup and some alcohol. It has a sweet and sticky mouthfeel with low carbonation. This is one of my favourite belgian ales. Its complexity makes it a winner in its style for me. Great brew!

Bottle. Pours a dark brown, nice beige head. Aroma is brown sugar, raisins, dried fruit, chocolate, plum- a lot more but I honestly had a hard time distinguishing what the aroma is, that being said, the aroma sets up huge expectations on the taste buds for how amazing it is. Flavor is smooth- moderate sweet and fruity, light to moderate yeast. I wanted the finish to last longer because of how amazing the taste was, which would be the only reason this beast loses any points. Third time drinking this and the first time I really appreciated just how great a beer this is. Thank God for the widespread distribution and the cheap cost (I got a bottle for 5.99) because this is a must have and should be enjoyed by all ratebeer enthusiasts at least once a year.

Wow!! What a beer. Pours a thick dark brown color. Gigantic head. Too many complexities to list. Definitely some raisin and brown sugar, but also some fruity notes. Would have to try this several times to give a fair assessment. Exceptionally smooth! Going back to buy the last 2 bottles.
Very close to the tripel Rochefort beer, but more strong and with more complex aftertaste.

Bottle from drink shop Tallinn. Thick black with xxl thick brown head. Fruity Yeasty with tequila aroma. Alcohol and High carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Off White Head, Mild Lacing

S: Dark Plums, Raisins, Molasses, Sweet Bread, Sweet Bourbon

T: Raisins, Molasses, Sweet Bread, Plums, Rum

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium To Full Bodied, Semi Sweet, Mildly Boozy

Overall, WOW, the taste on this is amazing (and full flavored) but you get the individual flavors, may even be more complex than Westy XII.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Color is deep walnut with a thick tan head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is caramel, toffee, bread and dark ripe fruit. Taste is heavily sweet with a nice complexity of flavors - toffee, raisin, plum, sugar spice. The finish drys out pleasantly without becoming overly bitter. Silkly mouthfeel and soft carbonation. The alcohol provides some warmth, but overall its well hidden. Great quad.

Et une Trappiste de plus au top !
Brune tres foncée avec un col fin mais persistant.
Des arômes fort de fruits noirs et mures, des notes de caramel et desther.
La bouche est tres ronde, tres bien equilibrée meme si le sucre est un peu trop marque a mon gout. Longueur parfaite pour ce type de biere a deguster tranquilement.

Nice spicey note on the tongue, very drinkable. Great aroma, some fruit aroma and that note of rochefort yeast in the nose. Well balanced, not hoppy at all, no off flavors or smells here. Perfect beer all around

Bottle 33 from systembolaget. Cloudy brown with a beige head. Pears, brown sugar, syrup, figs, dates, slightly boozy. Medium/full body, lively carbonation, quite sticky, sweet finish. Nice, but I will probability like it better aged.

Bottle from systembolaget 
Syrupy, honey aroma with some pears in it. 
Beige head that is a bit to thin and short lived. Cloudy brown appearance, not very appealing. 
Very sweet, syrupy taste with some raisins and some alcohol. Way to sweet for me and a bit to alcoholic. 
Medium to full body. Lively to fizzy carbonation which I feel is a bit to much. Sticky texture. 
Not my kind of beer. Way to sickly sweet

BBD 30.04.2018; Pours, dark hazy brown, with floaters -brown head. Souer, spicy, malty, dried fruits, caramell aroma. Taste is vinious, spicy, sweet malty, caramelly with dried fruits, rasin. Creamy, dry mouthfeel. Bitter, spicy lasting finish. Yes, its special..

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2013 Bottle, BBE 27/02/18. Pours a very dark brown with an auburn tinge. Quite a large, latte-colored head. Aroma is a bit wooden, a lot of dark fruit and dark maltiness. Caramel. Taste is rather sweet with malt, some caramel, a lot of dark fruits: Prune and dates. Alcohol is well hidden. No idea at all that this would be over 11% ABV. The dark fruits really control the flavor. Light bitterness on the finish, maybe herbal. Yeast provides more earthiness, more maltiness. Very dark, fairly rich and sweet dark malt bread. Prunes and dates. Fairly full, some carbonation. Good, but not perhaps as good as I was expecting from all the praise.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2015 Cerveja considerada uma da melhor do mundo. Aroma frutado, muito bom, lembra um vinho espumante. Espuma densa e duradoura. Cerveja para degustar. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The very best I ever had.
Complex aroma with some roasted, fruity, wine-like hints. Overall appearance is good. Nice off-white foam, brownish/darkish and partly ruby-red color. Taste is superb, smooth, a complex of (dark) fruits and some roasted flavors, litte coffee, toffee, chocolate. Nice melange overall. Lightly bitter. Creamy but not so thick texture. Despite the alcohol level its hardly noticeable. Overall: pure joy. Take your time to really enjoy this beer.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 33cl bottle into tulip. 

Lille, France

Appearance: Very dark brown. Almost black. Lacing on the glass and sediment in the bottom

Aroma: Heavy on roasted barley, coffee, dark chocolate. Alcohol. 

Taste: deep and dark. Very little sweetness. Some what bitter. Like drinking very dark chocolate.

Palate: Full body, though less than the 8. oily texture. Appropriate carbonation. Long long finish. 

Overall: I drank this right after the Rochefort 8. A well made beer, but I prefer the 8 over the 10. The flavor profile is very dark and dry, almost like Guinness ( to be clear, this is 100 times better than Guinness overall). Not very complex relative to its peers. Surprisingly easy to drink for the alcohol continent. Still, not the best quad I have had.

I bought this beer because it had so high ratings. Well, not my style, but its for sure well crafted. You cant really feel this 11,5% alcohol. Its strong, but you wouldnt say that its that much. Very nice perfume-like aroma, beautiful deep purple color, almost black, with long-lasting head. Tastes well, with a lot of sweetness and not much hoppiness. Coffee notes and a lot of fruit, plus wine-like character. As a hop-head I cant say I loved it but it was a very decent one!
first quad, everything about this beer is candy, its hard to find any belgian, belgian style better.

This is a great belgian quad ale in the Trappist tradition. It has a big, malty taste and pours a dark brown with a thick cream head. Smells if plum, raisin, and caramel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very solid quad. This is rite there along if not as good as the westy XII.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 330ml bottle from LCBO @ Queens Quay, Toronto, ON. 11,3 % Alc./Vol. Pours an opaque deep brown colour with a small lasting head. Small pieces of yeast swimming on the bottom of the glass. Aroma of plums and caramel. Complex bittersweet taste with notes of dried fruit, brown sugar leads to a hoppy finish. High alcohol content is barely present. High carbonation.

The king of (affordable) quadruples. Dark purple colour, little head. Sweeter to the nose than the tongue. It hits you with a plum start, medium sweet middle and lingering aftertaste of forest fruits. Foamy texture on the tongue.
Malty, not bitter. Very aromatic (dark roasted). Taste: Dark chocolate, malty, caramel. Fizzy, but not too much. A little strong for a beer.
12oz bottle at Matteo's. Pours a dark brown color with a little head. Belgian yeast aroma. Caramel flavors with mild sweetness. Subtley complex flavors. Great quadruple.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Aroma is almost hoppy, caramel brown on color... Flavor is sweet, like brown sugar, notes of plum, raisins.... Slightly boozy, finish is sweet and clean.... Phenomenal beer

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 Hazy, brown color. Frothy, medium lasting head. Aroma of plums. Light bitterness, taste is medium sweet. High carbonation.

Bottle 33 CL.Pours dark brown with a tan creamy big persistent head.Aroma is bready, vinous with tones of cherry. Taste is a perfect balance between sweetness and bitterness with some liquorice. Carbonation is average, medium to full body. Cherry and liquorice in the aftertaste. Unexpected High drinkability, hides alcool very dell, astonishingly balanced.
A gift from one of my students who went to Belgium. wow its a rich malty beer with some fruity overtones. A bit brandy or port like. Packs a flavor and alcohol punch! Fantastic!

Cloudy brown with white foam. Malty caramel aroma. Maybe some dark fruit. Caramel, toffee, malt and dark fruit flavors. Some hops in the middle. Smooth well balanced and complex. Wonderful beer. There is nothing I dont like about it.
Rich brown color, slightly fizzy but just right. Rich, dynamic flavors of toffee, fig, subtle caramel, with malt burst at the end.

Dark brown color with a off-white head. Aroma is complex, notes od roasted malt, dark fruits, toffee, chocolate and coffee, hints of plums. Flavor follow the aroma, plenty of dark berries and plum again! The alcohol is not strongly noticed.. Nice bodied and medium carbonation, great beer!

Tried this during the Teusink family Christmas Eve tasting last year. Was a bit too tipsy to properly rate. This pour a dark purplish brown with an ever so slightly tan head. Scent has hints of grape, berry, and caramel. Taste starts clean and sweet and finishes barely bitter. Wine like viscosity and well carbonated. Fine beer that is too pricey to drink regularly. Bottle - Intown Market - Atlanta, GA

Totalt great beer, and it has good price :-) the aroma and flavor, one of my favorites.

Poured out of 11.2 bottle. Strong caramel, toasty aroma with dried fruit. Appearance is a cloudy dark brown. Flavor is a wonderful meld of caramel, toasted grains and dark fruit. Great mouth feel, great beer.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2014 Dark, murky appearance with a caramel head, malty aroma, syrup, caramel and toffee, quite intriguing. Alcohol taste, unsurprisingly given the 11.3%, liquorice too, malt notes, dark fruit, toffee, caramel. Palate is pleasant, not that much carbonation. Exquisite
Best beer Ive ever had. You cant be this artfully crafted brew. This is what every Belgian beer should be based off of. Dark. Complex. Sweet. Satisfying.

Full bodied dark sweet beer. One to end a cold winter evening in front of a fore with. Drunk from 33cl bottle.

One of my favorite beers!! Nice dark brown beer. Taste´s of caramel, chocolate, dried dark fruits a bit nuts. Aftertaste has a bit brown/old rum and vanilla. Sweet but not too sweet, well balanced.

Dark, ruby-brown with a tan head. Aroma of dried fruit, plums, toffee - smells fantastic. Taste is plum jam, cherries, sweet, sticky feel to it, dessert winey finish with some alcohol warmth. Fantastic.

It pours rust coloured with copper highlights; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: plums, raisins, pumpernickel bread, molasses, and a slight liquorice note. The taste is medium sweet that finishes medium bitter; there are notes of: dark chocolate (predominantly), the aforementioned aroma notes, plus dark rum (alcohol notes). The palate is full bodied, it is sticky, has little carbonation, with a long finish. Overall, an old favourite of mine that Ive never got around to rating until now.
looks and smells like the kind of piss I like sinking. Pretty good Belgian piss. Not going to rim the brewer out but it gets the job done. Might rim him out actually. Na, Fuck him.

Mine-one was quite young - 4,5 years until the date on bottle. Poured into snifner. A cloudy orange-brown color, like a ginger tea, with HUGE 4mm long pieces of yeast!! A decent, temperate, tan coffee-head - good lacing. Lots of dried fruits hitting my nose at first: raisins, french plum, some caramel and cinnamon, a bit of fallen autumn leaves from yeast, and an obscure vanilla-sweetness if sniffed a bit further from the border of a glass. Taste is amazingly smooth as for 11.3% ABV! Very delicate bitterness tells me all the story about it. Hot malty barley sugar makes this bitterness more rounded and pleasant, it tastes like and overripe plummmmmMMMmarvelous! Adorable thick texture, feels like its chewable! Average carbonation and deeply warm finish. Anyway my eng vocabulaly is too pour to describe this beer as it deserves.. And.. Drink it responsibly - its 11,3 anyway ;)
Dark hazy brown, one finger head that holds well. Nose of sweet carmel. Taste of burnt toffee with dates infused, vanilla, boozy. Has a little spice in the back, nice.
bouteille 330ml de brune. notes de caramel de cerises et de mures. en bouche la force de lalcool ressort mais la douceur des notes de caramel équilibre le tout a merveille. super bonne a reprendre

A taste and aromas very pronounced in the nose, in mouth of the notes of caramel come on the palace. 
A delight
Bottled at BeAbout in Bratislava/Slovakia. It is an absolute delicacy! The best was the price - only 2.90 the bottle :)

Clear pale brown,short off white head, fizzy carbonation. Aroma is dark fruits, leather, caramel. Taste is fruity - raisin, plum, dried cherry. Some light wood character and sweet caramel. Great beer, glad I revisited it after a couple years

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 Many bottles at various locations throughout the years. Well-balanced aroma is malty, caramel, toffee, nuts, raisins, dried fruits, touch of chocolate, butterscotch. Flavour is sweet with a very smooth finish. Body is again quite smooth and nicely medium to full. Very earthy, rich and well-balanced.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Cáliz de Chimay. Marrón muy oscuro y apariencia turbia. Espuma bronceada, corona persistente y firmes anillos de encaje. Aromas de levadura Belga, maltas tostadas, ron azucarado y café, redondeados por pasas y ciruelas, trazos de vainilla y especias. Rica entrada de maltas tostadas y pasas. Cuerpo intenso y carbonatación suave. Textura densa y sedosa. En el intermedio notas de frutos secos, caramelos y cacao amargo que recuerdan los bizcochos de invierno. Agradable calor alcohólico sin acidez asociada. Prolongado final dulce/amargo. Suave y sabrosa, resulta una muy buena compañia para un trago pausado.
330ml bottle. Chimay Chalice glass. Deep brown, foggy appearance. Tan foam, lasting crown & sticky lacing rings. Belgian yeast, sugary alcohol -rum like-, toasted malt & coffee aromas to the nose, rounded by prunes & raisins, hints of vanilla & spices. Rich upfront shows toasted malts & raisins. Full body. Soft carbonation. Dense & silky texture. Dried fruit notes, candies & bitter cocoa in the middle - Winter cake like-. Kind alcoholic heat but no acidic sensation. Long sweet/bitter finish. Smooth & flavorful. Great company for a paused drink !!

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2015 Bière brune quelque peu rougeoyante, complètement remplie de particules pouvant être assez grosses et rendant le liquide parfaitement opaque, aspect même un peu boueux, effervescence très difficile à observer à travers ce magma mais qui semble bonne, et surmontée dun col brunâtre, pas tellement large, mais bien dense, résistant et collant. Arômes principalement maltés présentant une bonne dose de fruits foncés très mûrs voire confits (raisin, cerise, prune/pruneau) et de caramel, avec du pain grillé et du chocolat au lait, ainsi que quelques effluves de malt fumé (fumée, charcuterie, tourbe, léger boisé), dalcool et desters fruités (bananes!). Le nez est très agréable, belle complexité, intensité très élevée. En bouche, cest bien pétillant et lonctuosité au palais est excellente, cest rond, mousseux, soyeux, velouté... Au goût, cest largement fruité (raisins très mûrs, pruneaux, cerises) avec du pain grillé, du caramel et du malt légèrement torréfié (chocolat surtout) et légèrement fumé, boisé. Lalcool est plus présent au goût quau nez, remplissant le dégustateur de sa douce chaleur, mais cest très bien intégré, comme toutes les autres saveurs dailleurs. Excellent produit! Belle complexité, les saveurs sont très intenses, et leur équilibre est savamment réussi.
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Dark fruits and a boozy aroma... a similar taste with hints of caramel. .. fine beer... not my favortie retry ... so bad

Bouteille de 330 ml, acheté à la SAQ. Couleur brun foncé, très brumeuse avec mousse beige. Odeur de fruits confits, malt, houblon. Amazing beer! All I can say, perfect mix of fruits, spices; and its even better that this beer is so cheap for the awesomeness of it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Perhaps it is sacrilegious to say, but I prefer Rochefort 10 to Westy 12. The differences are miniscule, but enough that I am just happier with the Rochefort. Not to mention that I can get a steady supply of 10!

Reviewed 9-9-10.

Sometimes its tough to review a legendary beer after you have not had it in awhile. Questions like: Tastes change over time, and what if I dont like it? are very commonplace - at least in my mind. Anyway, I picked this up over at the Arlington Whole Foods today because...it was there.

I poured this into a sniffer.

Ap: Dark brown, muddy water pour, that adds up to this beautiful fully cabonated (almost champagne-like), dark brew that has the foamiest head Ive seen in a long time - unfiltered obviously.

Ar: VERY subdued, but equally pleasant. I was expecting this big flood of dark fruit to start beating me up (like Raison dEtre), but much to my amazement - no. Sure, Im getting the fruit, but I smell chocolate.

T: Sweet licorice right off the bat, then dates. VERY sweet. I actually think age will mellow this out. Not many fancy spices at all - just good old fashioned malts and sugars. Earthy and then some!

P: Creamy as hell, with the intense sweetness being part of the brews charm. Lots of foamy lacing on the glass.

O: 11.2 fl. oz. was plenty. Because the stuff has an ABV of 11.3, Im feeling pretty good!

(Bottle): Pours a dark murky brown, thin off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits (specifically plums, raisins and red grapes), malt, bread, yeast and a hint of alcohol. Fantastic flavour of plum, raisins, fresh baked bread, yeast, spices with hints of alcohol in the background. Although present, the alcohol is really well hidden considering its such a big abv. The beer is carbonated just right and super smooth to drink. Such an amazingly complex, well balanced and perfectly produced beer.
Hard to imagine how one could improve on this for the style. Only downside is that it is too strong to enjoy in the quantity one would desire.
cereal, chocolate, roasty, black color, full sweet with a little sour with the end and a little bitter from throat ,this make the sweet doesnt too much,full body, it just a complex belgium beer.

Until I had had West XII, this was my favourite. It is still a phenomenal beer and an absolute must for any beer drinker. A model quad. 

Appearance: dark brown with a head that disappears quickly. No significant lacing. 

Aroma: one of the beer's greatest strengths; a strong, immediate smell of dark cherries, red wine, plums, raisins ...beautifully overpowering. 

Taste: boozy fruit at first, slowly giving way to a dryer sweetness with pleasant alcohol warmth. A buttery, brown-sugar tang hovers nicely at the front of the top of my mouth. So many beautiful flavours, yet it gives preference to fruits and wine over an overall balance. Beautifully complex, changes tastes as it warms, becoming brighter as it opens up and the dark forest fruits really come out on the nose. 

Mouthfeel: medium body with a distinctive alcohol warmth. The taste will hang around in your mouth for hours!

Overall: it is the booziest of the big Belgian quads (Westv., St B 12, Pannepot) but it's complexity and dark fruit notes make it's taste far superior to St Bernardus 12. A lighter body than others (Abt 12's mouthfeel is to die for) and relatively quite boozy. That puts it behind Westvleteren, which also has a beautiful blend of bright *as well as* dark fruits. 
All in all, an unforgettable beer and a world class experience. Easily worth it's AU$10 price tag. Probably the best beer readily available to most people. Be sure to keep a couple of bottles tucked away at all times!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very strong alcohol taste. I prefer the 8 or 6 over the 10. Compared to other Trappist beers, this one ranks very high.

Poured from a 375 mL bottle. Pours dark mahogany. Head is off-white with generous lacing. Aroma is gorgeous sweet malt and toffee. Favour is rich in sweet malt, caramel, toffee, vanilla, and brown sugar. Mouth feel is full-bodied. Awesome Belgian strong ale, perhaps the best beer in the world.

Dark brown, slight hazy pour with big, tan colored, frothy head. Aroma is sweet, prune, alcohol, basement. Big body with slight cocoa, dark fruit, roast flavor that finishes with alcohol sweetness and warmth. Very complex and very, very good.

Very good, though not really my style. Much more mature and refined than some of the more indulgent and sloppy Belgians. The sweetness isn't overwhelming, instead it blends nicely into the complex dark fruit flavors. Mouth feel is crisp, perhaps a touch too carbonated and effervescent for my taste. Easy drinking for the abv though the alcohol heat is there. Rather than being masked, it is diffused through the entire sip. It's warming in that way. Was a bit sad when the glass was gone. Expensive, but worth it every now and then.

My favorite till I began the super-search for the truth. Today, still in my top-five. Excelent. High in alcohol, but incredible aroma and palate. Really sweet, and particular flavor. Repeating is never a mistake.
It is costly. But it is well worth the price. This beer contains so many positive characteristics.

more bubbly that i was expecting with a ruby brown appearance. flavor was typical of the style, lots of brown fruit and quite sweet. good, though im not the biggest quad fan. i get the popularity though.

Dark brown pour with a solid beige head and lots of floating yeast sediment. Aroma is light but pleasant, hinting at the flavours to come. Taste is full of dark fruits; notes of raisin, plum, prune, currants, and a hint of chocolate. Texture is rich, moderately heavy and very smooth. Overall, this didnt blow me away quite to the degree I expected, but still a fantastic beer. Beautiful and complex balance of flavours, and so rich and smooth.

Dark brown with some red here and there. Big foamy head lingering on top. Scent has dried plums, raisins, tannin and some nuts. Smells interesting. But taste isnt clearly my type. Same flavors as the scent promised with lots of warming alcohol and ending with rather unpleasant after taste. Overall good but something turned me down here. Needs an re-rate in the future.

Finally trying the 10...very very good. Trappist 10 is highly recommended.

Bottle 33cl, from backlog. Head: beige foam. Colour: dark brown. Aroma: spicy, some clove, bread. Taste: bitter & sweet roasted malt. Palate: smooth, full body, medium CO2. Overall: very nice.

Dried fruits with prune and mace spice overnotes. 
Nice chocolaty finish.

This is a top beer for a reason. I would add a long list of wonderful things like its fantastic aroma, perfect mouthfeel, and out of this world complex fantastic taste. In short just find a bottle. chill and enjoy.
Probably one of the best beers I have ever had. Recommend it to everyone. The price is not too bad either.

Boozy, yet not overpowering, aroma. Fruity, yeasty, with a hint of chocolate. Goes down smooth for a high-alcohol beer. A delight, well worth $5.50 for one bottle. Like all Belgian beers, I had to deduct a point in appearance for floating yeast (despite the fact that it adds to the flavor).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Bottle @ home. Pours with a dark brown colour, beautiful big off-white rocky head. Aroma is moderately malty, with notes of bread, chocolate, fruit, and soft notes of licorice and vanilla; little hoppy, with notes of herbs; moderately yeasty, with notes of dough and basement aromas. Well-balanced aroma. Well hidden alcohol. Taste is moderately sweet, softly bitter, moderately salty, softly sour. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, warm alcoholic sweet finish.

Aroma: malt, malt, malt, raisins, plumbs, oranges, nuances of hops, smooth alcohol, touch of vanilla and cinammon. Very complex. Deep brown, nice browny head with thin layer to the very end. Balanced between sweetness, alcohol and bitterness. On the scale dry-full I would place it closer to full end. The finish is bitter, boosted up with smooth, elegant carbonation. It is a mighty beer. Designed to enjoy slowly, from designated glass with little sips with great, strong second course or with significant dessert. Definitely not for everyday drinking.

A delicious Trappist ale. Dark in Color with a great head. Flavor is complex and has something to offer for hop lovers and farmhouse/sweet Belgian malt lovers as well. Alcohols content is not a negative on the flavor either.

The Derricks

330ml bottle from Good Beer NYC. Best before 30.01.2018. Pours very deep, dark brown; almost black, with a medium-sized, carbonated off-white head. Aromas of ripe dark fruits (cherries and plums), huge amounts of raisins, sweet fruity malts and a bit of toffee. Taste is full and rich, with notes of raisins, figs, slightly roasted malts, peppery spice, yeast and liquorice. Very smooth taste for the strength. Simple uncomplicated taste.
Nicely carbonated. Beautiful chocolate colour.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Color realmente oscuro, café. Espuma generosa y persistente. Aroma dulce, ligeramente afrutado, con suaves notas florales, el lúpulo aparece cuando se va calentando, es indispensable tomarla no muy fría. Pours thick murky brown with a. Beautiful creamy beige head. Aroma brings dark fruits, fresh baked raisin bread, and a faint hint of sweet booze. Flavors are similar, plum, big fresh raisin bread, and dark fruits on a perfectly balanced body. It is an awesome beer.
Great beer but a bit too much. Lots of plums and raisins. Rated with another app.

500th rating. Poured from bottle into Societe trappist glass. Pours a murky dark cola brown with a one finger rocky tan head which fades to a thin head which linger throughout. Aroma is of plums, raisins, currants, dark fruits, wine, woody notes, belgian yeast, and some smoke. Taste is raisins, currants, dark fruits, plums, toffee, molasses, smoked sweet malts, some vinegar, and some very light booze. Has a medium full body with a semi creamy, slightly rocky mouthfeel, and a slightly dry, slightly bitter, but mostly sweet, medium-long finish. Overall, a excellent abt that hides it extreme abv very well and is one of the best widely available beers in the world.

Lots of flavor of dark fruits with notes of spicy yeastiness and a lingering sweetness throughout. So smooth and well carbonated. For a big abv the alcohol is almost totally hidden in the flavor. Delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 Pours a murky brown with a tan / khaki head that disappears quickly. Aromas & taste are of alchohol, caramel, butterscotch & a witbier spiced flavor. The flavors are deepened as it warms and absolutely should be drank at temperatures only slightly cooler than room temp. The initial mouthfeel is almost like a wine and I got an alchohol buzz on the very first sip almost immediately, WOW. I enjoyed trying to pick out the flavors & aromas as much as I enjoyed drinking it, fantastic beer!

Amazing beer! I try to have this beer at least once a month, if I could afford it I would be having it every day. What an amazing belgian beer. Dark brown in colour with an initial haziness, no head whatsoever. Smell of sweet and heavy plumb and raisins with notes of honey toast. Nice hints of plumb on the pallet and other darker fruits, surprisingly smooth for higher ABV and great for a summer saturday afternoon.
Herbs, caramel, butterscotch, bread. Zware eindbaas. Zonder depot gedronken. Lekker met smeuige kaas.

Bottle from MatchCopal, Grevenmacher, Luxembourg!

Aged 4 years in my cellar. Smells dark fruity and yeasty. Starts with lots of plum, raisin and belgian yeast. The middle part has massive dark fruits, lots of belgian yeast and some alcohol. Goes into an alcoholic-yeasty finish with delicious dark red fruits.

This was my first trappistes it was sweet and it was a mouthful. Sip this beer I would like to go on a beerbaticle. While on this trip this would one I would like to try freshly made. Not as carbonated as most American beers. It adds to the uniqueness. The abv will not your socks off. A must try in my books.
UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 From bottle to disposable hotel coffee cup. Beautiful ruby color. Virtually no head. Smells of raisins and malt. Light carbonation. Delicious.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2014 Incredible beer. Perfectly blanched. Big flavors of Toffee, dark fruits and a hint of chocolate. This beer lived up to the hype. Glad I bought three bottles. I still have two more to drink. Cheers!
Not having gotten my hands on westy 12 is really the only reason this beer is not getting a perfect sore from me. This is the best example of my favorite style beer that I have experienced.
Very similar in quality and flavour to the Westvleteren XII, but available for a fraction of the price and easier to find. A great alternative to the best beer in the world.

From bottle at a tasting at Bar & Cigar. Clear mahogany with a beige head. Aroma of raisins, dried fruits, plums and malt with caramel and notes of spices and fortified wine. Sweet, but balanced. Complex and flavourful. Fullbodied with fairly soft carbonation. Quite delicious sipper.

6/8/13. The best beer to date so far. Sooooo complex. Was beer #3 of the night. Actually tasted chocolate after I was walking back in the house. Exceptional!

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2013 Donker zwaar bier met een uitgebreid smaakpallet. Toetsen van cacao, gekarameliseerde candijsuiker. Zoete banaan geur met ook hierin een toets van candij. UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 Aroma of plum, bread, caramel, red fruit, alcohol, bubble gum, banana, raisin, some moderate spicy phenols, some fruity hints by hops (its a young bottle) and a lot of other sweet things I cant even recognise. Every time I put my nose into the glass its a different experience, wow! Dark amber color, turbid if you pour the bottom, tan foam. Sweet but not cloying, not extremely attenuated, lively carbonation, velvety texture. Long orgasmic finish. I have no words... fabulous! How the hell do they get such a complexity and fullness in this damned beer? Im almost crying... astonishing.

brown, large off-white head. gusher. rum, dates, raisin, cherry, brown sugar, booze. very sweet, light bitter. full body, creamy feel, extremely fizzy carb. im sure its great for a lot of people, but its just too sweet and too fizzy for me.

Complex aroma rich with malts, fulfilling.
Persistent taste, starting medium sweet with a slight bitter ending, winey. Full body, but not heavy.
An excellent meditation beer!
11.2 oz bottle. Dark brown color with a fruity aroma. Malty, fruity taste with some alcohol at the finish. Very nice, though I prefer some of the others in this category.

Perhaps my favorite Trappist beer, that Ive tried. Beautiful pour dark mahogany pour, nice white head. The aroma shines, raisins, figs, cherry, yeast, leather? Flavors are really nice, get the cherries and raisins and and booze. The alcohol is very well balanced for being 11.3. This is an archetypal Trappist and strong Belgian dark ale.
A good Trappist. Very dark and full of flavor from nuts to raisins and a very strong flavor of darkroasted barley. You cam spend an hour enjoying this beer.

A: Like a dark cherry wood. Lighter head is stable, but doesn't overflow the glass. 

S: Molasses and fruit and malty, bready goodness. 

T: Just like it smells, the opposite of a letdown. Like a liquid Jamaican Christmas cake. Sweet, but a cinnamon-like sting as it leaves. 

M: Thick. Carbonation is just right. The alcohol just blends incredibly here. 

O: Truly the best Belgian beer I have ever tried, and in my top ten favorite beers of all time. Yes, I've had a Westvleteren 12, but this is better. Whereas the Westy was too carbonated and short-lived like a darker Duvel, the Rochefort is thick, almost Doppelbock-like. A must have.

Tried a small amount in a group tasting. Deep purple colour, mild head but lots of lace. Aroma is loads of dried fruit but also rum aromas. Nice! The alcohol shows up in the taste but thats to be expected. We also get the typical fruit, sweetness and nice fullness for for the style. Palate is not as big and full as I had expected. There also may have been some astringency as well. Great beer!
As always a great beer! Its aroma fills your nose with a round sweetness and the taste fills your mouth with a sweet palette.
Ontzettend lekker bier! Een heerlijk Belgisch biertje met een goede smaak. Voor herhaling vatbaar
Top Gun from the Top League. I always keep around 20 bottles of this masterpiece in my basement. Aroma, taste intensity and hidden alcohol makes it so irresistible.

11.2 fl oz / 330ml bottle into a trappist glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Bready, yeasty, kind of boozy. Raisins. Kind of smells like a Cinnabon, hahaha.

Appearance: Nearly opaque, hazy, dark brown body. Visible sediment. Moderate tan-ish head dissipates to a very sparse cap.

Taste: Very bready and boozy. Pretty sweet. Either its super complex and I cant appreciate it, or its pretty straightforward. Tastes fantastic though!

Palate: Moderate-long sweet and boozy finish.

Overall: Pretty fantastic beer. I love the way it smells.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Pours a thin beige head, deep brown almost black colour, average carbonation. Nose of plums, raisins, figs and caramel. Taste is sweet and soft with the mentioned sweet fruits and  caramel but comes with some licorice, mocha and alcohol. Much more accessible than the Westvleteren and St Bernardus, great beer.

Bottle, best by 10/21/14. Pours dark brown with billowing off-white head. Surprisingly carbonated. Aromas of grapes and other dark fruits. Taste is super rich in raisins and caramel. Plenty boozy as well. The sweetness here is well-balanced; I get a bit of acidity thats helping it out, though that may be from the carbonation. As the beer warmed, I got a faint bit of cardboard in the aroma, which I didnt think would be terribly prominent in a 4 year old beer thats mostly been in my fridge, but as Eugene always tells me, I know nothing about beer. Mouthfeel is not too full and the carbonation gives it some liveliness on the palate. Finish brings some alcohol heft and lingering sweetness. I think I prefer Westy over this one (you d have never known since I dont rate...consider that my gift to you, the viewer). Still, the accessibility of this beer makes it the go-to for the style, obviously.
Pour is a deep brown color with beige head. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark fruits, caramel, and chocolate. Taste is similar with boozy finish. Full mouthfeel with good carbonation.
Quite possibly the best beer I have drank... almost as sweet as wine... love the high alcohol content

Dark brown almost black color, medium beige head. Sweet and rich aroma of roasted malt, dark fruits, caramel, chocolate and some spices. Taste is similar with some yeast notes too, bitter sweet with gentle alcoholic finish and long . Full body and fizzy carbonation. Delicious.
UPDATED: MAY 23, 2014 Flesje gedeeld met bryanvdv @ Charlies, geur alcohol, en rijp fruit. Smaak zoet vol alcohol em rozijnen. Vol zoete afdronk alcoholwarmte.

Bottle to glass. Pours a very cloudy deep brown color with a thick creamy light brown head. Aroma is quite pleasant, full of toasty malts and dark fruits. Smell intensifies as the beer warms. Taste is a wonderful toasty malt sweetness with a complex blend of dark fruits. Alcohol hotness is well hidden in both the aroma and taste. Medium to full body with a lingering heavy malt sweetness. I honestly feel that this beer puts westvleteren 12 to shame. Not sure what all the hype is about. This is magnificent, and Im usually much more of a hop head.

Bottle. Not a huge nose on it, but looks dark and handsome in the goblet with a thinnish fine head. Packs a punch with boozy cherries, raisins, and dark caramel. Mouthfeel fizzy but carries the alcohol nicely. Crafted and balanced, the quality is evident everywhere. Even on a humid rainy day it slid down beautifully.

Nice aroma of raisin, alcohol, molasses, and cherry. Nice ebony color with a tan head. BIG BEER! Taste of smoky caramel, raisin, fermented cherry and notes of spicy fruit. Nice balance of sweet and bitter. Very complex. Finishes with a mild bitterness, and a nice alcohol burn. Slightly above average carbonation that sits well. Sip and savor....outstanding!
very strong taste nice aroma very good trappist beer Have to visit Rochefort next

Simply deelisheous! Great malty molasy tastes ... perfect carbonation little head and perfect crisp palate! woop woop love it!

Dark brown, opaque. Thin tan head. Aroma of ripe fruit and molasses. Flavor profile is malt based and lightly smokey with notes of raisins and prunes. Mouthfeel is thick and rich with a sharp carbonated finish. This Trappiste Ale goes perfect with a deep, plush sofa. Savor, and enjoy the warm buzz.

Bottle. Poured very dark brown with a smallish tan head -- best looking of the quads Ive had. Aroma and flavor had lots of fruit: cherry, plum, black currant, raisin. Anise, soy sauce, light chocolate. Wonderfully rich but very drinkable. Boozy but not overly so. Very complex, but nicely integrated. Moderate to full mouthfeel. Neck and neck with Westvleteren 12 as my favorite quad.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2015 The appearance of this beer impresses straight out of the bottle and into the glass: the enormous off-white head, a lightly colored yet large-grained sediment, and the opaque dark brown color each do their part. The aroma yet fuses the scents of vanilla, caramel malts, toffee, fig, and plums, and the taste is very well blended between a mild sweetness, mild umami, and a touch of sourness with flavors similar to the aroma notes; furthermore, the palate combines a lively carbonation, boozy and malty finish, medium body, and a slick texture.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 Dark brown eye color appearance with medium head and some black spec resin at the bottom. The aroma is incredible, it gets your taste buds watering with interest. Complete opaque, Rich fruit, caramel, dried fruits, Strong fruit, slight sweet, ... Slight acidic Smooth, much smoother than the 8, not as yeasty... Very nice
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2015 Excellente bière trappiste!! une de mes bières favorite :) j en ai bu des litres et je m en lasse pas! :)

As the Eurythmics said, sweet dreams are made of this. This is as good as it gets! It is in a little bottle but it is packed with flavor. It has a rosy, kind of wine sensibility like in a Chilean Merlot. It has a sweet wash down, absolutely delicious. A very noble beer.
Bottle. Pours a hazy brown with light toffee head. Aroma of dates and port. Taste of fruit with a booze finish

Perfecta cerveza dentro de su estilo, referencia dentro de las cervezas trapenses y abadia. Perfecto equilibrio entre potencia y delicadaza, en sus sabores.. La mejor o única buena cosa que ha hecho la iglesia en 2000 años.
Full and rich flavor and aroma, strong yet smooth, fantastic taste and palate. Ready to have more. Glad I can get it in Panama.

2012 bottle to flute
Aroma of raisins, currents, port, and rum. Sludgy brown with very little white head. Complex fruity taste with alcohol at the end.

Bottle - Brown sugar, dark fruits (raisin, plum etc), subtle alcohol and some ever so slight sourness. Muddy brown with no head. Brown sugar, followed up by the dark fruit and an alcohol burn The body is a bit lacking for the strong flavors. Beautifully complex and a wonderful beer to finish the day with as I am now.
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2015 Mooie donkere kleur, weinig schuim. Ruikt erg fris, kruiden met tikkeltje zoetig. Smaakt bijzonder fris voor een sterk bier. Lekker friszoetig.
Ruikt heerlijk. Ideaal biertje voor een relaxte zomeravond. Drinkt makkelijk weg dus kijk uit.
Bottle at beertasting with Carsten Bertelsen 19 / 6 2013. Dark brown, almost no head. Aroma, dark fruits, sweet, alcohol. Taste, dark fruits, yeast, some alcohol. Great belgian beer.
This is my favorite beer of all time. The best I have ever had. Lots of plum, cherry,  and yeast flavors. Alcohol is there but, not overpowering.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2016 2013-06-19: 9+3+8+4+17 = 4.1. Bottle. Clear chestnut brown with a medium sized light brown head. Alcohol, vinous, musty nose. Rum soaked raisins, caramel, nuts, sherry, flowery and fruity yeast notes. Quite easy to drink with no rough alcohol. Medium/full body, medium sweet and bitter, warming, slow drinking, good stuff.


Drank it again because winter. I like it, but it sure is feisty. Also not as full bodied or with as much depth in the flavour as I remembered, which makes the alcohol stand out. Still a good brew, but something I rarely crave for.

Incroyable bière trappiste. Robe brune foncée accompagnée dune superbe  mousse beige. Le nez dévoile de arômes de bananes, de raisin, de sucre candy et dalcool. En bouche, lalcool est parfaitement dissimulée laissant place aux saveurs fruitées. Fine amertume finale ! Une grande grande bière.

Quite good and dangerously easy to drink... Lots of dark fruit flavors and smells... Good belgo... Taste the alcohol...mmmmmm

Easily one of the best beers on the planet!  Sweet, malty, caramel, coffee, alcohol, yeast...all in fine balance!  The carbonation is something to marvel at, almost Champagnesque.
bottle.  Pours dark amber brown with huge foamy head. taste is fruity with plums and orange peel. the high abv is evident and the sweetness and bitternes are perfectly balanced.

Bottle (33 cl).  A dark brown/red and very hazy beer. Pours a thick, light brown head with the sediment from the bottle clearly noticeable. Very rich aroma, fruits, alcohol and spices. Taste is also extremely rich and complex, again alcohol, spices and fruits but also yeast and bit of chocolate. Very full and oily and a bit sticky body and lively carbonation. Goes down very smooth, and has a long aftertaste. Amazing!

In my opinion the best beer in the world. It is beatifull Brown beer with a fruity taste, without being sweet. The yeast and the malts are a perfect combination to give the beer the taste every brown beer should have. A full bodied beer, with Smooth taste. only down side is the lack of foam. For everywhone who doesnt have taste it, do it when you have the change.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 Dark and stormy look. Aroma is fruity malts and sweet caramel. Taste is perfect for me - not overdone, but sweet caramel toffee, dark fruits and a certain liqueur quality. Brilliant. Palate is sweet lingering but not too sticky. Overall, an extraordinarily well hidden abv and a world class beer. Could drink this one all night long.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2013 Bottle from Discount Supermarket, Cardiff. Pours dark yeasty brown with light brown head which lasts a while. Lot?s of fruit; plums, raisins, cherries... it?s more christmas cake than christmas cake. The yeast gives it a bready, fruit loaf note, yet it keeps a little bitter - this is good. So smooth; a joy to sip. This is up there as one of my all-time favourite beers, and amazingly affordable too. Always have a few stashed away.

Bottle thanks to flylikeabanana. Pours a murky maroon brown with coarse khaki head, settles in minutes with minimal lacing. Aroma is fruity, plum, stone fruit, vinous/sangria, definite alcohol. Flavor is plum, stone fruit, red grape, mild alcohol. Alcohol is well masked as expected. Soft carbonation, medium to full body, smooth texture, and mildly warming. A fruity, juicy quad.

This is a delicious beer. Bottle pours a dark, murky brown with a medium light brown head. Good retention. Aromas of plum, cane sugar, fig, and bourbon. Taste is sweet and full of dark fruit flavors. Almost gives the character of barrel aging. Alcohol builds as you drink.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 Bottles from Cork & Cask and Bottle Baron. Deep ruby/brown body with a thin beige head that quickly fades. Very faint lacing. Aroma of sangria, plums, rum, prunes, a hint of vanilla, black cherries and a light spice. Flavour of oranges, liquorice, Christmas cake, almonds, red wine, alcohol-soaked raisins and a tangy finish. Medium to full body with a foamy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Complex and easy to drink for the ABV. An astounding beer.

Dark reddish brown, makes a nice blonde head. Aroma and taste are rather fruity and sweet. Kinda also reminds me of red wine. The mouthfeel is pretty carbonated with alcohol warming up a bit. Theres also some nice bitterness in the finish.

Aroma of toffee and sweet fruits.  Dark cloudy red brown in colour, with a small tan head.  Very minimal lacing.  Sweet to taste with a little hint of saltiness.  Lively fizzy carbonation brings a creamy mouth feel to life.

2011 
Pours dark brown with a creamy head that dissipates fairly quickly. Pretty much little to no lacing.
Aroma of cherry fruit caramel definite alcohol.
Flavor is  a perfection blend of raisin, prune, molasses.
This is one of my favorite of all Trappistes brews.  Done well & better every year of age.

Brune foncée, fine mousse persistante. Arôme fruité et caramel. Huileuse palais avec une toute petite astringence sur la fin. Caramel, légère amertume, fruits foncés sucrés, un rien dépices. Alcool pas trop présent malgré son ABV. Complexe et simple à la fois. Une merveille!

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 Dark reddish brown beer with a residual head. Aroma of, dark berries and a touch of caramel. t is medium bodied and a little oily on the palate. Good carbonation. Excellent beer!

Well this is obviously a great beer. Nothing new to add really just very very pleasant plum, damson, raisin right through this. Darn well chilled mine too much so im waiting a bit now. Oh look theres a bit of fluff i missed with the vacuum. Its warmed up now. Boozy finish, but like the best Xmas pudding.

The only thing that makes this a tad less appealing to me compared to the 8 is that I do not feel like I can drink one alone without supper. 

As a compliment to a fine belgien (or otherwise) stew this is far superior to the rocherfort 8. But alone it just a tad to overpowering.

Very dark, with a thick, brown head. I enjoyed this Belgian greatly, due to its smooth palate, and its very rich and fruity taste. You could tell it was strong, but this was never the overwhelming feature of this beer. Felt almost like syrup in the mouth and was just the ticket before bed. Delicious.

Sweet with a nice dryness on the back end.  Has a really complex peppery flavor with hints of dark fruit, banana, bubblegum, caramel, and vanilla.  Quite great.

Such a classic. Rich full flavors of dark fruits and caramel. Great to sip on after dinner.
Pours dark with a creamy espresso like head... Smells of cherries and caramel...thicker beer with a very complex taste... Top quality

Bottle. Pours dark, dark brown with big foamy head which vanishe quite quickly. Good carbonation with floaty bits. Toffee, bubblegum, booze and maltiness aroma. Pretty light on the palate for a beer of this size.Treacly, caramel flavour. Not as complex as I thought it would be. A tasty drop nonetheless.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2014 Deserves all the plaudits..a great desert (or dessert) beer. Pours an amazing head, and has a sweet, (although not too much), taste. Quite a bit of sediment lots of dark fruit and really complex. A perfect sipper. Dark fruits, spices (cinammon, cardammon etc), port, vanilla, alcohol, scotch whiskey in the finish, berries etc.


.....and thats me out. Cheers.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2013 Poured from bottle into 12oz snifter. Medium brown color with light tan head that minimizes after settling. Deep caramel smell with dark fruit notes. Sweet toffee and caramel taste with just a hint of belgian spices with a touch of booziness. Not a huge belgian fan but I would literally drink this any day. Great beer.

Strong raisin notes on the nose. More alcohol than the 8, but can barely tell. Full mouth, complex palate, semi clean finish.

Bottle, 330 ml, at home. Poured into a trappist glass. ABV 11,3%
Very dark mahogany brown colour, with two fingers of soapy light beige head on top. Good retention, no lacing left on the glass. 
Aroma of dark fruits,lots of plums, a bit of sugar, some hints of the alcohol too.
Taste of dark ripe fruits, a bit of bubblegum and banana at the end too. Sweet but delicious. Really great taste. The alcohol is only just a tiny bit notable.
Thick body, good amount of carbonation. Quite dry on the palate.
Overall a great beer, and without doubt the best of the three Rocheforts.

Worth the price of admission.  Love the complexity in taste with various fruit notes of raisin, plum and cherry coming through as you sip.

330ml bottle. Dark brown color. Medium size, thick and sturdy head. Hold well. Plums, raisins, cake, toffee in aroma. Raisins, plums, sense of ginger, spicy flavor. Sense of alcohol and peppermint in the aftertaste. Full bodied. Delicious!
One of my favorite "shelf beers".  Really similar to Westy XII.  Dont drink this colder than 50 degrees F, IMO.
Smells spicey, a little fruity, and a little boozy.  Taste is really smooth, some sort of spiceyness.
Heerlijk biertje. Flink zoet met een hoog karamel gehalte. Veel karakter en diepgang. Na een half glas wordt het biertje wel een beetje veel, maar toch zou ik zo een tweede nemen.
Poured a dark brown with light tan head. Smell of malt, prunes and raisins. Smooth taste of fruit with the alcohol well hidden. Great beer with an awesome palate.
This is such an outstanding beer.   So clean and smooth,  with great mouthfeel.  An intensely rich and dark fruity taste.  This is the pinnacle of trappists.

Pours very dark brown colour with some ruby  hints at the sides of the glass. Very small creamy off white head. Aroma has dark fruits, alcohol, some sweetness. Taste some sweetness,dark fruits, alcohol a little bit overwhelming, bitterness. Aftertaste is malty and lingers and is very good. Think the 6 and 8 are better, but thats just my opinion.

caramel, vanilla, chocolate, roasty, spruce, citrus, herbs, brown, hazy, minimal head, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, creamy, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Pours a murky dark brown, like apple cider with a lot of cinnamon in it. No head. Nice aroma of dark fruit, fig, dates and slight alcohol. Taste matches aroma. Pour is dark brown with red tint, and a bubbly tan head. Nose is dark fruit (plums, some raisin), cherry, raspberries, light caramel, red wine, and alcohol. Smells like some great red wine. Pours a deep amber with an off white head. Extremely smooth beer, with a body that is bursting with flavor. Malt, dark fruits, caramel, in a perfect blend. Very special brew, hats off to the monks.

What an excellent beer?!  I had this on my first trip to Belgium, which just concluded last week.  I happened upon this at a tavern in the city centre of Liege.  Great aroma, mouth feel, and of course, taste.  I will be looking for one of these again, one of my new favorite beers.

Trappistes Rochefort 
One of the Best Belgium Quads in the world.  11.3%ABV.   

Aroma dark dark fruit plums and raisin

Appearance nice dark brown with a slight red hue with a small beige head with little lacing 

Taste On if the best Belgium Quad I ever had.  Full dark raisin / plum flavors with little Caramel notes.  Extremely well balanced. The 11.3%ABV is well hidden 

Mouthfeel. Lightly carbonated and mildly viscous. A little warmth on the aftertaste 

Overall a must have beer if you are evaluating and enjoying Belgian Quads

Head: beige, medium, frothy and creamy, avg retention. Colour: deep brown and hazy.

Aroma: intense, dried fruit (prunes, raisins), wine and alcohol that together make a sort of oud bruin sourness, almond, more alcohol/solvent. Some herbal bitterness at the bottom. Soft carbonation. Taste: complex, delicate but not overwhelming malt sweetness, roasted and spicy bitterness, warming alcohol. The finish is sweet, roasted, spicy, alcoholic. Complex, rich, delicate and well-balanced.
Brown collored beer. With a great texture. Taste is good but not my style. All by all a good beer from Rochefort.

An excellent beer, impressive and striking bottle and an even more attractive dark liquid with a frothy, tan, head. A whirl of flavour, moving it around the mouth picks up different tastes and textures with a strong alcoholic bite. A truly enjoyable drink, and the best of the Rochefort Trappistes.
chocolate, roasty, earthy, used Chimay glass had frothy head. Wonderful, a standout beer.

Wow, this beer is superb. Pours an amazing dark colour and an incredibly foamy head. Similar aroma to the 6 and 8; dark fruits and sweetness, but richer and with more chocolat. Very complex and heavy taste with fruits, sweetness, yeast, bitterness and strangely enough my grandmothers cake. Sweet and warm (alcohol) finish. 
A benchmark beer.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown beer with a residual head. Aroma of alcohol, dark berries and a touch of caramel. The taste is firstly warm alcohol, then dark berries, plums and licorice with some sweet dark bonfire toffee. It is medium bodied and a little oily on the palate. It has some major fizz that mixed with alcohol dances on your tongue. Amazing stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Tria in Philadelphia, PA. I'm going to have to agree with popular consensus and say this is a near-perfect beer.
great aroma of caramel and plum, and raisin.  great black color, with a fine white head,  heavy sweetness and a medium bitterness,   full body with a great long finish

Pours reddish ocher, dark, cloudy and with sediment; creamy, long lasting head, moderate size; good lacing. Aroma is smooth, gentle, malty. Banana, roasted fruits and herbs. Strong mouthfeel, overwheelming strength, long, very warm, sweet finish. Taste is sweet, roasted fruits, licorice; Very complex and well balanced.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown color with big off white head. Malty, dark fruit, raisin, brown sugar aromas. Dark fruit, raisin, malty, sweet flavors. So good. So smooth for an 11% beer. Simply amazing.

Pours dark brown with a full head. Aroma is fabulous with tons of dates, stone fruit, chocolate, black cherries and malt. The taste is viscous with more dates, rum cake. A bit sweet, but not excessive. Palate is surprisingly acidic for such a strong beer.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2014 A: Pours a pretty sludgy brown. A gentle pour yields a creamy light tan head. Its a little light but pretty nice.
S: A most fruity note tinges my nostrils. Plum, raisin. Acidic boozy note but it is well complimented. 
T: This is a super complex taste. Very fruity at first. Super sweet (probably from the alcohol which is well masked but present) finish is malty with fruit notes lingering on the palate. The problem though with this one is its too sweet. 
P: A little alcohol tinge. Good flavors. Carbonation is a little aggressive. 

Overall a pretty good beer and probably the best belgian style, but maybe not as great as people think. There are some great flavor notes, and some great fruit. Some nice malt. But just too sweet. The sweetness nails you on the first sip. 

I grabbed a couple bottles and the other one is in the cellar. Maybe Ill give it another go in a couple years and well see then.

Aged a year..... Palate is the only thing that changed really. Palate is mellow. Goes down smooth and carbonation is smooth. Upped from 3 to 5. Also more dry. Still not amazing but definitely one of the better belgians Ive had. Taste from 7 to 8. Overall from 14 to 17. Still has that sweetness but it is more subdued and more of a compliment now than a take away.

A - Pours a deep murky brown with a 1.5 finger of tan head that slowly sinks

S - Raisins, plums, cherries, figs, caramelized toffee, spicy bread dough, hints of chocolate and yeasty banana.

T - Toasty chocolate covered in toffee, rum soaked figs, vanilla bean, clove, pepper, hints of smoke and tobacco. The finish has a warm dry bite that wraps everything up.

M - Like drinking velvet, perfect carbonation.

You could probably drink this 20 times and pick out something new and different everytime. This beer gets a lot of hype but truly lives up to it. Extremely complex. Superb.

Serving type: bottle

01-01-2011

This is just an incredible beer. Someone said they wouldnt recommend this for a newbie? My take is quite the opposite. Why not turn the new kids onto the deeply groovy stuff right off the bat? Thats my take. Old School BUD drinkers wont budge no matter what so? Damn the torpedos!

330ml bottle into a goblet.

Pours an opaque dark ruby, almost black, with a light tan one finger head. Really decent head retention and lacing throughout.

The aroma is full of dark fruits such as plums, raisins, dates, and figs. Is quite vinous with a very red wine-like aroma. Some notes of sherry and cranberry. Quite nice.

The flavor provides even more depth than the aroma. Plums and grapes along with sherry and a hint of vanilla. More dark fruit washes over the palate with some oak and plums. Bitterness is on the moderate side with much of the perceived bitterness provided by the alcohol. It is never harsh but is definitely noticeable providing a nice, pleasing warmth in the chest and throat.

Overall, an amazing Quad and one of the best Trappist beers out there. So many complexities in the aroma and taste it is a brew that every true beer fan should experience.
Söt, fruktig, alkoholen slår tydligt igenom. Tänk jul mumma! I sin klass strålande, men inte riktigt min påse.

330ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. Dark brown colour, thin beige head and aroma of raisins, fresh plum and bready malt & yeast. Taste is sweet caramel malt, dark fruits, vanilla & cocoa with spicy earthy yeasty bitterness that lingers. Smooth mouth feel, full bodied with soft carbonation, warming alcohol finish. Complex and well balanced.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a thick opaque blackish brown with a tall creamy, off-white head. Nose is dark fruits; plums and berries, caramel malt and a doughy/toast yeast. Taste is plums, vanilla, raisins and brown sugar sweetness, caramel and a touch of mocha. Vibrant yet creamy mouthfeel, attractive bitterness. Wow, heard great things but this was insane.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 330ml bottle. A bot cloudy brown body with a hint of red and a huge beige crown. Notes of dried plums, raisin and red berries. A hint of dryness and a warm alcohol finish.

Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard. Pours dark brown with a thick off-white head. Aroma is caramel, malt and dark fruit. Taste is medium sweet with a hint of alcohol. A little bitterness in the end. Really great indescribable mouthfeel. One of the best beers Ive tasted. Brilliant beer.
Sweet heaven. Best trappist ale i have had. Not too sweet. Smooth, no burn but warmth. Great complex taste.
