My favorite of the Trappistes.  Outstanding all around!  This beer should be drunk in a chalice for the right combo of aroma and taste.  The taste and finish are to complex to explain,  just a delight.

Great beer. Actually a rather drab look in the glass, pours very dark amber with a quickly thinning off white head. Nose is plum, raisins, caramel and rich. Balanced in the mouth with moderate carbonation, the alcohol is well disguised. Fulfilling aftertaste.
Reddish brown pour with an offwhite head.  Lots of caramel and dark fruit yeasty malts.  Taste is sweet and candied sugar and the Belgian flavor is just awesome.  Love it.

These beers are so bad ass its not even funny. They are very similar but there are subtle nuances to each. The higher alcohol in the 10 really makes it appealing and takes to another level. Alcohol nose in the glass is reminiscent of tanning. Of course raisins, figs, plums and special yeast. Complex like fine wine.  Sweet candy caramel and butterscotch. The way the toast the grain has to be a key factor in what make s this beer so special. Mesmerizing!

Pours Dark brown color, Khaki colored head was thick. Aroma was fruity and sweet.. Alcohol barely there. Some raisins and a hint of chocolate. Incredible depth. Alcohol becomes noticeable at the end. Oaky like whiskey. Great beer.
Bottle. Pours brown-purple with off-white head. Raisin, figs, caramel aroma. Malty, sweet, dark fruits (raisins, figs) taste. Full body, excellent beer.

aroma:caramel, raisin, vanilla apperance:brown/black, brownish head taste:
sweet, light some overripe fruits palete:full body,creamy, lively long finish
Kan inte fatta hur den här kan vara så högt ratead. Inte alls faktiskt. En halv flaska är precis vad jag kan få i mig

Pours a medium brown with tons of sediment. Smells of banana, some citrus and a hint of sugars and malt. Palate is great. Much the same as the aroma. Absolutely delicious taste! So many flavors its hard to nail down just one. Perfect carbonation, and mix of malts, sugars, fruits and citrus. My favorite Belgian that I have had!

Looks dark red/brown with a thick, beige head- which sticks around for a good while. One of the nicest looking beers Ive had in a while. Aroma is malt, dark fruit (raisin?). Taste is sweet, a bit port-like (but not too much so), with a hint of coffee bitterness coming through. Full bodied, slick texture with a nice  bit of fizz to it. I was expecting quite a lot from this beer, and while it is very good, I think I prefered the Rochefort 8... Definitley one of the nicest quadrupels Ive had though.
Aroma of sweet figs and raisins. Tastes like mashed up raisins and alcohol. Sticky and oily

Pours a really deep brown with a fluffy white head that lingers and leaves some lacing. Aroma is caramel, coffee, raisins and various other sweets. Taste is medium sweetness with a great amount of spices (in a good way). Alcohol is pretty well hidden and the dominant flavors are raisins again with a few bready notes. Big malt beer, yet surprisingly drinkable. Mouthfeel is really great, with a medium-low carbonation and a "thick" feel. One of the best beers out there even in this era of barrel-aged anything!
En mycket bra quadruppel med trevlig smak och arom. Vacker färg med en bra skumkrona..

Despite the pop when you open a bottle of Rochefort and the brown dirty looking foam, this is my number one beer! It tastes just as good as it sounds, Rochefort! I dont want to go into the nerdish details others do, and taste differs from person to person for sure. But this is a quality beer wich you have to appreciate if you like a full bodied beer with a distinguished sweet taste and a very long and lasting and surpsising aftertaste. The smell is unique and when taking the first sip it dominates your sences of taste immideately. There is a lot of bubbles in this beer, meaning a high CO2, hence the pop you often get when opening this beer. And I have opened more than a lot. When drinking it, it tingles the tongue, making this heavy quadrupple almost as light headed as yourself after drinking three or more in the sun. This Trappist is a bit different then any other Trappists, just like the Westvleteren and the Orval, but I prefer this one above any other of them. Some say the Chimay is the Trappist to be, some prefer the Westmalle (Rated nr.1 and 2 in a Trappist beer contest among Dutch and Belgium Trappist lovers on the web I found out last week.., I have no clue where Ive found that on the web, but it doesnt surprise me). For that matter La Trappe, or Achel, almost forgotten, are also two devine beers, but there is a unique difference between them all and Rochefort, Orval and Westvleteren. The Orval is unique and superb, but so is the Westvleteren 12, and I know taste differs and not a lot of people like the Rochefort because it has such a distinguished taste but that makes the little difference for me. Balance is everything and despite the Westvleteren is more balanced, this is my taste! Rochefort 10 is a divine beer. Its got character, freaking up the entire balance and putting you with both feet on Pluto. If those other beers are supposed to be from other planets, this beer is from Pluto for sure!

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. 1 finger tan/light brown head which settles quickly. Body is dark brown with lots of sediments in it, even when poured carefully. Spicy aroma of apricot, leather, raisins and coffee. Very sweet and pleasing, with a tiny hint of alcohol, but not too much. Taste is rich and extremely complex and balanced. Very pleasing on the tongue. The alcohol gives a warm, nice sensation down the throat. I finally see what all the fuzz is about. This is my new favorite beer!

Pretty amazing beer. Aroma is amazing. Citris, figs. My Scottish friend said Irn Brew. I understand what he means. Looks kinda funny; lumpy yeast all through. Dark ruby colour. Initial tan head leaves soon after. Beautifully balanced taste. Sweet and sour, bittered perfectly. Almost like drinking Port wine. Can see why its ranked up there. Go Catholics.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 My number 100! I know this beer, I had this one often. Not it in the time that I was serious about tasting so I am curious what rating it would get cause I never really liked it. Way to sweet and strong. But let's see! Pours a beautiful brown amber with a bit tan good head. Smells sweet. Caramel, dark fruits. The taste is complex. Medium sweet and little bitter. Nice long duration. Still it is to sweet for me. The palate is perfect tho. Sticky dry texture, heavy body and a good carbo. Alcoholic and astringent finish. I like it! More then I did before.
Originaly an easter beer. It has a lovely sweet smell and a sweet taste with a lot of alcohol. It is an all time favourite for me !!!
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2013 From a bottle  it is dark brown with atan head   The Aroma of raisins caramel, bready, sweetness, full body, creamy, long finish,
Caramel, resin, alcohol, butterscotch, cooked vegetables, caramel, banana, vanilla, herbs

Pours dark brown and has a beige head. Beautiful aroma of both ripe and exotic fruits, slight amount of tobacco and yeast. The flavor is huge! Very sweet with raisins, plums, bread, slight roastiness and a lot of sweet liquorice. Mouth feel is big, soft and round with a foamy and slightly bubbly feel a bit similar to other trappist beers. It has this nice and slight character of a good sparkling wines mouth feel.

T/p: med to full body with sweet finish of average duration moderate high carbonation. O: Taste change. Its use to be my top 1, what a drop. I still think its a reference.
