July 2010. From bottle. It doesnt get much better than this when it comes to Belgian quads. So much going on with this beer that its almost magic.
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 Cerveza excelente, de color oscuro y con una capa fina de espuma. En boca es complexa, con muchos matices, pero todos bien complementados.
An amazing dark beer, unusually smooth for its high content of alcohol. Sweet, with an aromatically rich aftertaste.
Just starting my beer adventure this beer I was recommended by specs employee best beer I have had
I really like this beer! It is a treat for every beerlover. I love the creamyness of the beer combined with dark, roasted nutty flavor.
Probably the best beer in the world. Spicy taste, ideal for degustation during winter.

Floral fragrant brown sugar smell,  dark brown hidden red, sweet well balanced with bitterness..left with some last touch of carbonate, smooth, slightly slimy, the best beer I drink so far, yet a bit pricy.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 Bottle. Pours a reddish brown typical of the style with a creamy tan head, low to no lacing. Very fragrant, scent is sweet, floral, robust dark fruits, caramel and alcohol. Tremendously flavorful, lots of dark fruit, caramel, bread, and some alcohol. Palate is full body and tick with almost effervescent carbonation. Balance is tremendous and there is a delicate and complexly flavorful lingering finish. Fantastic beer.
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 I kept this beer a whole year in the cellar... it was delicious!  Not bitter and not too sweet
Mejor cerveza. Cuerpo potente. Sabor caramelo y amargor preciso. No hostiga, refrescante e intensa.
My Favoriate Beer Ever. Taste dark notes. stong alcohol taste many dark notes and sweet taste delicious in every way.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2014 Good color, smooth flavor, not overly complex, but the berry like undertones kept this ale interesting.
Otima cerveja, encorpada com espuma cremosa e tonalidade escura harmoniza com chocolates, graduacao 11, 3%... Belga.
Dark coffee color, excellent carbonation.  Half inch head.  Pleasant aroma.  Complex tasting, not spicy, not fruity, very smooth.  Drinkable but not for long at ABV.

bottle @ aux inseparables, Binche. La miglior birra che si possa bere. Punto. profumo di pera e frutta a polpa bianca pane appena sfornato e un profumo di lievito belga che lascia intuire quale sia la portata alcolica. Versandola si apprezza un schiuma color nocciola molto ampia e durevole. se la si lascia riposare si creano dei bellissimi merletti di bruxelles. la birra è color moka, con riflessi rossastri in controluce. allassaggio è come uno schiaffo. Carbonatazione perfetta, solletica senza disturbare. il corpo è pieno e i gusti vanno dal caramello, al cioccolato alla frutta candita, il tutto ben bilanciato dallalcool. Il luppolo quasi scompare. Il finale sul palato è lunghissimo, avvolgente e caldo. a bottiglia svuotata il fondo rivela un bellissimo strato di lievito sedimentato, profumatissimo. un capolavoro birraio. (abbinare formaggi erborinati o cioccolato amaro)

I love trappist beers. This beer defines what is unique about Belgian beers. The ABV is what stands out through the intertwining balance of flavors. Fruity and sweet but with a nice bitter kick that makes taking another sip the merrier. The attention to detail in the flavors is what I love about this beer. You can taste some age if you let them sit, a slight musty taste that adds to the fruit a dry almost wooden taste but with Belgian sugar breaking through the pact. Not to sweet, not to bitter, a strong amount of alcohol that adds a third dimension to this beer. Try one, you will love the complexity but smoothness of this beer.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2013 Clearing backlog. No comments. Apologies, future ratings will have detail. 

Had it again.  Great beer.....still dont wanna describe it right now
---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The best quad, Ive had hundreds of these over the years. Sublime.

no need for description all ratebeerians know this stellar brew.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2015 33cl bottle.
Appearance: deep dark brown beer, nice thick creamy head.
Nose: chocolate, some fruits, mostly plum and raisins. Some wood.
Taste: very nice and complex taste. A shame that this was an unaged sample. Some port notes, the alcohol comes out great in this one.

Sweet aroma of plums raisins, caramel malt, alcohol warmth, belgian yeast aroma phenols and esters. Appear brown hazy  withstanding white head. Taste palate is vigoriously broad, dryed fruits like wine, sweets from malts and funky esters from yaest under controlled fermentation. Nutty and warmy aftertaste, some familiar but unidentifiable notes. Alcohol of this level is surprisingly well covered.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 AAAAH...that good old tenner...the classic...dark overripe fruit, dried fruit and raisins everywhere.

330ml bottle, a present from my girlfriend. Pours a dark ruby-brown with a thick bubbly head that dissipates very quickly. Aroma of cinnamon, apple, toffee, red berries, almost firewood scent. Taste is lovely and smooth - evenly spread sweetness with light sour and bitter notes, nice spicy notes too. Lovely smooth, full-bodied finish, and perfectly dampened carbonation. Absolutely delicious, definitely one of the best Ive  ever had.

Excellent dark nutty brown appearance with one of the best aromas ever. The aroma is so inviting. The taste is smooth as velvet and immediately i could tell it packed a punch. This beer has a great taste for such a high gravity. I liked this beer in spite of the fact that i do not like the sickening sweet taste that most high gravity beers display on the end,

Pours a dark root beer color with a rich, sudsy tan colored head. Tacky foam clings stubbornly to the edges like glue.Competing tartness and sweetness on the nose. The tartness has a cider quality while the sweetness is quite chocolatey. I note some caramel apple in the aroma as well. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel that gradually dries just before finish. I pick up a lot of alcohol warmth. Apple, chocolate, caramel, and a bit of brown sugar in the flavor. Just a little overly tart around the edges of the tongue, which throws it out of balance just by that much. The alcohol flavor bitters the finish in an unappealing way. Pretty good, but no Westvleteren.

Aroma of sweet figs and raisins. Tastes like mashed up raisins and alcohol. Sticky and oily. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark brown purple color. Whispy head. Kight aroma of sweetness. Plum raisin taste. Real smooth.

Una de las mejores cervezas del mundo, sabor ligeramente afrutado con cierto toque a regaliz. Queda una ligera capa de espuma. Mucho cuerpo y se nota el alcohol al final. Recomendable para después de una buena cena, por ejemplo.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2013 Aroma mostly cherry, appearance is nice foamy.
Tastes bitter chocolate with cherries, perhaps a drop of honey but strong alcohol reminds as if Im drinking vodka not beer, which I did not like.
Palate was reasonable.
A very interesting beer with a number of really interesting flavours. Not sure the flavours are the nicest though.

Bottle. Dark brown liquid topped with creamy tan head. Aroma is full of dried plums, dates and figs, also caramel, chocolate and volatile alcoholic note. Very sweet, molasses like taste, some alcohol (little bit disturbing to me). Very savory because of full body and creamy texture, maybe to high carbonated to my liking. Long finish full of cocoa.  This beer is something else, definetly worth drinking again.
Thick dark beer with a good mouth feel. Notes of toffee, plums, caramel, licorice and raisins. Complex and very delicious. Ends certainly in my personal top 10.
I have two crates with 24 bottles each of Westvleteren12 but the Rochefort 10 is definately the best! The shortage of Westvleteren makes it hard to get and therefore it is overrated in my oppinion.

Bottle 0.33 L.
Dark brown body with a large, creamy, tan head, fully lasting with a very good lacing.
Intense malty aroma (caramel) with notes of chocolate, sugar, red fuits, nuts, honey and light alcohol.
Flavour is moderate-to-heavy sweet but not boring at all; faint bitterness; alcohol is not dominant despite the high ABV.
Full body with a creamy texture; soft carbonation; light alcoholic warming in the finish.
Great complex beer!

Appearance: Brown-Amber with light brown head.
Aroma: Dried dark fruit, marzipan
Flavor: Raisins, malt, almonds and alcohol.
Palate: Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation.
Overall: Great balance of flavors. The high ABV is masked by body and sweetness of the beer. Perfection!

Appearance was cloudy caramel root beerish with tiny creamy off white head, no lacing. Aromas are sweet caramel, back strap molasses, root beer, candi, plum, cherry and alcohol. Taste are complexi array of sweet toffee, caramel, hints of chocolate, candi, molasses malts. Deep fruits of cherry, plum, date, fig Wow. Alcohol is here but not that burning. Palate was soft creamy CO2 with full body, then lasting warming complex wonderful finish. It would be prefect if not so warming.

Very dark, almost black with a moderate cream head. Sweet and intense, with a bitter and rounded finish with a hint of liquorice. Not highly carbonated, some coffee comes through, plus syrupy mouth feel. Not the beer for me though its very highly regarded.

Terrific beer.  I'm not a professional beer taster, but I appreciate a nice colour, good smell and great taste.  This beer has it all!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the best beers I know of. A hint of honey, sweet darkness, an overwhelmingly complex experience. Imagine your mouth being filled with all sorts of happiness (no catholic pun intended). Belgian trappist beer at its best.

Bottle at Monks. Very dark cloudy brown pour. Foamy off-white head. Deep rich vanilla caramel covered sugar plums. Intense brown quad. Medium-dark red fruit. Raisins. Dates. Rich and sweet. Heady and filling. Chewier than the 6 and 8 but otherwise similar flavors, just much more reduced and refined. More opulent as well.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Oct 2013 - Had a few of these fresh before.  This ones about 5 months old. Pours a murky opaque dirty brown with an enduring white head.  Smell is quite interesting - jasmine, floral, bubblegum, cinnamon, incense, orange zest.  Body is medium, with decent level of carbonation, foamy in the mouth.  Taste is sweet and malty, some of the floral notes from the smell, quite a lot of plum and red wine in the finish, a little sharp and the alcohol comes through noticeably. Better than the last few times, but still nothing too special in my view.  (3.7)
 June 2014 - 2011 vintage into snifter, over 3 years old.  Post-exam celebration.  Very dark brown, red tinge, sparkling, big tan head endures.  Aroma - is less interesting than a young bottle.  Malts, alcohol, some of the bubblegum and incense I got from the young beer, cherry.  Body - medium, touch of carbonation, quite foamy.  Taste - liquorice, nutty, cherry, some drying alcohol.  It has softened up with a bit of age. (3.8)
 June 2015 - 2009 vintage, 6 years old, shared at Pauls.  Aroma is leather, raisin and alcohol.  Taste is mellow malts, sweet with some spice.  This one definitely tastes better after a few years.  (3.8)
December 2016 - Bottle in Cardiff.  Tastes and smells like spiced rum and cola.  Ive found this beer variable - at best its decent and at worst very average but never has it been deserving of its reputation. (3.1)
One of the best beers, nice full taste, bitter but not to much (i like bitterness) very very rich taste
Simply a great Trappist beer.  Slightly raisin scent and taste but with many other complexities.
bottle. Brown with minimal head. Big carbonation like other rocheforts. Plum and raisin, mild sweetness. Alcohol well masked. Quite nice.
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2014 Wat een heerlijk biertje. Mooie donkere kleur, met veel smaak combinaties. Engelendrank!!

Best beer ever with a nice taste. The numbers 6 and 8 are also very good.
Are all the same beers with the same ingredients, but the combination differs.

Complex aroma, some fruits, some maltiness, some caramel... Pours very dark brown, good lasting head, nice carbonation. Pretty sweet. Long finish. Medium body? Medium to full perhaps. Overall one of the best trappists beers Ive ever tasted and, whether you like the (strong) style or not, worth a try!

Pours a very dark brown, fluffy, carbonated medium head. Smells ... Fruits, plums, dried fruit maybe banana some caramel, malty & slight yeast. Tastes..more dark fruits and dried fruits (banana), caramels, malts, roasty action. Long lasting wonderful finish.
Dark color. Nice fruity aroma. Upon first drinking a note of plum and roasted malt hit the tongue. Sweet and full the drink is one of the best in the world!!!
Very highly carbonated, brownish colour.       Seemed slightly dull/lifeless to me.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur brune foncée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (prunes, raisins, notes de figues, de cerises et de pommes), de caramel toffee, moyen dépices (poivre, léger de clou de girofle), léger de chocolat, de sucre brun et dalcool avec des notes de pain grillé. Plutôt ronde en bouche et moyennement pétillante avec une texture sirupeuse et aux petites notes liquoreuses. Goût de levures fruitées (cerises noires, raisins légèrement vineux, léger de prunes, notes de figues) et légèrement épicées (clou de girofle, petites notes poivrées) ainsi que des notes de mélasse terreuses lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de caramel toffee sucré aux notes rôties avec un moyen goût de sucre brun doux et un léger goût de pain grillé. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un goût dalcool moyen aux notes vineuses et réchauffantes avec quelques notes de chocolat noir jusquen finale,où une légère amertume de houblon herbeux  vient se joindre à la danse. Post-goût long et un peu sec, composé dun goût légèrement amer dalcool doux et de houblon herbeux avec un goût de levures fruitées (pelures de raisins vineux et de prunes) ainsi quun léger résiduel de caramel et de faibles traces épicées.
I think I prefer Trappistes 8 to Trappistes 10, but its a toss up. Definitely worth trying if you havent yet.
Cervezaca con toques míticos, olores a plátano y frutas. Un sabor increíble en boca, la llena sin dudarlo sin sentir ni burbujas ni nada alcohólico. Repetire mil veces sin duda.

This is one of my favorite beer.  It taste great an looks nice in the glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Almost black/somewhat brown color. Lots of carbonation and notes of grass and blackcurrant leaves. Some notes of rasins. However the taste does not match the nose. Feels flat and not that interesting.

Pours dark brown, slightly cloudy, foamy head that stays forever and laces thickly to the last drop.
Nose is syrupy sweet malt with dried fruits and a hint of straw.
Taste is strong sweetness up front, a bit of tartness and booze, and then a hint of bitterness in the end.
Creamy mouthfeel, lively carbonation.
Very nice brew!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

For me one of the best beers. I like the flavor which is very rich. Its a beer i like to drink after an hard day of work, at the fire. You can drink it after a good meal. There is a long tradition and knowledge of cisterciëncermonks in it.
What more can I say about this beer that hasnt already been said, its about as good as a  Quad gets; I havent tried Westy 12, though.

Drank at the buitenlist bottle to glass... small white/beige head... dark brown/black colour "clear"... smells like hops somewhat herbal.. taste herbal stays not much hops though still very good beer very nice alcohol level and feeling...
Best tasting beer there is. But to drink i prefer a chimay or a sint bernardus abt 12

Bottle from Barley Wine, Copenhagen - A dark brown pour with a medium off-white head. Fruity dark fruit aroma and taste, dates, raisins, currants. Sweet boozy alcohol in the finish which is lovely and smooth. Very satisfying and can only imagine how this will get better in time with storage. Beautiful.

0,33 bottle. Frothy nice head. Rum, raisins almost a dessert in itself. Fantastic aromas and a wellbalanced ale. Alco is very hidden for high ABV
Love it

I think I might have stumbled upon a wrong bottle.... It did not taste anything like the descriptions I read here. Instead, the taste was unbalanced, too strong and too medicinal. Maybe Ill try another one in the nearby future, because my friend had another bottle of this beer that seemed to taste much better.

330ml bottle from Breeze Thru. Pours a murky reddish brown with a bit of foamy off-brown head. Some lacing. Aroma has dark fruits (raisins, prunes, plums - dare say figs??) with sweet caramel and an earthy spicyness. First sip is of grapey-chocolate. Subsequent sips are of sweet fruits with multi-layered complexity, some bitter dark chocolate, a thick malt base with a lot of caramel/toffee/molasses character and some salty tangy licorice. Quite a muddle of flavors really led by the dark fruit/malt density. Thick and syrupy, with the alcohol kicking in with its presence to make it a sipper. Finishes sweet and strong with a lengthy licorice-y kick. Was it loveable, no - probably too alcoholly to love. Was it tasty, sure.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 Brown pour with off white head. Candy, syrupy, golden raisin  aroma. Taste is sweet raisin with thick feel.

Dark brown hazy pour, with a small offwhite head that clings. Aroma is Candysugar, with a sitrusy, almost dishwasher-soapy smell. Taste is soapy, heavy on the spices, not as sweet as most quads, but a long sweet aftertaste, accompanied by some alcohol. All in all a great brew.

Bronse and dark brown cloudy liquid. Tiny head that covers the liquid(more than both westvleteren and st. bernardus). Strange smell of something soapy citrusy and sweet. Taste very spicy but at the same time well balanced spicyness. Quite viscous and not that much alcohol flavour.

Poured an opaque mahogany with a large light brown head that settled down to a nice constant 1/2 finger ring.  Aroma is dark fruit, raisins, cherries, and some malt and caramel.  Taste is slightly sweet and salty with a little souring cherry thrown in.  All with a nice slight alcohol warmth.  Extremely complex and well-balanced.  Medium body with a tingle of carbonation followed by an astringent finish - not quite champagne dry.  This is a good example of what a good Belgian beer can be.  Perfectly deserving of the rating.

Got to love a big, smooth, dark Belgian that you can get just about year round. Hazy brown pour with a thick head. Nose of malt and some fruit. Just a little carbonation, smooth, a bit spicy and really nice!

It had a very strong aroma of dark fruits like prunes.  When I poured it into the glass it had a dark brown color with a very light caramel head.  The taste was a mix of darker fruits and a light roasted nutty taste.  All in all a great beer, but for this style I prefer st. Bernardus apt 12.

33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours murky dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma of very dark fruits. Full body, soft carbonation, soft bitterness, a bit salty aftertaste. Nice one but not that amazing

330 ml (11.2 oz.) bottle.  Pours a dark, cola brown.  In fact, it looks just like Coca-cola.  Has a light-brown head that dissipates quickly.  Aromas of chocolate, caramel, and raisins.  Taste is, WOW!  Lightly-sweet, but not overly so, with flavors of cola, plum, and another fruit that I cant quite put my finger on.  Has a medium body and texture.  Carbonation is pretty lively.  Finish is smooth and long with hints of brown sugar.

This is one fine beer.  The only thing I might be inclined to change would be to make it a little fuller in body.

Schiuma beige cremosa ed alta e di lunga durata, colore marrone scuro, aroma di frutta candita, di confettura di fichi , al palato si  percepisce un amaro importante dato dai luppoli seguito da una dolcezza dei malti in cui si percepisce uva passa, madera,porto, un grande corpo con un finale sgrassante e secco, questa, e una regina delle birre belghe. Grande birra trappista!!

Poured in a duvel glass. Notes of dark fruit, raisins, plums very interesting smelling beer. Tastes just like it smells with an almost rum like finish. This beer is phenomenal a must have, world class beer.

This is just the beginning and end .... the TOTAL beer experience.  Depth of flavour, malts, sweetness, moderated bitterness, raisins, caramel, leather, marmalade zing, deep floral dreamlines.  Yummy.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2013 Una delle migliori birre mai bevute. Aroma di malto e caramello liquorosi. Schiuma abbondante. Sapore di caramello e malto tostato, densità liquorosa al palato. Corposa, aromatica, complessa, una birra da meditazione non da tutti i giorni. Retrogusto intenso tendente al caffè e all?amarognolo, sicuramente piacevole. Carbonazione media ma perfetta. Birra estremamente equilibrata e armoniosa non dimostra al palato i suoi 11,3°. Ottima.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 Nose is molasses, marzipan rasins, sugar, black cherry, figs. Rich oak appearance. Taste is dates, plums, raisins, blackcurrants, sugar, leading spice a hint of pepper and almonds. Slightly sticky mouthfeel. Very good beer that is perfect for a winter evening.
One of the best beer there is in Belgium. absolute top quality belgian style

Very dark brown. Hazy and plenty if sediment. Off white medium head. Aroma is as advertised. Plenty if dark fruit. Very raisiny. Lots of plum. No booziness to speak of. A little bit of roastiness too in the aroma. Flavors are very similar but the black currant starts to come through more. Very clean for a quad. Easy to drink but still very complex. 

---Rated via iPhone

UPDATED: APR 11, 2013 Aroma: blackberry, chocolate, citrus, caramel?; Appearance: very dark brown, hazy, minimal off-white head; Taste: medium sweetness, medium-low bitterness, very lightly sour and "alcoholic"; Palate: full body, smooth, creamy and thick feel; quite soft carbonation; long dry and "fruity" finish, warm with alcohol; Overall: perfect balance, great taste, fantastic aroma, 11,3% not so obvious, Great Beer

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2013 appearance: Dark wood brown with creme/beige/mocca head. 

smell: I get dark ripe fruits right away, together with caramel / brown sugar. 

taste: First sip is quite alcohol heavy, together with ripe fruits and caramel and brown sugar at the end. The next sip the alcohol starts to mellow out. I get more flavors, like dates, raisins and plum, bready, getting some full sweetness of caramel up the nose. Some medicinal / phenol stuff going on as well. Got some peppery spice with alcohol. Mainly the brown sugar with (quite heavy) alcohol taste remains as a finish. 

mouthfeel: Medium thick and quite some carbonation. Alcohol as a spicy kick.

overall: I do like the flavor profile. The only thing is that the alcohol taste, especially in the finish, is just a tad too heavy. Good beer, dont drink it too cold, because youll lose all the flavors.
This is a beautiful beer! Thus is definitely one on my top beers to drink list and should be one everyones.

Brun färgad som kraftigt oxiderat koppar, fast ljus brunt skum. Doft: Lakrits, jäst, citrus, äpplen, trä. Smak: Honungsmelon, röda äpplen, päron, riktigt mogen och söt apelsin, torkad aprikos, kiwi, mm. Van vid spritig smak från denna öl, känner inte alls av det denna gång.

33cl bottle. Small off white head, leaves a nice layer. Color is turbid, brown and grey, as of rotten fruit. Aroma has plum, apple, sugar and prune. Flavour is licorice, cough syrup, fruits and toffee. All roasted.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad
0,33 l bottle shared with friends. Clear caramel colored bodybeige small head. Light port notes, caramel, fruity dried fruits nose. Sweet pungent spicy dried fruits, alco warm. Complex and wonderful.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 Pours a very dark, almost black, brown/mahogany with one and half fingers of off-white head. There is a subtle amount of carbonation with slight lacing. Nose is very fruity and sweet up front. A lot of dark fruits mixed with some caramel, chocolate and an awesome yeast presence. Mouth is very similar. A lot of dark fruits, mainly plum, black cherry and figs. Strong notes of licorice, spice, yeast and caramel. The alcohol is present at the towards the end but its very subtle and warming. This beer finishes very smooth.

~Strong prune aroma with other dark fruits that I cant describe and a tabacco smoke, also bready maltiness with fruit candy.
~Pours a dark amber with yeast chunks. Small lasting off white head.
~Raisin and prune in flavor with light smokiness and caramel sweetness. Balanced but on the sweet side. Alcohol sweetness
~Medium full bodied, with high CO2, Slight alcohol burn.  Sweet candied finish.
~I just had La Trappe Quad and like it quite a bit better than this one.  This is a bit sweet and doesnt seem as interesting to me. Enjoyable brew, but wont buy again.

11.2oz bottle, drank in a pint glass. Aroma is of rich chocolate, malt, and a hint of citrus. Pours black with a nice tan-white head. Taste is to complex to do justice to. Roasty, bready, chocolaty, creamy, with just a hint of alcohol and hops. Warming as it goes down. Lots of sweetness in this beer and the mouth feel is large and a prefect accompaniment to the flavor. Most likely the best beer Ive ever had, but could only be drank as a desert feature. Would be to rich to pair with anything.

330 ml bottle.  Dark, dark brown pour with a thick off-white head that eventually diminishes to nothing and leaves no lacing.  Some sort of sediment discolored the head but mostly remained in the bottle.  Malty, dark fruit aromas, light yeast, brown sugar, herbs and alcohol hit the nose.  Medium to full body with an unprecedented creamy and smooth mouth feel.  Perfect carbonation.  Exceptional flavor, dark bread malts, pepper, soft yeast, leafy hops, caramel, and other complexities.  The alcohol is hidden well, but thats not to say it isnt warming.  This is the best widely distributed beer and is a must try.

Dark, unclear beer, and unable to see trough it. Nice aroma of alcohol and sweet banana. It tastes like alcohol, with sweetness in the background. The aftertaste is bittersweet.

Donker troebel bier. Weinig zicht door het bier heen. Mooi aroma van alcohol en zoete banaan. Dit is ook lekker aanwezig. In de smaak is volop de alcohol aanwezig, met op de achtergrond iets zoetigs. De nasmaak is bitterzoet.
I love the maltyness and the balance with the alcohol in this beer. The head dissipates quickly. The mouthfeel is slightly heavy.
E cioccolata. Cannella. Narghile alla mela. A Istambul. Una birra bella, spettacolare e unica. In alto i nostri cuori!
Bottle. A superbly complex beer. One of the all time classics that comfortably lives up to the hype.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2013 Bottle at home; 2011 Vintage. Tasted side-by-side with Westy 12 and Berny 12. Pour is deep mahogany with a big tan head and great lacing. Big dark fruits, ripe cherries, caramel, big banana, a touch of clove, sweet brown sugar, toffee, and red licorice in the aroma. I have to give the edge to Rochefort 10 compared to the other two. Taste is sweet fruits, black currants, red grapes, somewhat caramelly, spice, bread, vinous, and sweet plums with a touch alcohol on the finish. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Easily one of the best beers I have ever had and definitely an institution for quadrupels. I have to give the edge to Rochefort 10 and for the money this beer  is by far the way to go. The best Quad I have ever had.

Really nice murky brown color. Definitely turns a few heads because it looks cloudy or hazy, unlike most beers. Smells like I just opened a container of raisins. For a brew with 11.3% ABV, this hides it very well. It has flavors of prunes or raisins. Pretty sweet and smooth. On the palate, I taste grape skins. This finishes almost like a sweet wine. Overall, a great beer. I am glad I got lucky and found the one bottle sitting amidst the mix-n-match 6-pack selection at my local grocery store.

First time having this beer. 12 oz. Bottle. Aroma is mild with hints of plums and raisons. Pours a malty, toffee, hazy drunk brown color. Almost no head or lace. Very bold flavor with plums and raisons. Mild alcohol taste for a 11+ beer abv. Love the soft treatment of the palette.

2013/01/06 - Pours a murky dark toffee brown with an off white head the dissipates quickly. Smells of caramel, vanilla, toffee, dark fruits (raisins, plums and cherries). Taste is sweet up front with hints of caramel and dark fruits. Has a dry, boozy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAY 4, 2013 A great beer with a abundance of flavours.  Blackberry, Dark Chocolate, Prunes, Raisins and all the dark fruits you can think of.

33cL bottle in Belgium. Pours dark brown molasses. Smells strongly of butter toffee with yeast, brown sugar, and a hint of nut. Flavor is a strong mix of alcohol, toffee, fresh creamy butter, molasses, brown sugar, nut, and yeast with some spice too. Very light and fuzzy/bubbly. But not as light or smooth as other quads (e.g., Westvleteren or De Konigshoeven). As expected though, its still very good.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2013 Pours nice tan foamy head, like root beer float.  Very deep amber, or brown with slightest hint of amber.  First thing that jumps out with the aroma is raisins or dried apricots.  Spicy caramel after that, but for me much lighter than the fruit.  Crisp carbonation. Sweet but balanced. Mild yeast, strong fruit, light roasted malt?  Not in that order. Takes a while to get all the flavors after a drink. Warm alcohol, not biting.  Fantastic. Beer.
It is so strange that a so strong beer can become so smooth when drunk. It pours a lovely dark beer and smells as good as it tastes. The only problem is that a 0,33 cl bottle is just not enough...

Bottle poured dark almost black brown, with a minimal tan head. Great nose, brown sugar, malts and fruits (raisins and/or plums). Taste,  this beer is simply Delicious, sweet but not too sweet, malts, caramel and raisins is so smooth that you dont feel the high ABV. Very easy to drink but at the same time full bodied and complex flavor.

Clássica e autentica Belgium Dark Strong Ale trapista simplesmente deliciosa! Desce no copo fazendo uma espuma densa e bege, encimando o liquido escuro, opaco. O aroma é surpreendente: álcool, frutas secas, ameixas, carvalho, intenso e duradouro. Logo no primeiro gole, sentimos o poder da breja. A carbonataçao extrema da um toque picante que se junta com o doce típico do estilo. O resultado final é uma complexidade de sensasações, indo de especiarias, passando pela ameixa, banana-passa, pão, com um final alcoólico bastante duradouro. O retrogosto é persistente e igualmente intenso, com o álcool se sobressaindo. Talvez se nao tivesse tanto álcool, ficaria um pouco mais equilibrada, mas isso nao deixou em nada a desejar. Ótima!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Très bonne biere! Par contre, je trouve quelle ne mousse pas beaucoup. On reconnait bien le style belge dune bonne brune. Jadore

Pours dark brown to black. Minimal head. Aroma of currants, plum, brown sugar.  Doesn't taste as hot as 8.  Flavor of raisins, dates.  So good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Heerlijk genieten, lekkere aromas! Volle smaak, lekkere nasmaak. Dit smaakt naar meer.
330 ml bottle. Aroma lovely; malt, dark sugar, "green" minty notes. Taste: dark sugar, pears, rich and full flavor. Great beer

Intenese brown colour with stable white (a bit yellow) cap. Moderate sweet rich taste, easy enjoyable. (Came to Delirium cafe to try this after RB top list during my 1 day trip - instead of lunch btw :))
Sweet aroma, excellent belgian style beer. Slightly sugar sweet with fruit and slight alcohol flavor. Incredibly smooth finish. Easy to drink and yet full flavored and heavy.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 dark brown colour, some beige head; aroma of dried fruits, green apple, cheese notes and some minimal chocolate; taste of roasted sugar (maybe some chocolate), dried fruits, apple, some bitterness and alcoholic sweetness; despite the very high alcohol content (11.3%), it is not disturbingly intensive, but quite realizable; best belgian ale Ive ever tasted so far.

I ws very excited to try this.  It did not disappointment.  Very drinkable.  Great color and flavor.  One of my favorites for this style of beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours murky dark brown. Aromas of plum and raisin, but very strong (bottle too cold?). Slightly sweet, creamy, complex and full. A really wonderful beer. Top class.

A handbook like trappist, almost perfect. Clear and quite strong aroma is well balanced with taste. Very stylish appearance with dark red tones. Taste is smooth and clear with wide taste spectrum. Alcohol comes trough only a bit, what I think is ok on trappist. But, when I couldnt avoid  of thinking, that this is quite like Chimay Blue (and strong rival), I also realized the drawbacks: there is nothing unique in this beer. No basement aromas or any other qualities that kind of belong to the trappist. A bit too sterile feeling in all aspects makes this world class beer "only" almost perfect.

Bottle.  Highly carbonated.  Malty taste with raisin taste.  Decent beer, not something I could drink all night.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a very dark amber with a beige head. Pretty neutral bar aromas, authentic ambience since Im now actually at a bar. Some dark fruit I guess. Taste is remarkably smooth. Quenching, actually. Some roast, rum soaked fruit. Some cig butts. Good.

11.2 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy dark brown with red highlights and a nice off-white head about 1/4 the size of the pour.  Aroma is toasty and bready with coffee, toffee, and banana.  Taste is sweet with plum and cherry and some bitterness at the end.  Tasty quad.

Bottle at sampling session. 2008 vintage. From notes (Nov. 12, 2011). Great red berry aroma. Sharp metallic initial. Fruit flavors run over the tongue. Finshes like a dream.... This beer has aged soooo well.

Du bonheur en bouteille. Liquide riche, brun foncé, dont les odeurs évoquent les prunes et le raisin ; au goûter, on décèle du sucre cuit, des bleuets et des épices. Nez floral puissant et invitant. Belle robe opaque, effervescence parfaite. Parfaitement balancée. Pratiquement aucun défaut, et ce à tous les paliers. Un réel délice.
Sticky sweet fruity bread aroma. Taste extremely malty with fuity notes from the yeast. sticks to the palate like glue (in a good way). Love it. favorite belgian to date!

Good grief... This beer was enough to make me want to finally sign up for this site if that means anything. 

As good as sex...

Aroma: Very deep, chocolaty, malty heavy smell. A hint of fruitiness but not very much.

Appearance: A dark but ever so slightly opaque look... caramel and chocolate look for sure with about 55% light transfer.

Taste: One word... WOW. As i said this beer is what made me sign up on this site... i feel i need to tell the whole world! It is a heavy COMPLEX burst of tasty flavors. I cannot describe it; just try it yourself. Redefines a quad for sure.

Palate: Easy to drink with very little taste of the potent 11.3% ABV that is in there. It flows and fizzes like it was made specifically for me. 

Overall: The best beer i have had yet... i will be blown away if i come across another that is better/more enjoyable than this brew. 
You NEED to try this one for sure.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Deep dark hazy brown colour, with beige thick head, not long lasting. Aroma of chocolate, toffee, dry fruit, and alcohol. Rich taste of chocolate, raisins and other spices, liquorice.
Very complex beer, amazing to discover every time.

Pours a bronzy dark brown with a thin bubbly foam atop the ale. Aromas are boozy & rich with caramel, candi sugar, earth, spice, ripe dark fruit. Tastes are boozy & sweet with spiciness, fruit, yeast, raisin, rum, brown sugar, molasses, earth, pepper, buttery. Mouth-feel is rich & smooth with plenty of carbonation. Overall, one of the best beers in the world and spot-on for whats expected from the style. Prefer this beer to Westvleteren 12.

Rochefort 10 is een zeer donker roodachtig bruine Trappist
Aroma van, rozijnen, alcohol en donker fruit en een hint van chocolade.
De eerste smaak is karamel, dan donker fruit (zwarte bessen, rozijnen), karamelkoekjes, drop en hints van chocolade en geroosterde amandelen.
Smaak is zeer rijk, bijna overweldigend met alcohol.

Bottle 0.33cl from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Pours dark and reddish brown. Aroma is sweet malts, nuts, yeast, dark fruits, figs and alcohol. Wow, this beer has one of the most complex and invigorating aromas around.
Lovely balanced taste of dark fruits, nuts, warming alcohol. This is a great beer indeed.

I just had this beer and i have to accept its absolutely one of the best beers I ever tasted. Only the Sint Bernardus 12 seems to be close. The taste is very full and has a kind of wooden taste. The Westvleteren 8 is absolutely more fruity, but less exceptionnal. 

I absolutely recommend the beer and the website that helped me to get the beer for a good price (even if i dont know if this is allowed in my review: http://westvleteren12.webs.com/ ) 

Enjoye

Good god what a nose. Beautiful deep plummy figgy chocolatey nose. Profound and complex.If the aroma could talk it would speak like James Earl Jones.
Pours deep red brown with almost purply highlights and eventually forms a contant strong thin line of head.
Tastes like it smells. Like having your mouth massaged with chocolate. Body is slightly acidic yet firm bit in time integrates and leads to an outstandingly  long sappy sweet soft smoothness.

Bottle at Amsterdam Ale House. Pours murky dark brown beer with huge tan head, thick and lingering for a long time. Very complex aroma of portwine, dark fruits, nuts. Taste is full, similar to aroma, rich and fruity, a good deal of alcoholic warmth. Medium carbonation and heavy body. A top Belgium.

Brown ale. Médium head. Mainly Fruity aromas but some malty notes like cream and vanilla which introduce complexity. Medium and oleous body. Sweet taste and a warm sensation in mouth because of the high alcohol. Long ending with retronasal aromas of caramel and vanilla. It is a very nice beer. 

Filip

Aroma of brown sugar, cinnamon, Carmel, brown bread.  Dark brown color.   Thick head.  Has "legs".  Sweet creamy flavor.  Brown sugar cinnamon and some four fruit.  A touch of Belgian "wang", but manageable.  A very nicely crafted beer.
Jaha Stefan. Jag antar att du kommer läsa detta så.... Känns som vi får träffas oftare om du ska lyckas få mig att tycka om denna ölen! Aroman är ok+ men alltså smaken...... Bättre än 8an dock !
Pours dark brown with tan head.  Sweet malty nose.  Syrupy malt with some heat from alcohol.  Dark fruit to raison flavor.   Drinks mighty easy for high alcohol

Bottle. Pours hazy dark copper brown with airy off-white head. Dark aroma of maæt, caramel, raisins and fruits. A discreet boozy in the long nose. Delicious, perfectly balanced bittersweet taste of malt, hops, rasins and fruit, turning into a delicate sourish falvour ending in a sweet roasted note. Great.

330 ml bottle @ Grunerløkka Brygghus, Oslo,Norway
January 09,2012
One of my all time  favorite beers.
Malty and a bit caramel.Dark brown color.
Lots of alcohol,but in a positive way.
Nice Trappist beer.Well worth the high price.

11.2oz Bottles A - Pours a hazy dark brown with a lingering one finger khaki head. Can tell there are some floaters in there. Mild lacing. S - Sutle, but interesting.  Licorice, faint dark cherries, yeast, and very faint booze. T - Complex. Sweet malt, licorice, dark fruit, raisins, cherries. Alcohol is hidden well. M - Full bodied. Sweet lingering after taste. O - A special treat.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2013 2013.01.14 - Trappistes Rochefort 10 - 11.2oz bottle in goblet. Bottle marked 220616 10:34. Iâve had a number of these but never rated, apparently. Pours a deep chestnut sort of brown, mostly clear but dark. Very light tan or white head is fizzy but disappears quickly to remnants and a bit of lacey ring. Aroma is much less bready yeast than many Belgians. there is a bit ofsomething in this like caramel or toffee. Iâm even catching a little butter as it warms up. Unexpected, but it smells good. Taste is pretty the same. there is definitely something going on like licorice or treacle, or toffee. Kind of a bell curve, front end carbonation ramping up to these favors, then fading out to a mild bit of medicinal alcohol bite. Mouthfeel is pretty light, not really creamy. Mid carbonation. This is pretty tasty. Alcohol is pretty well hidden for 11.3% abv. A nice quad, highly rated for good reason. Not a "omg I love this" quad, but certainly very well done and tasty.  I can definitely drink several in a row.  Frequent purchase worthy.  Aroma 8/10, Appearance 4/5, Taste 8/10, Palate 3/5, Overall 18/20

Pours a frothy light brown head that mostly diminishes. Body is hazy and reddish black. Aroma contains caramel, lemon, dough, banana, raisin, plum, date, cherry, cassis, red wine, tawny port, toffee, brown sugar, spices, vanilla and alcohol. Flavor starts off light acidic, to go to sweet. Bitterness is subtlely present all the time. Body is medium to full, texture creamy and carbonation soft. Balanced, complex, great! Another example of the great trappists!

Treu Belgium quad.  Dark pour, decent head, full body, thick feel, average carbonation,  medium sweetness.  Worth the price, excellent beer, alcohol is hidden, but it gives you the warming feeling, and the alcohol will hit you.

Strong alcohol almost floral smell.  Sweet almost burnt toffee taste with fruitiness. Slight burn and spiciness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beautiful brown color, moderate head, little lacing.  Nice dark fruit and caramel smell.  Same in taste with little hoppiness.  Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rich aroma of raisin, alcohol, and sherry. Dark brown slightly cloudy with a foamy white head. Flavors of raisin, chocolate, and a little butteriness. Full bodied with a alcoholic warmth. Enjoyable beer.

de couleur brun tres fonce elle a un eforte presente de fruits confit et de caramel dans melange liquoreux tres tres doux au gout malgre la presence des 11,3 % d alcool c est la force de cette biere elle a beaucoup de corps et presente mais toute en douceur chaque gorge est tres complexe c est une biere fantastique  divine (rate 35)

Bottle at The Nomad (Minneapolis, Minnesota)
Aroma: dates, plums, toast, and caramel
Appearance: dark brown, hazy, big frothy tan head
Taste: malty, quite sweet
Palate: medium bodied, sticky, with a pretty lively carbonation.
Ive had this one a few times, most recently from a corner shop that I walked in to on Christmas eve in Brussels. Its very good, cheap, and can be found almost anywhere. Definitely a favorite.

Vajaa vuoden kypsytelty versio arvioinnissa. Kaatuu lasiin tummanruskeana yllättävän niukalla ja katoavalla vaahdolla, joka kuitenkin jää oluen pinnalle pieninä saarekkeina. Haju on todella moniulotteinen ja siitä löytyy ainakin kuivattua hedelmää, luumua, rypälettä, suklaata, lakritsia ja taustalla anistakin. Maku on hyökkäävän aniksinen, jonka jälkeen tulee luumua, sitrusta, kiuvattua hedelmää, lakritsia ja mietoa puunmakua esiin. Muos hieman sokerisuutta nousee suuhun. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen ja lievä katkeruus jää kutittelemaan kielelle. Kokonaisuutena yksi parhaista juomistani oluista, joka joka suullisella kutsuu juomaan aina uuden kulauksen.

Aroma:  Dates, raisins, plums.  Vinous, caramel ... theres a lot of crazy sweet deliciousness promised by this aroma.  Bread, baking spices.  Toffee.  Port.  Damn.  Appearance:  very dark brown with some red when held to the light. Creamy offwhite head, long retention.  Taste:  quite sweet and wonderful.  Toasted bread and biscuit.  
Mouthfeel:  Alcohol in finish.  Slick, almost syrupy.  Full body.  Lively carb, great lasting finish.  Overall:  Fantastic.

Dark brown with a thick, big light brown foam. Aroma is woody and fresh, quite appealing and strong. Taste is strong, malty, oddly fruity and overwhelming in a good way. There are caramel, coffee and herbal notes. Alcohol pushes through a bit at first, but disappears somewhat after a while as you probably get used to it. Quite an achievement, considering how much of it there is. All in all quite pleasant beer with a lot to it.
Es impresionante. Da aromas en frío y a medida que se va atemperando va ganando matices.

Wow. Finally got my hands on a bottle of this. Poured into a belgian ale glass. Medium off white head that dissipates quickly. Beautiful dark brown color which appears very thick. Tantalizing aroma of various aged fruits including figs, dates, raisins, and brown sugar. Tastes even better than it smells. Sweet, but not overly so. Dark cherry, raisins, figs, and burnt sugar all work together to make this the most delicious belgian ale I have ever tasted. For such a high alcohol content (11.3%), there is only a hint of an alcohol taste on the finish. Lively carbonation with a full body. I already want more!
Bouteille de 330m, robe brune foncée aux reflets rubis, arôme de petits fruits sauvages, goût qui rappelle les arômes.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2013 Ikke noe spesielt øl.  Greit leskende men ikke noen stor stjerne.  Kort sagt nei takk men gjerne ett glass vann.
Geweldig bier. Mooie kleur, mooie schuimkraag, fijne smaak. Die monniken kunnen brouwen!
Bottle at home (Whole Foods). Big, beautiful, dark pour. Smooth, full taste with complex taste, slight fruitiness.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2016 0.33l bottle. Very dark brown, almost black body with a nice beige head that dissappears quite quickly. Very complex aroma with caramel, reisins, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, yeasts and floral hops. Taste is amazing as well. Lots of caramel, fruity hops, coffee and chocolate. Really sweet when you sip it, but the aftertaste is hoppy. Warming alcohol. Amazing beer. After a while, lots of sediment gathers at the bottom of the glass.

Appearance: pretty much black, small dark head that fades quickly, possibly a hint of brown when held up to the light, some brown yeast particles at the bottom Aroma: very sweet, fruity, very intense amazing smell Taste: very sweet, fruity, slightly bitter on the finish, some alcohol Palate: feels heavy on the tongue, slight bitter hoppy aftertaste, Overall: one of the most intense smelling beers Ive had, I have to dock it for that alcohol that comes thru over 11%, ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a sniffer. Color is deep brown with a slight ruby red tint. Big off-white head, that ends up being about a finger high. Not much lacing. Aroma is malt and dark fruit, but as it warms I can detect the caramel and toasted bread smell. There is actually a lot going on in this smell. For a beer with 11% in it, I cannot really detect it in the smell. Taste is smooth too, slightly sweet, medium body and carbonation. Belgian Quads became one of my favorite style of beer before I moved to IPAs, and this is now at the top of the list. Its had to imagine what Westvleteren has on it.
brown, heavy cloying sweetness, full body, slick feel, lively, average carbonation, long finish, lightly bitter, lightly sour,

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2013 Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy dark brown with a large tan head. Aroma is great, a sweetness from dark sugar, cinnamon, raisins, vanilla, molasses. Taste follows the nose with a mild bitterness in the end. The alcohol is very well hidden.
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 Cloudy Dark Brown with a tan head.  Dried fruit aroma.  Very bubbly feel in mouth.  Champaign like feel.  Dried fruit flavors some brown sugar.  Very nice.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 It has a hazey brown color. This has a great flavor and is one of the best beers Ive tasted.

Dark brown murky pour with a lot of sediment. Thin tan head tha stayed around forever. Aroma is dark fruit, plums, raisins, caramel, some chocolate notes. Surprisingly subtle beer, but complex at te same time. Flavor is full of more dark fruit, slight chocolate notes. Alcohol is extremely well hidden. Excellent beer.

Dark, cloudy caramel brown with thin off white lacing. Cocoa nib, raisin and coffee on the nose. Rich, smooth palate...heavy on cocoa flavour, with hints of gingerbread, banana, clove, coffee, anise and raisin. Big, definitely a sipping beer. Wonderful.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 Bought a bottle that went bad.  WAY too much fizz out of the bottle.  Contaminated?  Date on bottle said good until 2018.  Big letdown, waste of money.  I have to dock it overall for lack of quality control.  
On tap @ Busters on 28th.  Pours murky nutbrown color with lots of sediment.  Head is thin, spread wide in a trappist glass and sticks around as a thin layer.  Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, and alcohol.  Not in-your-face, but very complex and enjoyable.  Taste is similar to smell - dark fruits like raisin and plum, but the alcohol is incredibly well-hidden.  Its there, but not double-digit ABV there.  The alcohol shows itself more as it warms, but by then its warming you and its supremely enjoyable.  As you near the bottom of the glass, you notice the tons of sediment in the drink, some of which are pretty large flakes.  9+5+8+4+18=4.4

Pours deep brown-red with some haze. Minimal head. The aroma is incredible - at first I get sweet toasty malt, fresh strawberry, red wine, cherry. There is some spiciness happening later on - an underpinning of cinnamon, orange and vanilla. The taste is initially sweet, with rich caramel, plum and cherry. This leads to a bit of tannic astringency and a bittersweet finish, floral hop on lingering malt. Big-bodied but not cloying, a feat considering the medium carbonation. Everything works together to form a singular, beautiful whole - this is nearly perfect.

Upon opening the bottle, it took a while to adjust to the boozy, rum-like nose of the beer. After a while, scents of figs and dark chocolate are quaffable. It pours a dark-ruby/brown with oil-spill bubbles floating on the thin, off-white head and dark unfiltered specks settling. Minimal lacing. Upon the first sip, there is an instant warming effect. A spicy quad, this tastes like a sparkling red wine with notes of plum. There is a consistent tongue-tingle and warming of the throat. My one complaint is that this is a surprisingly thinly bodied quad, lacking the silkiness and pillowy texture of other quads.
(bottle 30/12-2012) Large beige fading head, dark brown color, caramel aroma, slightly sweet taste, complex taste, light alcohol taste. BB date 01.08.17.
Huge white head. Cloudy dark brown colour. Celestial caramel aroma. Extraordinary spicy taste and a roasty, caramel palate. This might be the best beer in the world.

from bottle straight into a trappist glass. pours a dark, deep red brown colour with a two finger frothy beige head. intense aroma of roasted malts, burned nuts, red wine, dark fruits and brown sugar. average carbonation, full body, kind of oily mouthfeel and a long lasting, pleasent sweet and warming finish. fantastic fruity and sweet malty flavours. this beer is full of complexity and pure enjoyment. fantastic brew!

Drank in a traditional Trappist glass. Aromas of dark fruits, caramel, vanilla, and alcohol. Has a muddy brown appearance through the top of the glass but dissipates into darkness. Tastes of bready malts, raisin, fig, and alcohol. Aftertaste is dry with an alcohol presence. Overall, this is what should be expected of high quality Trappist Ales. Nothing too shocking or surprising but a consistent product. A very good beer.

Very good. Dark fruit flavored. Musty, dry. Raisons, currants. Vintage character sediment swirls. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Biased because quads are one of my favorite styles.  Pours a deep chestnut/amber with very thin white head.  Aroma has the spice from the Belgian yeast you would expect, along with notes of overripe cherries, raisins, and caramel.  Nice carbonation to give it a lighter-than-expected mouthfeel.  Full and complex body.  Sweet with dark fruit notes (cherry primarily), just a hint of spice--clove and nutmeg come to mind, and a bit of roasted chocolate bitterness.  Great (and warming) on a cold winter night.
A rock in the beerworld. Always a secure value. Impressive (cf commercial description). Good mouthfeel. A complex balanced personality.

Bottle poured into trappist glass. Pours dark muddy brown with burgundy light shining through the top. Very little head on my pour, brownish offwhite color on what head there is. Plenty of alcohol legs, which is expected with the alcohol content. Decent amount of lacing on the outside as well. Smell is bready, yeasty, dark fruits such as raisins and plums. Getting a little spice maybe cinnamon or nutmeg. Reminds me of a warm piece of cinnamon raison bread. Absolutely a great smelling beer. Taste is much like the nose, tastes like im drinking a piece of bread dipped in cinammon raisin syrup. Definitely getting the alcohol taste but not anything overwhelming. Covers the pallete well and leaves you wanting another sip. Overall I have to say this beer is exactly what I thought it would be. I had high expectations for this beer and it met them. Definitely recommend this to anyone who hasnt tried it before.
Medium head dark chestnut colour, sweet caramel sirup smell, dark sweet taste medium carbonation caremel taste, a bit burned stays like a coffee aftertaste

I was surprised when I first tried this beer, as I was expecting it to be very similar to the St. Bernardus abt 12, but it is not at all similar. I would say this is more like a stronger & sweeter Westmalle dubbel.  It is none the less a lovely sweet, dark & strong belgian quad style beer. It is sweet initially, with a dry finish. The taste is of dark fruits, candy and dark chocolate. Overall very nice.

excellent, really great

pours with a medium head that slowly receeds. dark body that passes some light.

fantastic taste, dried fruit and berries, fairly bitter fruity finish. lovely mouth feel really thick

great beer, had it with my xmas dinner and it was perfect

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2013 3.5 month bottle vs 7 years - Deep dark brown with a thick, beige, disappearing head. Smells of spiced rum with caramel (the caramel becomes stronger in time), dark dried fruit becomes stronger over time fig, raisin, plum and cherry. Fruity but with a bit of alcohol. Lots of malt and roasted malt. Medium oily body with soft carbonation. Tastes of Christmas Pudding with rum. Tastes peppery with dark fruit with roasted malt and lots of caramel. In time, it becomes a more fused malt flavour with fruit. The finish has some warming with some chocolate and a some subdued fruit. The alcohol is present on the finish as well as in the aged version

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 Bouteille 330 ml. 11,3%. Couleur brune voilée, mousse beige. Arôme de fruits confits, alcool, malt....un peu de chocolat ! En bouche, notes de vin fortifié, un peu dépices, caramel, levure, alcool, fruits rouges mûrs, prunes noires. Finale en herbes, alcool et toffee. Une excellente bière, bien construite. On doit lui donner le mérite dêtre de grande qualité.

Pours a deep dark brown with no head. Aroma of candy, chocolate and caramel. Very sweet. Taste is dates, caramel, chocolate and alcohol. Strong alcohol finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Renk koyu kahve, cikolata.. Kokuda alkol ve asitise hakim. Hafif kirmizi meyve kokulari da var. icim yumusak, govdeli degil ama komplex. Dilde ve damakta hafif acilik, ardindan meyve tatlari vurmaya basliyor..

--- The Server

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2013 0.33 bottle. Much darker than the Rochefort 8 but still retains some of its purple and red tinge and the same kind of white, yeasty sediment on the bottom. Head is medium and brownish, disappears quite quickly. Malty aroma, coffee, wood, alcohol, definite chocolate, a little bit of dark fruits. Takes a few sips to grow accustomed to the plethora of savors flooding your mouth. A lot of dark fruits but its mostly their bitter side that is present, sweetness comes from malty flavors. Delicate fruity sourness looming somewhere in the background. Body is between medium and full with the indication to the latter. Fine thick texture, carbonation is just below average, much better than in 8. Overall this beer is genuinely great, not really my type but I have to admit its merit. It is undoubtedly more balanced and less astringent that 8, also much more consummate and tempered despite the strength of its flavor and a very high alcohol content, they could work on the aroma though. Will take me a lot more than this occasion to fully apprehend it.

Bottle into Rochefort abbey glass.  Dark carmel color.  Dark fruit, raisins and plums, carmel malts, toffee, slight belgian spices, a touch of sweetness.  Very well balanced between the belgian spices and dark fruit flavors.  easy drinking and better than I expected.  Much better than the St. B12, which compared to this seemed like a half hearted copy.  Possibly the first belgian beer that I really enjoyed.
Great aroma of alcohol, licorice, dark fruits and berries. maybe too much alcohol in the taste. No head - disappointing, but maybe expectable.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Dark brown with a soapy caramel head the inital taste is toffee, dates and sugar.  The aroma is quintissential Belgian Strong Dark Ale or dare i say Quad? I cant decide whether i prefer this or St Bernadus 12 which can only mean a tasting is in order. My only issue was the yeast, which where normally i dont mind, this however, clumped together through the beer.  A small observation for recording purposes.

Fantastic!  Pours dark brown,  caramel,  light tan head. Smell is fruit,  berries, raisins.  Taste is medium bodied,  malt,  fruity,  long lasting warm after taste.  Really enjoyed this. Would pair this with cheeses.
My second favourite beer so far, goes down very smooth and gets better the warmer it gets. I taste chocolate and caremel notes. Will continue buying this one on occasion for sure.
Poured in proper glassware. Dark dark colour. High carbonation. Let it settle till it reached slightly warmer temperature. Strong alcohol. Overall Excellent beer.
Pours dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is malts, fruit. Taste is malts, stone fruits, alcohol. Lively palate, dry slightly spicy finish.
Many fruit aromas with a sweet caramel malt. Highly carbonated with a warm alcohol aftertaste. Definitely a sipping beer.

Price: $6 / 330ml

Appearance: Reddish dark main with rusted perimeter. Standard khaki head for the style which is thick and low. 
Aroma: Rich in spices, fresh baked bread (like all trappists), and of blue berry jam. Smells slightly of alcohol which is contradicted in the flavor. 
Flavor: The usual caramel and brown sugar but rich with fresh dates, figs (and for that matter prunes), malt, hints of nutty bleu cheese. Purple fruit flavor overall with butterscotch and raisin finish. Has an almost powdered cocoa mid-palette or maybe its just from the sweetness fading to tart. 
Overall: Deceptive for such a dark beer to be as smooth and light bodied as it is. Heavy alcohol flavor but with such a high ABV that is nearly impossible to avoid. The only acidity detected would be that of a stale orange peel. Medium to low carbonation.
Placement: This beer is worthy of putting on a beer list. 

http://donovanmiske.wordpress.com

I drank this beer out of a bottle overlooking Swan Fall in the Snake River Canyon. Tasted ver good. My lady liked it a lot. Tool lovely photo of the bottle with Canyon in the background. Want to try it with a glass. Very drinkable and felt it fast. Love the story behind this beer.

330ml bottle from Cobbetts, Dorking. Pours a dark chocolate brown. Small caramel coloured head. Aroma is of toffee, coffee and slightly of wine. Taste: well, it does indeed taste fantastic but perhaps a little too complex for my young palate - Ill be drinking this again in a few hundred beers time. Anyway, tastes of coffee with an initial hit of alcohol with the "beer" taste coming after. I get the plums and a little smoke but not the raisin and blackcurrant as described.
UPDATED: JAN 15, 2013 Kjempegodt øl. Moderat med kullsyre. Lang ettersmak, litt bitter. Et godt vinterøl.....

This pours a solid brown color with a foamy beige head. The scent is bold with a mixture of tart fruits and yeast. The taste is smooth, mellow, and light to the taste buds. There is a mixture of sweet malts combined with spices, yeast, and toasted fruits. A very well craft brew that drinks seamlessly without a single flaw. Leaves behind some good lacing and a great aftertaste. If it wasnt for the cost Id say more please!

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2013 Very malty aroma, chocolate and coffee hints. The color is dark brown, the liquid cloudy and with sediments. The head is minimal, right after pouring the beer. The taste is magnificent. Full body, very complex and to explore in every new tasting. One of my favorite beers (maybe the most) without a doubt. The 8 is great and maybe more balanced, but this one is an explosion of sensations and will reward the most exquisite and patient palates. I recommend to drink it almost at room temperature, just a little cool, in order to enjoy completely all its wonderful aspects.

Pours a very dark copper brown but is very clear. Big & lingering tan head with some lacing. Very high carbonation for such a big beer.
The aroma is a toffee/plum with sweet notes and a little bit of heat.
The flavor is big and bold. Caramelized crystal malts on the front end giving off a sweet malty base and the esters of dried plums. It dries off fairly quickly and leaves a fruity sherry-like warmth to it.
Although the warmth is noticeable there is a good balance of elements and is very smooth.
Not picking up too much of that spicy Belgian character, but this is certainly a complex and enjoyable elixir. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at bar. Dark brown color, beige head. Strong malty taste with nuts, plum, bread, barnyard aroma, tart and hint of alcohol. Sweet finish with malts and earthy notes. Magnificent quadruppel.

Aroma is grape, toffee, touch of caramel. Appearance is a beautiful deep-brown colour with a tan head, some lace, all that is needed to top such a beer. Taste is grape, bourgundy especially, warm toffee, the slightest bubblegum or marshmellow flavour in sweetness, treacle too, and some spices. Palate is warm, spicey on tongue, thick but not toffee like, bitterness too in feel, but very subtle, gentle really. Overall, I wasnt even in the mood for this beer when I tried it and it still blew me away, WOW.

330ml bottle, poured into Leffe chalice. Colour was very dark copper, with auburn edges, opaque. One finger tanned head, very good retention, had a small scar on top of the head from the pour. Aroma was initally musty, notes of grape, caramel, malt, medicine and brown sugar. The first thing I noticed after pouring was that a could smell the beer from a lot further away than normal. Tasted medicine, brown sugar, molasses and strawberry. Booze was so well hidden I wondered if the decimal point was too far to the right. Texture was very smooth and almost moussy, very light body, perfection. Overall exceptional, aroma, look and mouthfull cant be improved. So far Ive never had a better beer.
Bottle pour.  First Quad I ever had. Dark fruits really add to the palate and make this a great tasting beer. $6.99 / bottle

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2013 Bottle bought at the Norwegian wine monopoly. This beer is like eating a chocolate or a very tasty dessert. Its a treat. Have never tasted anything this complex. Its an explosion of flavor; lots of vanilla, chocolate, caramel and liquorice. The aroma is delicious. Smooth and creamy with little taste of alcohol despite being a strong brew.
Dark colour, big capuccino head which does not last long, chocolate and a bit sour aroma, full taste, too much alcohol in aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2013 Tested the 2nd time and it turned out that my first bottle may have been bad. This 10 is a huge beer with lots of great aromas like chocolate, sweets, caramel and some alcohol. Maybe the best Belgian of my life. Especially compared to a good 6 and a great 8 - the 10 is a fantastic quality piwo.
OMG ! It smells like, ... like victory ! Its taste is a gift from our migthy Lord. It appears black because it is... My favorite beer ...

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Deep black colour meets a creamy, smoothy head combined with a very thick texture all together. Taste of roasted nuts, this flavour is really delicious and intensive. Further you may notice rich malt, honey, caramel, dark grains and butterscotch. Not easy to drink but delicious to enjoy.

pours opaque dark Dr.Pepper Brown with a noticeably smaller head, light ringed retention and just a few slow streams. Thick heavy malts on the nose with some molasses. Drinks with a heavy maltiness with 8/10-sweetness up front-creamish mouthfeel, tastes of molasses, light roast coffee, soy sauce, sarsaparilla, cocoa, finishing light tingly/fizzy with a med-deep malty medium bitter smooth finish. Medium complexity, med-high depth, good transitions, excellent carry, good drinkability. Substantially heavier than the 6 and 8, but just a smooth.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown a with a moderate off-white head. Nose has nominally sweet, but slightly sour notes with some stronger dark fruit in there. Taste is rather sweet and yeasty. Not my style.
Pours brown with a brown head. Strong arrival with notes of brown caramel, sweet malts, brown sugar. Very good!

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2012 Nice solid aroma, sugar and fresh grapes. For a non over hopped beer plenty of aroma. Appearance was lacking, head retention faded, but very cabonated to instill a constant head. Taste like heaven, its as mild as a soda, with a fruit flavor. Very amazing very smooth. Plum more than rasin, rasin is mild, easy on the tongue. WOW! I have to brew this. If they coudl fix carbonation... could be my top bier on earth? Thanks from my sister for bringing from Europe! Iâm gonna search for this. dated 04/04/17 for expire date... gonna age some for sure!

Fantastica birra trappista. Un capolavoro di quadruple, un corpo esagerato con un profumo eccelso, frutti rossi e note tostate/cioccolatose ne esaltano il gusto!!! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Perfectly nicknamed the "wonder" (la "merveille"), the Rochefort 10 is dressed with a magnificent black dress with a thick tan head. Aromas are caramel, coffee, roasted malts, plum, berries, liquorice and spicy hint. Medium bitterness and seetness, also slightly sour. Long sweet, alcoholic and fruity finish. Amazing beer !

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2013 Bottle at pikilinna, tampere. Dark hazy brown color, small white head. Aroma of plum, sweetness, little alcohol. Balanced full bodied taste licorice, sweetness, low co2, syrup. One of my favorite belgians.

Pours Dark brown with little tan head. Weird spicy yeast aroma. Brown sugar, rasins, funky yeast, dark fruit, Alcohol was pronounced at first then goes away completely when the mass amount of flavor hits you. Has the taste of a Flemish sour brown without being sour. Medium body.  Really unique, extremely complicated to explain.

Pours brown with sediment and minimal off white head.  Aroma is dark fruit, chocolate, port wine.  Taste is sweet raisins, dark fruit, port wine again.  Alcohol definitely noticeable. Not the biggest fan of the style but good stuff.

Dark brown in colour, thick creamy off-white head. Inviting aroma of stewed dark fruits, raisins, plums, roasted malt. Exceptional taste: spiced dark fruits, liquorice, port, a hint of dark chocolate, light yeast. Very complex. Velvety smooth and full mouthfeel. Medium high carbonation. Warming alcohol presence. Fantastic.
Aroma of raisin and taste of plum, coffee, toffee.  Sweetness lingers just for a moment.  Color is of rich, hazy coffee.  Very clean, enjoyable brew.

33cl bottle from Beers Of Europe.
Dark brown coloured beer with an off white head which looked great in its own brewery glass.
Roast malt and chocolate on the nose straight away followed by toffee and fruit.Did not linger too long on the aroma as after a couiple of seconds my tongue was now somewhere down by my boots with the thought of tastes to come.WOW!.Superb.Chocolate and port,raisins and toffee plus alcohol all beautifully blended together in this rich and warming drink.Next time i am in the "Welly" in Birmingham i will follow Rogers example and finish the night on one before the chill autumn/winter evenings walk back to the train.Truly lovely beer and like the Sint Bernardus 12 i would love to try this one in the 75cl size bottle in which it  occasionally appears.

Pours a rich muddy brown with off white head. Aroma is very clean, roasted malt with dried fruits/raisins. Taste is big raisins, dark chocolate, a little caramel. Very complex malty flavors that are hard to identify. Palate is slick and full with a sweet aftertaste. No hop flavors or aromas. Loved this beer.

Minimal aroma and amber pour with an incredibly balanced taste and mouthfeel that strengthens as it warms.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013 Poured into a goblet. Very dark brownish red appearance. Off white head that reduces quickly, but a bit sticks around. Smells fruity with malty goodness. Grape/raisin overtones. Very smooth taste. Fruity, medium carbonation. Balanced taste. Mature flavor. Definitely deserves its high praise.

Excellent taste with a sweet finish of plum and a small hint of molasses.  Reminiscent in color of a light oatmeal stout or similar in color to a rich brown ale. Flavor was exceptional with the slightly sharp tingle on the tongue to the finish and an ending pleasant palate.

330ml bottle. Pours murky dark brown with small tan head. Aromas of sweet caramel, vanilla, bread, toffee, and dark fruit. Flavors of toffee, caramel, raisins, dark fruit, bit of vanilla, and bready yeast. Carbonation is right on. Little bit of alcohol warmth in the end. Just at good as westy 12, although this was a much fresher bottle.
One off my favorites; strong with full flavor, fruity&spicy aromas like banana & licorice

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Deep dark nutbrown with thin beige head, lasting well. Lacing awesomly.
Aroma.. very complex and rich. A load of malts, dark fruits, chocolate, yeast, raisin, bit alcohol. Its not just a bomb of aroma, flavor.. its not just a complexity that makes this beer great..
what is.. its perfect balance. not too pushy in any of aspects, but it takes you into a journey of aroma and flavor. You cant stop enjoying one great aspect when next comes around
Full body. Long smooth finish and sparkling lips. Even thou its full bodied, rich and complex, its very refreshing and mild as well . Quite high carbonation.
Taste takes you from pleasant, not sticky, sweetness, to some hints of fruit sourness and some mild notes of bitterness. Long enjoyable finish.
If you can fall in love with beer, this one is worth that

#403
Dunkelbraun, leicht trüb mit einigen Schwebeteilchen; der Schaum ist rar und schnell fort. Ein zuerst malzig-würziges Aroma, das nach längerer Standzeit des Glases geradezu einem Dessertwein ähnelt (Mavrodaphne?). Der Antrunk ist auch einem Dessertwein ähnlich, stark und überbordend alkoholisch. Im Geschmack wird die Süße des Würzmalzes von der Hefe gut abgepuffert. Der Abgang ist primär wärmend vom Alkohol; der Hopfen kommt klar zu kurz, schade! Insgesamt ein ordentlicher Trappist, wenn ich auch -wie so oft- was dran zu nörgeln habe: Da fehlt mir ganz klar die Komplexität und Tiefe, die beispielsweise ein Orval bietet. Zwar trotz der 11,3% Alk. gut trinkbar, aber manch "normales" belgisches Abteibier hat eine größere Aromenvielfalt zu bieten. Vielleicht bessert sich das ja mit der B-Probe, wenn die Flaschen Rochefort im Keller ein paar Jährchen vor sich hin reifen dürfen!?
	
Test vom 2.12.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,12,9,10,12,11 - 10,55

bottle->stem.  Dark murky amber color with small head.  Incredible aroma of fruit, flowers, yeast, spices. Taste is more of same, but deep and complex.  Perfect carbonation for the flavor and body.  Outstanding.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2013 Une de les bières le plus complex. Je trouve le nez malté avec les fruits. Un goût initale un peut comme les fruits sec, même un peut liquoreux, qui change lentement en malt et houblon.

Small bottle. The aroma is of fruit and some belgian yeast. Looks dark with a light tan head. The taste is dark fruit and yeast  with a little bit of skunk that smoothly rolls dark malt. The palate is very pleasant. Overall, a fantastic beer. Hides the high alcohol very well. Great beer.
Bottle. Hazy dark brown color with a creamy beige head. Balanced aroma of blackcurrant, peat, smoke and yeast. Sour taste of yeast, roasted malt and raisin. Sour and slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 My bottle is dated 05/11/13 so nearly exactly 4 years old. Served in Rochefort goblet glass at home.

The Appearance
Rich dark caramel cola in colour. Thin light brown head the disipates to solitary galaxy shaped head driven escaping co2 at the centre of the glass.

The Aroma
Raisan, rum, sherry in spades. Hints of green apple that i often get when a beer has a little oxidation. As the beer opens up and warms up I�m getting more of the boozy alcohol character. The aroma reminds me of mum�s christmas pudding.

Flavour
Initally sweet with the caramel and rasin coming to the fore. The alcohol warming really kicks in half way through the beer. Slight biting finish from the alcohol. Small amount of oxidation,which is impression for a 4 year old bottle of beer, that has probably not given the treatment a beer like this deserves. Rich deep dark decandent full mature.

Palete
Highly carbonated that tingles and numbs the tongue although mellows as the beer opens up. The higher carbonation makes this beer evapourate on the tongue and drives those rich dried fruit aromas up thought nose. This intensified the overall experience. The finish is velvlety 

Overall
A world class beer. To me this will the beer that turned me on to Belgian beer and it will always be up there as on of my favourite beers. To me this is the finest example of a Belgian strong / Belgian Quad that I have tasted. Like sitting in a very comfortable leather chair in front of the beer. Class

The day finally arrives. Yes, yes and yes. Warm and lovely. Fruity and warm. Lovely and fruity. If I ended my adventures here Id be content. I have a glow. Im going to buy some Kyuss. Happy birthday Bish. Thank you and goodnight.

Stunning beer. Aroma of fruits; raisins and others I can?t yet put my finger on. Taste is dark fruits, brown sugar with spice, black pepper. The little alcohol kick is just perfect, a warming, whisky-like sensation. Complex. One of my favourites.

Once tasted, you notice why its considered as one of the best beers in the world. So complex that it is impossible to describe it at the first time: plenty of aromas and flavours (caramel, nuts, fruit, malt, keg...) that are structured in a perfect collection. Anyway, I need to taste several of them to know it in depth, and probably Ill never get it...
Birra scura con schiuma color nocciola. Laroma è di cioccolato e liquirizia contornato da frutti scuri. In bocca vengono rispecchiati gli odori. Buona birra.

Delicious.  Strong flavour.  Raisiny notes.  Not harsh despite high alcohol content.

Mejor del tiempo que fria ya que a medida que se oxigena y calienta va ganando sabores y matices. Muy compleja y especiada. Un fondo de armario imprescindible casi siempre, sobretodo en invierno.
A great beer all the way around.  Pours dark and rich.  Great on the palate.  Taste stays with you for awhile.

Poured a very dark colour from a bottle with a very thick head. The aroma was to me very caramel and spice but very pleasant. The taste was very good and not to sweet for the alcohol content. I really enjoyed this beer and hope to try again.

Bottle pours deep brown with a slight reddish hue, generous foam although it disappears fairly quickly. Slightly sweet smell, caramel, toffee, bread, spice. Prominent alcohol component to the flavor. Roast, toffee, nutty, dry cherry, and some spice or yeastiness. Very dry palate. Definitely complex but i have a hard time getting past the dry alcohol flavor. An excellent beer. Great taste and body, just be careful it can get you your head pretty quick.
