Bottle from Whole Foods Market, Coddingtown, Santa Rosa, California. Pours a dark brown color with reddish hues and a giant long-legged off-white head that diminishes slowly into a perfect lacing and film. Smell is yeasty, fruity with some earthy and lactic touches. Very complex! It has notes of toffee, milk, dulce-de-leche, blueberries, blackberries, black currants, raisins, overripe apples, liquor, banana with palm syrup, sour cherries... I could keep going all day. The earthy smell is more obvious after a while. Taste is incredibly complex and intense, showing different aspects in every part of the mouth. Sweet and fruity flavor that shows notes of berries, cognac, honey, toffee, earth and nuts. This is a collossal Abt. Highly warming, it leaves a trail of warmth down the throat and the esophagus. Finish shows some booze. Different and so much more complex than anything else Ive tried so far.

Pours a very dark, murky brown color. 3 finger tan head and lots of foam rise up. Head retention and lacing are extremely good, especially for such a high alcohol beer.

Smell is heavy on candied belgian rock sugar. Sweet molasses, burnt biscuit, and roasted malt are also present. Hops arent present but a distinct high abv beer booze aroma is. 

Taste is big on astringent alcohol, balanced by sweet candied sugar and syrupy burnt malts. A strong,smoky, dry scotch-like flavor which is uncommon for the style is dominant. 

Mouthfeel is medium bodied and well carbonated. Head contributed a smooth creaminess to beer. Finish was semi dry and astringent. 

Overall this beer was good but a bit too heavy on the booze side. Strong, malt forward flavors make this a complex beer, but I think it needs to age acouple more years before its at its prime drinking state.

Bottle: dark brown with large fizzy off-white head. Aroma is funky belgian yeast, sawdust, brown sugar and cooked plum. Flavor is funky yeast, dusty wood, brown sugar, light note of molasses and creamy caramel together with cooked mild stone fruit notes. Palate is tangy from high carbonation, a bit of a malty feel but not syrupy. There is an alcohol warming but not as much as expected. Top notch, wish I could afford lots more.

Pours a dark brown hazy. Aroma is syrupy and malty. Taste is highly carbonated sweet and malty. The finish is crisp with some residual sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cL bottle.  Agree with description 100%.  One of the best Belgians, in my opinion, a classic in every way.  Its the beer that made me realize I like this style better than any other.  You cant call yourself a beer snob until youve had one.
I love this beer.  Probably my favorite Belgian, I stock up whenever I find it on sale as it ages amazingly.

Pours chocolate in appearance, retains its head.  Rich well blended aromas of brown sugar, malts, dark fruits.  Delicious and complex flavors, vanilla, malts, dark fruits, too many to name.  Some booze like tastes in the mix.  Smooth and creamy.  Alcohol burn in the finish, otherwise clean.  Classic!

Its a velvet hammer, smooth and forceful.  I wasnt too smitten with this beer, despite all the hype.  It has a fruity smell filled with raisins and berries, which I liked.  The taste is the same and very tart. My tastebuds picked up something like apples and black licorice too.  It has a very fizzy mouth feel and even though its light bodied approaching medium, it fills you up with all that carbonation.  Its one of the most drinkable 10%+ abv beers Ive had, but I still dont think Id have it again.  It was too tart and pungent for me.  Hats off to the Rochefort brewers though for creating such a dynamic brew.

Bottle to oversized snifter. Looks good; brown with white lacing. Smells good too; sweet, plum, and boozy. Tastes great! Like it smells with some caramel. Great balance and nice on the palate. Good stuff!

Bouteille 330ml, 2012. Couleur brune opaque avec quelques particules en suspension. Mousse beige disparaîsant rapidement en laissant une fine dentelle. Arôme de fruits confits, de caramel, de mélasse, de rhum brun, avec une finale dalcool. Goût de mélasse, de fruits confits et de rhum, laissant une bonne chaleur dalcool en fin de bouche. Texture un peu syrupeuse, voire collante, avec une faible carbonation. Excellente!

I poured an 11.2oz bottle into a Trappist chalice

Appearance: Opaque dark shade of maroon/brown; forms a small, off-white, soapy head which fizzles like a soda but does retain a bit but doesnt lace the glass. 

Smell: General dark fruit fragrance plus notable alcohol sweetness. 

Taste: Usually when it comes to beer the fresher it is the better it is, but in the case of a beer like Trappistes Rochefort 10 the opposite is true. My bottle was dated 16/11/16 which I assume means it was bottled on 16 November 2011. Since Ive encountered many  Belgian beers of the style I know the beers palate will change over time and usually for the better. Thats not to say this beer is bad in the slightest bit - just that it didnt seem to be fully matured at the time I drank it. But if this is an immature brew, its still quite impressive for what its able to accomplish.

Like most others it begins with a pure energetic sensation. Intense Belgian carbonation combined with a sweet taste of dark fruits and a vodka or rum-like alcohol taste open the palate. It makes itself known from the get-go and it makes no apologies for its character. Unlike most which have a wine-like taste to them, this one keeps in the tradition of the 6 and the 8 with confectionary-like sweetness rather than fruity sourness. Toffee and caramel are quite prominent throughout the second half, with minor bitterness and dryness to round out the palate. The aftertaste is remarkably clean (maybe a little too clean), although theres just a trace amount of alcohol to be found. A delectable palate for sure, but it seems like more will happen with some age on this body.

Drinkability: If Trappistes Rochefort 10 is the most robust of the Trappist quads, its also the most spastic in the mouth. The carbonation dances on the tongue, almost causing a bit of a friction burn and it does get stuck in through making it difficult to take more than a sip at a time. While its obvious its a potent beer, it never seems to be as dense as its 11.3% ABV weight would otherwise have you believe. Alcohol is detectable, but its not flagrant or distracting. Id imagine an older vintage would be perfectly smooth, though.

a superior rating beer.  pours almost black and aroma is fruity and brash once the beer is sitting at the right temp.

flavor is wonderful! raisins and currents a hint of alcohol a symphony.
Honestly did not like this. Too sweet and too much candied sugar for me. Too much booze as well. Oh well.

Has a almost totally black colour, aroma is OK, but I wouldnt say anything too special. Leaves interesting taste to my lips, sweet and sticky :) Aftertaste is a bit too harsh for my liking. Wouldnt pick as a first beer..maybe :P

Bottle at home. Vintage 2010. Has a black colour with a medium beige head that diminish fast. Smooth aroma with dried fruit, leather, wood, chocolate, herbs and some alcohol and milk (!). The flavour is filled with leather, licorice, alcohol, sweet dried fruit and some brown sugar. Slick and nice mouthfeel, and light bitterness. Ages well, and is balanced and delicious.
Bottle pour. Dark hazy brown, frothy tan head that dissipates to a paper thin milky sheet. Lots of rum raisin and plum, bitter dark chocolate, fresh bread, wonderful mouthfeel.
Oh my oh my this as a lovely beer! Dark and sweet. Tastes of fruit, raisins, chocolate and malts. One of the very best. Tastes like more!
Pours dark. A sweet smell with some chocolate and alcohol. It´s a very smooth beer and the taste is sweet fruits, alcohol and some yeast.
Man, this was good. Dark pour, very sweet complex flavor; raisins, chocolate and yeast primarily.
330ml bottle served in a cognac glass. fruity smell, very smooth even though the abv is so high. I Realy like it Im keeping some in my reserve and see if it gets even better after 2 or 3 years.

From the 330mL bottle to a tulip.  I despise the official trappist glass. Been strored in the fridge since early May.  Aroma very tart and  tangy.  Dried apricot, peach, and various citrus fruit in its dehydrated, dry form.  The tangy-ness is unbelievable. No hint of booze until the head fades away and gets near room temperature.  Appearance is dark-ruby with tan head.  Taste is sweet and very boozy.  Boozy in the pleasant sense and not the chemical sense.  It warms you from the inside on a cold winter day.  Palate is perfect, not too prickly, not too flat.  Just right.  Overall this is my favorite beer and I want to thank everybody involved and all their dedication to creating the most complex array of flavors and aromas I have ever found in a beer.
This Trappist ale has a hint of vanilla flavor with a nice aroma, goes great with dark chocolate deserts or any spicy meal.

Pours dark brown with plenty of sediment. Aroma is alcohol, syrup, dark fruit, caramel,  and malt. Flavor starts with dark dried fruit and sugar, immediately followed by roasted malt, caramel, and alcohol. The alcohol really makes its presence felt, but not overpowering.
Si no es la mejor cerveza del mundo le falta poco. Es incluso mejor que la Rochefort 8, lo cual ya es difícil.
A delicious trappist beer.  Beautiful carmel flavors and sweetness with just a touch of alchohol at the finish.

En fyra år gammal flaska. Stora härlig dofter av madeira, torkad frukt, rom och marsipan. Smaken går i samma stil men är också lätt fadd. Fruktiga övertoner av lichi, röda bär och vingummi. Lätt kandissockersötma. Mums.
Roasty sweet aroma.  Dark brown with tan head.  Taste is medium sweet.  Pretty complex.  Finish is malty sweet.  Even a caramel flavor.  Perfect blend of sweetness and malt.

Last of the three, certainly made an impact - wouldnt recommend doing all three in one go at the end of a session! Not very clever, let me tell you!
Pours dark with a white head that quickly dissipated to leave a dull looking drink, but the lack of a head probably helped as the first sniff really packed a punch - a heady mix of boozy fruit, sweet spices and almost like a Christmas pudding. Taste has a hit of rum-like alcohol and again the sweet and spicy fruit. Good mouth feel, thick and meaty, just the way I like my beer. 
I like this... a lot.

This is probably the best Trappist Dark Strong Double I have ever tried. Heck it may be the best beer Period that I have ever tried!  It has it all... ultra smooth, nice head, lacing, dark fruit ( plums, cherries, etc) nice subtle molasses like sweetness( with some dark brown sugar hints), rich roasted malty notes, and just enough hops to give it balance.  Chimay Blue, and St. Benardis abt 12 come close.  Expensive as hell around here ( $6.00) 11 oz bottle.  I treat myself to about 1 bottle about every other month! and Christmas Eve and Day!

After all beers that i tried this is my favorite. I like beers with sediment and darkness. Also the smoothness of drinking. The color is very satisfactory and the strength is good enough to enjoy your drink even with one bottle.

Bottle poured a dark chestnut brown with a medium tan head, active carbonation, and notable lacing.  Appealing aroma of banana, caramel malt, plum, and raisins.  Taste is very well balanced blend of similar notes of banana, caramel, and dark fruits.  Enjoyable mouthfeel, extremely smooth finish, and very drinkable as the ABV is not at all apparent.

Cellared and with about 2.5 years aging.  Deep, dark fruit and alcohol on the nose.  The alcohol takes the background as the complexity of the fruit really overwhelms in a nice way.  Oil pit tar there as well.  Murky brown, with a light brown head that leaves quickly - as expected due to the alcohol.  Another whiff - have had it in the glass for about 20 minutes and the aroma is just fantastic.  Very viscous mouthfeel.  Yeast presents itself firmly on the last half of the palate with a chewy yeast and tongue covering heavy blanket.  Deep plum flavor.  Lots of barn as well - not a Brett led barn, but just full, massive, complexity of flavors only found in the countryside - perhaps resembling dried meadow.  Alcohol present throughout, but shows most on the finish.  You can wring out your tongue (by squeezing it with your teeth) minutes after a taste of this beer and still get many of the sensations.  Even a slight floral appearance after many tastes.

Aroma: As soon as i opened the bottle, i smiled spontaneously. Smells of rich vine fruits and plenty of caramel and malts. Begs to be consumed 
Appearance: Deep brown in colour and pours a decent head extremely creamy so lots of sticky lacing
Taste: This is nectar of the beer gods. Extremely sweet and dominated by complex layers of vine and dark fruits: figs, plums, cherries, you name it. Malts present also but to a much lesser degree than Rochefort 8 
Palate: Creamy but with enough carbonation to leave it clean. A good mouthfeel to allow swirling the tastes around. Exceptional again
O: There is nothing i can add to justify this beers greatness. The best beer i have tasted thus far out of more than 150
Light brow color. Aroma and taste are rich, malty and fruity. Great flavors of dried fruit and berries do their best to hide the alcohol which can also be felt.

330ml bottle. Murky reddish-brown body, small mocha head, surprisingly low retention. Aroma is wine like, caramel, dates, booze, yeast, plums, raisins. Taste is overwhelmingly boozy, caramel, tons of dried fruit, strong warming effect. Lots of sedimentation. A little disappointing.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2013 Donkerbruin, troebel bier met medium cappuccinokleurige schuimkraag. Aroma van caramel (licht gebrand), toffee, koffie en donker fruit. Je voelt dat het een sterk bier is, maar proeft de alcohol slechts weinig. Smaak is perfect gebalanceerd. Flinke body, zacht palet.
Lots of brown sugar and prunes on nose.  Pours brown heady wort colored.  Rasins, coriander, and black fruit on palate.  Great beer.  Slightly hot from ABV.

Bottle-330 ml. Into tulip glass. Pours a dark brown with a lasting beige head and some lacing. Aroma is full of dark and dried fruits, with a malty and yeasty backbone. Taste is slightly sweet and alcoholic Body is full and moutheel is oily, creamy, sticky texture. Awsome beer!

Poured from 330 ml bottle at Yangshuo Village Retreat in Yangshuo, China. 

Clear, but nearly opaque deep mahogany with large tan head and good lacing. 

Complex aroma of dark fruits, especially cherry, raisin, plum and raspberry with cloves, pepper, fig, apple, pear, yeast, bread, grain, caramel and alcohol. 

Taste is much the same, but slightly sweet with a hint of smokiness.  Alcohol is well hidden. 

Medium/full body and medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Sternbrauerei Rankweil. Aroma is fruty, malty with hints of dark berries. Sweet-ish. Appearance is wonderfull dark brown, almost black with a finger thick brown-ish head. Has heavy cloying sweetness and light bitterness. Feels like drinking wine. Alcohol is recognizable but very well hidden for 11.3%. Full body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. A very long malty, wine like finish. Overall probably the best Quadrupel Ive ever had. Very complex and interesting.

Bottle from Binnys.

Pours dark brown, slight hint of ruby; thin off-white head that didnt stick around.

Chocolate and cherry aroma, with a good bit of cough syrup thrown in the mix along with vanilla.

Very rich and sweet, yet balanced well with a little bitter finish followed by a huge caramel aftertaste.

Extremely full bodied, light carb. A bit boozy, but I have no doubt that this would improve with age.

Overall, Im still not a fan of quads, and its no westy, but still a fantastic brew, given the style. Solid sipper. 4.5/4/4/3.5/4

***
Tasted blind as part of top 10 quad tasting with callmemickey and sideshowe.

A - translucent dark brown with little head.

S - Banana peel, chocolate, some roasted nuts and a nice earthy smell. 

T - Very rich sweet treacle and toffee with a slightly roasty bitter finish. A sweet dark caramel lingers on the tongue.

M - Perfect carbonation, little heat

O - Incredibly drinkable and a fantastic accessible version of the style. Finished tied for 3rd with Westy 12 for me. 4/4.5/4/4.5/4.5
There is nothing that I can say about this brew that hasnt already been said. Great stuff.

This is quite simply one of, if not the best beer Ive tried. Pours a muddy brown with a large tan coloured head. Full bodied with a thick mouthfeel, quite lively carbonation though you dont feel it in your mouth. The taste is out of this world, extremely complex with hints of raisin, toffee and plenty of other flavours. Fully recommended, hides the alcohol worryingly well.

So, after many years of enjoying this fine brew, I am finally sitting in the comfort of my home and reviewing this highly regarded trappist ale.

The beer is brown with a nice, tan head. Decent lacing and retention. The aroma is inviting, with yeast, malt, caramel. It definitely smells like an amazing Belgian quad. Wow, what a flavor! The 11.3% abv is so well hidden, and this bottle is fairly new. Simply terrific. Balanced to perfection. Its been several months since I had last enjoyed a Rochefort 10, and I am suddenly remembering my fondness for this spectacular beer. Certainly one of the finest quads on the planet.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2012 Pours a dark, muddy brown.  Smells of dark fruit - almost like fig newtons? in a very good way.  Taste is dark caramel malts, maybe some Special B malt.  Very carbonated.  one of my favorite in the style so far.  Smoother and slightly sweeter than my most recent quad (from Harpoon)
Very dark brown beer with a light brown foamy head. There is a multitude of fruit scents. Full flavour with a distinct presence of alcohol.

330ml bottle.  Pours extremely dark with tan head.  Bold aroma, boozy and almost wine-like.  Flavor is very powerful, grape and wine flavors with prevalent alcohol presence.  Somewhat sour.  Full body with mouth-coating texture.  This is okay, but I dont think I enjoy it as much as some others do.

Bottle at home from Bitter Virtue.
Pours Dark chestnut with a luscious, mocha foam head. Fantastically complex nose, plums, stewed apples, molasses, toffee and vanilla. Mouth coating, sweet crystal malt at first, followed by a big boozy note, touch of buttered popcorn, increased vinous fruit towards the end, a touch of noble hop and more vanilla.

This is definitely the best of the 3, has some really complex scents of fruit, almost like a red wine. Taste is pretty complex, can't put a finger on it, has a burn like 8 too.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Definitely my favorite beer all time. Such a flavor is amazing. Cant start to describe it ))

Too bad the brewery is under pressure now by mining activities in the area. There is a high risk that they loose the  good quality water spring they use for their production... 
Ill follow this up: would be a great loss to the beer world! )))

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2015 33cl bottle. Pours deep chestnut brown with impeccable off-white/tan head, decent lacing. Aroma is wonderfully complex: plums, figs, raisins, grapes, dates, black forest fruits, clove, bread, red wine, yeast complexity. Taste is equally complex and rich: dark fruits play a major part, cloves and spices, berries, vinous notes, slight alcohol, beguiling yeast complexity. Perfect carbonation leads to a wonderfully full silky mouthfeel. Slight alcohol warmth as it goes down, satisfying and lasting multilayered aftertaste. An absolute cracker of a beer, one of the very best out there no doubt.
One of the my best ten beers in the world. Not full rate only because it isnt a Westvletteren.
Cerveza de alta gradación. De sabor fuerte e intenso, aunque no es la más fuerte de la familia Rochefort.

Birra trapoista scura.
Sapore pieno amarognolo ma valida! 
Nonostante tutto non impegnativa, anzi si fa bere!
Good strong beer. I had it while in Belgium. Being a 10% its nice and strong,got a buzz outa 2. Good taste as well.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 Beer store guy pointed out this was the last bottle he had and highly recommended it, so I did.  Bottle poured into tulip glass a super dark brown with off-white head.  Aroma was very strong of dried fruits (mainly raisins and plums, some cherry), chocolate/caramel malt, yeast and booze.  Taste added a level of champagne-like taste/carbonation and more spices(mostly currants).  Pretty damn good and I will be going to this particular beer store when this beer guy is there :D
Ottimo, retrogusto simile realmente a quello del formaggio, unica pecca è il fatto che alla lunga possa "stomacare"

Pours hazy dark brown almost black with thick frothy head that lingers well. Aromas of plum, raisin, chocolate, caramel, alcohol, and malt persist. Wonderful smelling beer. Taste is exquisite and follows aromas with with dark fruits, cherry, raisin, caramel, with a hint of chocolate and touch of alcohol bite. Mouthfeel is full and creamy with quite a bit of carbonation. Overall one of the best beers I've ever had. Such an experience!

--- Cheers
Superb full-bodied and complex flavor with a lot of fruitiness of dried fruit (prunes, raisins, etc.). Despite the high alcohol content there are not a shred of alcohol taste. Pretty good!
Taste like a sweet Norwegian cheese. Fruity and delicious. Exquisite beer. I love it!
Very strong, sweet taste. The smell is also very pleasant, but what got me was the excellent taste. One of the best beers Ive tasted.

Spent a token on this at the Brussels beer festival (great day out mind) and was left bitterly disappointed. The wrist Belgium beer I tried during my one year stay there and I would strongly not recommend.
Really nice strong beer. A lot of alcohol but well hidden. Fruity aroma and strong nice head when poured. Very tasty when well chilled. Slightly prefer the 8 and that´s why I didn´t give it 5/5.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a rochefort glass.  Aroma of raisin,  malt,  and banana.  Initially tastes of banana but smooths into  nice bitter malt.  seems heavily carbonated almost champaign like.  Overall a delicious quad.
dried fruits, sweet hay and grass notes, chocolate, complex dark taste, lasting sweet bitterness.

330ml bottle. Cloudy dark amber with huge firm lasting frothy to creamy moderately lacing off-white head, collapsing to a still more dense, compact lasting layer. Yeasty aroma, slightly spicy, prickling to biting nose, minimally dry and with a touch of leather. Surprisingly unfruity. Complex taste, initially cautious and retained, then upcoming are blueberry, other slightly sweet dark fruits, some herbs and leather notes, lately effective alcohol. Everlasting sticky finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Cloudy dark amber with huge firm lasting frothy to creamy moderately lacing off-white head, collapsing to a still more dense, compact lasting layer. Yeasty aroma, slightly spicy, prickling to biting nose, minimally dry and with a touch of leather. Surprisingly unfruity. Complex taste, initially cautious and retained, then upcoming are blueberry, other slightly sweet dark fruits, some herbs and leather notes, lately effective alcohol. Everlasting sticky finish.

Tasted right after St. Bernardus abt12. Murky brown pour with a pillowy tan head. Aroma is earthy with nice fruity yeast esters and some raisin. Flavor is more of the same. Very complex and very good. Excellent beer, but I slightly prefer st. Bernardus.

Bevuta alla Pecora e il luppolo di Mosciano SantAngelo (TE). Birra scura con un buon tenore alcolico.Laroma è caratterizzato soprattutto dai malti tostati con note di liquirizia e frutti scuri. In bocca nonostante il suo tenore alcolico risulta comunque godibile. Da meditazione.

11.2 oz bottle pours a dark brown with a lasting beige head and some lacing.  Aroma is full of dark and dried fruits,  with a malty and yeasty backbone.  Taste is slightly sweet and alcoholic Body is full and moutheel is oily, with just the right small amount of carbonation for the style.
210410: Dark brown color with good head. /foam. Licorice and malty aroma. Sweet taste with lots of licorice and fullness.

In bottle bought in Brussels. Poured a dark brown with red hues, looks very clean. Smells alcoholic and estery, plums perhaps. Taste is complex, sugar, plums again, malts, not overly sweet. Carbonation is right for the style. Finishes with alcoholic caramel notes, very pleasant. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2012 Smells of vanilla, yeast, alcohol, and amazing freshness - not as fruity phenolic as your typical Belgian, though that element also shows the more it sits.  Pours a nice brownish purple like St. Bernardus Abt 12, but even darker, and with better lacing.  Dark sediment at the bottom as you finish.  Taste is very roasty, yeasty, nice sweetness, alcohol burn, vanilla, almost like a doppelbock in some aspects, mouthfeel very smooth - creamy, yet not over-bodied, great lingering bready and caramel aftertaste.  Less alcohol burn in the after-flavors than St. Bernardus despite higher overall ABV - how did they pull that off?  A little acidic, but cant complain much about this beer at all - deserves its rep.  A sure four-plusser.  OCTOBER UPDATE: Having this at a cooler temp, and the grape purple fruitiness is really shining in aroma and flavor this time - less vanilla and "roasty" than my first offering.  Incredibly smooth - not noticing as much acid on the second tasting.  Alky burn present, but still amazingly well-concealed given it is in excess of 11%, after all.  Every bit as good as my first bottle, but for different reasons.  When a beer holds up with such great complexity at varying temps, how can one criticize too much?  Still tasting grapes and malts minutes after the fact.  Just an incredible beer that is worthy of its Top 50 World status.
Würzig schokoladiger, stark karbonisierter Beginn. Süßlich angehauchte Kräuternoten, etwas grasig, intensiv. Hefig, vergoren bananig, sehr trocken werdend. Karamellig herbes Finish. 8/10/11/13/9/11

elle présente une robe brune aux reflets acajou très foncé. Sa clarté est limpide bien quelle repose sur un lit de levure. Elle se coiffe dune chapeau de mousse beige fugace, traversé par une effervescence relativement saturée. Une merveille

This beer has wild notes that hit on alcoholic tones and overtones. It is an amazingly solid beer, like all the Rocheforts, and provides a brilliant experience. This beer goes beyond your typical beer, or even your typical Belgian, and (like many Trappist beer) goes towards extraordinary.
One of the beers I frequently return to. Dried fruit, sweetness, and a bit of funky yeast.
Riktigt gott. Karamellig, maltig, söt, kraftfull, chokladtoner, smaker som utvecklas med tiden, bara till det bättre då både sötma och alkoholsmaken blir mindre och smaken komplexare.
Very nice trappist. Dark colour with white foam. Heavy, sweet. Hints of chocolat and caramel. Also a little bit creamy. But overall a nice trappist!

Great beer and for a very competitive category, puts up a solid effort. The malt and yeast presence was predominant in the aroma. The appearance was darker than average with very little head. If someone is wanting to taste a Quad done right, they should go for this. However, I believe there are some American versions that can give it a run for its money. The palate was pleasant but not not overly unique. Like I said, a true testament to the style.

Russin, plommon, körsbär, mysk dominerar doften. Fyllig, söt och alkoholhalten känns av.  Visst är den komplex och god, men tillsatsen av socker gör den lite väl söt...och brygden påminner mer om ett dessertvin än öl. Slutsats: Godkänd men jag skulle vilja prova den utan det förbannade sockret....

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2014 330ml bottle. Raisins, caramel, malty aromas. Pours very dark, floculent, with some tan head, vanishing, but with some lacework. Full body and soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is sweet, roasted notes, fruity and some bitterness developing. Alcohol noticeable but balanced anyway. A really good belgian classic.
toast, resin, earthy, amber, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, lively,

Marrone scuro con schiuma beige abbastanza persistente. Al naso è molto intensa e persistente, complessa, con sentori di frutta sciroppata, tamarindo, liquirizia poi a seguire frutta secca, datteri e cacao.....
In bocca entra dolce e calda......gran corpo.
Birra eccellente, e con un rapporto qualità/prezzo spettacolare....chapeau

Beautiful rustic beer that looks is af it had been trapped in a basement for generations. Dark yeast and an old, brown, hazy colour. smells like port wine and caramel malt. The taste also got port wine, but also yeast, alcohol, dades, figs, raisins and other dried fruits. Nice but a little boozy.

11.2 oz bottle.  Pors opaque brown with offwhite head. Dissipates slowly. Aroma is sweet with hints of cherry and raisin. Tastes of alcohol, chocolate, and dates.  Complex flavors, clove, leather, banana. What a beer!

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Good trappist. Dark brown with quite small head/foam. Anise is major in aroma. Also taste includes anise, caramel and some sweetness.

Testattu yhdessä St. Bernardus Abt 12:n kanssa vertailumielessä. Väriltään oluet ovat hyvin lähellä toisiaan. Abt 12 on ulkonäöltään täysi kymppi. Luonnovalkoinen vaahto säilyy pitkään oluen pinnalla ja jättää kivan pitsin. R10 taas on selvästi pienivaahtoisempi ja hiilihappoista poreilua on havaittavissa pitkään. Tuoksussa Abt 12 on pehmeä, karamellinen ja yllättävän "mieto". R10 vahvasti anismainen. Maultaan Abt 12 on pehmeä, karamellisen maltainen ja hyvin miedosti, ei juuri lainkaan katkera. R10 on monimuotoisempi maultaan, mutta anis todella vahvana. Yhteenvetona: Abt 12 on "helpompi", pehmeämpi ja kauniimpi olut. R10 sisältää Rocheforteille tyypillisen anismaisen tuoksun. Lisäksi maku on syvempi ja voimakkaampi. Todellisia laatuoluita molemmat, mutta omassa arvoasteikossa Abt 12 on rinnan mitan edellä R10:n turhan vahvan anismaisuuden takia.

(Flasche-leichter Schnupfen) Es hat eine dunkelbraune, erdige Färbung, mit einer hellbraunen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist etwas süß bis malzig und minimal erdig. Es Schmeckt schwer, vollmundig, süß, etwas alkoholisch und im Abgang leicht röstig. Bittere ist kaum vorhanden und die Karbonisierung passt. Zusammengefasst, ein Bier das als Abendunterhaltung reicht.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2014 dark brown, beige head. very strong aroma of port wine. taste is very sweet with notes of caramel. great beer!
to me its like the wine of beers. LOTS of legs around the rim on the glass
Coffee/caramel color. Licorish/caramel smell with some banana sweetness in the background. Strong abbey beer with mild sweet liqueur after-taste. Very pleasant!
Dark fruits, red licorice aroma. Plum, raisin, red licorice and sweet caramel in the flavour. Slightly alcoholic. Medium caronation and a full body. Gives a slick mouth feel and finishes a tad dry.

Birra scura con aroma di liquirizia,caffè e frutti scuri. Il sapore è caratterizzato soprattutto dal tostato e da un leggerissimo amaro. Nonostante il suo tenore alcolico la birra è ben equilibrata.Ottima
One of my favourite. Dark brown with very nice head. Aroma of grape, yeast, caramel. Taste is sweet, grapes, caramel . A very good beer

From a 11.2 oz. bottle this beer poured a deep opaque brown with a short lived tan head. The nose is all sweet dark fruit while the flavor is complex. Rasins, prunes, currents all call for attention up front with a hint of alcohol in the finish. The mouthfeel is silky. This is an amazing beer… a beer to sip and savor! Want to buy again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer pours a wonderful thick burgundy color, hues of dark browns but also ruby red when placed near the light. The head on this beer is insane, sits about a finger high but sticks around indefinitely and leaves behind some amazing lacing as well. The aromas are amazing, lots of the famed Belgian yeast, cloves, toffee, a bit of caramel, brown sugar, and finished with a big kick of dark fruits, fig, dates, plums and even a bit of cherry. The alcohol is definitely prevalent in the nose, but it doesnt detract from the beer, even with the heavily sweet aromas. The flavors follow suit very well and are just as complex, the yeast again kicks off the flavors, mild clove, some banana, candied sugar, lots of spice, perhaps cinnamon or allspice, some nutmeg flavors are notable as well. Dark fruits again take over the finish on this beer, plum and prune are big elements, hints of dates play with the spices and yeast so well and are balanced with some rich toffee, caramel and nougat flavors with faint alcohol at the end. The body is so rich and full, coats the mouth so well, goes down so smoothly, about as perfect as it gets.

One of the best classic quads, I like the Westvleteren 12 a bit better, but for a beer I can walk to the store any day of the week and grab for a great price, this cant be beaten (alas, Westvleteren can only be consumed in 2 bars here!!!). The flavors are wonderfully complex, each sip yields something new and the smoothness is just delightful, if you havent had it yet, you are missing out!

Pours like a cola, dark brown with a heavy dark tan head.
Aroma is plum, raisin..
Flavour is caramel malt, more dark fruits...
Taste fluctuates between tart, sweet and bitter in each sip..
Amazing how well the alcohol is hidden.
Magnificent.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2012 Bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium tan head that has reasonable staying power and good lacing. Strong aroma of sweet raisins, some yeast, caramel malts, breadlike. Flavor is quite complex, with fruity/spicy notes, caramel malt and a back of Belgian yeast. Warming alcohol in the late body and finish.  Lightly bitter finish, but crisp. Very nice beer.

Pours a murky dark brown, with dissipating tan head and little lacing. Smell is of sweet fruits and a slight toffee malt. Taste is really complex; you get the currants out of the gate, then a little bitterness, before an interesting clean, dry tongue takes over, and a bit of burn on the way down. For the abv though, not overly alcoholic on the palate. Good beer, yes; one of the best in the world, maybe.

Tastes of plum and brandy. Dark and rich with a tart fruit aroma and slightly syrupy mouthfeel

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brilliant, liquor like viscosity with choclate and dark fruits.  Alcohol, while high is not prominent
Birra dal colore nero con schiuma nocciola.Presenta un bel corpo con profumi di cioccolato,caffè e frutti scuri. Ottima
Hedonistic brown pour.  Big full aromas. and soft on the palate.  Did this one after Bernie 12 which did not help the cause.  A great beer, but I felt overshadowed by B12.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2013 Aroma elegante, el cual cumple las expectativas de una de las mejores cervezas! Maltas tostadas y chocolate invaden las fosas nasales, se perciben ciertas notas a pastel de chocolate. Simplemente delicioso!

Apariencia perfecta. Color marron obscuro, nula carbonatación. Cuerpo redondo y corona de espuma esponjosa y abundante.

Al primer sorbo se siente un ligero picor en virtud de su alto contenido alcohólico, así como notas dulces y elegantes. Dichas sensaciones son menos notorias y los sabores más redondeados mientras más tiempo en guarda tenga la cerveza.

Al paladar, simplemente un elixir de los Dioses!!. Maltas acarameladas y ligeramente tostadas, estructura elegante, matices achocolatados y vinosos a la vez. Final largo, pronucniado y exquisito.

En general, una cerveza exquisita, deliciosa, alcohólica es cierto, pero que se disfurta en demacía y que hace una realidad el hecho de que la cerveza es un liquido digno de Dioses....

Complex aroma with chocolate, malt and dark fruit.  Pours a deep murky brown with a sizeable light tan head. Head diminishes gradually over several minutes with slight lacing. Great, complex balance of flavors with a very smooth finish, particularly given the ABV of this beer.  Creamy, soft palate with mild carbonation. An outstanding beer I just couldnt put down.

0.33l bottle from my friend Guillaume (cheers!). Pours a mostly-opaque brown with a small fine beige head that dissipates quickly. Aroma: Wow. Chocolate, raisin, cloves, oranges, malt, butterscotch and licorice. Fantastic smell. Palate: full bodied, creamy, fizzy, surprisingly dry finish. Taste: sweet. malt comes out stronger in the taste than the smell. Drinking it is a nice mix of grape and malt. Wow, what a beer.
Sweet dark fruits and malty richness predominate. Aroma of raisins, cherry, fig with dark cloudy brown pour with thin tan head; taste, malty, fruity, yeasty esters with clean but thick finish.

Det här är en bra öl med en stabil kropp och en fruktig, nästan vinaktig smak. Jag är imponerad över hur lite alkohol ölen smakar med tanke på sin alkoholstyrka. Slutsats: imponerande fruktig och god.

Pours brown with a light brown head into a tulip glass.  Did not find the aroma that appealing.  Somewhat sour.  The taste was a huge surprise.  Very nice raisin sweet brandy type taste that is nothing like the aroma.  For such high % this beer is easy to drink.  Very smooth and tasty.  Highly recommend giving this a try.

What a surprise. I have been on a quest to purchase a Trappist Westvleteren 12 while living just south of Belgium. To make a long story short, they dont sell it in stores, but they have a crazy list of rules that are posted on the abbey of Saint Sixtus of Westvleteren website (http://www.sintsixtus.be/eng/brouwerij.htm#Be I started to pick up all the interesting beers that I could find in various stores. And, I came across the Trappistes Rochefort 10. Score!

330ml bottle into a Tournei tulip. Drank February 23, 2012.

Appearance (5.0): After only drinking different Belgium beer for the past couple of weeks, I have learned how to make a good pour. The Rochefort has a thick head, roughly 1/3 the size of the pour. The head stays firm, slowly disappating over the course of the drink, leaving long laces of The dark brown beer is a nice contrast to the head.

Smell (4.5): A complex smell of cherry and chocolate, flowers and coke. Effervescent bubbles tickle the nose.

Taste (5.0): For a dark beer, the taste was fruity, but still a true Belgian feel. Despite the high alcohol content, it wasnt overwhelming in the mouth. Started and finshed creamy.

Mouthfeel (4.5): There is a response to most Belgiums for me, where the first two sips are full of bubbles. The carbination is overwhelming, but settles down for the rest of the glass.

Overall (5.0): This ranks at the top of all beers I have had. I need to sit down and try one later ... with some good friends. Ill try to brig a few home to the states if my friends are unable to find a few bottles at House of 1000 Beers (http://beeradvocate.com/beer/profile/15450 just lucky to have another of a "Top 10" beer ... even if by accident.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-25-2012 21:50:25
Deep brown with a tan head. Aroma of dried fruits and brown sugar with a slightly earthy note. Rich malty palate, just sweet enough without being cloying. Complex palate. Really great.
Pours a hazy brown with a minimal tan head.  Smells of raisin, dough, earth, caramel.  Taste is medium sweet with a small amount of sour and bitter.  Very smooth, fruity but not cloying.

Bottle at Bristol, Portcullis, 8th May 2012.  This is full on as you would expect, big aroma, musky, boozy fruity.  Looks fine plenty of sediment, the flavour is intense, raisins, sultanas soaked in booze, fruit and marzipan undertones.  Palate is nice but overly carbonated for my taste.  Good, but not top of my list

Bottle from Ye Old Spirits, MD.  Huge frothy head.   Powerful aroma of raisin, plum. beglium yeast, candy.  Med-light sweetness, dry finish.  Medium bodied, creamy texture.  Softer carbonation.  Long finish.  This is such a refined quad, so complex and smooth, I dont know how these monks do it, but damn they make good beer:)  I could drink this stuff all day long, sell my bike and buy more and drink this all day tomorrow again.  Spectacular
My favorite beer on the planet. So dynamic its a slightly different experience every time.

Bottiglia da 33 cl. Ottimo aspetto,color tonaca di frate molto scura con schiuma di grana fine, abbondante, persistente di color nocciola carico. Al naso frutta esotica molto matura con note di cacao. Al palato ad un leggero caramello iniziale lascia spazio alla frutta e sentori di cacao per chiudere con un leggero amaro ma di bella persistenza. Pur essendo di alto tasso alcolico è ben bilanciata e ben attenuata.

Bottle at taberna belga, Braga, Portugal. Dark brown color. Thin to medium brownish head. Medium carbonation. Medium sweetness. Low bitterness. Caramel, pepper, spices, herbs and malt aroma. Goes very well with francesinha sandwich!
Deep color, brandy style aroma.  Fruity flavor and smooth after affect.  An excellent after dinner or desert beer.

Deep brown, almost black, with 2 finger off white head in Rochefort glass. Initial smell is vinious, lots of grape/raisin under-pinned by a strong toffee and banana sweetness. Taste is sweet, strong, smooth and highly complex. Initial attack is from the carbonation then toffee, raisin, liquorice and vinious alcohol bursting on the palate, whiskey notes, finishing with fig. Finish is very smooth. Carbonation is moderate.

Every sip demands to be savoured... outstanding.

Bottle from Preporská pivotéka. Heavy airy beige head - most disappears pretty quickly, but a thin layer remains stable. Cloudy dark brown colour, some sediment. Aroma of roasted malt, fruity, alcohol, caramel, also minor whiskey-like notes, with smoke and wood. Mouthfeel is creamy, smooth, alcohol evident, but not annoying. Taste is expertly balanced medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter. The finish is rather sweet and sticky. It leaves that warm feeling in mouth and throat that I know from whiskey.
Bottle.  Pours a deep brown with a mocha head.  The flavor is dark roasted malt with a mildly sour aftertaste.  There is a bit of carbonation sting on the tongue.  Pretty good overall.

Pours a deep reddish brown with a huge head that dissipates away but lasts forever. Aromas of dark fruits, syrup, and alcohol. Flavors of plums, roasted malts, and a slew of other flavors that pop out here and there. Alcohol is hidden extremely well, and it gives that good ol warmth when it hits the stomach. Wow, this beer exceeded my expectations tenfold. I would consider this one of the best belgians, and beers in general, Ive ever had. If you ever see this or get the opportunity to get a bottle(which I purchased (for $7/11.2oz bottle), do it. Anyone who considers themselves a beer lover would appreciate/love this beer . CHEERS

One of my absolute favorites for when you need that one beer after a long tough day. Light reddish-brown pour with decent amount of head that dissipates quickly. The smell has a lot of fruits coming off - banana, raisins, figs, apples, cherries mixed with chocolate, cinnamon, and even leather. The taste is complex with a number of nice flavors that can come through - of course, chocolate and booze are right there to warm you. Sweet and smooth for being so boozy, Anise and dark fruit in the middle. Ends with mellowing malts. Rich mouthfeel that warms and lasts. Excellence!

Dark brown hazy beer with small tan lasting head.  Aroma of fruit, primarily raisins and a little banana, and very sweet malt.  Flavors of apples, plums, vanilla, lots of sweet malt, alcohol spice.  No hop character to speak of though it isnt imbalanced or overly sweet.  Thicker mouthfeel than the 8 and 6 but still lively and more silky with little sediment aspect. Alcohol immediately warms.  It is rich & luxurious next to the 6 and 8.

Excellent! Poured from bottle into a trappist glass, nice head which retained well with good lacing, color is dark brown chocolate, aroma is molasses and fruit, palate is substantial with nice carbonation and a very nice warmth going down.

Bottle.  Pours deep brown with a couple fingers of off white head, plenty of lacing, and a lot of uneven bubbles in the glass.  Aroma is mostly dark fruits: figs, plums, and a little brown sugar.  Taste is very sweet with a really sugary taste.  This almost reminds me of a black cherry flavor with a little fizziness. The finish is very active on the tongue and smooth.  This is really good and so well priced.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Limpido color castagna con una schiuma beige sottile e poco persistente. Delizioso aroma maltoso con frutta essicata, toffee e più delicati sentori di fave di cacao. Il gusto è molto complesso: inizialmente è mediamente dolce con intense note zuccherose di fichi, pane, albicocche essicate e zucchero scuro; dopo alcuni sorsi emergono note amarognole di cacao e sentori liquorosi solleticano il naso. Al palato è incredibilmente morbida e lalcool è perfettamente mascherato; pienamente corposa e con un finale lungo che lascia però la bocca molto pulita. Una birra meravigliosa e perfettamente bilanciata, un capolavoro!

Aromas of cherry, black liquorice, grape and raisins. Pours a blackish brown color with a quickly evaporating foam at the top. Tastes of various malts including caramel, barley, bread, oats, nuts and raisin or black liquorice. Possibly a slight hint of vanilla. Flavors all blend very well and the alcohol presence is very subtle. Overall, a primarily malty tasting beer with spectacular balance between flavors. Id give this an A+ rating.

Originally reviewed: 11/20/10. Ive wanted to try this one for awhile. Finally pulled the trigger. Poured into a snifter. Pours a really cloudy dark mahogany with a thick two-finger off-white head on top. Light lace left behind. Scents of grape, plum, strawberry, yeast, and light booze. Very fruity nose. 

The mouth is creamy with subtle carbonation play on the tongue. The flavors remind me of an old ale. Dark fruits like plum, some licorice, molasses. The booze isnt noted in the flavor but I can feel it a bit. Very smooth mellow Quad. I will definitely get this one again. A bit on the pricey side, but worth it.

Finally a Belgian Abbey ale that I have not tried.  All I can say is wonderful.  All of the qualities that one would look for in a trappist ale can be found in this ale.  Deep mahogany in color and very bread like and chewy.  I would drink this anytime but I would very much recommend this for winter or Christmas.

Diep donker bruin met getinte kop die snel verdwijnt. Blijft een dun laagje over. Geur is zoet met koffie.

Meer dan gemiddeld koolzuur. Smaak met tinten van aarde, koffie, vijgen/dadels en caramel.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Roasted malt, sweet dark fruit, molasses, and vinous alcohol aroma. Hazy brown with a small fizzy head and chunky sediment. Syrupy sweet dark fruit, cola, and alcohol flavor.  Simply too sweet for my taste. Full carbonated body. Despite its high ratings, this one just isnt my thing.

[ASPETTO] 			
marrone scuro, senza riflessi, opaca			
[SCHIUMA]			
color beige, media presenza, fine ma poco durevole. Rimane solo un sottile strato duraturo			
[OLFATTO]			
prufumi di lievito, malto tostato con sentori di caramello , quasi cioccolatoso, una certa asprezza fruttale che con note alcoliche ricorda frutta rossa sottospirito liquorosa			
[GUSTO]			
una base dolce, mielosa con un tocco tostato, ancora forse qualche nota di cioccolato; subito compare una certa astringenza, sapori di frutta matura e alcolica, un pizzicore sulla punta della lingua ancora di natura alcolica  e uno speziato notevole nel finale e nel retrogusto, comunque secco ed alleggerito da note amare. una leggera sensazione allappante chiude il tutto.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, consistente in bocca, quasi oleosa, una carbonazione contenuta ma avvertibile che ravviva. Alcohol evidente e attivo nei sapori e sfumature			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
ultimo scalino della serie Rochefort, alcohol ben inserito che da spunti interessanti ma è sempre li che aspetta dietro langolo. Nel complesso si ritrova un po di tutto ed in armonia: un dolce maltoso, sentori torrefatti e  frutta, lieviti belga in piena forma, uno speziato festoso. buona, anzi più che buona; non mi sottraggo alla tendenza. la migliore del genere ?.. non so, manco di  esperienza.. attendo comunque al varco il mio pack special edition de la Westvleteren12, poi si vedrà.

From backlog:
330ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Dark amberish colour with big head. Aroma is malt, sweet, bread. Flavour is sweet, bready, plum. Alcohol is well hidden. Really great quad.

This brew pours into the glass with an attractive and promising mingling of dark brown and deep red tones, and forms a small but lingering head.  The aroma is very nice; strong, rich, fruity.  Each drink was a dense, strong mouthful.  The taste has a wine like quality, more of the fruitiness from the aroma, with caramel and coffee and noticeable alcohol.  Slightly dry, but never enough to slow me down.  Maybe thats a not a good thing, I wish this had lasted a little longer.  Really a delicious beer, if it werent for the slightly high price Id make this a regular.

Dark brown and reddish with a medium tanned, stable and creamy head. Aroma is malty, sweet, alcohol, caramel, chocolate, fruits. Very full body. Quite alcoholic. Tastes intensive and similar to red whine. Very nice.

Sorry ...my score is 300 on 100.  But the machine doesnt work !!!
Statistics I have verified one by one : 126 ratings with the maximum note !
I thank you all.... friends.
For the little story, my parents are living not far away : 25 kms from Rochefort....  Im nearly born in this beer !!! 
A member of my family, for the business, had contact in his time with the monastery/abbey .  Ive been there with an old "Opel Captain" to the "porterie", and inside to deliver goods....
Nothing to add to the ratings. Only that you can note : "hors norme" 
Or if you want :
merveilleux, extraordinaire, splendide, fabuleux, fantastique, grandiose,
